I legit got a a final grade of an A in this class (according to the syllabus and canvas grade) and I was given a B in my final transcript. Altsatt isn't very responsive to emails. Please think 100x before taking this class.

I have taken Ann for two courses. She is a tough grader. I struggled to keep my grades up in her classes, and I am normally a solid A student. Otherwise, she is really kind, easy to talk to, and overall a good person. But if your gpa matters to you, she might not be a great choice.

Don't take this class unless you want to be stuck twice a week doing boring class assignments. Ann is nice enough but their teaching is all over the place and disorganized. This class took hours of life away from me i'll never get back...

the weekly lecture and homework actually take time and effort, content is super educational and informative if you have an open mind and is actually trying to learn about queer art, covered many topics and the interview style lectures felt super personal and fun! graded easily and TAs are super understanding

Interesting if you're really into the california art scene. Basically just watch some interviews, do the 5 question quiz every week, write notes, 4 discussion posts over the quarter and a final project (choose something art based to avoid writing an essay). Fine class, kinda boring but really not much work, I usually finished within 2 hours.

While it is important to highlight the sexual side of queer culture, this class felt like her advertising her own ideologies and friends' works, which wouldn't be so bad if it weren't a class. It felt like 10 weeks of the same thing and it got really grating. Especially since she used mostly her own interviews as homework.

Dropped after the second week and thank the lord that I did. Entire course was just a way for the prof. to pander and promote either their random artist friends or whatever "ecosexuality" is. You start your final in week TWO. 'Lectures' (if you can even call them that) are almost comically low quality and unfocused. Incredibly embarrassing stuff.

This class is her promoting her ecosexuality kink and attempted pandering. It's embarrassing to queerness and UCSC as a whole. Her knowledge of queer art is limited to the Bay Area, with the interviews and videos almost always being with a friend of hers. Everything about her perspective on queerness is sexual and gross.

Good teacher and clearly very passionate about Environmental Art. Lots of discussion posts and short papers that are easy to do if you do the modules. I wasn't very into this type of art but I enjoyed the class nonetheless.

Down to Earth (literally sometimes lmao) and genuinely one of my favorite professors ever, i think. The course is easy yet still rewarding if you put in the effort to pay attention. Lots of interesting material (although some is definitely incredibly bizarre). And as an online course, it really doesn't get better than this

Lots of busy work, weekly essays, discussions, quizzes, and one midterm, and final project. It's manageable, and the topics in this class are very insightful and eye-opening. Extra credit is offered throughout the quarter and she is very accessible through email as well.

I loved taking this class. I took it to fulfill a GE and it was super easy. Most the content was videos which you need to pay attention to/take notes on as you watch as there is 1 quiz per week and 1 (1 page) response paper due per week based on these videos. The quizzes and response papers were super easy, & extra credit was also offered.

This was a fairly easy online class taken in Winter 2020. There were weekly one-paged papers due that were easy to write. Stephens' lectures were interviews with different artists around the U.S. so they were pretty interesting to watch. As long as you attend section and participate in the discussions, you'll get a good grade.

Professor Stephens does a really good job of covering a variety of topics. Lots of videos to watch each week, most of which are interviews. Weekly Zoom discussions are mandatory. Discussion board posts and essays are required weekly, too. A bit more time consuming that I would have expected from an online art class, but I would still recommend it.

Beth Stephens is so problematic for so many reasons. She does not respect her students and created a very tense learning environment. She did not make her class space inclusive and often relied on guest lecturers to carry the class. Beth hardly added anything constructive to the class and the little that I did learn, I learned from discussion.

Beth Stephens has a reputation as a professor to avoid among my social circles. Class was easy but uninformative and often tense for me as an LGBTQ student of color. Other peers have expressed similar discomfort. The guest lecturers Beth invited offered dated perspectives on queer, feminist, religious and cultural theory without adequate critique.

This was the first time this class has been taught, and it was definitely something else... Really strange, but in an interesting way. Beth made the class fun and exciting when it could have been extremely awkward. Assignments are pretty simple as long as you go to class to watch the films, and the midterm and final are both take home, and easy.

If you're looking for an easy A, Stephens class is exactly that. Although I'm an artist myself, lecture was often boring and drawn out. Her class was late at night, so often only about a fourth of the class would show up. Grading is based on weekly 1-page paper, not bad. Skim the readings. She randomly began taking attendance after the midterm.
She is awesome!!

Elizabeth Stephens taught us environmental art, which for many students, seem uninteresting and quite bizarre at times. Lectures can be boring and slow. I liked the class, because it gave me a new perspective on what was seen as art. The readings were confusing, but the writing assignments were extremely easy. Easy take home final. Easy A.

Environmental Art was an interesting course, but I wouldn't recommend this class if you 1. don't appreciate art and 2. don't have an open mind. Beth really knows her stuff, and her lectures are interesting. Not too much work to pass this class with an A, but I found it difficult to remain enthusiastic about this course.

Beth is truly an inspiring person amongst many other things. She will make you think and view things differently. She has been there for me. I recommend her to anyone, especially artists interested in the environment. I am taking more classes taught by her for sure.

Beth is wacky, but cool. Lectures are long and boring but can also be fun sometimes, it's a little hit or miss. Sometimes the relation between the readings and lectures isn't clear, but it doesn't matter. ART 80B is an easy A as long as you do the readings (which are easy) and weekly responses.

This is for BIOL 86!! Super cool class if you're interested in scientific research (don't take this if you aren't willing to read papers!) Jeremy has great insight on everything we discuss. The class setup is super lively and interactive. You only present once a quarter and the rest is other group presentations. Presenting is made less scary here!

I love Jeremy. A truly amazing and informed lecturer, with true passion. Make sure to do the study problems ON TIME and come to discussion/office hours with questions. This class is objectively difficult but if you put in the work you can get an A and gain a whole lot of knowledge. Grateful for this class & can't wait to take more classes with him.

His class is really hard, since your grade is legit made up of 2 quizzes, 2 midterms, and 1 final exam. The midterms and exams are 90% of your grade. The questions are challenging, plus there are no study guides that are similar to his exam questions. Plus, the material requires a lot of memorization and is extremely vocabulary-based.
Your success in this class is very dependent on how well you understand and apply the material. Use the study questions. go to office hours, ask questions. He is very knowledgable.

Jeremy is obviously interested in the material he teaches, but the long lectures with little diversity make it hard to focus. He provides a break in the middle of class, but there is little to no interaction during lecture. The whole grade is based off two quizzes, two midterms, and the final, all graded pretty harshly.

The class average was a 67, he did not curve. Grade was based on a midterm and a final both of which were graded harshly and over the top difficult. Tests were focused on random specific examples and confusingly worded. One of the worst professors I've had, if you have the opportunity to take anyone else I would highly recommend you do so.

Was scared going into this class due to previous ratings. Lee is a very caring professor, even though grade is based on exams/quizzes, he provides study problems and review sessions that help you prepare for the exams. The exams are pretty fair, but you need to study, they relate to the lecture and he doesn't throw irrelevant things at you. 10/10

I was scared to take this class after many people complained about Jeremy, but I have to say it was the most interesting class I have ever taken. Lots of people blame him for the difficult content, but he really is an amazing lecturer and you can tell how much he cares about the subject and his students. You just have to go to lectures to keep up.

Great professor. Super caring about his students, and I would recommend going to his office hours every week! Study questions help you a lot with the tests, and he shows that he loves what he does. I would recommend taking him for genetics and biochem!!! One of the kindest professors I've had and one of my favorites.

The tests are much harder and more specific than what is gone over in class. The grade is based only on quizzes and exams that are not curved. Very tough class and the prof doesn't care that the tests are too hard. Would not recommend.

I took him for biochemistry over the winter. I had a lot of difficulty in his class, he only used quizzes and midterms to determine final grades. I ended with being 1% away from a B and got a high B on the final, he refused to round up. Would not recommend take any other professor.

Professor Lee's class is challenging, but engaging if you stay focused. Rely on the free textbook, attend lectures, and use unstuckstudy for study prep to do well. Exams are tough but the curve helps.

Lectures are long/boring and challenging to stay engaged with. He rarely, if ever, actually lectures on what he asks for in depth of his exams. Entire grade is based on the exam scores which are ridiculously difficult. He claims he curves but he didn't for my class (a lot of people didn't pass). I like genetics but I hated his class.

Jeremy's lectures are very heavy with material. He explains concepts really fast so it can be easy to fall behind and feel lost. His exams cover everything in lecture and he has study questions to help you prepare for them so as long as you those you will be fine. My biggest advice is to stay fully attentive during lecture.

not the most exciting lecturer but seems like a nice guy, and he explains things in a pretty clear way given the difficult subject matter. the grading based on just five tests--2 quizzes, 2 midterms, and the final--means a comprehensive understanding of the subject is key to succeeding. watch out for that second midterm.

This class is not necessarily difficult. All assignments are manageable. There are weekly quizzes, but all info for them is given in lectures, slides, and protocols. Lectures are not mandatory to attend, but the actual lab is. Overall, this class was very relaxed.

Professor Lee is simply the best. Period. But your grade is only dependent on 2 quizzes, 2 midterms, and a final, which makes it hard to get an A in the course. However, his lectures are thorough and will prepare you well if you really just zone in in class. Do the study sets and read test questions thoroughly and you should be fine.

His lectures are like a Ted Talk. His slides don't provide a lot of details, but listening to his explanations of the material is key. His tests can be difficult and preparation is definitely needed, but they are fair. Everything from lecture and his study questions are fair game. Attendance is not taken and readings not required.

amazing lecturer but exams are difficult. mcqs are really tricky, frqs are fair, and fill-ins are usually free points so it evens out. extremely kind and caring when you talk to him outside of class. his teaching style isnt for everyone but hes objectively a good prof. put in the work and youll succeed

All tests are MCQ, fill-in, and FRQ. MCQ is fair though he's tricky, fill-in is a lost cause. I studied all of his slides for him to test words he used once in passing. FRQ is hit or a miss, there is always one with info he barely skimmed over that wasn't in his study sets. He curves so even though he's not good, he's the least bad. 65% class avg.

Teacher clearly gets off to watching her students struggle. Also she must be going for the worst rating on RMP speed run with the way her classes are treated. Super privileged and condescending vibes coming from this useless professor. Do the world a favor and quit your job already because you're clearly not good at it. Skip her for your own sanity

Happy to see im not the only one that had a negative experience with this professor. Very self centered teachings with unclear rubric requirements and when asked to clarify was told there was nothing she could do.... like what? That's literally your job. Might as well of had a clown for a professor because you wont be able to tell the difference...

UCSC just hires anybody to be a professor I guess now. Very unqualified and unprofessional professor (if you even consider her one). Don't waste your time taking her class if you value your money and time. If I could give this professor a worse rating I would because a 1 out of 5 for her is too considerate. Her class and teachings SUCK!

Genuinely worst professor at ucsc. Im convinced the only good reviews for her on rate my professor are actually written by her because no conscious human being would actually enjoy her or her teachings. Makes you spend half the quarter working on a bs project because she can't develop a decent teaching curriculum. Thank God I was honest on my SETS.

DO NOT TAKE HER AS YOUR PROFESSOR. Worst emotional roller-coaster of a class at this joke of a school. Worked insanely hard for weeks on a final that she deemed inadequate. When you see this professors name under the class sign up do yourself the biggest favor of your life and pick a different class. (Half her students feel the same way btw)

Wish I looked at her rate my professor before taking her class. Failed half the class after we all did the assignment to her rubric only to be told we didn't do it correctly at all. Idk for half the class to get no grade or zero on the final I find it difficult to believe its actually our fault. Asked for clarification only to be told off.

Horrible, awful, and very self centered professor. Take her class if you want your gpa to tank. Extremely strict with her grading with very little guidance and very unclear instructions. Would come into your breakout room or make you attend office hours just to criticize you for the same things over and over again.

Literally all you have to do is go to the online lectures and you basically get an A in this class. Attendance isn't hard but as an introvert being put into breakout rooms somewhat frequently was a little annoying. Not sure why people hate her, she's incredibly nice and doesn't assign much work at all.

participation is heavy in this class, but grading criteria is not clear, and participation grades are not distinctly described and not inputted until the very end of the year. goes on tangents often and seems not organized despite being strict on mandatory attendance/participation. assignments are not hard, but lectures just seem disorganized.

Really sad to see all the bad reviews. I loved her. Yes attendance is mandatory but you're paying to go to class so just go 🤷‍♂️. She's really sweet and the lecture content was really cool. For this specific class there weren't too many assignments either and they were pretty easy A's as long as you put in some effort. Would recommend.

If you do not like being on camera all the time, do not take. You are forced to have your cameras on and "actively" participate in discussions. Grades strictly and subjectively and directions were vague and unclear of what prof ACTUALLY wants. Very slow or no responses at all. This was a really confusing and pretty disappointing class.

This professor tends to steer discussions toward more straightforward interpretations and often discourages deeper engagement with complex or challenging ideas. Additionally, there appears to be a noticeable favoritism toward certain students, which can make the classroom environment feel uneven or less inclusive.

Would not recommend this professor in general due to lack of professionalism, real world understanding of the material, disrespectful treatment of students who do not align with her lens, and lack of experience outside of art academia. If possible avoid.

A.M. is a fantastic professor, I loved 80i. Learned so much about game design, play as an art form, and making games by myself & with others. Other ratings genuinely shocked me :( Be prepared to put yourself out there and hear crucial constructive criticism, you'll get so much in return. He's pretty busy but him & his TAs care lots about students!

This was by far the WORST class I have ever taken. Assignments weren't so bad, but wow Darke was a terrible professor if you can even call her that. Incredibly disorganized, unprofessional, lectures felt pointless but were mandatory, refused to answer questions in class, was rude to students and her TAs. Thinks she's better than her rmp ratings.
Professor is unfriendly and her course is boring. always receive a poor grade and feedback doesn't make any sense. I wouldn't recommend this professor if you not good at art design.

We read once out of the textbook. The only thing that was actually taught was typography. All of the projects we did had no rubric and no guidelines. We had to learn a programming language outside of class to make a project. The lectures were not recorded, and the assignments not updated, so anything said in class is lost. I'd prefer the dentist
Quite possibly the worst teacher I've ever had. She's rude, disrespectful, not understanding, and am convinced she does NOT care about her students. Would not recommend this teacher to anyone.

Class is totally make me confused sometimes. project grade is one of hardest part and it can change your grade all the time. TA are "MORE!!!" helpful than PF If you are taking for GE, then PNP. Else, try to join a different PF class.

I was going into this class excited for well-designed coursework that would teach me about play in a welcoming environment. 1) I learned nothing in this class, 2) none of the coursework was well-designed, and 3) A.M. never communicates, believes he's the only one who can give valid criticism, and will bully you if you don't meet his expectations.

Took ARTG10 with them for credit, it was pretty chill! Projects weren't too difficult to understand, and they have videos linked to help if needed. There were reading assignments, but it wasn't hard to complete, just a little more time consuming (The readings, not writing part [Writing was like 2-4 sentences or so] )

This class was just fine. I think the lectures were really good and helpful but the homework assignments and projects felt unnecessary. I wish they were a little bit past the fundamentals and when after some more essential in core skills that I would be using for the rest of my major. Good luck contacting this professor, grading was inconsistent.

Attendance is graded, but not heavily, so if you miss a few classes it's not a big a deal. Projects always had instructions to walk you through them, and reading/participation assignments were pretty easy and not super time consuming.

she has open book lecture quizzes but some of the questions can be unclear/subjective. it's project based which is fun and mostly an easy A class. attendance is mandatory but she give 4 free passes, overall a fun person but her lectures don't relate to much of the actual learning. overall would recommend, not super assignment heavy

The class structure was really well-organized. The lectures were formatted on an external website by the Prof and had a mix of reading and videos. The videos were long, but aside from that the content was very interesting. The assignments were graded pretty loosely, but still required a good amount of effort and time. Used Photoshop and Illustrator

easy to understand lectures + they go really in-depth if you're not as tech-savvy, lots of time to do homework in-between each assignment but there is also late submission, would recommend this professor highly for artg classes and those majoring in it

Attendance is semi-mandatory, she does quizzes to check that you're in the class but they only contribute to 1% of your grade. There are a lot of projects but in my opinion they're very manageable. Her biggest skill is that she has so much experience with the project content so she posts step by step project instructions that are super helpful.

Easy class, lectures not mandatory if you have previous knowledge of photoshop/illustrator. None of the projects are too time-intensive and will be graded well if you follow the syllabus. Stuff can be submitted late, but there's so few projects with a lot of time in between so it's not needed. Good class for easy GE credit, no coding just art
Overall really nice agpm intro course, hard to see how it connects to the rest of agpm classes but that's not her fault. A really nice teacher.

(ARTG10) Professor Gillette kept the course enjoyable and manageable, with simple assignments that didn't require prior knowledge of game design. They were also very lenient with late submissions, making it an easy A for anyone looking for a stress-free class.

(ARTG 10) Attendance is mandatory, but the lectures are optional. You can read it on your own time and watch the online tutorials on how to navigate and create through Adobe Creative Cloud. Login with your school email for FREE and get creative with the projects. Projects are fun and easy, not at all time consuming.
Would recommend if you want an easy ge class. Had fun on projects. More feedback would be nice though.

MY COURSE WAS ARTG10! Attendance is mandatory but only worth about 5% of your overall grade. Lectures were not necessary to understand what was going on in the class. Online tutorials were very clear for beginners. Based on Adobe Creative Cloud, use your school info to get it for free! Easy readings and fun projects. Not very time-consuming.

This class was very easy to pick up. The first few assignments used Adobe Photoshop while the rest will use Illustrator. There were 2 art projects and a content quiz due every 2 weeks. The projects come with the rubric that will be used when grading so you know exactly what they want. Overall if you need an easy A and a GE take this class!

Simple and easy class, recommend for a GE. Assignments were straightforward, with 2 art projects and a quiz due every 2 weeks. All online, readings were interesting in my opinion. Wish we got more feedback rather than just a rubric grade but the grades themselves were really forgiving. I got 100% on some toddler-level art!

The Prof does not give feedback on the work that you do just grades them (kind of wish I knew what I could work on when it comes to art). Other than that her videos are easy to understand. Lots of reading but it does pertain to the class and its extremely interesting.

I took this course online synchronous. Every week we were assigned a project and used different creative platforms for each one. Their tutorial videos are easy to understand and very beginner friendly. They're lienient on late work, gave us 48 hour grace period for projects.This a perfect introductory for Adobe platforms and Blender.

I took the professor's online course for ARTG10 and I really liked it. The class is mostly project-based. Although I attended every lecture, it wasn't exactly needed to complete the projects, more like extra help. Lenient deadlines and very flexible. There is a short reading/writing assignment and quiz every week.

Although the class was fully remote, her videos showed you how to do everything from a beginner's POV. I was able to complete all projects with no substantial difficulty or prior experience in Photoshop or Illustrator. 7 Studio Projects (including final project) and she gives you more than enough time to do them + grace periods. Really solid Prof.

DO NOT TAKE 106O if you are not interested in animation I've taken 3 classes with this prof now Her lectures explain exactly how to do the projects so as long as you do the work and follow the steps it's a great class. She teaches a wide variety of techniques to really help you get your foot in the door to do your own projects.

The most clear instructions I have ever had in a class. Answers your questions before you can even ask them. Always online and accessible for questions outside of class on Discord, will walk you through problems so you learn and quickly fix your issue. Lots of work, but super fun class and a great late policy. Never answers his email lol.

Ed is the goat!! I have taken multiple courses taught by him and have enjoyed all of the materials (also received A's for all of them). I have learned a lot about 3D modeling from his classes and am interested in this subject outside of class. He is also very communicative, and always goes out of his way to help his students. Best professor EVER!
He's literally one of the best professors I've had. He's thorough in explaining new things and goes above and beyond to help. He's also very funny.

Ed is probably one of the best professors Ive ever had. One of the few that dont tolerate BS. Utterly based. Extremely thorough with lectures and tutorials, will even fix your assignments for you if you mess up and are stuck. Super prompt on responses and is always available. Sets very reasonable expectations. A professor that gets it.

Posts lots of resources on Canvas. Doesn't seem to sleep and is available by email throughout the day/night. Spends most of class time helping students, doing tutorials, or giving you work time. Critique light. Passionate about subject. His class is what made me decide I wanted to work in game design after grad.

Took and didn't pass Genetics with Needhi before, but did with Roh. Go to office hours and section bc the TA's are awesome and basically taught me everything. Two curved tests are the majority of the grade (grading scale is vague). Def hardest/most material in an entry level upper div course but he's easier than Needhi imo

Brilliant lecturer, but quite disorganized. If he taught at a semester system school his class would've been far easier and more interesting, because he has so much detail he wants to explain but can't due to time constraints, and he ends up rushing through what seems like a week of material in one class.

Ro was a great professor who really seemed passionate about what he was teaching. The hw is not helpful though since his test problems are nothing like the HW. Attend every lecture and make sure to do the readings since it really does help. You're only graded by a midterm and final but if you complete his past exams you should have no problem

Honestly pretty good lecturer, really good at explaining things and slides are clear. Office hours are helpful as well as section, however the exams are not similar to the practice exams at all. Received an A- on the midterm and a C+ on the final. Most likely will be curved so I will probably get a B or something. The hw does not help tho!

Roh is the GOAT!! Yes your grade is based off only 2 things in the class... but Roh gives you plenty of past exams to prepare yourself with... and he is super helpful in office hours! Roh was able to really weed out the important concepts for genetics and was enjoyable to listen to in lecture.

Ro is such a kind professor and is very understanding if you need to talk to him. I would for sure take him again if I had the option to for a future class. Tests are very hard and your grade is made up of 1 midterm and 1 final. Lectures cover a lot of material, but that is expected for a Genetics class.

The class structure is tough, 40% midterm and 60% final. Homework isn't mandatory and doesn't apply very well to the concepts, TA's advise not to do it. Past exams have no key so you never know if something is correct, neither do the TAs if they can't figure something out. Lectures are intense but aren't applicable to his very tricky exam questions

I gave him a 3 in difficulty because our grades are only based on two tests, so there's no wiggle room if you mess up, but his tests are pretty easy and fair. His lectures are actually pretty helpful and interesting, and it is clear that he is passionate about what he's teaching. It kind of sucks that none of his material has answer keys tho :/

The coursework wasn't easy but it's a genetics course so I wasn't expecting it to be easy! He only grades based on the midterm and the final, but he always answers questions in depth when you ask him during a lecture. So if you don't understand something, you just have to ask! It's clear he loves what he's teaching, which makes it fun to learn.

He was an okay teacher. He does love what he teaches and lectures well( although very fast--> will not slow down) however he only grades two things -- the midterm and the final. He gives out optional hw with no hw answers so its very independent. He also doesn't answer his emails so create a good network of classmates.

a very useless prof. he just reads his slides during lectures. only grades based on midterm and final, yet u don't know if you're doing things right or wrong bc he doesnt have answer keys to hw or any old exams so when u take the midterm, only then do u realize u were doing a type of problem wrong. just don't take his class

You have to work hard. This is my second time taking BIOL105. Took it with Sharma in the Fall. Dropped it. Compared to S's, K's exams are a walk in the park. Do at least 4 of the provided previous exams and get ALL answers checked by TAs/tutors. Join MSI or ACE. I'm in ACE and did several practice exams + some HW. I got 90% on the Midterm.

He's good at explaining but goes pretty fast. He gives you copies of old exams which is helpful. However, only gives two opportunities to get points(1 midterm and 1 final). If you aren't a good test taker or good at being ahead, I would say don't take him. If you are good at staying ahead of the class and are a great with exams then you'll do fine.

Our genetics class had only 2 grades in it (midterm & final) so students were pretty much set up to fail. The midterm was filled with trick questions, subjects we barely covered, and was harshly timed- students were docked points for every minute over time including DRC students. Gets annoyed at class questions, refused to give practice exam keys

Ive always found genetics to be my weakest strength in learning the concepts and while many students said they got an A it wasnt my experience at all but I can definitely tell you that Roh explains everything in detail and I attended about every office hrs and was nice and helpful. If you have a similar experience take him and you will succeed.

Dr. Ro is so cool. He's funny, he's friendly, and he's super knowledgeable about his field. Had him for genetics lab and lecture. His lectures are straightforward and easy to understand. Just memorize the slides and you're guaranteed an A. The lab is awesome as a learning experience in a very laid back environment.
I learned more in his class than I've learned in my entire undergraduate career. He knows how to teach, he's funny, he wants all his students to LEARN. Ro is great.

I put in a lot of hard work and study time to get an A+ in this course. That being said, it is very possible to do well. Ro is great and gives you everything you need to excel in genetics. He is friendly and gives a lot of advice in his office hours. He provides a LOT of practice exams. DO ALL OF THEM. Find a good TA & study pals. Loved this class

Take. Genetics. Seriously. Even if you feel like you know what you're doing, you need to practice in this class. The key is his pas exams, if you know how to do those you'll be golden. Also, go to class! He's a great professor, but his test content can sneak up on you. Study everything he says, even if he says it won't be on the test (histones).

Rho is by far my favorite professor at UCSC. He may be a little intimidating at first, but if you go to his office hours, you will find out that he is actually very generous and super helpful. Genetics is a very hard class but Rho makes it as easy as possible. HW is useless. Got an A by practicing all of his old exams and going to class regularly!
zeros in on smaller details not emphasized that well in class. know even the small random details that seem insignificant, including general understanding of the pictures on the slides

Unempathetic, provides no guidance/study guides, exams are most of your grade and they are graded very harshly, most of the class barely passes the exams and he doesn't seem to care. He tries to be relatable/funny and that's great but considering the overall course, it makes up for nothing. He made me hate going to class.
Lacks any and all empathy. Don't recommend taking or doing anything involving him.

I took Wang for Cell Bio Winter 2021. He changed the syllabus after the first exam due to cheating & the rest of the exams were free response. They weren't too bad if you really study the lectures. The final grade was made up of the 3 exams & a 1 page essay that isn't too bad either. Overall, he is a funny lecturer and makes his lectures enjoyable.

In his course, he was very unfair and inconsiderate, providing no guidance, rubric, nor help on any assignments/tests. When asked about the final grade, his response was rude and explicitly said that people did better than me in the class in a very rude manner. He did not give feedback on the essays we wrote. All in all, avoid Wang.

I took this class the first quarter under lockdown. Although lectures were pre-recorded, he lectures very well, is knowledgeable and also injects some comedy too. This is a hard class, but put in the work and you will do fine, I liked having a project for the final too.

Dr. Wang was a great professor who made sure that his lectures were informative yet engaging. He clearly wanted us to succeed and found good ways to make sure that student's needs were accommodated during the COVID-19 crisis, while still teaching effectively.

Wang was a great lecturer who made the class engaging and was also extremely understanding of student's needs. He clearly wanted us to succeed and balanced strictness with accomodating us in light of the COVID-19 situations.

Dr. Wang was great! He walks you through the lecture and draws out diagrams with you in class. This was really engaging and helped me to remember diagrams more easily. He explains the pathways and progressions very well and makes things easy to follow.

Was clear in lecture and you walk out of there understanding a lot of the content covered. He gives 4 tests, one every 2 weeks; multiple choice (Very TRICKY/Focused on details), T/F, writing and draw. Go over lecture slides and drawings. Attend lecture! It's useful. Curve was generous, I got avg on tests and got an A. Can be condescending at times.
Easy class, lots of busy work though.
Take this class for GE. PNP is fair, it is hard to get an A but easy to pass.

Lots of reading assignments, but the lectures are great! Tad's super cool and has a ton of experience in the field worked for riot, lucas films, and blizzard. Also referenced a ton of relevant video games like league while teaching. Mainly spending the class building a video game, takes a lot of time, but at the end very worth the effort.

Tad is an amazing professor! Very knowledgeable about what he's talking about and loves interacting with students. Deserves even MORE respect than what he already does. Class is straightforward as long as you keep up with the material, and even better if you attend his lectures.

Really easy class, tons of extra credit. The group projects weren't that bad as long as your group is good. Class is not mandatory but the sections are. Quizzes happen every week but they are open note and internet and have no time limit lol. He really wants you to do well in the class but the lectures got boring so I skipped them all. Easy A.

This class was fairly simple online and Tad was a great and very passionate professor. The projects consisted of two games that we were given more than enough time to complete. Quizzes were based on readings and pretty simple. Section attendance counts for your grade, but the actual section and lecture were a little tedious.

tad is pog!!! the class is pretty easy and is fun to engage with. you'll have a few projects (one of them is a group project), and section attendance is mandatory. the class is really fun overall, and tad makes it fun to go to.

UCSC, pay this man. Tad is one of the best instructors at UCSC as he really cares about not only teaching the curriculum, but also trying to give his students a solid sense of direction with what they're doing. Extensive knowledge about the field and just an overall amazing human being.
Fantastic professor, the lecture is really interesting, and it's very kind and knowledgeable. I hope I can take his class again!

I'm not a coder, I am not a computer guy. I took this class for credit. It was awesome. Tad made lectures feel interactive and fun. Even online, I was there for every lecture. It was clear the system hadn't removed his passion yet. Please take his class. Even if just for credit.

Leckman is so experienced in his field it's actually kind of hysterical. He has done so much awesome work creating games and teaching people to make games as well as being part of some really inspiring movements. His lectures are engaging and share some of what it's like to create games and what it means to him.
Fun lectures and assignments. There were daily quizzes that were used in place of attendance. I enjoyed lectures, but they sometimes were off topic.

Very interesting and entertaining lecturer. Gives and takes feedback well from students. Consistent reading assignments but nothing too crazy. Tad has a lot of experience in the game industry working for companies like Lucas Arts, Blizzard, and Riot Games. If you like video games and/or d&d, there's no way you won't like Tad.
Tad's lectures were interesting and informative, drawing on his personal experience in the industry! The assignments were also fun to complete and he left valuable feedback on the assignments.

I can't remember if I've ever done a rate my professor before. Usually I consider this thing to be Disrespectful and Lame. Tad really deserves praise. He taught the entire 170 -> 171 -> 172 sequence this year for both game design majors at UC Santa Cruz. I especially enjoyed the lecture on Tahm Kench.
Tad always goes above and beyond for his students!

Prof. Ballard was really caring and open. I went to his office hours quite a few times and he was always helpful. Some of the readings are really dense, but he's totally willing to explain if you ask him. The class is heavily group project based so hope that you end up w/ good people in your class. He was a really fair grader tho and a lot of fun.

His lectures are so interesting! Understanding professor and silly guy, most of the projects are group projects, attendance is mandatory, as long as you show up and do your best, I'm sure you'll get a good grade! Most criteria for projects are up to interpretation and gives a lot of freedom for creativity.
Clearly extremely passionate about the course work he teaches, and gives students a lot of room to challenge themselves and make interesting projects. Great class overall.
amazing class would take again
This teacher is extremely amazing and enthusiastic about this class, would definitely recommend taking this course if you are at all interested in video games. The group projects are also fun.

He taught a very interesting and engaging class. There are readings, but I felt like you would get the most out of conversations that happened during the lecture. There are 3 major group projects and it's very important you get started on them as early as possible as those due dates do creep up on you pretty quickly.

Patrick is fascinatingly fantastic. I feel very very inspired after being in class and talking to him in office hours.
He is earnest & goofy & thoughtful & relatable & passionate. He is into experimental avant-garde. The class has some dense readings that are very interesting but slightly grueling. If ur not into art you might find uninteresting

Patrick is the most based and inspirational profesor/orator I have encountered. They offer a perspective of reality that empowers students to seek and embody their truth, so that we may live through our art in every moment. Apart from awakening an insatiable hunger to live deeply, Patrik is deeply caring and accommodating. 350 char limit too short!

Lectures are long but engaging and outside the box. Patrick will really encourage you to go outside of your comfort zone and apply the ideas of the class in unexpected ways. Flexible and easy to talk to one on one. I appreciated that he will really challenge you and engage with your work.
He's very creative, but it's exhausting to listen to his lectures. It feels like you have to align your work with his political standards in order to get a high grade.

Amazing professor! Makes lectures fun and enjoyable by being as goofy as possible. Lots of group stuff, but pushes you to be creative with the projects. Very easy to talk to! Playfaire requires you to do lots of outside work so be prepared for that! Highly recommend this professor :)

Very fun teacher. Heavy on group projects, and has graded attendance. Sometimes felt like a rush but other than that minimal issues. Always brought fun energy to the lecture and made the class very enjoyable.

So glad I took this class! The lectures are very interesting and fun and the tangents are also great. Definitely get ready for some vague assignment directions and flexing your creative muscles though. Feedback is informative but kind of late, wish this class was longer, would take again!
He has interesting lecture and assigns fun projects!

Amazing professor! It took me a little while to get out of my shell and just play. He's very respectful, encouraging, and provides helpful information from his lectures and sources. The game fair is a big part of the class, so be creative. He will help anyway he can! Just ask!

Love Patrick. This is the second class I've taken with him and it was so much fun. Very respectful individual, and you can tell he cares about his students. Provides helpful readings and cool information in his lectures. FS take a class with him if possible.

I loved my class with Patrick! He's a really funny, engaging, and kind professor, and the class material was super interesting and got me engaged with levels of theory that were pretty new to me. The amount of reading is a bit much at times but it was a really great class and I really recommend him

Patrick was one of the best teachers I've ever had throughout my entire educational experience. He was funny, inspiring, chill and kind, which all made me want to continue to make games & art to the best of my ability. If I could take one of his classes again, I 100% would. 
Group projects were big in his class, but I made friends because of it!

One of my fav classes so far. Very caring and understanding of people and their lives. This class does require some outside work if you are not up to date. There is some reading to do. And this class is a huge group project, so grades are based on how well the group does. Attendance is mandatory in order to get a good grade.

Such a great professor who has so much passion for his work. He puts so much effort into his lectures and they sometimes run long, but they're almost always about something super interesting. Lots of group projects which could make or break your grade. Usually only about 1-3 small assignments per week. Def one of the best classes I've taken!!

I loved the class and the professor! She is very knowledgeable about the field and provides good feedback on projects. Everything we worked on in class was group projects, often with the option to work alone if you wish to. Project prompts were super fun and engaging. Extremely easygoing class. Definitely recommend!

Easy, caring professor. She has short lectures that are typically straight to the point. Almost everything is a group project. Gave great feedback to my groups before submitting the final assignments. Has lots of great insight and experience if you talk to her outside of class or during office hours.

Very easygoing and helpful. There are a few group projects and attendance is mandatory with 3 allowed absences. The final project takes up half of course and could be done as a group or solo. Fun class
Really good professor and extremely laid back. Occasionally her lectures might be slightly dry but they are still super insightful and you always learn something new from them.

This class was not what I expected it to be, but I'm glad I took it. It's based around creating your own card game, learning concepts in lecture that you would apply in lab assignments due weekly, a lot of creativity involved. Syllabus is clear with due dates. Lectures were interesting and I learned a lot. Pop quizzes are based on weekly readings.

Great professor. Very difficult to get a bad grade since he will just continue to give back homework assignments until you get 100%. 1 online take-home midterm and a final project but neither were difficult.
Very cool dude
Bro was silly
He got us all 5s on AP Physics 2.
Theres a kid named Vihan that acts sped.
Movshovitz englightened me.
Sometimes Movshovitz can't control the class.
Very good teacher

Naor Movshovitz is a luminary in the field of physics. His exceptional grasp of the subject has expanded our comprehension of the universe, while his gift for teaching has ignited the passion for physics in countless individuals.
Movshovitz is the best physics teacher
Classics
He is amazing
Classy class

I hate coding, but he teaches pretty well. Theres only 6 hw assignments, a midterm quiz, and a final project. He gives a lot of grace with due dates and doesn't take points off for being late. But they are pretty hard if you don't know what you are doing so definitely pay attention and go to class--attendance not required but definitely go to class

This is the hardest class I've ever taken. If you have to take a coding class as an astrophysics major, I would strongly recommend taking CSE20 or the Java adjacent. Homework is incredibly difficult. If you have zero coding experience, the class with move at a pace that feels nearly impossible to keep up with.

A kind guy, but also ignored my emails when I desperately needed help on assignments multiple times. Also told me I could revise the final, then did not ever respond, leaving me unsatisfied with my grade

I love Dr. Batalha and thought her class was so interesting (astrobiology). She's very passionate about her work. Not too much required homework (if you read the textbook it's really helpful but a lot of reading and I would only do it sometimes for studying). I def recommend taking her!

She is a very nice person and I also thought that the lectures and the content of the course was all covered in a satisfactory way. However, her methods for preparing the students for the exam was not effective and it showed. The only prep provided was a huge document with every topic ever brought up in the class. Class average was a failing score.
She is very passionate about her teaching and her work. I really enjoyed the class.

I took this course remotely during COVID-19, but I wish I was able to take it in person. Professor Batalha was very passionate about the subject, and kept us engaged in zoom classes. The lectures were interesting and she had to problem fielding every question in the chat. The homework will not be difficult if you attend lecture.

Lectures were interesting and she is very passionate/knowledgeable about the topic. However, lectures are her talking with some diagrams and she was not always organized or clear. The HWs were from the textbook and were difficult/not always relevant. Only 5 HWs, a midterm, final, and small paper. Tests were qualitative and time-crunched, some math.
Lecture slides were beautiful.

Ryan is the best professor I have had at UCSC (rising junior). Took course for the GE and highly recommend. I was terrified bc I hadn't done any math since junior year of high school, but the math is insanely easy and just about the concepts (just logs and inverse square laws). He offered MANY extra credit opportunities that greatly boost grade!!

I'm convinced that he doesn't like us. His attendance policy sucks, you get one chance to take a picture on a specific slide and if you miss it you are marked absent for the whole class. So if you go to the bathroom or are late it's not worth it to go to class. I've seen him do it in the first 30 seconds of class, too. Good teacher, but not kind.

He has amazing visuals within lecture. I'm a humanities major and this class was perfect for learning science since it was conceptual, there was some math but not too much. There is an in person midterm and final but if you're worried about doing well don't worry he has a lot of extra credit opportunities. He's super nice and understanding!
All the lectures and the sections are all mandatory! I did enjoy this course because he made it fun, although there was a lot of information to keep up with, it's definitely manageable
This guy makes learning complicated subjects simple, and keeps you entertained the whole time. Little to no math involved, super easy to comprehend. W professor

Ryan clearly puts a lot of effort into the course. Lectures are mandatory but fun. Lots of information but animations and movies made it easier to follow. Homework took 15 minutes and the exams are curved really easy. For a math GE, there was barely any.
Very passionate about astronomy; attendance is incredibly important. Often passive aggressive & rude with little to no empathy for students.

My least favorite teacher & the hardest GE I took (entirely physics-based). He's arrogant, controlling, rude, and doesn't care about students. Because I missed 1 quiz (for a valid reason) he didn't allow me to make up, I couldn't get an A despite doing every extra-credit opportunity. Prepare for sly, backhanded remarks whenever speaking with him.

I ended with an 82% and I assumed that was a -B but somehow thats a C. This was the worst GE class I have taken. I thought I was going to be getting an introduction however, it was like he expected us to know already. The final was a mess he kept saying different things each time. If you want an easy GE do not take this one.

Very passionate about his work but the class itself takes a bit of effort to understand. He goes over things like we already have a background in astronomy and rushes through slides. Very inconsiderate to students as he didn't want to make class accessible to students who couldn't get on campus during the strike. Very controlling too.

Ryan was passionate about the subject and made continuous effort to support students throughout the duration of the course, despite it being a large lecture-based class. The content was interesting, and he clearly wanted students to succeed in the course. There were fun extra credit opportunities, including a meeting where he provided coffee.

Pros:

Class is easy to pass.
Class material itself is interesting.

Cons:

Professor is controlling, and does not care about the student.
Manner of teaching is suppressive, not expressive.
Exams are not proctored.
Lectures have little context.
Professor dislikes questions, so lectures remain contextless.
Professor discourages academic curiosity.

Ryan has a lot of original and interesting ideas of how to run his class. Easily the biggest problem was he made a star modeling software that only runs on Mac/Linux mandatory, and it was awful. He had us conduct real world research but it was too much for any undergrad to handle. His lectures are too math heavy. His grading scale is fair.

ASTR-19:  You could tell he is passionate about what he teaches and is a great teacher. Just come to the lectures. As someone with previously--little Python experience--I learned A LOT in his class. Yes, his projects are confusing, so I just did extra reading to figure them out, and he's always there to help. Would 100% recommend his class.

Terrible professor. Don't take if you care about GPA. reads off slides and has unclear instructions for large projects. if you don't have outside knowledge of coding, the projects are nearly impossible and he is not very helpful. DO NOT take this professor.
Very unclear instructions with large projects. Reads off a slide every class to teach and is not helpful when you go up to him for help.

Taken Fall Quarter 2017. Was a dead class most of the time so he probably did the best he could. Was mostly fine, but it was very boring at points, which isn't helped by his speaking tempo. Not very understanding when it came to going home for holidays. Definitely was passionate and disliked students who weren't engaged.

Brant's lectures were always well planned and clear, though at times dense and heavy on the amount of material we covered. He obviously wants you to pass. He's a fair grader and approachable outside of lecture. He made astrophysics seem a lot more simple than it is.
awesome

This was a great course if you have little knowledge of physics and astronomy. I couldn't recommend this course enough for completing the MF GE requirement. Professor Bundy had great lectures and the assignments were easy (in this online format for Fall 2020) to complete.

Prof. Bundy is amazing! Passionate about astronomy and clearly cares for his students. I always looked forward to his lectures. He has a great sense of humor and even used student-made memes in his presentation. 10/10 class with a 10/10 professor.

Homework is minimal and tests/quizzes are easy to pass if you pay attention (or even if you dont), so anyone should be able to pass his class. Hes really caring and a great guy to learn from since hes so passionate about astronomy. TAs were all really good to learn from too! Need a class? Hes the one to go to.

Dr. Bundy is an AMAZING professor, who really takes time to listen to what his students need! He makes the class fun and exciting and doable, even for people who aren't amazing at math/science. I would definitely recommend taking this class!!

Prof Bundy is one of the best teachers I've had. He gives killer lectures and shows you that he's passionate about what he does. His grading criteria are clear and his class is straightforward. You'll learn lots of really cool things with him. Overall a great guy!
Oh my god, Kevin is awesome. If you have the opportunity to take a class he teaches, you take it. His teaching is clear and careful, with a healthy mix of humor and good stories.
This class is a must take. Professor Bundy is incredibly kind and passionate about astronomy. I almost switched to being an astronomy major because of him!
He is a super fun prof and usually always gives a q&a after lectures and gives time to the students.

he's a clear to understand and nice professor. the textbook was a textbook he was writing so it worked well with what we were learning in class. every thursday had group participation problems to solve. every week had a quiz, reading assignment, and problem set. final was a project on an exoplanet and give a 2 min speech in class.
Very cool professor. You're gonna have work, but as long as you remain dedicated, you'll pass! Not to mention, he's very passionate about astronomy.

Jonathan is an excellent professor and I love his lecture style. His derivations on the board are very well-motivated and informative, and his slides are always interesting. Lectures are exciting. Jonathan is funny, enthusiastic, and really good at answering questions. All of his classes have been great! Tests are fair. Go Jonathan!
He loves going to conferences a lot and leaves us with nothing really. I think I learned like 5 concepts from this class.

Use caution when taking Fortney's classes, he means well and is very intelligent. Unfortunately he is a horrible instructor. I will more than likely end up with an 'A' in the class, but I know I should be coming out of this class with more knowledge than going in -- I'm not sure I am. Every class his math is flawed, and the book < useless. Avoid!

Don't take astronomy 3 with this teacher. He is a really nice and smart professor but does not know how to keep students attendance. He goes over 2-3 ch. per class. Maybe if you're astronomy major might want to take this class but if ur looking for a easy G.E DONT TAKE IT!!!!!  I put so much effort in still ended up with a C.
Best Astro Teacher No Doubt. Super chill and funny. Really smart guy seems like he'd be cool to hangout with. He knows everything you'd ever want to know about space.

Pretty cool class on formation and properties of planets, and the ongoing search for them. Should only get more interesting as science progresses. Oh, and the professor is really friendly and helpful! Good experience.

Professor Rubin is very nice and cares a lot about his students. His exams are very reasonable and his lectures are clear and concise. My only gripes with this class was the homework and discussion quizzes. The ALEKS homework was tedious and often unhelpful and the discussion canvas quizzes were also quite annoying.

Very kind and passionate professor! The given homework helped apply the topics to the midterms and finals, and on top of that he provided a bunch of practice problems both in lecture and in study packets which helped me succeed in all the exams!
Very passionate about his class, great teacher, makes lectures interesting. Moves through lectures quickly but records them so students can go back and rewatch later.

Seth is a great professor and although his lectures are very fast-paced and content heavy, his office hours are extremely helpful so I definitely recommend going to them! Very clear with his explanations. Do expect to spend lots of time studying and doing homework for this class though. This class got me interested in chemistry so I recommend!

Seth is a great teacher, but he moves incredibly fast. If you're like me, going to MSI, reviewing ALEKS, doing tons of problems, and still not doing good...go to his office hours! My grade shot up as soon as I started attending. They're especially helpful during midterm and finals season, he goes over types of problems that show up in the tests!

Hes really caring and understanding but he follows a strict grading policy so whatever grade you get is the grade you stick with. There is no extra credit, but he is very accessible during office hours. Majority of the hw is through ALEKS, just make sure you stay on top of it and its fine.

The tests are worth everything in this class. He doesn't curve or offer extra credit for this class. Most of his lectures are fast-paced but you can rewatch the recordings. Great dude with a fun personality, but if this is your first chem class since like the start of hs and you think you might need extra credit, don't take him.

Professor Rubin had engaging lectures and explained concepts well. I had not taken chem in high school so it took a lot of work in the beginning to get caught up. The homework is mostly graded from participation, however be ready to work hard to finish the topics (ALEKS). TA's were very helpful & its clear prof Rubin cares a lot about his students.

Though Seth is a good guy, he goes way too fast in lecture for anyone to keep up. I distinctly remember that whenever he paused to ask questions, no one ever answered because we were too busy trying copy our notes down. Tests are very difficult, and quizzes are even more challenging. If you have him, go to as many office hours as you can.

Lectures will not be enough to pass this course. Goes super fast 2-4 new topics each class, ALEKs homework is extremely frustrating and are even harder than tests. You will fail the quizzes but it's okay since you should use them to study for the midterms. This class requires a lot of work and the final is a hard cumulative assessment.

Seth is a wonderful professor. Although already understanding most of the content, the lectures were very well put together. Seth is passionate about teaching and I would take him again in a heartbeat.

Seth is a very nice guy, but not the best at preparing us for the homework or exams. Weekly tests arent worth much, but are almost impossible to do well on. Homework eats up most of my time during the week. Go to section or you will not understand the material!

I took this online for my major and hated it. He goes way to fast and doesnt go over things clearly. My TA advices to try and get a C to barely pass. This was advertised as beginner friendly but thats a lie. Be prepared for tons of homework and heavy weighted exams. Horrible

his lectures were pretty thorough and he was good at answering questions that people had. homework was really tedious (and on webassign) and there were quizzes every week, but if you paid attention and read the textbook it wasn't too bad.

The class wasnt difficult, but the grades were inaccurate/a secret the entire quarter due to him not knowing how to include discussion sections correctly. Also, it was hard to read his writing during zoom lectures since he wrote on paper.
Seth was a great teacher! He was really attentive about answering questions and having a lot of office hours and staying after class to help you out!

his class is difficult but he's readily available if you need help and answers emails super quickly. exams are much easier than homework. overall the material of the class was hard but he made it enjoyable!

His lectures cover the basics with easy examples, but the tests, HW and quizzes have difficult problems very different than in class. What is taught in class is not enough to pass. You will be teaching yourself. He says he curves, but only enough so that those who failed (D+, C-) pass. If you don't have a failing grade, he won't curve your grade.

Prof Rubin's lectures were thorough and clear but the homework often was not in line with what was taught in the lecture and was very tedious. Classes were not mandatory which was helpful to be able to go at your own pace but if you fall behind, that is tricky to come back from. The prof is very available through frequent office hours.

Professor Rubin was an awesome professor whose class was super engaging. His lectures were very engaging and straightforward and was super accessible via email and office hours. His class was a bit difficult, but he does everything in his power to ensure you understand the material.

Lectures weren't helpful. The notebook and report guidelines were vague, and there were no given outlines. The lab protocols often contained incorrect instructions. At times, even my TA was confused about what he expected in our reports.

This class was so hard for no reason. The canvas was not designed to be useful to the students. There were no due dates in canvas. His lectures were pointless ranting that did not help with the lab reports or experiments, only blessing is that they weren't attendance mandatory. What he said in lecture versus what happened was so contradictory.

Guido is an amazing professor with great humor! He breaks down a lot of concepts in biology that may be hard to understand into realistic metaphors that make them very understandable. He cares a whole lot about fairness and will always try to help students. This class has a lot of material, however. Keep up to date with the slides.

This class was hard but the textbooks and teaching team are always helpful. Don't procrastinate because exams are material heavy and hard to cram. Exams are also a little tricky and can sometimes feel like there's more than one right answer (multiple choice exams). You'll be solid if you're good at taking exams and memorization 
He's a good guy

Guido is SO funny and encouraging! This class is pretty hard, but it's just the content and not his fault. He gives very interactive lectures and is so open to go to if you need help! His tests are pretty hard, so study a lot for each and treat it like a final! I recommend ACE. Love love love Guido and would 1000% take another one of his classes!

Guido is an amazing teacher, he is so passionate about what he's teaching and he truly cares about his students. He constantly provided extra credit opportunities and did his best to engage with the class throughout the lecture. His tests are a little hard and there's a lot of content to learn/memorize but that's to be expected from biology.

Guido is so funny and his class is SO engaging. He catered to various learning styles by doing notes/lecture, watching videos, and demonstrations of topics. Even though the class is long, I looked forward to going to class because he had so much energy and would actually talk to us.

Guido is a really great professor. I've had him for Bio 20A and his lectures are fun and interesting, as well as engaging. He really cares about his students and often encourages his students to participate and ask questions. His exams aren't the best, but the class is based mostly on quizzes and homework assignments, as well as class assignments.

Guido is actually one of the funniest people I've had as a professor. He's super passionate about what he's teaching and often times makes jokes (especially about his love for In-n-out). Don't get me wrong, the class is pretty hard since its a lot of material to cover, but Guido makes it easy to digest with the activities he implements in class.

If Guido has 10,000 fans, I am one of them. If Guido has one fan, it is me. If Guido has no fans, I am dead. This is my GOAT right here. Even though we've only talked like twice, I feel like we were best friends in a past life. Hes the only person who can make chemiosmosis seem interesting.

Such an amazing professor. His class was tough but he gave a lot of extra credit to bring your grade up. Midterms are lecture heavy but he's super interactive during class which makes it easier to learn.

The lectures were very interactive, although most of the material on the slides was not the same as seen on the test - it tended to be much more complex and had many trick problems. The first midterm average was so low that he turned off the ability to see the averages. Be ready to spend a lot of time studying and reviewing to pass.
He do not keep his words.

Guido is an absolutely amazing professor and really does care about his students! He's a hilarious lecturer and makes such heavy material fun to learn. However, this is a rigorous course and you will have to study hard to get the grade that you desire, but it isn't impossible. He's also straight forward and fair with his exams and expectations.

He doesnt care about his students and wont give any accommodations to students. No exceptions at all. For the whole quarter I was undergoing a traumatic experience. The police, Title IX, and student conduct all understood the severity, and so did this professor. When the CARE office requested accommodations on my behalf, he offered close to nothing

Honestly don't remember much about his teaching style, but I know that a good amount of people had to retake it. His lectures are pretty text heavy, and writing notes in class is hard. Going to section was helpful and the way it was set up really deepened my understanding of the material. Almost all other bio courses work like this one.

Guido is very passionate, knowledgable, and has very inspiring stories to tell. This class however is very intense, and it's definitely on you to study for the tests and be prepared. I frequently felt like I was making my best guess on what to focus on, or just had to know everything which made tests hard. This quarter the tests were jam packed.

His tests are lengthy and you will be more stressed about finishing the test than actually reading the questions. 
He does not test for understanding but how well you can read. His free-response questions are nice but his multiple choice are impossible. 
He is funny and loves science but his way of testing for knowledge is not ideal.
amazing and cool

If you like a class that uses a clear rubric system where you know exactly what you will be graded on then this will not be a good professor for you. Jimmy comes in with good intentions to challenge students and show them what the real world will look like, but he does it in a discouraging way. Did not hold kindness in his heart

He was very enthusiastic about the subjects he was discussing and was always willing to go back over any topics needed. Professor Shanks assigned lots of readings but always gave us ample time (up until the midterm/final) to do them and would give us reminders. When I had a family emergency, he was incredibly accommodating, rescheduling my midterm.
Class itself is great, loved it! Shanks is a PAIN in the bum tho. Does not listen to student concerns, yells, and always thinks he is right. NGL he is difficult to deal with.
Took the neurobiology lab last spring and really enjoyed the class. You can tell he's passionate about the subject and he was always willing to talk and offer any advice.

just put in the work and do the reading and you'll be fine. he's great to talk to outside of class and is seriously passionate about what he teaches, definitely will be taking a class with him again :)
This mf is actually sexist lmao
If you aren't religious, pick a religion FAST and start praying. This class is incredibly demanding for a 2-unit course. Would not recommend at ALL.
I liked him, he is nice and passionate about the material, I was surprised looking here that he has a lower rating than teachers I hated.
evil and bald unfortunately.

Professor Shanks is really passionate about the material and does a really good job simplifying the complexities of MCD bio for people who have never seen it before. I am a bio major but I think with a little effort this could be understood and enjoyed by non stem students. super interesting class, I look forward to lecture and hw.

Shanks is downright degrading and seemingly not passionate for his profession. The class is unstructured and professor/TA's are eager to take points off assignments for literally everything. My advice? Don't take his class and wait until another professor is offering this course.

After taking this class, I was surprised to see many overly positive reviews. Based on my experience, I suspect some may not be genuine. Just sharing my honest experience approach his class with caution. He lacks structure both in his teaching and personal conduct, which makes his class feel unpredictable and, unfortunately, difficult to follow.

Unfortunately, this professor often went on unrelated tangents about his personal life, which disrupted learning. His frustration with his career created a negative environment. I hope future students experience a more respectful and supportive classroom
Assignments have confusing rubrics or are not directly stated making class difficult

When I took this lab there was only 1 exam and 1 presentation. I believe he now has 2 exams and 2 presentations. I got lucky having a TA who was pretty chill. The prof was also pretty rude to some students. This class kinda turned me off of pursuing research, until I took Bio101L and loved it. I'd recommend going with the other prof if you can.

His class was not hard or anything, it was doable, but objectively, he is not nice. Very egotistical and bordered on rude interacting with students. His class entails a lot of work for a two credit lab, but the real issue is just how mean he is, and it just seems like he wants to hear himself talk. This sort of attitude makes him a bad prof.

Either my TA sucked or the actual professor was too harsh but for a 2 credit lab course there is way too much work. Projects or lab reports are due every week, and strict lab notebook checks. And don't get me started on the fact that this lab has a final and some quizzes some weeks.

Found his class to be easy and his expectations clear. He told us EXACTLY what to include in lab reports and I got good grades as long as I did just that. The midterm is literally some basic C1V1=C2V2 algebra and converting units. He really cares about his students success, so he can be harsh and press certain things that are important.

LOVE THIS CLASS! Yes, he is really difficult and the class should NOT be this hard considering it is 2 credits. But honestly I learned so much. As long as you put in good work you will do fine. It is a LOT of work beware. I really love Jimmy and he is super passionate and caring. Even though he can seem scary, he really is a sweet guy who cares.

Dont raise your hand in class if you arent 100% sure of your answer. Otherwise he might criticize you for being wrong. A lot of his grading is random with no clear guidelines which means that if you cant read his mind, you are not going to get full points except on presentations (the only time he doesn't show up to class)

Prof. Greider is crazy intelligent and capable of explaining concepts in a way that is universally comprehensible. Certainly a very reasonable class in terms of grading and the midterms and final are very fair in terms of material covered, they are assay-heavy and real-life-oriented which is great, no need to memorize esoteric language and terms.

This professor is hands down the best I've had at UCSC. She is very smart and can explain concepts clearly. Her exams also don't trick you, so as long as you go to lectures and section, and spend time studying the material you should be good. There were 3 exams (cumulative). Highly recommend taking molec with her.

The best organization/structure of a class ever. There's 3 midterms, no cumulative final. There's problem sets due a couple days before each midterm and are mainly spot graded and mostly by completion, boosting your grade by a lot. The tests are mainly experimental analysis and the class is genuinely interesting. 10/10 hands down.

Overall good lecturer and does pretty well in breaking down the complex and detailed material. She did have in class participation quizzes and actually being present for lectures was important. Grading was pretty test-heavy- based on 2 midterms and a final, but also had 3 problem sets which can easily balances out grades point-wise.

Dr. Greider was one of the most understanding professors I've had, was happy to listen to students and push back due dates + let us drop our lowest exam score. I learned a lot from her lectures (mandatory) and her expertise on the subject is so clear. Exams and homework are heavy on experimental methods so study those!!

He definitely cares about students and is happy to help but at the same time I felt like I was just doing things without understanding what I was doing and he went over general concepts of lab procedures during lecture but instructions for data interpretation or other assignments didn't feel clear/thorough enough.

Doody is a great person but I feel that this 2 unit lab had too much work. I appreciated the skills and data interpretation learned but it feels almost like busy work at times and I felt harshly graded on certain assignments. This class also has a midterm AND a final. It was a fine class but I feel like I deserve more units for the effort put in.

I wish I put more effort into Doody's class. He is a recent graduate and knows how to explain in ways that undergraduates would understand. The quality of BIOL 105 instructors are highly varied, so if you have options, pick Doody first.

My favorite instructor I've had a UCSC!! His lectures are engaging, fun, and thoughtfully structured to make even challenging content interesting. While the material can be difficult, he goes above and beyond to support his students providing clear expectations and extra help outside of class if needed.

Micheal is my favorite professor I've ever had. He's so funny and caring. He takes the pressure off of being a STEM student. He made me fall in love with science again after having professors that made me feel dumb.
Michael genuinely cares for his students and takes time to get to know you if you do the same!! He does the best to make you succeed and trust it's rare for STEM professors to try as hard as he does.
Solid dude

Very good Professor he is a caring teacher and has amazing lectures that are very engaging. The only stem teacher that I have found at UCSC that actually cares about his students and understands life problems. Not only that but his lectures are very self explanatory and he gives a lot of practice problems that will help you on exams.

Awesome and caring teacher, which is so hard to find in STEM classes. He cares so much about his students and their success. But the content is difficult and his final is way way harder than midterms but the curve helps a lot.

Michael is so caring and passionate about who and what he's teaching. Definitely puts in his 100% to make sure everyone is on the same page through extra review sessions, polling what students need more help in, etc. the material was hard and some of the exam questions were very hard but nevertheless a great professor who talks at the perfect speed

Professor Doody truly cares about his students. He gives clear and informative lectures and makes the tests very fair. He seems to grade easy to fair, but most of your grade is dependent on the midterms and finals. Overall a great professor who helps his students access study resources and who knows his stuff.

It is difficult to like or enjoy his class since you are only graded on exams. There are 2 midterms (50%), a final (37.5%), and some quizzes. The quizzes are easy, but the midterms are very difficult. I do like him as a person, but I don't think he prepares you well for exams, and no matter how much studying I did, I still would fail midterms.Avoid

Spring 2022 was Michael's first time teaching. He did really well, better than some other seasoned professors I've had. He was extremely compassionate and a fun lecturer. Tests were tricky, especially the final. I and other students I'd talked to felt underprepared for it. He did curve when necessary and genuinely wants students to succeed.

This was Michael's first time teaching as a professor & I think he did pretty well. His exams were difficult if you didn't study his practice exams, they were handy for the midterms.However, the final went very poorly.
