Pedro is the fuc**g goat. He made Math 100 actually enjoyable, and his lectures are super entertaining. The class weight added up to 105% which made it easier to get a better grade. Still waiting to take to the final, but overall highly recommend. Homework was lengthy, but it was expected. Would take another class with him again.

19B winter 25. His lectures made calc 2 concepts seem extremely intuitive, and grading is really generous. Not exam heavy at all and lots of extra credit. Exams themselves are straightforward and don't have any curveballs
Just overall a great professor. Real ones know that if you put your mind to it, you're guaranteed an A.

His lectures were super theoretical. He'd use examples, but they'd only teach very specific scenarios, and he'd explain them using theory so that you could never apply what you learned anywhere else. The projects were also completely different from the material covered in class.
One of the best professors within the Math Department.

Took him for 19A in the fall—he's genuinely cool. When a tough midterm question tripped everyone up, he let us explain our solutions afterward to recoup marks. Lectures were engaging and fun. Study the topics he explains after class and attend class, and you're practically guaranteed an A.

Pedro i love you. I have always been a "not stem kid", and bad at math, expecting to get a c in this class. You can do anything you set your mind to with Pedro. Pedro you're the goat. He's so kind to his students and very obviously passionate about the subject. Also gives so much extra credit and buffer room to get an A. Genuinely my goat

Prof Morales is just great. His 19A really improves his 19B course however he still lays things out clearly. Excellent lecturer and just cares a lot. Take the 19 series with him if you can. Just hope your TA doesn't suck because sections are mandatory.

He's a very good speaker and he definitely cares about the students. I hadn't taken the class before with him (MATH 19A) and he referenced it a lot so I was pretty confused. Overall, there are much worse math professors at UCSC and Pedro is a very good option if you are required to take MATH 19B.

Engaging, enjoyable, & a bit funny. Preclass modules are comprehensive & incredible; you don't need to attend lectures because of them. HW helps you reinforce learned topics. Section activity experience varies on what day you have it & what you know. Only issue was some problems were so complex that even the TAs couldn't solve them. Solid prof!
Prof. Morales the goat. Just do hw, and come to lectures for good practice problems for midterm and final. Good lectures. Very helpful during office hours.

This guy is genuinely a great professor. I had some AP Calc AB knowledge which helped me a bit. He genuinely cares, and explains things very well. As long as you keep up with all the pre lecture assignments and do those thouroughly it helps alot. I highly recommend his class if your willing to put a bit more time into it. Midterms are theory heavy.
choose happiness, don't do this to yourself.

Prof Morales is awesome, he makes calculus very digestible. Section is mandatory, hope you get a good TA. I'm taking MATH 19B w/ him also. If you put in the effort you will pass this class. He really cares about his students and you can tell. He knew many of us by name at the end of the quarter. Would highly recommend.

Engaging lectures and accessible professor. Recommend using resources like Unstuck study along with office hours to get a solid grasp on concepts. Homework-heavy but manageable if you stay on top of it.

I already knew most of the content that is in this course so it was easy for me, but the way he teaches things is easy to understand so even difficult concepts are made easy. The tests are pretty hard but as long as you expect applications (which he makes well known will be on the test) you should be fine.

Highly recommend taking this class with Pedro. Midterm and final were difficult but even if you don't do super well on them if you've done all the rest of the work you can still get a good grade in this class. He explains things really well and makes you feel welcome in an intimidating subject. Section is mandatory.

I disagree with people who say "he doesn't seem to care much about the orchestra." I see quite the opposite. Bruce is a great director who genuinely enjoys what he does regardless of what ensemble he's conducting. He's inspirational, fun, hard-working, and skillful. Take this class, you won't regret it! It's not a big workload.
Has a great sense of humor. Very confident and makes rehearsals fun
Great orchestra director

Bruce picks out the music and leads the ensemble like any other conductor would. It doesn't really seem like he particularly cares for the ensemble, as he has other orchestras he prioritizes. The concerts are still enjoyable and you definitely get the orchestra experience, but that's about it.
Really nice conductor!

Bruce is a good conductor and a good director. He gets the job done quite well, and is engaging during rehearsals. My only major complaint is that he's doesn't really seem to be super invested in this particular ensemble, as he conducts a lot of other ones elsewhere. He also repeats pieces between quarters a bit more often than I'd like.
A fun and engaging class!

Nat is an awesome choir director (and wind ensemble director). His rehearsals are fun and fly by because of how engaged he is with everyone in the room. Excellent taste in music as well and very fun programming for concerts. 10/10 recommend
Nat is one of the best conductors Ive ever had!
Personally struggled to enjoy the class, but Professor Berman is a great director. He is careful to be clear and open with the class about what he wants and how to get there.

Nathaniel is one of my favorite music teachers ever. He constantly balances between being "on" and incredibly dynamic and funny while also being deeply thoughtful and giving us plenty of opportunities to reflect on the nuances in the pieces we're working on.
Nat is an amazing director. He always picks awesome music and really clearly cares about us as musicians. He's also one of the funniest teachers/professors/directors I've ever had.
Very great and highly recommended

Nat is an absolutely wonderful wind ensemble director. He'll tell you if you're playing something wrong, and he's relatively tough, but never mean. He is always encouraging and never lets you go with giving less than your best. You have to practice to do well and get the part you want, but nothing that's not worth it!
Nat is fantastic. Serious yet fun and easygoing, soft-spoken but confident and means what he says, nicest guy in the music department.
Nat is one of the finest choir directors I have ever had the pleasure to work with. He dedicates a lot to both the music and his students, and his passion is quite apparent.

He is a very good teacher who will work very hard with you to get you to learn the music. The only problem I had was that I really wish he could have made a variety of song choices. Every song we sang was in Spanish. Other than that, he is a no nonsense type of teacher but the class isn't a lot of hard work. It just requires a lot of time.

If you can read music semi-well and keep a tune, you NEED to audition for Concert Choir.  Beautiful music and very fun. Nat is everything you could want in a director -- nice, funny, clear, diplomatic, and never humiliates or puts people down.  It was my first choir experience and I had a blast, as did experienced singers.
I don't like the fact that he doesn't even teach a single lecture and assigns a lot of work for someone who doesn't even teach the class. I would honestly not recommend take a diff gen ed/

This class was honestly a lot of work for what it is. I took it expecting an easy online asynch, and that is not what I got. Don't get me wrong it was not as much work as most major classes but definitely not a fly-through like some of the other online asynchs like COWL 52. Fiore didn't do any of the teaching, so can't really speak on him as a prof

Took this because I heard it was an easy A. DO NOT DO THIS. It's not super hard, but it is LOTS OF WORK. The workload is way too high for an online GE. Weekly quizzes, essays, and lots of readings, listenings, lectures, and videos. This class was too much work for an online asynchronous non-major class, I was spending more time on it than my major

i took the beatles class a few quarters ago with professor fiore and when i saw he was teaching an online class i got excited. was super disappointed when i realized he doesn't actually teach this class with his own lectures, it's some random guy and his lectures are super boring. not really a rating on giacomo fiore, more this class he facilitates

graded on 5 small writing assignments, weekly super easy quizzes, midterm and final. midterm and final were so easy. most questions were from previous quizzes. hes not the one in the lecture videos but hes easy to talk to outside of class and reasonable grader. super easy fun and interesting ge, i would def recommend!
As long as you watch the lectures and don't miss an assignment you're pretty much guaranteed an A. Basically a perfect GE course. Really fun coursework and I really liked this class.

prof was kind and accessible. class was mainly a lot of lectures and readings, with 500 word writing assignments due every other week. the weekly online quizzes are a little difficult but the midterm and final are easier.

It's an online class so my expectations were low going in. Lectures are quite engaging, they're professional filmed, not just him talking into a webcam. There's a lot of lectures and they feel a little long, but they're reasonable. Lots of quizzes and a good amount of writing assignments, all very doable. Relatively easy class, in a good way.
Almost impossible to fail the class just do the work.

An amazing professor! While it helps that the material is already enjoyable the professor still helps to make the experience even better! Quizzes, Midterms, and Finals were all async meaning it was easy to get A's on them as they were all open note. By far one of the best professors I've had at this school.

I looked forward to attending this class every week. Giacomo really really cares about what he teaches and you can tell through his lectures. His demonstrations are incredibly rad. All around, I'd retake this class over and over again. Love this guy!

Prof. Fiore is easily one of the best professors to exist. Lectures and fun and the quizzes and midterm/final are all online and are done outside of class. Super funny professor as well. He was always making little jokes and having a laugh the whole time. TAKE HIS CLASS PLEASE YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!! Easy GE too! (This is the Beatles class btw)

From the introduction zoom call, he was a fantastic professor.  Too bad most of this class was taught by lecture videos and his own writings.  Still, really great guy and especially respondent to emails.
He is such a great professor!! He cracks lots of jokes and has very fun and packed lectures. I liked the assignments, mostly quizzes and discussions. He is simply just the best
He was very passionate and talked deeply about music and detail. Written assignments were fun but long. He is a baller and I wish I could've met him instead of just watching videos of him online.
genuinely writing this while taking his final. baller teacher. cares about the music the most, and i love it.

He is an amazing professor, the Beatles class was so much! I would definitely recommend taking one of his classes, it was fun, easy, and his lectures were super engaging. Beware though, the class is super detail-oriented and note-heavy, but he has TAs that post the notes after class so there isn't much to worry about in that department.

If you are a Beatles fan you will love this class. Lectures are slides about albums with listening time in lectures. However, quiz and test questions are extremely specific. I took intense, specific notes from every lecture slide but the questions on the quizzes are different and not in my notes. Also, he does not post lecture slides.

Never interacted with prof after week 1, so I'm rating 80P here. It's all prerecorded and taught by a different instructor. Lectures were fine but the course took some getting used to. The quiz questions are very specific so I would start early and rely on searching the provided outlines or the captions on videos. Essays are easy but kinda a pain.

Professor Fiore has got to be one of the best professors I've had. He's funny and great at teaching the content of the course. You need to show up to every lecture or you won't do well. There are a couple of short writing assignments, one quiz that goes over lecture material per week, a midterm and final, and listening assignments every week..

He never grades or gives feedback. All assignments were graded the day before grades were due. There are weekly journal entries that are over 500 words on top of reading about nine articles or chapters of texts each week. In class there are discussions about the readings.
Kay is very thoughtful and cares a lot about his class. If you need anything he would be happy to help and answer any questions.

Super cool prof and, from what I can tell by talking to people in other core sections, he seems to be the best of the core profs from my year. Fun and engaging and easy to conversate with. Also very understanding about late work and life situations. I wasn't a big fan of the MERR 1 corse curriculum but prof. Kay made it enjoyable.

He was very aware of students' lives outside of class, and understanding towards the realities of life that can make it difficult for people to meet deadlines and complete all assignments. Liked his classes; they were engaging and facilitated lots of open discussions.
He is a great teacher, if it is possible take his class.

Super amazing class and prof. He's a really good lecturer and if you watch all the lectures then you can definitely do amazing in this class. He allows a note sheet for exams, and has ways to earn back missed points on exams. He really teaches it as a true intro class, and doesn't go down rabbit holes or anything. Definitely take this class!!!
Professor Patnode is easily the best professor I've had in UCSC. He is extremely passionate about what he teaches and wants his students to succeed in the course! Take this class!!!

Fantastic professor. One of my favorites. The class was so interesting and he made it engaging and included lots of fun facts! The class was approachable but SO interesting. I felt like I learned so much!!!

Best class I've had at UCSC! Prof. Patnode is super caring and has amazing lectures. His lectures are very visual and he has blank notes that you can download and fill in during class. He allows cheat sheets on exams as well as opportunities to correct a few mistakes you may make on the midterms. Highly recommend :)

100% recommend! Best professor i've had at ucsc, truly made me love microbiology. Course is very well structured with quizzes (allowed multiple attempts), discussion posts, and many extra credit opportunities. Patnode really wants you to succeed and sets you up to do well on exams. Lectures were super interesting.

Only homework is a single discussion post after every lecture. 10/10. Lectures are very clear and engaging, Patnode is very enthusiastic about teaching this class. TAs were very helpful and their review sessions were even more helpful. Multiple quizzes due at each test are unlimited attempts. Very lenient with test grading. Ton of extra credit

It was his first time teaching this course and overall he was a very effective lecturer. Test questions are based off his lectures so no textbook was required. Exams were online and fair in difficulty but were too long to go back and had barely enough time to answer everything even if it wasn't correct. Mandatory section. Extra credit offered.

Such a great person to take molecular biology with. She truly wants all their students to succeed. She is always available during office hours and during lecture to answer any questions. I would take another class with her if I could. She gives out extra credit via exam wrappers and drops the lowest quiz AND exam scores.

Dr Stone was a clear and effective lecturer as she would annotate her powerpoint slides while going through them. Exams were fair but be careful with time. 3 exams and four quizzes but the lowest exam and quiz are dropped. Quizzes can be a bit tricky. Was also taught by Dr Greider

Vicki was an enjoyable lady and the material taught was very interesting. She was accessible outside of class and gave old exams + main study points that helped us with studying for the test. She was so kind and provide us with red scantrons for both midterms and final. Quizzes were extra credit and she constantly reminded us to do them.
One of the best classes I've ever taken at UCSC! Victoria is beyond helpful and approachable and makes learning very easy. Would definitely recommend taking this class.
I enjoyed her class so much.

Very interesting class, awesome professor. Gives great lectures. Offers 6% extra credit in the form of pop quizzes (show up to class). Easy for an upper division class. Gives practice midterms. No excuse to not do well in her class.
Great teacher and class. Learned a lot and really enjoyed it. Take the class with her, study and you'll get the A

great professor and a pretty interesting class! her test are fair and straightforward. go to section, do the study questions, practice exams and you'll get a good idea of what will be on the tests. i don't think she curves much (avg around 77-80%?)but its doable to get an A in if you put in the time and effort. highly recommend!

Prof Stone is very clear, concise, and presents the material in a very organized fashion. She makes very good use of technology and keeps the class interesting. She is not boring and makes coming to class at 8am worth your while. She is very helpful and very dedicated. I didn't didn't attend OH but people who did said it was worth going.

Prof. Stone made the class interesting. Her voice did not put me to sleep. The book is not necessary to do well in the class. Just make sure you attend lectures (b/c she likes to write/draw on the board sometimes) and listen to her podcasts. I really enjoyed the class.
Awesome professor! Extremely helpful and clear about what she expects from you. Lectures were very interesting and made waking up early tolerable. Definitely take this class!

Content is genuinely quite interesting, the demonstrations and guest lectures make the class unique and fun with a low workload. Terra is also amazing and offers support whenever you may need it. Her personality combined with the class structure makes it super low stress and easy but fun to complete. Would definitely recommend.
Best professor ever. He genuinely made me consider switching majors to microbiology

This is genuinely my favorite class I've taken at this school. I randomly took it for a GE and I'm so glad that I did. Chad Saltikov is absolutely GOATed. Take the class if you can. If you do the work (which isn't very hard or time consuming), you will get an A. Textbook provided to students for free

Awesome professor. Very kind and lenient, and very responsive to emails. Interesting class. Lectures are very helpful

Get ready to read a lot. He assigns a research paper to read every week. It's tough but it's also entirely manageable

I highly recommend this class. Take it if you can.

Chad is super funny and engaging. His lectures were so entertaining and the content rules. This class significantly improved my ability to read and understand scientific literature. Grade was mostly your final project, with case studies and problem sets taking up the rest of the points. This may change if the class gets bigger though!

Chad is always willing to answer any questions from the students even if the answer is obvious and is a really chill guy overall. Grading is straightforward and proffessor is generous to let you resubmit assignments for full credit. Priority seems to be to let students learn lab techniques instead of worry about grades. TA Juliana is also great.
He is very nice and lovely. He is very fair and know what he teaches and does.

Professor: He's super chill but still expects you to know the material. Responds quickly to emails. He's a really sweet and approachable guy, and really funny. He knows his stuff, and will gladly help you out. Class: Do every assignment, work on your lab reports a bit each day. Those lab reports are long,he lets you a revision on one.
Best lab class!!! He is so nice and helpful. The workload is not too bad.

All notes posted online, but it's really helpful to attend class regularly and take your own notes. Dude loves metabolism questions. Exams are hard, but fair if you study everything. He likes applying issues to questions. Really helpful if you go to office hours. TAs were amazing.

A very intelligent man, good-natured and a privilege to know. Lectures sometimes come across a bit scattered, leaving you feeling overwhelmed and sort of unsure as to what he wants. Goto office hours for clarification! Tests were fair but tough (and borderline tricky in a couple of parts). Know everything and you'll make it.

Saltikov is a nice guy but I felt like his lectures were not thorough and he seemed to have trouble being confident about his knowledge, although he it was obvious he knew it well just had a hard time teaching it. He grades fairly but his test seemed a little challenging because of the way it was worded, but I wouldn't not take him.
He likes coffee...go to office hours..doesn't like slackers...likes coffee!(good coffee)

Prof. Saltikov was an excellent professor! His grading is fair, he runs the class in an extremely relaxed fashion, and he makes lab very fun! I highly recommend taking a course with Chad, because Bio 119L was def. one of my favorite courses.

Professor Kimmey is an absolute gem!  I'm so happy to have taken this course. Very knowledgeable and actually knows how to teach well.  She brings excitement and enthusiasm to her lectures.  I learned a lot from this class.  Her exams have open ended questions so you can write about what you've learned. She values students and student feedback.

Dr. Kimmey is the best teacher Iv ever had. She is so fun and engaging, and knows how to cater to college students. She also really emphasizes dynamic learning, rather than just listening to a two hour lecture, she makes her classes active. She is a caring person who clearly loves her job and is excited to pass on what she knows. Shes so awesome!

Prof. Kimmey has great energy and made the class very interactive. Tests are very mechanism applied, forcing you to know a great deal of information. Provides lots of extra credit to make up with exam scores though. LOVED HER

Professor Kimmey was one of the best professors I've had at UCSC. Awesome teaching team, lectures are also flipped but honestly I found it very helpful in helping understand the material. Tests are also open note (although your notes won't really help you) but as long as you attend section and lecture it's light work!
Asks for way too much on exams. Don't take her if you don't have too (AVOID)

loved this class and professor kimmey. it was taught with a flipped structure, so lectures are pre-recorded, and in-class time is reserved for answering questions and case studies. all of the material was very straightforward and engaging. textbook is free online, but i never had to touch it. definitely recommend this course!

Manel is literally the nicest, most caring professor. He's a great teacher and really wants us students to not only understand the material but enjoy it as well. It's anatomy, so it is difficult memorizing all of the terms, but Manel makes it a lot easier with all of the resources he provides. GREAT TEACHER, highly recommend!!

Professor Camps was an excellent teacher. Although lectures might be boring at times the material in the class is really in depth and difficult at times. Professor Camps tries to manage the material as best as possible and gives a good study guide. The class is also highly curved which allows for more mistakes

Took his cadaver dissection class which was an unique experience as its not offered every year! Gives great feedback, is accessible outside class, and truly cares about his students learning and grade. Very approachable and is knowledgeable about anatomy and pathophysiologies.

HW is 20% and two exams are 40% each. Tons of memorization obviously, but Manel is approachable and honestly wants his students to do very well. Clear grading criteria and does not webcast lecture. 10% grade boost if you improve on the final compared to the midterm.

Manel is a very calm and collected man. He's very nice and approachable. We had a great conversation where he explained to me that his goal is to make sure students gain a better understanding of their own body and selves. He also discussed biofeedback and many other interesting topics. Very smart and open minded.

One of the nicest and genuine professors I've ever had. He works very hard to make the material easier to learn. If you know the vocab sheets you will do well. He is very accommodating and extremely fair. The curve was very large for his class. He takes feedback and really tries to improve every time he teaches.

He's trying to improve his lecturing. He has bad hand writing and needs to be at least a little enthusiastic. This year we used program NewConnect but this essentially replaces the necessity of having a professor for this class at all. Just read the book and follow the vocab list. His tests aren't as bad as they used to be in past years.
Learning all of the material in 5 weeks was pretty stressful, but Camps was very helpful during lecture and out of class! As long as you stay on top of the material you will do well in this class.

God, his penmanship is awful. You wouldn't be able tell the difference between a small intestine and a kidney if he drew them next to each other. That being said, his tests are not very challenging and the final is not cumulative. Just try to make sense out of his scribbles and memorize diagrams in the book and you'll be fine.

Manel is very knowledgable about all things anatomy so get to know him if you a remote interest in any of the topics that he brings up in class. Yet he is a horrible lecturer, misspells many terms, and has the worst organization of notes I've ever seen. He tries to improve however. Def not a born lecturer. Read the book and speed through podcasts.

Great guy, difficult class. It's interesting that he spends ZERO effort to project his voice. He basically whispers the material and expects the mic to do its job. It is also very tough to decode his handwriting. Print out a list of vocabs before class will be helpful.

Prof Camps is a really nice caring professor.He tries really tries to be clear and help students in every way.He posts lectures slides w/anatomical pictures and outlines. You basically need to know every thing on the outlines and slides. It's anatomy... It's obviously going to be a hard class. You must study a lot. Class is curved a 85-100, B 75-85

passionate guy who really knows his stuf, made difficult material very approachable and as stress-free as he could i didnt find his accent to get in way at all very tough class but manuel made it manageable by making effort to not to stress us out. exams are difficult so study harder and a little differently than you usually do for other bio class
Very nice teacher.  Has a really thick accent that is hard to understand.  Wanted to be able to enjoy the class because I was genuinely interested in the topic, but he made it so unbearably boring.

It is a very vigorous class that requires so much comprehension and memorization. Just know everything (especially with charts on the notes) because the professor can test students on anything. If you want to really pass the class, the you should read the book, go to a tutor/section/MSI, and listen to the podcast frequently. So much time + energy..

Class also Anth107. Manel is a good prof - he clearly knows the information and he does his best to keep you engaged. The problem is his accent. I'd recommend going to lecture, then using the info he gives you as a baseline for what to read in the book. Use lecture podcasts if they're available, and study at your own pace.

For METX 133, medical microbio, she's AMAZING. Sure exams were tough, but the lectures prepared you and you had a half cheat sheet. Ask any questions after class or office hours. The half lab structure was SO fun
Micobio is hard, so study a bit in advance and at write notes in class, but I don't think she lived up to the bad reviews. Loved her smmm

I took METX119 in the summer and I really liked the course. Prof Ottemann makes you work for it, and going to one office hour a week is a MUST because there's no key to the study questions. I learned so much in 5 weeks it's insane. The negative reviews are from people who want everything handed to them and don't study enough.

Coming into this class I expected it to be difficult but I never thought it would THIS difficult. No key for study questions , we couldn't ensure that our answers were correct unless we went to office hours. Midterm and final were both in low C range. Multiple choice sections were a joke. Overall very difficult, good luck to all that take it.
Pretty easy course. pay attention to lecture, understand it and you'll be set. exams require you to really undertand the material.

The bad reviews made me question taking the class, but really it was not bad at all. Some problems were somewhat confusing, but office hours help a lot. She also provides extra credit on tests and for SEMS. Overall, very interesting class, not super easy, but if you put in the work, you'll do well.

Professor Ottemann is an amazing professor, dont read all these bad reviews and think that this class isnt worth taking with her, her tests and quizzes are not hard and they are ENTIRELY based on the study questions in her lecture notes that she provides , her grading scale is lenient as well.
Lectures are fine. Exams are difficult and the grading is tough. Doesn't really care and her attitude is condescending. Try to pick a different prof.

Karen is a researcher and NOT a good professor. She doesn't care about her students, does not try, and gives bare minimum effort especially online. Her pre-recorded lectures have many errors and are unorganized. She's been teaching this class for so long she doesn't care about it anymore...
I do not think information included in this course is sufficient
Summer online course rushed too much

Class is 100% based on 2 midterms and 1 final. Her exams are based on lecture study questions and activity questions, so textbook reading isn't necessary. Lecture is webcasted and attendance isn't mandatory. GO to section (not mandatory) and office hours to get answers to study questions. Very fair and funny professor.

Karen gives you all the information you need for the exams in her lecture notes The study questions on each lecture are basically fair exam questions Review the study questions and go to section or office hours to clarify any questions It might be a lot of info but it is very doable Tests are fair but grading can be strict Not an easy A

Karen is very motivated to help her student understand the material give. Section isn't mandatory, although I strongly recommend it for answers to the study queations. Book never used. Practice exams are nowhere near her actual exams. Her exams are fairly difficult, but her grading scale for your overall grade is awesome(60-77C)

Karen is very knowledgable and makes this lab very doable and reasonable. She's a great resource and I would definitely recommend getting to know her. The course is not too demanding, just requires lots of busy work and time. I would definitely advise to email the TAs and Karen for lab report/group project tips and corrections.
GREAT TEACHER! Always explained experiments with necessary background info. Easy to talk to, very approachable, willing to help. She's also very nice & funny.
Ottemann rocks.  Her lectures are crystal clear and she has a dry sense of humor.  I think she's kind of cute, especially when she smiles.  Listen to the lectures and study and you'll be fine.
She's very good ad knows her stuff.  Always willing to answer questions and usually knows the answers...

Excellent class, tho going in with thoughts of ease will be your downfall. Don't slack and you'll be fine. Tests are fair, but grading is tight so be sure to cover everything. Ottemann rocks and knows her stuff without being pretentious about it.

karen does not seem approachable or friendly for that matter, but by email she is fine. she is an amazing lecturer and the topic is interesting. the test are completely fair but as with any science class - alot of info. great class, great teacher, don't miss this opportunity if it presents itself.

Otteman was an amazing lecturer but she also comes off as tough and not as approachable as I would have imagined. Her tests were fair and I enjoyed every single lecture, she made them interesting. I would definetely take her again if she taught another class I needed.

Fitnat is great! Extremely knowledgeable and has a cute  fun class persona. She was tough, but tells you exactly how much you need to know for her exams. Definitely prepare to put in work in her class, but its honestly a class you can take a lot out of. I feel like I learned more in this class than any other Biology class in Santa Cruz.

Very passionate about the material. Go to her office hours and ask questions, because she will answer in the clearest manner possible and make you feel at ease. Also come to lectures & sections for extra notes and be sure to study her in-class and study questions. She will make you think about the material through her exams, not just memorizing.

Fitnat is a great professor! She encourages students to ask questions during class, and she is very helpful during office hours. How to pass: Go to class, study the notes (she includes study questions at the end of every lecture. Know the answer to all of those questions), go to discussion section and office hours, and do not fall behind.

Study the lecture slides.  These are key to an A.  Grading is pretty easy.  Most people think this class is hard, but it isn't...  Instead of testing rote memorization, Fitnat tests your critical thinking and data analysis skills on exams.  Also, class is awesome because no homework or quizzes.  Just three exams + 1 extra credit optional hw.
Way too detailed and expects you to know way too much... roughly 450 slides for midterm and so much material on a slide... don't take this if you can't put in 15 hours a week
She is nice enough. Test questions are too specific though.

Great lectures, very approachable, knows her stuff well.  A LOT of memorization is required, but that's like most biology courses.  Show up to class because there are things discussed in class that aren't in the online lecture slides.
Ick. Take another instructor if at all possible.  Very arrogant and teaches everything off of slides which have huge chunks of text just lifted off the text book.

She is a nice professor, but teaches at an okay level. She lectures from the lecture notes completely. Memorize/know/understand everything from the lecture notes, even the general and detailed information, because she will grade brutally on your tests. Her extra credit does not help at all.

She expects you to know everything. Goes through slides quickly (lectures are ~20 pages each, 4 slides/page). Has an accent that is sometimes hard to understand. Go to class though, she provides info not on lecture slides. Final is cumulative and you need to memorize all the slides. Provides extra credit, but don't assume it would help you a lot.

Horrible lecturer, will confuse the heck out of you, also very condescending. Skims through lectures too quickly to even write down notes, exams are all based on random info from the slides. Very picky grader, exam have a lot of confusing, AVOID

If you take this class be prepared to memorize every single slide. She emphasizes topics which wont be on tests and there is no study guides. It's hard to know what will be on the test. There are study questions but they didn't help. TAs even seemed frustrated. I hear Vicki Stone is a great teacher.

Horrible teacher. No practice test and extremely hard grader. Wants you to know every little detail down to which number sigma factor binds to where. You do not learn except stupid details that do not help you in the future, take with different professor!
The best teacher. i loved taking her class, very interesting and willing to help with questions. AND SHES PRETTY HOTT!!!!!!

boring, other than the pathogen lectures. first MD was solely on generic lecture notes (pic slides which are posted), MD 2 had stuff that was reminiscent on the class discussion during lecture and Final was a mix. shes ok, but she expects youto have a grand interest. usually not a big # of ppl take this class at a time,dont completely bomb one MD

Class is really fun.  The exam questions seem straight forward and you walk out of the test feeling like you did fine, but discover that you've been owned.  She is pretty particular about how she wants answers.  Be interactive in lecture, it's helpful.

Amazing Professor, she actually makes you think, something a lot of instructors don't do. Course was difficult for a Microbiology class, but was interesting. She does interactive learning and presents the material clearly.

Approachable and willing to help students but has a very thick accent. Grades consist of two HWs, two midterms, one final, and section attendance/participation.  Exams were difficult because she wanted detailed information and graders were really picky about particular answers and there's no curve. But I still enjoyed her class and learned a lot!

2 HW assigmts, 2 midterms. Picky grader. Lectures are printable online. Heavy accent. Doesn't give out old exams. Lots of extra reading besides the lecture notes....like knowing certain details about an organism. No review sessions, except TA discussion, but they're not making up the exam so it's unclear what to study for. HARD!!
very picky about grading in homework & on exams. covers wayyyyyyy too much info in a 10 week period. no curve!!!! accent is thick, thank goodness for printable lecture notes.

Such a respectable teacher. He is really sweet, and although his classes have a lot of students, he tries to remember every one. I really enjoyed his class, and I'm glad he didn't hold a grudge against me after emailing him all summer with questions. He is accessible, don't be afraid to reach out for information!!

Only final assignment, no homework, no quizzes/exams. He will send lecture videos through email, and he will teach you how to do your final assignment in those lecture videos. Final assignment is not hard, but you need to work hard.
Total chiller, great musician, take a class with Baumbuschka.

This is a great GE if you want something that is interesting but also easy. Prof Merchant is clearly super knowledgeable and passionate about the material taught in this class. There are group assignments, but I barely even felt the need to communicate with my group because the assignments were short and easy. Tests were online and open book.
I didnt understand anything in this class and didnt feel like I learned anything or was given the opportunity to ask questions

Tanya was one of the nicest professors I've had, and did not care at all if people used phones/computers during class despite what other reviews say. The class was incredibly boring, however class was not mandatory and everything was graded really easily. If you have any prior musical knowledge this class will be a breeze for you.

After reading everyones reviews for this professor, I was quite scared to take this class, but I ended up being pleasantly surprised. She is an amazing teacher, and you can tell how passionate she is about the subject and how much she wants you to succeed in this class. Her lectures are interesting, and the workload is manageable.

Tanya clearly has a love for music and wants to share that with you in class. That being said, if you wanted to take this class to ignore it and just get an easy A, that's on you for picking the wrong class and complaining about it. Grades are mostly done through weekly group works (DON'T SLACK IT'S THAT EASY) and listening exams.
Horrible Professor. Class felt like being shown a YouTube video by an person you dont like. Do not take even if you like world music.

If you aren't into music, this class will be very unengaging. It's not hard but pretty boring, Merchant is clearly passionate about music but it's lost on non-music major students. You can skip lectures bc they're boring but you might miss some info that'll be on the music exams. Easy grading, try a little and you'll get an A. Lots of group work!

If i'm being honest here, she doesn't post any of her slides on canvas, which made my life difficult when I couldn't attend some classes and when I wanted to review for the final exam. There was waaayy too much work for a regular GE class, take another class to complete the GE instead.

Okay, let me be real with you. If you're trying to take this class for an easy GE. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. It's true that you don't really need to go to lectures and there isn't a lot of homework to do, and quizzes are quite easy too. But the exams are going to kill you. I studied so hard for them and the highest score i got was a C. Don't take it

She is a real stickler on having cell phones out in class. The class required more work than it should have being a GE class. The reports are very easy and straightforward. The midterm is a consistent format with the final. Beware of her strict grading policy, she will not round grades at all. Going to lecture reduces outside study time.
Class is pretty boring and no electronic allowed. Didn't go to any classes, but still got an A by cramming during dead week.

She likes going on tangents and rants about other things. For the past classes I've been to, she only got through 2 lecture slides because she talks a lot. She doesn't post any of her lectures online, so if you don't go to class you won't really know what she went over. Overall, easy exams & just show up to class and you'll be fine.

Extremely knowledgable and passionate about music/music theory (also HK woke). Class satisfied ER GE, and was an easy way to do so. Just don't be on your phone/laptop and she won't yell at you. If you must, she is usually distracted during listening examples. Papers are an easy A, exams even easier. Goes on hella tangents, but theyre LK interesting

Pros: Easy A! She's very knowledgable and the content is interesting.  Cons: She's a complainer and gets frustrated easily. Blames not having enough time on UCSC after showing up late, spending half the class yelling at people on their phones, and wasting 45 minutes going on tangents about unrelated things. Irritating, but worth the A!

EASIEST CLASS EVER. As long as you attend every class and take notes, you'll do well. She is very understanding and engaging. However, the topics were boring at times. This class is a hidden gem in the myucsc portal (It's always available fall quarter). I highly recommend for a GPA boost and a GE fulfillment.

What was really annoying about this course was that there was no book, so all the information was taken from Tanya's lectures. Her powerpoint slides were vague and she often rambles on the entire class time about the artists. Be sure to pay attention and take good notes. However, her tests and assignments were extremely easy!
Really easy class! Show up and do some extra studying and you will pass. The lectures are pretty interesting for the most part and Tanya has a lot of knowledge and is very respectable.
She was more interested in telling personal (boring) stories than actually teaching. Don't take this class if you can't sit through lecture without sleeping or using a phone.

Extremely easy course. There were a few times were lectures were interesting, typically in the first unit. Majority of the time she wasted time talking about a few terms instead of focusing on music examples and interesting information. I enjoyed her class the first unit, the last two were pretty terrible...
Loved this class! Got 103% in the whole class and got the highest score. Just go to every class and study.

He is very approachable and friendly.  He is interested in his students, if you are interested in the work.  Very knowledgeable about Mariachi, folk music, and Latin American studies.  He has given me really useful feedback on work for other classes too and is a great mentor.
Excellent class and professor
Excellent professor and expert. Definitely requires class attendance and participation, but Russell is very helpful and supportive with class work and research paper.

Rodriguez's 80F class is an easy one as long as you keep with the textbook readings and his lectures. The work this class demands is not much. The textbook will cost 80$ and you'll won't find it online. Exams are online. Don't have much else to say, but he's a decent professor.

Textbook is mandatory and not available online, so order it early! Seems like a fun class on paper, but lectures can be boring. If you read the book, you'll get an A in the class. Few assignments, and tests/quizzes aren't too bad. Prof is nice, but there's better classes that fulfill this GE :/
Does not teach does not care. Reads off slides for 2 hours for "lecture". Don't take.

This was a chicanx/latin music class and i loved it. He is very friendly and approachable. He would show songs during lectures and played some songs for us. The class itself was very interesting. During exams he would let us use a page of notes and the class itself was not homework heavy.

If you show up to lectures, read the book, and go to test review sessions, you'll get an A. What I personally didn't like what how he tried to make you analyze music (texture and meter) which was difficult if you don't have any background in music. 3 Exams (final exam on canvas), 3 quizzes (on canvas), and 3 writing assignments (one/two pgs)
Russell is fantastic. He is super laid back. Some assignments were unclear at first but he made them clear soon enough. Can't complain about his music 80F class, a perfect ER GE to take.

Book is mandatory. Attendance is not mandatory, but some midterms included questions regarding lecture. The only thing I disliked about him was that he changed his mind super last minute about assignments and midterms.

Lectures are inefficient and drawn out.  We have trouble figuring out key points from them.  Attendance is mandatory to class and sections.  My TA is very helpful.  Russell has good intentions, but his class is very general and at times, random.  I don't know what I'm going to get out of this class after it's over.

Prof. Lanam was awesome; her course was great. The work was reasonable and flexible. There is quite bit of reading, but the quizzes were easy. She also gives a lot of extra credit which can really boost your grade a lot so there's a lot of opportunity to earn those. Moreover, she gives a varies of option for the final which made it fun.

Faith is wonderful! Her way of explaining topics is so beginner-friendly, clear, and easy to digest. The workload, specifically for MUSC 14, is a bit too much, even for an online class. Granted, it's all helpful work, so if you're not busy and can devote MANY hours a week to it, go for it! For MUSC 60, it goes fast, so practice consistently.

Took winter quarter 2025. Prof. Lanam is very passionate and knowledgeable. All assignments are due Fridays. Some weeks are pretty homework and reading heavy so important to space assignments out and have good time management. 3x per quarter online zoom sections with TAs. Prof was very helpful/responsive via email, overall would reccomend

While she is passionate about the topic and is very educated, there is way too much work for this being a three credit course. Long readings and documentaries, lectures, and even with the midterm and finals week there is still so much work during those weeks. Interesting but too much for a three credit course.

In a 5-week course, we had to complete 2 modules per week with a journal entry at the end of each module. There are video quizzes and reading quizzes and those questions are reused for the midterm and final exam. The course was very well organized and you can tell Faith was passionate about the content through her background and her lectures.

Actually took MUSC81D and its so interesting and not hard at all. Lots of extra credit opportunities. There are Discussion sections for each unit (abt 4 total) and must attend for credit but it's not too bad to miss it if you do the extra credit. Always reads comments and emails, responds thoughtfully, and allows multiple attempts at the quizzes.

LOVE FAITH!! She is so awesome and had such an organized way of teaching, especially with an online format. There were a certain amount of assignments assigned per week and you just had to complete them by the end of the week. Requires a lot of time budgeting on your own. Super well organized and you always had the resources to complete assignments
She was sweet, but I hated the asynchronous format and the way she approached this class.

Very planned out modules that help guide learning throughout the class. I had no musical education/knowledge before this class and the professor made it super accessible to those who wanted to learn notation and keyboard skills. Covers and reviews the basics! Heavily recommend with this professor to anyone interested!

Dr. Lanam is awesome! She assigns a reasonable amount of work and gives very good/specific feedback. She is also flexible if you need an extension, and will work with you to complete everything. She holds zoom check-ins once a week to help keep you accountable for the work. I would definitely take her again.

This class was originally taught by another professor, but after they clearly had issues both personally and with the new stay-at-home format Lanam came in and saved the whole summer session. Even though she wasn't there the whole time I felt like I got a lot out of the class. She's good at challenging students and listens if you say it's too hard.
Professor Lanam is awesome. She is very clear and flexible about coursework. During COVID meetings have been once a week with multiple time options.

Super chill guy. Thinks he is a Praetorian tho, but other than that, at the end of the day, he still is a chill guy. Probably the most chill professor I've had at UCSC. But does that mean he's lazy? NO. He's grounded in what he does, he's a composer himself, and he's knowledgable. Every class he has at least one great tip.

He is very clear about what he expects from you - if you listen to what he has to say, and do what he assigns, you will have no problem passing his classes. He also has a great interest in what he teaches, so that helps!
Great teacher. Funny, clear, but still expects a lot from you. This class is not easy, but Chris made it fun. He also looks like the main character from Clerks. Sweet!
not my favorite teacher
No Comments
cool, but thinks he is a Praetorian
This guy was awesome and made class fun. As long as you go to class you should be good. He is sooooo helpful outside of class too.
Presents concepts in a clear and logical way.  He brings in musical examples from bands like Pink Floyd and Jane's Addiction to realate the theoretical concepts to current music.
Good sense of humor, relates to his students, leads the class at a good pace (considering the students' varying degrees of previous experience.)

She is not a hard grader and she is very very knowledgeable of music theory, but I felt that her style of communication and in-class lecture structuring needs work. However she made all of the very detailed packets for all of our TA lab sections. Also is a very helpful and responsive person. I can tell that she really wants her students to succeed.

Hi Kyung is a great musician, but she's not the greatest instructor. Majority of the class was doing your own, private study and then things would be "clarified" in the classroom. Even then, it's hard to fully understand things until you go to the labs (both of them) for practice. She's passionate which is a plus as a music teacher.

Dispite the *not so bad* accent she is a very nice teacher. She is a very happy person and it rubs off. The class is hard unless you really know your music. Sections are hard too and the TA I had wasn't too helpful. The class has 1 midterm and 2 quizes before and after, there's lab midterms too so watch out.  I'd highly reccomend her

Overall, a good prof.  She's humorous, encourages participation, her english and accent is fine, although it may be hard to understand her explanations once in a while.  Always encourages students to go to her office hours or the TA's office hours if they need help.

HORRIBLE teacher. Don't take her. Her accent is so thick much will be unintelligible. She doesn't speak English well enough to answer questions accurately, she often gets the question completely wrong. She is rude to students. She doesn't teach as much as just gets through the curriculum assigning homework and grading- no method for acquiring skill
Evil. Hardest teacher ever, and least sympathetic. Literally made me want to kill myself at times.

Maria is a great piano instructor. She is definitely strict and if you're not good at piano, she will tell you you suck. but if you practice enough and meet her high expectations, she can definitely help you improve your musical understanding and interpretation and become a much pianist.

Although Maria is possibly the biggest hardass of the music department, her ear training instruction is top notch. If you can put up with the rigorous practice and performance she expects of her students, she will turn even the tone deaf into amazingly accurate ears

Can be intimidating, but really pushes you to challenge yourself.  Personally I've always found her teaching method very helpful and haven't really had much trouble with the class.  Tests can be very challenging though, especially when it comes to recognizing digressions and key changes in a progression.

Maria is an extremely strict professor, but her instructions will definitely help you improve dramatically. She is an amazing pianist and she tries so hard to help you become one too. Although she can be a little too harsh sometimes, the experience you gain and the improvements you make are definitely worth it. Just be prepared to practice A LOT!

This class was the coolest I've taken. You have to have rhythm tho to do well, like it's hard to teach that. The class consisted of mainly drumming and some singing/dancing. It can be overstimulating, so I wore earplugs, but the professor is so passionate and sweet. Take this class if you need to cover a GE!

We had one actual assignment but apart from that it was all hands on learning. Professor Akotuah is very passionate about Ghanian music and it's honestly inspiring. I loved coming to class and participating. He's funny and unserious and I really liked his teaching style. Definitely helped lighten my load. I would recommend this class to everybody.

Francis has a deep passion for Ghanian music and I really appreciate seeing that in a professor. He motivates and encourages his students and is very willing to help. His enthusiasm is felt throughout the room and he is really hilarious too, he makes sure to not take things too seriously and to just have fun! I would highly recommend this class!

Awesome prof. Took this Winter 2022, transitioned to in-person and I loved it. We learned 4 instruments, song, and dance! Take it with your friends, you'll truly feel like a band playing Agbekor. Francis tries his hardest to help all the students and is ready to stop everyone just to help you. His wife also helped out. I'm thankful to have met them

Francis is a very kind person and good music teacher. I was a little intimidated before taking the class because I didnt have any experience playing Ghanaian music, but hes very conscious of making the class the right difficulty level and it was very beginner-friendly. Take this class if you have the chance, its super fun!
Amazing course and amazing professor. Would definetly recommend this class if you are interested with hands-on experience with drums and singing.

Professor Batish is an expert in Indian instruments, and his class helps you develop your musical skills. Grades are mainly based on attendance, but makeup assignments are allowed. There are only a few assignments, and they are graded leniently. I'd recommend this class if you love Indian music or want to learn more about it.
Listen to the Bombay Boogie, Ashwin Batish is a legend. If he wears his black sitar power hat and beige jacket, that's when you know it will be a good class and a good day. This is every class.
This guy is a genius at music and the kindest professor. He comes from a family of talented musicians. Best class!
SO nice. He genuinely just wants you to have a good time and enjoy music. Met once a week and grade was entirely based on participation and attendance, take this for a GE if you can!!!!

Best GE class I have taken at UCSC. Professor Batish is so caring and a great teacher. You can come into the class with experience or not and you will leave learning how to play the tabla and dhol. Grade is based 80% on attendance so just show up once a week, and the other 20% is fairly easy homework and final which you can discuss in class. 10/10!
What a cool professor! Learning about North Indian Rhythms by a man who was an expert in his field, tabla playing, was such an amazing experience. No tests, no homework.

Matt was a great professor and held a really engaging and entertaining class! Every concept was very fun to learn about and we got a lot of hands-on experience, plus access to the on-campus electronic music studios. The Max MSP labs at the start of the quarter were tricky but everything else felt quite easy and creatively fulfilling.

I really loved this class, it felt very interactive and engaging! I would recommend this to anyone interested in electronic music, especially if you have an interest in pieces from before the last decade or two. It did get pretty technical at times, but if you have interest in the subject that should be fun if anything!
Mostly graded on participation and journal entries. 3 easy exams graded lightly. Exams are in person, closed note. Easy class, W professor

Great lectures that covered so many different types of electronic music up until the modern age. He kept us engaged with connections to modern artists, did an amazing job at highlighting underrepresented artists, and explained the different paths of influence very well. Homework was simple but thought-provoking. Great class and great professor!
He's super passionate about jazz and you can tell that his real dream was to play. Because of that, his class is formatted poorly. I liked the guy a lot, just wasn't the best teacher.

If you saw a title like "introduction to jazz" you might think it would be about musical analysis and theory, exploring the musical techniques that make jazz what it is. That it most certainly is not. MUSC11B is actually a rather opinionated history class crammed full of names and dates to memorize. If that sounds interesting to you have fun.

This man so passionate about this material that he completely forgot how to organize a class. It is unclear when assignments are due because most of the time, he's not aligned with the syllabus. His quizzes are just sentences copied from the textbook, so I recommend downloading the digital version if you are so destined to take this class.

Exams are tricky because they are so heavily based on textbook material and he doesn't go over a lot in class. Some exam questions are literally copied text from the textbook with a fill in the blank. The extra credit he offers helps, but some of it you have to be in class for to do or even hear about. Good attendance + reading  pass.
Look everything up on wikipedia, it's copied word for word.

Definitely a nice and knowledgeable guy, but this class is terribly disorganized. Not only were the TAs very elusive, but Prof. Hester didn't previously inform us of his strange testing format until the day of the midterm. Not a difficult class, but don't go in thinking you won't have to do any work. Make sure you go to lectures for extra credit.

While he is very interesting and knowledgeable about Jazz, I can say that without a doubt this is the least organized class I have ever taken. You are at a complete loss as to know when hw is due. The hw is also torn out of your textbook - making it impossible to sell back. (he doesn't allow photocopies). The midterm was ridiculous and complete bs.
Difficult to understand, all over the place. VERY passionate about the subject but the material is presented in a really unclear manner. Read the textbook and you should be alright.

WASTE OF TIME. This class is pretty hard for a music class. He does not even reply to his email regarding grade reviews. Sending the music surveys that he wrote to other professors was embarrassing because they felt that it was lacking. Take a diff. music course.

If you are actually interested in the topics this guy teaches you will not be disappointed.  It is immediately evident how much he cares, knows, and wants to share these subjects.  Couldn't be better.

He is a stereotypical "jazz" musician. He's a bit cocky, but hes so cool that you forgive him for it. He's also a very nice guy. This class would be more appropriate in a smokey bar with him and 6 other people rather than a lecture hall. He invented the jazz flute. He is a wizard. He is a God. He is... Karlton Hester.

Wow! I can't believe the whiners on this site. Not only is Karlton a good teacher and clearly loves the topics he discusses, he couldn't make it any easier to do well. The music is amazing, the text interesting and his lectures full of insight. His slides clarify the topics he will cover on exams and the prelims are not tough.

He says he teaches in a "musical style" and he will never teach any other way, but most students have never learned to play an instrument, and there's no visible structure in his lectures. Hes very ignorant and pompous. Has slides full of 12 point font up for 5 seconds, when he should have a few main points. doesnt know how to teach a college class

one of the funniest things about hester's class is how he places the notes quickly on the overhead and removes them quickly so that you can't take notes on them and all of this CLEARLY ON PURPOSE while the class whines

This class was one of the most unclear and troubling experiences i had freshman year. I thought it was going to be an easy GE, which it partly is, but the way that he presents the material is scattered and hard to follow. The line between what you need to know for exams and random facts is often indistinguishable. The material was interesting tho.

Alright so Hester is fine. Like smokin actually. But he doesn't care about you, or your grade. DONT BUY HIS BOOK. I spent 80 something dollars and never once opened it. Go to class and you should be alright.

This is probably the most frustrating and unorganized class that i have ever taken. The TAs are obnoxious and unhelpful. He assumes that you have a background in music and doest clarify anything. Goes fast during lectures and seems to have a bit of an attitude towards anything that isnt African.

Karlton is the worst "professor" I have ever had.  On his tests, he copies large amount of text from his textbook (which he wrote and costs $80) and expects you to fill in one word. ANYTHING discussed in class can be put on the tests, even the most insignificant little detail can be a question that costs you points. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

IMPOSSIBLE..i ended up with a B+ but dont let that fool you I failed my midterm and final but I guess some people got F--- and maybe i got an F+. But it was the worst class ever, he was not helpful, his lectures were paragraphs after paragraphs that he makes impossible to take notes on! Made my first quarter at ucsc HELL.HORRIBLE

This is a hard class, but if you are seriously willing to put the time in to listen to a lot of music and find an interest in musical history, then this class is bearable.. If you're doing this for GE's, I recommend you do pass/no pass

I loved this class. Professor Heying has really good lectures, like even though there's a lot, on 1.5x speed and just taking notes, it's pretty fun. Weekly quizzes and discussion that are based on the lecture but are easy, 2 papers, midterm and final are open note. My friends called it my underwater lesbian basket weaving class and yk what yeah.

Women in Music was a cool class and I really learned a lot. The lecture videos were broken into bits so they weren't too long and the quizzes were not difficult. A lot of the homework was listening to music which was super cool.
Very clear assignments and lectures. Very easy to pass with an A.
Awesome clear class, everything makes sense and isn't hard.

This class was very easy. There were about 3-6 lecture videos a week but they were pretty short and manageable followed by a short discussion post about the lectures and a quiz each week. Answers to all quizzes were in lectures/required listening for that week. Modules open at beginning of the week then due by Sunday, very manageable class overall

Prof. Heying has a easy music class, I always completed stuff within a day, excluding projects. There's like 3 projects and they're not hard. Heying is clearly passionate and her lectures are interesting, albeit I watched on 2 times speed. Most difficult thing is music analysis in weekly quizzes. Be warned assignments are released different times.

Heying is very knowledgable in this topic. Async lectures were long but could be sped up. Weekly assignments were discussions so you could see everyone's responses (great for reviewing material later!). Exams felt reasonable and the 2 essay assignments were fine. The weekly reading was essentially optional, though listening examples were essential.

giving a 4 because i didn't get to know her since it was online, but the course was easy and especially easy if you are interested in music, not a lot of work and it is possible to get by without watching every lecture.

Very passionate about what she teaches, prerecorded lectures and 4-7 videos each week around 16-30 mins each. Has bullet points on slides but the most important info to write is what she says. Weekly quizzes (4-5 questions in 5 min) and one discussion post weekly. 1 midterm 1 final, took this as a GE for credit, recommend taking it if interested

Lectures were to the point and easy to write notes on. There were quizzes that had all the answers through the lectures. Two papers which were fairly easy as well. This was a super easy and enjoyable online class!

this class was amazing! I loved the lectures and you can tell she has a genuine love for what she is teaching. learned a lot about women in music and a better appreciation of the history behind the movements of music. only graded on a quiz and discussion post a week and then the midterm final. definitely take notes to help prepare for the exams tho

Her class was the easiest GE I've ever taken. The course consisted of 1 discussion & 1 quiz due at the end of every week, 2 main assignments, a midterm, and a final. You can tell that she is passionate about the material and keeps lectures entertaining. 10/10.

Her class was by far so easy! Her class consists of weekly 4 question 5 minute quizzes. If you watch the lectures and the required listening they should be easy. 2 exams (1 midterm and the final). Midterm is based off the lectures and required listening videos. Dr. Heying is such a sweet and caring professor. Highly recommend her class.

So much of your grade is based on 4-question 5-minute exams with extremely redundant questions. I already struggle with online classes, but the sheer number of dry, prerecorded lectures I had to sit through was unbearable. I dont entirely blame her, since it was asynchronous, but I would not retake it unless I had to.

Flexible online class. Take notes on lectures and do the required listening for the quizzes. Do the study guide before you take the midterm and final. Assignments are straightforward and can get full credit if answered thoroughly. Extra credit is a response to the documentary.

A little more intensive than I was expecting, but it's mostly just memorizing facts from lectures. The lectures can range from 7 min to 22 min vids, but I usually put it in 2x and copy whatever lines she has on the screen. Required listening's and quiz each week. 1 Midterm and a final; class isn't too bad but take notes. Extra credit offered.

Class was not relevant to the course description. She spent nearly 3 weeks talking about rap, and didn't even mention a lot of famous historical electronic musicians. Teaches with a political agenda in mind. Didn't end up learning a whole lot at all, just memorizing random things for tests. Easiest A you could imagine, but not a fulfilling one.

The grade was based on a course journal(45%), Recording Project(25%), and a final exam(30%). All you really need to do is read one reading per week for the journal entry and make sure to go to most of the classes for the in class journal prompt. Recording proj was simple and she allows cheatsheet for the final. She wants you to pass so good GE.

Madison is a really cool professor! Pretty much if you go to lecture you're guaranteed an A. There are very few assignments and she really just cares about student's actually gaining something from the class. Lectures can be kinda hippy dippy but they're fun too. Recommend if you want an easy GE.

This was one of the easest classes I've taken. No text books are needed, just some articles that she posted online that weren't mandatory. The pop quizzes and exams were super easy if you showed up to the lecture and took 10 minutes each day to study your notes since its all memorization. She also gave extra credit for going to shows and on tests.
Other homework seemed fair but the major assignments required too much busywork. The instructions for the midterm project were unclear, and the final exam project lacked any sense of purpose.

She didn't like my writing style and was convinced I was using AI. I contacted her about it and she refused to look over them again. Contacted the department chair and Monica just defended her decisions. I dropped the class because she was going to fail me. Never felt more degraded in my life. All because she had assumed false pretenses from TAs.
I hope she clearly stated what she was going to do for assignments and exams on the syllabus, allowing only students who are willing to go through that process to take the class.

Decent Professor. Very caring and provides a lot of feedback and insight on the topic, Beatles. Lots of writing assignments with discussion posts and homework assignments. Video posts were also required.

Work was straightforward, and there was great engagement through grading from prof and TA's even though the class was asynchronous. It's definitely easier if you already know a lot about The Beatles and have a lot of musical knowledge since sometimes it gets very technical, but she doesn't go into or explain the technical aspects/vocabulary at all.
If you do everything, you will get an A.

(MUSIC 80H) Great professor. Only one thing made your grade which is the final group project. As long as your group, which you can choose, does each of their part you'll easily pass the class. Lectures are mon,wed,fri and fridays you watch a musical. Attendance isn't mandatory but Hammond is such a sweet person so I recommend go to class sometimes

(MUSC 80H Hollywood Musical) Nicol is VERY kind and knowledgable. Mon: lecture, Wed: small group work, Fri: Watch a movie. Attendance optional, lectures recorded. Weekly writing assignments that always took

The class is easy, just a lot of quick-writes and readings. It's very much discussion based, so prepare to participate. The professor gives very board instructions, not clear at all. Does not grade assignment until the end of the quarter, which sucks.

Very sweet professor, although this class was very boring and unhelpful. She interpreted every single opinion in her own words, which limited conversation between students. Seemed very similar in structure to a high school class.
She is very nice, probably one of the nicest teachers I have had, but the classes is hell. If you thought you left high school you are seriously mistaken!

I highly recommend everyone to take First-year music seminar. There were different professors from the department each week to talk with us, very interesting research topics. Very kind and understanding. She doesn't grade anything in canvas until the very end of the quarter, but as long as you participate during class you'll be fine.

Amy is a fine teacher and quite a scholar.  Not only did I learn a great deal in 101 C and D & 197 with her, but she inspired me to be great.  She will provide substantial help if you avail yourself to her.  Class was always interesting and full of interesting, obscure, and at times risque tidbits about composers.  Understanding, caring and devoted

Concise, full of information, fun when there's time to be, and above all, extremely enthusiastic about the subject. Couple that with some great listening selections and you've got a great music history teacher. Teaches 101C and 101D

amy is WONDERFUL!! a very warm, helpful, and extremely knowledgable professor. she really knows what she's talking about and is very clear and organized in her lectures. she is ver willing to help you after and outside of class as well. also genuinely concerned with students and likes/wants to know about your life other than school.
Amy was awesome.  She was obviously a fan of the material she taught and made it completely worthwhile.
Amy is a passionate and compelling teacher of the history and practice of twentieth century music.
This class is horrible! Totally rancid. The professor is completly unhelpfull and didn't warn us that non-music majors would struggle. The worst class I took at UCSC.
No Comments

amy is amazing! great lectures, examples, etc. i walked away from the course with a huge appreciation for classical music, something no one has every been able to achieve! i bought cds of the composers we learned about. nice person too.
Very insightful course with an engaging syllabus and awesome, generative seminar discussions that came out of it.
Wonderful teacher, expert, and very interactive with students. Knowledgeable beyond the scope of reality tbh and very fun to talk to outside class.

He puts in a lot of effort into his lectures. Great camera and sound quality. He even will play you some examples of chords, melodies, and beats. My only criticism is to beware if you're a visual learner. I had to turn on closed captions and pause the videos many times to take notes because it's all just him talking, no slides.

Overall, the class wasn't really difficult. The lectures are all recorded on youtube to watch at your own time. Exams were online (on canvas) 4 online quizzes (1 per Unit) unlimited time, access to notes/google. You pick one listening response from every unit and reply in a discussion (easy grading) Lots of extra credit too, I didn't do any though.

Excellent class. Lectures were out-of-the-park, the deadlines were flexible, and the grading was generally lenient. There was a clunky interface and a problem that made people think their midterm grades were lower than expected. But the prof replied to all emails quickly and very generous.

I took this course to fill some units and it turned out being one of the more highly influential courses to my path. Ben Carson is very knowledgeable in this course topic which made the lessons, field outings, and assignments worth while. I highly recommend this course with Ben given that our campus' natural environment is extremely vital!
Great music class! Very informative! Makes you feel like you're failing the class the entire quarter so that you work extra hard but in reality, you're doing just fine! This class needs some slack.

A mess of an online GE. The (non-Canvas) class website (which should be your priority giving an online class) is an absolute mess, making it difficult to navigate and find your needed assignments, readings etc. Additionally, the grading was unclear, inconsistent, and not done on time. Expectations were ridiculous. The midterm average was an F.

Oh great, So first off both midterm and final you had to fully watch al 10 hours and 15 hours of lectures and readings. To pass and get correct answers. Canvas site was a mess and grading as well. Still missing some grades that I had submitted the work for.

Jesus Christ where to start. Quiz/Test questions are insanely subjective. If you plan on getting the answers right you better watch the like 10 hours of lectures a week he posts + 15 hours of reading. The canvas site is a mess, not even to include that he's using the OUTDATED version. I have to google "Uc online Santa Cruz" every time to connect.

Has a unnecessary heavy work load for a class that is not upper division. Many failed our Midterm due to a lot of inconsistencies in the study guide and amount of test questions. Don't trust the study guides. Not worth it if taking it for credit.
Ben is awesome! I learned alot though you have to learn stuff on your own cause he can't seem to convey alot of what he means when you get into set theory.

a music class in disguise that covers music from late 1800's to now. pretty easy and interesting class with a good teacher. mini "quizzes" are given each class to account for attendance (you get points for whatever answer you put, regardless of if its right or wrong) so go to class! no textbook either. would recommend.

He is a really good professor. His test are easy, and always be on time to class because he gives out quizzes. The quiz demonstrate if you understand the lecture as well as your attendance in the class.
good teacher, musician, person, stand-up comedian. he is very clear and wants everyone to get an a.
I LOVE BEN CARSON! HE IS MY FAVORITE TEACHER BY FAR. IF I COULD TAKE ANOTHER CLASS WITH HIM I WOULD. GREAT WAY TO FULFILL A GE
BEN IS AWESOME! I WOULD RECOMMEND ANY CLASS WITH HIM! GREAT WAY TO FULFILL A GENED REQUIREMENT AND HE REALLY WANTS YOU TO SUCCEED!

Yeah, Ben is pretty dope. His classes are extremely entertaining and wow, is he talented. Exams are pretty straight forward, but dont blow off taking notes or coming to class because he gives little pop quizzes, so to speak, at the beginning of most lectures.

wonderful lecturer. very entertaining and never a bore. class was easy if you completed your writing assignments. the only way to get total points though is to do a little extra writing then what is assigned. exams are pretty straightforward. one of the best GE classes i've taken so far
