The class itself will require a lot of work regardless, Sasha himself is a decent professor. The homework is the hardest part of the class, aside from that, the class is very manageable as long as you do the reading and go to class.
Quality prof

Professor Sher is very good at explaining & keeps students accountable w/ multiple parts to the class instead of all on exams. What he asks of students is w/in reason. I think since the majority of students in this class are frosh/soph who aren't into upper divs yet, they might be projecting their frustration w/ hard conceptual material on Sher.

Do. Not. Take. Lectures are somewhat clear, but the tests/grading is a nightmare and often doesn't relate to lectures. Mandatory lecture iclicker, mandatory discussions... anxiety throughout the quarter through the roof due to so many things you need to do for a grade. Bad all around class.
Sher isn't very helpful and states facts and theorems rather than doing actual examples.   you could get an A going to his lectures blindfolded if you finish and study homework problems.

Lectures were confusing, and if you did not read the material beforehand, you will be lost. Homework is difficult, but quizzes were fair. Going to discussion and watching youtube videos is the only reason I passed the class.

The class is overall extremely difficult, especially for those who did not learn the material before enrollment. Lectures are very complicated, unorganized, and hard to follow. Homework since week 1 are tough. Exams are crazy. Even explanations to the exams and homework are very complicated.

The worst physics class I've ever taken. His lectures are all over the place from powerpoints to the chalkboard with no organization whatsoever. I can say that I learned absolutely nothing from class and barely passed because I taught myself. Good luck!

A really tough class. This professor gives very tough exams. He doesn't really tell you what you need to know for these exams. You kind of need to guess what type of problems will be on the exams by observing homework and notes. Also, he has really bad handwriting. I had a hard time copying down what he wrote. He uses iclickers for participation

The averages for exams are extremely low and usually in F range without curve. His practice exams are easy and actual exams are hard and have nothing in common with practice exams. He does not explain concepts clearly and has bad handwriting.

He's hard to follow in lecture, handwriting can be very unclear, he teaches 6C as if this is the 5 series. Homework is useless for studying. He makes this class seem scary even though it is doable so avoid him. 1st exam 50% was a C, 70 a B and 95 an A. 2nd exam 35% was a C, 65 a B and 90 an A. Where does he come up with these curves?

This is not a hard class although Sher was determiend ot make it a nightmare and scare most people away from enjoying physics. His teaching algorithm is a jumbled mess and his attitude is no different. Avoid.

Test average was 40% first midterm, 35% second midterm.  For the first miderm, 40-70 was a C, 70 + was a B, did not specify what A was but really? 40% average and you need a 70 to get a B?  Second midterm required 65% to get a B and 90% to get an A with 35% average.  Not bad professor but good luck getting a B or A.

Good professor. He has an accent, but it just makes the class more entertaining. Beware his written R's though, they look like Z's. He spends a lot of time on questions, and answers them well. He writes big, and has a lot of fun with the demonstrations. There were always two homework assignments: masteringphysics and handwritten.
unclear, messy, just writes equations with little explanation, no partial credit but easy tests, and condescending

Not very approachable but nice enough. Appeared to be bored with the class and to resent the students. Organized but rigid. Mastering physics and iclickers. Merciless exams. First exam avg. = 30% Second = 40%. Gave no partial credit. Wild right? Knows his stuff but doesn't seem to care if you learn it.

About 6 in class lectures to learn the concepts around the labs. 2 labs and reports, 1 HW on concepts and calculations from lectures. TA created Jupyter Notebooks of code to process the data and do the labs. However, sometimes I got comments contradicting the notebooks so there was a bit of disconnect there. Very willing to meet out of class.

Approachable. Hot. Use projectors. Clear handwriting. Draws examples from astronomy. No physical demonstrations. Occasionally waste time to answer questions she's not able to answer. Exams and homeworks are easy compared 5B/C. Don't miss the lecture before Thanksgiving!

Took this independent study research class with her and she really put in the time to help me learn all the material Id need to be a good Cosmologist. She really enabled me to focus on my research and allowed me to explore dark energy cosmology during my time at UCSC. Awesome professor, learned so much.

Tesla is a solid lecturer. Knows what shes talking about, makes sure to connect topics to her research. The current book for this class isnt that great but Tesla does a lot of work to make sure people understand anyway. Available outside class to help people. Great problems and fun class. Not too much homework, just enough to get good practice.

Tesla is an amazing teacher. Great lectures, really inspires with her research. Fair grading policies and a reasonable amount of homework which allows students to really think about the material. Really cool advocate for women in STEM, big inspiration. Cares about people and genuinely tries to make sure they learn.

Her lecture is based off textbook but put in a clear and concise way, so as long as you go to lectures, this class should be easy. She also make many references to her research in astronomy, which is very fascinating because we learn how the theories are applied.

Tesla is a really great professor with a love of astrophysics. Her lecture style is clear and helpful, and she answers questions thoroughly and thoughtfully. My favorite moments in lecture are when her sense of humor shines through. I also enjoy hearing about her research. A helpful tip: don't miss the lecture before Thanksgiving!

The lectures are pretty much a slow version of the textbook. I typically go to lecture to ask questions, but I wasn't able to do that because she had such a hard time answering those of other students that I didn't even bother. She obviously know her stuff, but shes isn't very good at transferring that knowledge to others.
She is an ok teacher, very intelligent and passionate about the subjects, lectures are long and boring in my opinion, though.

Very nice, chill, entertain Professor. She cares about the students learning and consistently asks if there are any questions. Keeps class focused. Goes by the book. Her review material and hw was very similar to actual tests.
Best physics professor that I've had throughout the Physics 5 series. Clear lecturer and fair tester.  Final exams are killer.

Jeltema is the bomb diggity. She gives straight-forward homework and tests. She is very enthusiastic about physics, especially astronomy-related topics. She's very kind and respectful of her students. She always brings a stapler on homework due dates! Sometimes her explanations are little hand wavy and unclear, but overall, she does a great job.

Tesla is really amiable! She's intelligent, funny, nice, and definitely understands what she teaches.  Her tests are reasonable and so is her homework. On top of all of this, she's absolutely gorgeous!!! I would definitely take her class again. I respect her and admire her!
one of the best professors i've had

Talks super fast, writes left handed, covers her notes, skips how she got her answers, only goes over how to derive a formula and chooses the hardest questions for the test. She is from MIT, maybe that's why shes tough.
She was great up until the brutal final. She gave no warning that the final was going to be way harder than the midterm, practice tests and homework......went from a B+ to a C.

She is very straightforward with her tests and does not try to make it tricky. The tests are based mostly on a parallel of the lecture examples. The homework is a lot harder than what the tests will be like. If you go to class everyday and go to office hours/section and do all the homework with the will of understanding, you can get A

She covers a lot of material in a short span. Skips steps and goes over probably 2 examples per chapter. Hwk is 35%+5%bonus Test are the rest, if you can do the hwk no problem you can Ace the class no doubt. Easy to get at least a B here.

Great teacher. The lectures are good and she really cares about her students. Her tests are not hard and the final was not hard as well. Just read the book and study hard by doing problems from the book. Do the practice exams a couple of times and you will be in good shape for the tests and final.
She is a very nice professor, very helpful and dedicated. The tests are fairly easy and follow directly from book/lecture.

My god he's the Frenchest person you will ever meet. All the way down to how he grades and "feedback" he gives. first week of class im petrified because i can barely understand him through his thick french accent but it did become understandable. thinks his opinion is the end all be all, and instead of actual helpful feedback he just judges you.

Literally one of the worst professors I've ever had. So vague in the guidelines for the final, received a horrible grade on the final and negatively regraded all my past assignments because of that final. Lecture slides don't reflect anything he actually talks about in class. Contradicts himself in the assignment comments. Don't take him.
good professor !!
such a chill funny french guy. can be passive aggressive sometimes but he's got great lectures esp this class. i personally felt that he graded very generously this year

If you're looking to authentically improve your writing skills then I would highly recommend Serres's courses. He's genuine and lectures w/ a passion. GE requirement or Major requirement, he will teach to the ones that want to learn. Topics are relevant and interesting to learn about. Series's system for participation is straightforward and simple.

I enjoyed his class. His accent can be a bit hard to understand at times but he is willing to reiterate and explain more. His assignments are straightforward, they require you answer in a textbook way rather than think too much. 

Overall I learned significantly more politics under Serres, and would recommend to take him!

This teacher was probably the worst professor I've ever had. If you don't work well with accents, then don't take this class. He expects every assignment to be a polished essay. His lectures don't correlate to the slides and the slides don't correlate to anything we write. Be very weary of this professor. Only take if genuinely interested in topic!

This was my last quarter at UCSC and I took this class because I needed 15 units. By far one of the most interesting classes I've ever taken. Professor Serres is incredibly involved, competent, and passionate. I mean the dude got an extended applause at the end of the quarter so props man, I don't think I've ever seen that.

Serres has been my favorite politics professor throughout my time here. He is hilarious and makes an effort to include all students during his lectures and discussions. He challenged me a lot and helped me grow as a student. He can be a harsh grader, so it's really important to pay attention in lectures.
Thomas is great, he's funny and gives great lectures. He's very fair and care about what he does.

Prof Serres is incredibly knowledgeable on the topics of class, but is willing to admit when he does not know something. Lectures are always interesting, albeit the slides are long, but as long as you do the readings beforehand you'll be set for success. Participation is necessary to do well and he emphasizes this throughout the course.

This class had amazing/interesting lectures but is only graded on 3 things. The 2 papers felt stressful, they encourage being original and you get to choose the topic, sometimes making it confusing. He gives constructive feedback and grades fairly but is tougher than other professors. Incredibly knowledgeable and respected. Participation MATTERS.

Professor Serres is a kind and wonderful professor! He is accessible outside of class and is always happy to help his students. Participation matters but he doesn't care if you give a right or wrong answer. He also has you work in discussion groups throughout the quarter during class to talk about the readings. There's a group project at the end.
Amazing lecturer, and very helpful and down to earth. If you want to do well, go to class. Theres not a lot in his canvas slideshows that help you on papers, all the important stuff is in class.

Easily my favorite politics professor at UCSC, though there are many other awesome ones. The classes were engaging felt like they really flew by fast. He really knows what he is talking about but wasn't afraid to admit when he wasn't as knowledgeable on a topic. Took him for my senior seminar which was awesome and an extremely rewarding class.

he gives a lot of readings which you should do! but they are usually interesting. he grades on participation but doesn't really care if you give a "correct" answer or not, only that you've formed your own opinion. he gives really good feedback during office hours and makes accommodations for busy students if you just ask him. accent not bad at all!

My favorite politics professor. He is pretty good at explaining the texts and never has us read about boring topics (at least for me). He is very caring about students and their situation and has made online learning super easy without sacrificing much in material. I'm never stressed out about his class and I still learn a lot from his lectures.

Professor Serres is an unusually understanding and kind professor. He goes out of his way to support his students. Participation is necessary but not stressful. Serres encourages independent thought but also challenges students to think critically. Overall, I'm glad I was in this class and would recommend it to others.

Thomá(s) is a very interesting and intelligent man. He is quite personable and if you learned how to write in kindergarten this class should be a breeze. As long as you use academic language and have a basic understanding of the english language an A is almost guaranteed. Participate as much as possible!!!!
My favorite politics professor! He has interesting and interactive lectures. Go to office hours if you need help with an essay! If you show effort, you will do very well in the class.

Benjamin L Read is immensely passionate about China, and class discussions are very engaging. I learned so much from this class about China's domestic and international happenings. Highly recommend this course.

Prof Read is really caring and thoughtful in his work. He expects participation to the extent of class conversation. He assigns readings and will do quizzes, everyone once in a while on them, but he makes the selected readings very specific and relatively short. They are manageable and inspired me to actually read them.

I strongly advise against taking this class unless absolutely necessary. The course is extremely reading-intensive and relies heavily on memorization. Lectures are often dense and difficult to follow, hard to grasp the material. Since the class was small, there were no TAs,  the professor graded everything himself. take another class !!
i had to abuse stimulants to keep up with this class. dont do it. just dont.

Extremely hard grader. Everything is based on memory in this class and nothing is really about learning the material. I strongly suggest this professor reorganizes this class to be based more on helping the students understand instead of memorize for tests. Although, professor gives good feedback on written responses.

Good chunk of required readings each week, but really interesting course material. I found lectures to be very engaging (albeit they felt lengthy). Professor read absolutely makes time for students who want to succeed, and provides great feedback. Course is graded on a midterm, a final, and a final essay. I had a positive TA experience as well.

I had Read for 140D, 141, and 161 (I dropped 161 mid quarter because I had a negative experience). Read's course structure is full of really fascinating dense readings. Despite this he finds a way to make the readings boring. His teaching style is rigid. Be careful about attendance because he takes your absence as a personal insult. Not a nice guy.

near impossible to succeed in this class. entire grade is based on 3 assignments: a midterm, an essay, and a final which are graded extremely hard. 80-100 pages of reading a week and attendance is MANDATORY. if you miss ONE lecture your grade will be dropped. cool course material but i fell asleep in lecture. hes terrible at answering questions too

The professor seems like a super cool guy. The lectures contained lots of material and were luckily always recorded. There is no digital media policy, so get ready to take notes by hand. Lots of weekly readings, and the TA's will ask you about readings, so you can't BS your way out of it, unfortunately. Tests are super hard if you don't read.

Knowledgeable prof but has completely unrealistic standards. If your answer isn't in the exact wording he wants (he won't tell you what wording this is), your answer is wrong. No tech policy kept students from taking notes on laptops/iPads. Attendance is mandatory and recorded. Hundreds of pages of readings you must memorize to get above a B.

Professor Read gatekeeps learning about politics by making this class so difficult and dull. The grade is based on how well you can read, but he looks for very specific answers that he never provides. Ever. DO NOT take this class as a GE (especially if you are in STEM upper divs). Terrible introduction to politics---chased me out of the minor.

He made everything unnecessarily complicated. 100+ pages of reading per week. Tested on material he didn't have enough time to cover in class or sections. Closed book essay questions in person where you're supposed to have sources memorized. Complete pseudo-intellectual power trip.

Professor Read's only redeeming quality is his lectures. I don't have enough characters in this text box to mention the utter BS in his examinations and his grading, but I've given him a 1.0 to emphasize to avoid his classes at all costs.

I took his Chinese Politics class and I regret it so much. He assigns so many readings and 2 movies that are 3 hours long. He will quiz you every week and if you don't participate in his lectures he'll call on you. He's midterms are at-least 5 pages long.
Boring and tedious lectures. He makes up for that with tough grading and difficult exams. His TAs are just as bad. Skip

Professor Read is an outstanding lecturer and an expert on East Asia, especially China. Attendance is mandatory, pop quizzes based on the massive amounts of reading you cannot go around. Reading is absolutely mandatory, and it will consume huge part of your quarter. This class is a challenge, but if you take it seriously you will learn a ton.
Get ready for a boat load of work you can't weasel around

Professor Read is a very difficult professor! His class honestly is more diffucult than need be! The teachers aides are just little to passionate! Especially Xioa Ping! Beware of her, she's a difficult grader and you can't even understand her!!!! Take with precaution and please take it seriously!!!

One of my top 2 classes taken during my undergraduate career, with the other being his graduate seminar on Chinese Contemporary Policy. Professor Read lives up to the prestige of a Harvard Ph.D, providing a truly unique and amazing learning experience that is uncommon outside of top tier universities. Be prepared to work hard in return.

This class is far and away the HARDEST class I have taken at UCSC. Loads of complex reading, and the entire class grade is based on a lengthy midterm and final, with no curve on either one. I did well in the class, but I can't recommend it to anyone unless they have a very strong interest in third world politics, or a masochistic view of studying.

caring and incredibly smart professor. this seminar can definitely be a little intense but his feedback on your papers and the amount you will learn from him makes it worth it. my writing has 100% gotten better after taking this course.

I have taken three classes with Prof. Wirls, so trust me when I say that Prof Wirls is the best professor at UCSC. You will learn so much from his class. His passion for American Politics seeps through his lectures, ingraining your mentality to want to go above and beyond the class. Go into his class with an open mind and you will actually LEARN

He will make you buy his own textbook, but I think it is an acceptable tradeoff because he is a good instructor. He is good at facilitating during discussions and office hours. POLI 1 seems a little too easy though, I think Wirls could go more into depth on the class material.
The professor is knowledgeable and engaging, but the course workload is heavy. Attend lectures, use unstuck AI for exam prep, and you'll do well.

Fantastic lecturer who truly wants his students to succeed. I would highly recommend going to office hours if you need support, he does his best to make himself available for students. Hates phone usage in class (fair). Also the midterm (at least this past year) was so easy, just be prepared to memorize.

Wirls is an amazing lecturer, truly one of the Professors whose class you can attend and always feel engaged with the content. The classwork isn't too much, except do study for the in person midterm. Besides that, two papers and online quizzes. He's a great guy and genuinely wants to know the students / takes time to know all of their names.
Dan Wirls was the best professor in the Politics department when I was there.  He always gave great feedback and engaged students in rigorous discussion.  I would absolutely take his class again.
good professor, he made each lecture interesting and you can tell he really cares about what he is teaching.

Super passionate professor/lecturer, the readings are average for a political science class in my opinion. Midterm was given a lot to study for (told to remember all the authors of every article assigned, etc) but the actual midterm was easier than that. Weird essay instructions, was nitpicked ("demonstrates" corrected to "illustrates")

Get ready for a lot of reading and super strict grading by the TAs. The quizzes are very specific and oftentimes pretty difficult. Very passionate lecturer but pretty boring and HAS FAVORITES!! Calls on students by their names so go to office hours or talk to him or else you simply won't be known.

Loved Wirls and his class. He is clearly very intelligent and passionate about what he teaches, and has a good sense of humor. I looked forward to attending his lectures; not only were they entertaining, they helped breakdown the readings that would have otherwise been daunting.
He is awesome. You can tell that he is super smart and cares about what he teaches. Also understanding and will answer your emails. Often left class feeling smarter.

He is a very kind and funny professor with very knowledgeable insights. Always willing to help. However, his class is pretty intense with the amount of reading we do. Graded by few things. The quizzes were pretty hard if you do not understand the material since they are VERY specific with limited time. My TA was extremely helpful and kind.

A genuine and caring professor. He is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches, so the lectures are fun, but also helpful. There is a good amount of reading per week, but Wirls goes over it in the lecture, so attendance does help. Overall an amazing professor.
Very nice guy. Assignments aren't too hard as long as you go to class.

Professor Wirls always knows what he's talking about. There is quite a lot of reading for the class (every lecture) that connects to the lecture contents. He makes every lecture slideshow/content available afterwards, but I attendance helped me grasp the content better. Grade is based on short quizzes and 3 short papers throughout the quarter.
Professor Wirls is super knowledgeable & his classes are always interesting. He clearly cares about his students and goes out of his way. Excellent prof!

Prof. Wirls is my favorite prof. I've had at UCSC. Anyone who asks me what classes to take for Politics, I recommend they take one of his. Lectures are clear and to the point, and classes as a whole are well-structured and organized. He is quick to respond to emails and is always available to help and support his students. You will learn a lot! :)

Professor Wirls is absolutely wonderful! He makes this class easy and understandable. It is very clear that he cares about his students. As a third year politics major, I don't think this class is super reading heavy but if this is your first upper division course then it might seem that way.

Wirls the GOAT, had him for intro to Poli too, if I could take him for all my classes I would. Really cool guy all the way around, even if you do not care for Politics he makes stuff interesting. Favorite UCSC teacher and best PoliSci one by far.

Prof Niedzwiecki is passionate about her studies and it shows in her teaching. The class is a bit reading intensive, so be prepared to allocate some time for it. The reading and lectures go hand in hand. The lectures adequately prepare you for papers and exams. I had TA Taigo Tasca, who was also just as amazing. They both invite questions happily.

Professor Niedzwiecki is one of the kindest, most caring professors I've had UCSC. Her lectures are extremely engaging and she's always willing to help her students. If you have the chance, take her classes.

By far one of the most talented and caring professors on campus. Extremely loving and puts students' needs above everything. Always stops throughout the lecture to clarify anything that is misunderstood. Class is extremely manageable; take GREAT notes and do the weekly reading annotations

She was AMAZING! By far my favorite prof at UCSC. She's understanding and a great lecturer. Midterm/final focus on key terms, and grading depends on TAs, which can affect your grade negatively if they suck :/  Take detailed notes!! Reading is long, but skimming worked for me. Stay on top of your work or it's hard to catch up!

ong one of the best politics professors. she is a very sweet with a passion in her work and fields of study. her class is very manageable and not difficult at all, though there are a lot of readings which can be annoying ( 1 point each). attendance is mandatory and graded with a sign in sheet every class. overall amazing professor TAKE HER CLASS.
Incredible lectures, very kind professor with clear expectations. As long as you attend lecture and do the readings you'll pass easily.

Professor Niedzwiecki is extremely knowledgeable, and it shows in how thoroughly she answers questions! Her lectures are concise and informative, and assignments are well-defined and doable. She's level-headed, reasonable, and understanding. The course requires dense reading annotations, which takes a lot of time, but it's manageable.

Amazing!! One of the greatest professors of all time. Highly educated, knowledgeable and passionate about Latin America..Extremely professional. If you ask a question you don't understand over and over she is willing to answer it and explain the concept behind it patiently and happily. Begins each class with a recap of previous class.

Niedzwiecki is probably one of the best professors I've had at UCSC yet, she is extremely passionate and educated on politics in Latin America. She explains concepts extremely well and is very accessible outside of class. Beware of two finals and weekly assignments, but they are all fairly easy if you pay attention.

The assigned material is incredibly dense, even the TA encouraged us to voice our concerns about the heavy material. It's contradictory for politics professors to advocate for justice and equal opportunity while assigning 80+ pages of complex reading. This approach makes learning inaccessible for students and undermines the principles they teach.
This course was hard, however, she was very understanding and always open to questions and feedback. I went to every lecture because I enjoyed them so much.

Niedzwiecki was amazing and cares about her students so much. even tho I took her class on zoom it was still inspirational and engaging. there's weekly reading hw but you can take small notes and TAs grade. the midterm and final are short essays and defining key terms... so easy (would've got an A but I'm lazy didn't turn in reading hw)

Niedzwiecki is incredibly nice and understanding. Great lecturer, and she clearly loves what she teaches (which helps a lot). The class is very, very reading heavy, but there is only one big paper, a midterm and a final, and the rest of the graded is mostly just through completion-based assignments and participation.

She is kindest lady ever who is extremely knowledgeable on Latin American politics. There is lots of reading, but once you get it done and discuss it, you feel like you learned a lot. Very clear and engaging lectures, and such a fair midterm! Take this class; you won't regret it because she truly cares about her students. Tiago was also a great TA!

She was amazing! Im a politics major so I'm really interested in what she teaches but it's aslo a great GE class. There are lots of reading but if you have the general idea and pay close attention to lecture you'll be fine. Her lectures are so interesting and allows for a lot of discussion
Best politics lectures I've had.

I took POLI61 and POLI120 with Niedzwiecki. She is an amazing lecturer and passionate about her work.  She tends to assign a lot of reading but you can still be successful without completing every reading. She is incredibly kind and is genuinely invested in the well-being of her students. 10/10

I took Professor Niedzwieckis Poli 61 class and it was one of the best courses Ive taken so far. I felt like I learned a ton in the class without having to do too much work. Her lectures were really helpful and the grading criteria was straightforward.

Professor Niedzwiecki may seem intimidating at first but she's actually very kind and wants the students to succeed. As long as you are putting forth effort and attending class, which a lot of the work really isn't hard, just time-consuming, her class is very enjoyable and enlightening. She really wants to teach students how to be better students.

Prof. Niedzwiecki is amazing! She really knows her stuff and is so passionate about what she teaches it makes lectures super engaging. I loved this class and would highly recommend it to anyone, first years especially! She also places a large effort to answer many questions and is very kind when you go to study hours.

he's a good teacher, a little confusing but if you go to his office hours he helps a lot. his male ta gallagher is an asshole and misogynist so if ur a girl try to get the other TA. otherwise the professor is awesome

Nice guy but damn are his lectures boring. not to mention he literally changed the whole grade weighting mid quarter and never told anyone. he didnt even realize there were two essays on the syllabus until a TA brought it up and he hoped no students saw it. #unorganized. knowledgable but not the best lecturer. amount of reading was light imo

Prof. was great! Def a ready-heavy class, and it's important for your projects, so make sure you understand the main concepts being outlined. Lectures are very dense and tiring, but resist the urge to be on your phone - he might call you out. He's obviously very knowledgeable and loves teaching, though, so if you pay attention, you'll learn a lot!
How can you hate this guy

I took the comparative post communist politics class with him. I liked it, because he is easy going and I was never stressed out over this class. It wasn't the most organized, but there was a lot of leeways for things and the was pretty hands-on and student focused.

I took prof. Schoenmans class in the winter quarter of 2025, and I can confidently say he was the most proactive instructor I've ever had. If he knows you are overwhelmed with anything he goes out of his way to help in any way he can. Also very passionate about the topic and gives engaging lectures.

One personal and another group project/presentation, periodic short essay/response assignments. Very fair workload for the class. Extremely knowledgeable on the subject!

Grades assignments himself and provides great feedback, first I've seen here!

Really great professor and class, take it if you can

Professor Schoenman makes classes engaging and incorporates different things into his lectures like games, simulations, and lots of discussions. He is very approachable and easy to reach via email or before or after class. There are quite a lot of readings for the class but if you go to sections then the readings are explained and talked about.

Hands down the best professor in the Politics Department at UCSC. Professor Schoenman worked so hard this quarter to make the content engaging, fun, and educational. You will play games in class, write interesting papers, and become well informed on the international political economy. Prof will do anything to not let this subject be boring!

Roger is a nice person and decent professor but I hated this class. This class was difficult, not because the papers and assignments were hard, but because the material is so boring and tedious that I was miserable every class. I appreciated that Roger at least attempted to engage students through games and activities, but it just wasn't enough.

I loved Prof. Schoenman! He had a great attitude in class every day, and was always very approachable. I would def try to stay on top of the assigned readings, and you really need to be interested in the subject to succeed in the class. Overall he's a great person with an amazing teaching style.

Prof. Schoenman came to every class with the material and really tried to make it engaging, but in the end, every lecture I was fighting not to fall asleep. Incredibly theory dense weeks 1-7ish and the lectures dont really help. He makes these unnecessarily difficult quizzes where you have 3 questions so you fail if you miss a single one, wack asf.

First, his voice is extremely monotoned...For a lower division class, it was extremely difficult. His midterm and finals were released 24 hours before due and required an excessive amount of work. I literally didn't have time to eat or shower that day. He also required a 2000+ word paper? TA was a tough grader too...

Overall, I had a great time in his class. Roger is extremely accessible outside of class and will help you succeed if you put in the efforthe makes your work for your grade. Personally, the quantitative undertones of the course were fascinating, but I know that many of my classmates were not a fan.
Class is boring, unreasonable tests, and he makes his final go late into the night for no obvious reason.

Love Professor Schoenman. I had him for my lower divs and upper divs and he's always come to the lecture with a sense of passion, understanding for their students as well as super easy to email and reach if you have any question or comment.

He seems really passionate about what he's teaching but this guy the most dull lecturer I've ever had. It's really hard to focus in class because his slides & teaching style are beyond boring. Your TA matters for what grade you're gonna get. The 2 tests expect you to recite an unreasonable amount of information but he allows 1 notecard on the final

Having Roger for my 1st politics class at UCSC was a wonderful experience. Although Comparative Politics was not as interesting as I expected, he kept the class engaged. Your grades are mainly determined by which TA you get & while they're all great, some are harder graders than others. Participate & think critically & you'll do well!

Schoenman is super nice. The only assignments are related to the final seminar paper, and all of the readings are on Canvas . This is a discussion-based class, so participation matters, and you do have to present your research to the class. This quarter the course topic was 'Transitions' of politics in the digital age, focusing on populism.

Schoenman is super understanding. He is a kind soul and it feels like he truly wants all his students to succeed. His syllabus makes his class not to heavy on the papers and finals which is nice. The topic is kind of boring and theory-heavy in the beginning but he does his best and it gets better after week 3 and its about money/trade.
incredibly passionate and knows so much about her work but her lecture runs all over the place. she has a tendency to go on a tangent about the same slide for the majority of the class.

She's extremely blunt, and always gives no-nonsense feedback. High energy in lecture so it's never really boring. Her accent is a tiny bit hard to understand at first, but she talks and engages students a lot so you get used to it.

Mostly graded on a group project and two essays. Clearly knows a lot on the subject, learnt a lot from her overall
very strict

- forced to drop the class b/c she wouldn't excuse my absences after my dog died
- gave me a condescending lecture about communication ironically despite not responding to any of my emails about why i was absent and assumed i had dropped the class
- tried to get me to come to class for a group presentation after i told her i dropped the class

Professor Pasotti is genuinely an amazing professor, but that does not mean that this course was easy. I enjoyed my time with Pasotti and was able to learn more about European politics than I had ever considered possible. The issues I had with this course were 1) the quizzes and 2) the papers. Quizzes are hard, and papers can stack fast. Stay

Very passionate teacher, truly tries to have students understand the importance of what she teaches and she cares about student's succeed. She makes lectures and class fun. I have truly learned and participated more in her class than any other class I have taken.

Would not recommend this class. Her quizzes are tough and don't include material covered in her lectures. On top of that, there is no "right" answer for many of the questions, just one that is less wrong than the others. I was never eager to learn, just stressed about failing the class.

Her lectures are boring and could use some improvement.... however, the class is not impossible. Watch the lectures, try and take good notes, do the readings, ASK QUESTIONS IN SECTION!! She will usually help with the complex essay prompts, you just have to ask her for some guidance! She is very knowledgable and I enjoyed this class (over summer).

I feel like she needs to be humbled cuz it seems like she has gone YEARS without being held accountable for her actions. In my class, she made it severely inaccessible for students to complete the material and participate because she's so aggressive and hostile. Does not make the learning space safe for folks and has sever god-complex.

Many claim it's the student's responsibility to understand the material given yet how do you expect that if she does not teach what you should know. She gives recorded lectures & endless chapters to read which did not help. She should have constructed a better syllabus and actually teach and not intimidate her students when they answer wrong.

Professor Pasotti is the worst professor I have ever had. She expects way too much out of her students and barely covers anything in the lectures that is useful for taking quizzes. Dense readings which is fine, but my problem was with the monotone boring lectures that sounded like she was reading off a script (and looked like it). Dont fall victim

One of the most intense politics courses I've ever taken. Take this from someone who typically puts serious effort into school and does well academically. She provides you with the tools you need to succeed, but know you'll really have to invest a lot of time engaging with the material to do well on the essays and quizzes. Hard class overall.

Professor Pasotti got a lot of flack this quarter, but I think that's because everyone is struggling with remote instruction. Quizzes are hard & questions are poorly written. Essays are reasonable and build on the material. Watch the lectures and do the assigned readings otherwise, you will really suffer. But what do you expect?

Pasotti structures her class so the students have to engage with the material in order to do well. She provides all the necessary information to do well in the class. If you do not plan to read and engage in discussions, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. You will not do well if you choose to sit back and not pay attention

You will literally have to teach yourself for this class. The TAs are amazing during discussion; but lecture with Pasotti gets you nowhere. She is very condescending and rude when you clearly need help. If you take this class, have fun watching hours long of lectures to barely get a C on the weekly quizzes.

By far the worst professor I've had at UCSC. Recorded lectures are boring and uninspired. The quizzes are intentionally confusing and hardly related to the reading or lectures. Essay prompts are poorly written and only tangentially related to the course material. On top of this she is condescending and rude. Avoid at all costs!!!

Please do not take this class. Take it from a person like me who enjoys taking notes on political structures and European institutions but this class is highly unorganized, causing me to want to take an emergency W during the final few weeks of the quarter.

I'm usually a very enthusiastic student but this class has taken the wind out of my sails. The Canvas page is not organized. The recorded lectures are dull. The reading quizzes are impossible without Googling. Only take this class if you are genuinely passionate about the minutiae of European institutions and don't mind taking the L on your GPA.

The professor is very knowledgeable, passionate, and enthusiastic. Don't ever take her summer class though unless it's the only class you're taking. An essay and a test is due every Friday and the grading is tough.  The average class grade is a C, which means few attain A's and B's. I've taken 9 upper div. LGST/POLI courses - this was the hardest!
Hardest class ever!

Omg dilf. Midterm and final were light work but he is such a good lecturer and is funny and engaging. super easy class and only hw was occasional online quizzes that are full credit as long as you just do them.
Supa dilf professor. Pulls up to class on e bike everyday and really cares about what he teaches. Really only lectures and gives readings but is engaging and communicates well with TAs

THE GOAT!! Easiest class ever, you will have so much fun! This was one of those classes you rarely wanted to miss. Gordon is very accessible out of class and the TA's are amazing! (Discussion section attendance is mandatory but great nonetheless).

Gordon is a great professor and entertaining lecturer (but you don't need to attend) who cares for the material. That being said, when taking the class on M/W/F he was often rushing to get his lecture done near the end. Lectures are not required but sections and participation in them are. In my experience, his lectures are more useful than the text

This was a light class, in my opinion, and I think Gordon's lecturing style made it that way since he is great at explaining unfamiliar concepts. (Get ready for the sports analogies!) Outside of lecture he was super friendly and helpful too.

You don't need to go to lecture to learn concepts, but good for memorization and explaining harder concepts in simpler terms. His teaching style is super chill, and he doesn't make learning overly complicated. Most of your grade is the midterm and final; you have 1-2 low-stakes quizzes a week that are participation-based, and section participation.
Lectures aren't mandatory, but sections are. His lectures are really interesting though, so I encourage everyone to go!!

Prof. Gordon was AMAZING! Lectures could be a little scattered, but felt like an interesting podcast and were super informative/relevant. Attendance isn't required, but you'll struggle if you skip more than 50%. Section's a must - good supplement if you can't make all the lectures. Also very kind - he gave me an extension when I missed a deadline!

Prof. Gordon has obvious interest in his material, but this leads to long lectures with little class interaction. Attendance isn't required and readings aren't checked (he asks for opinions on any that are "required"), but noting which ones are mentioned in class is useful for short essay assignments. Vague criteria for essays and group projects.

Great professor. My only negatives are from the TAs and even then he did his best to find a solution that makes everyone happy. Lots of lectures, but assignments are super duper easy and help with understanding of what is covered in the lectures.

Fantastic professor. He explains difficult concepts with exceptional clarity. He's a wonderful orator, gives insightful lectures, and cares deeply about the subjects he teaches. I wish I wasn't graduating so that I could take another course with him.

Professor gordon was a phenomenal lecturer and would explain course concepts in an easily digestible manner.  This class has only three writing assignments, and the rest of the homework is just reading. His lectures are useful and cover all important topics from the readings. He reiterates many ideas to help fully cement course concepts.

i've taken his classes before and they are all climate change-themed. i took this class last spring quarter and it wasn't too bad of a core class. the textbook is online, and there were only 3 short and simple essays to complete. he's a pretty chill guy, funny, understanding and gives extensions. also TAs were nice

my only complaint is the fact that we had to pay $22 to just be able to do the homework. otherwise, prof gordon is so cool and always kept me intrigued. i REALLY like the material and his teaching style is great.

nice guy gets off topic during lectures but good energy. hw on inquisitive ($22) & midterm/final (both short and long answer questions ab current events) classes were recorded, the TAs are super helpful. focus on applying concepts!!!!! textbook pdf free online thru reddit>google drive. gave the class a grade boost at the end

This professor is pretty chill. The lectures were pretty interesting, sometimes a bit boring. He records them and posts slides. The readings are long but the quizzes on them are graded on completion and help with understanding. The midterm and final were both long & short written answers. Open note and easy to answer if you go to class and section.

Cool dude, lectures were entertaining, and class was interesting. Hw is just ungraded inquisitive assignments, and the midterm and final are a couple of essays about current events/class. It was pretty easy, and the TA I had was helpful and cool. Sometimes things got a bit off-topic and Dave ran out of time, but still would take him again.

I took his international world poli class...not sure why it wasn't an option above. Most of the time his lectures are so theoretical that they are hard to visualize and difficult to write about. He is also the slowest speaker I have ever heard... Other than that he seemed very nice just definitely not my ideal class.

Prof Gordon is a nice guy and I learned a lot in his Poli 174 class. His grading is straightforward and not harsh, and he didnt assign very much work at all. I would definitely take one of his classes again. Although he was a bit inaccessible at times, he expressed that he was dealing with health issues so I cant blame him.

I actually had professor Gordon for POLI 160A. As a lecturer, he was pretty good, though boring at points. Though this was probably because they were not in person lectures. I appreciated how structured and consistent the class was. There was only 4 total grades in the book the entire quarter: participation and 3 essays. Pretty easy
At least it is now over.
Legendary.

Bruh I'm definitely not the type of person who cries a lot but this paper has me crying rn. I'm not even done with the course, I'm writing this as a form of procrastination. SO MUCH reading. Essays are 5-6 pages and only thing in the grade book. Haven't been going to my section so my review is kinda biased but ITS 8AM ON A FRIDAY WHO DOES THAT.

Prof Thomas had really good audio notes that accompanied the readings, and the work was pretty manageable. The zoom lectures were less useful, and by the end of the quarter I was falling asleep. Overall pretty good

Megan is a really kind and caring professor. I was worried about my grade, as I was going through a lot this quarter. I made sure to meet with Megan during her office hours a few times throughout the quarter and she was super accommodating. There is a lot of reading from the textbook plus some additional canvas readings, so be prepared for that.

I've taken 3 courses with her and absolutely loved them.  Yes, she and her TA's expect you to work hard and emphasize good writing but we're college students and her standards are pretty standard.  I've seen quite a few folks say that it's impossible to get an A or B, that simply is not true. You get back what you put in with her courses.

Avoid taking any classes with her at all costs. Worst Professor I've ever had hands down. Seems like she is searching for ways to grade down or to fail people. Requires a ridiculous amount of books/readings, erratic lectures, and the final exam was structured terribly to where our knowledge on material really could not be reflected. She's no good!!
Not one person got a single A throughout the entire course and there were only a handful of Bs. That should be enough for you to not take this class

Warning ! do not take any classes with this professor, she is extremely difficult. Expect anything from C or lower. Her expectations are ridiculously high. She will assign around 7 books to read and will give you very little time to prepare. for her class avoid her and her T.A. Andrew Meyer.  This was supposed to be a theory class not english lit.
She's adorable and really knows what she's talking about. A great introduction to modern political thought. Two papers, one final that is pretty straightforward
She's tough, but definitely knows what she is talking about. Do the reading or you're lost. Midterm and Final is pretty straightforward.

This being a theory based course, one really needs to articulate their own arguments based on the readings. The material is a little dry, but there isn't too much reading. Weekly quizzes, in-class midterm and final. Very energetic teacher and takes a lot of questions during lecture. I think my discussion class helped tremendously more than lecture
Professor Thomas is a great lecturer, has a good sense of  humor, and is very easy to talk to in person. She cares a lot about her subject and her students. No complaints.

The course was extremely interesting and so was the material, but the essay prompts were a bit constrained. Coming directly from Ancient Poli made this class a bit difficult to adjust to, but Megan is super enthusiastic and knows her stuff. Keep up with the reading and plan ahead for your papers and you should be good.

Loved her. She is SUPER nice and you can tell she really, really cares that everyone understands the concepts and material. All the readings were very interesting, and her lectures were engaging. She's great!

She's clearly personally invested in the subject she teaches. Interesting, eye opening class regardless of major. Section was the most helpful part of the class but lectures were still really useful. Though I did feel a bit talked down to when I went in for office hours once.

Tough, but you learn so much in her class! She is very clear & thorough. She has a lot of office hours for anyone that has questions/needs help. Her lectures are outlined ahead of time so you know EXACTLY what will be covered. She really challenges you & expects as much work from you as she puts in herself. She really cares about her students!

It is really hard to focus during her lectures, they are very dry and often confusing.  The readings are very dense and also confusing.  The only helpful thing in the class were discussions and tutoring.  DO NOT TAKE THIS AS YOUR FIRST POLITICS CLASS OR AS AN INCOMING FIRST YEAR.
Teacher is not very good, and can be somewhat of a jerk sometimes. I would not recommend taking this class. Tests are a lot of material.
OK, but not that good

Taking 120C with Professor Bertram was easily one of the greatest classes I've ever been a part of at UCSC. Professor Bertram is incredibly engaging in her lecture content, very kind and approachable in any context (casually or academically), and really cares about the success of each of her students. 1000/10 would take a class with her again!

This is one of the most interesting classes I have taken, and much of that is due to Professor Bertram. She unpacks the readings in lectures and they are very structured with an outline. She makes herself available to students and is always willing to chat about anything. Very educated and respectable. Lots of reading but otherwise light workload
A professor who'll push to analyze and understand the other side of the aisle just as well. She is the PERFECT politics professor at UCSC.

This professor prepares you if you wish to attend Law School. Her lectures are organized and truly prepare you for your essays. Please pay attention and do not get behind. Her office hours are a place to improve if you're lacking guidance. With the attendance and papers it's easy to focus and not be overwhelmed. Lovely Professor.

Honestly one of my favorite classes ever! Eva is an icon. Hard material to get through and sometimes dense, but this class is worth it because you truly learn so much. Eva has amazing and informed lectures.

Eva Bertram is the best professor I've had at UCSC. She is an absolutely phenomenal lecturer who knows her stuff for sure. She relays information in an informative and extremely engaging way. I'm now taking my second class with her and I find myself excited to go to her class each day. I highly recommend her, however, she requires a lot.

Eva assigns A LOT of reading, but you can get away with not reading by taking good lecture notes. I'd recommend taking a laptop bc she covers through a lot of material very quickly. Takes attendance. 2 essays & 1 final. Essays were somewhat challenging but totally doable if you keep up with material. Final is okay & you get a cheat sheet

Took this class 'cause I was interested in the subject. Sort of hurt my soul to sit through it for the quarter. To take in so much information about politics without anyone (teacher or students) seeming to move towards any new insights was- difficult. Kinda like a microcosm for politics as a whole in the country.

Eva Bertram just may be the reason I am the person I am today.  She is truly remarkable and your world will be better if you take a class with her.  Her way of "unpacking" often complex, and controversial topics is so even-head, thorough, and inspiring. She expects a lot, but putting in the time to engage in the material is more than worth it!

Overall, Professor Bertram is really great and she knows her subject well. She is a very intelligent individual and the subject, American Politics, was interesting to learn about. Sometimes class could get boring because she repeated a lot of things that were in the readings, but overall I really did enjoy this class.

Not a politics major but I loved the class, Bertram is an INCREDIBLE lecturer. She gets the point across, repeats herself without making it tedious, and consistently checks in with the class to make sure everything is clear. She is also happy to help anyone who needs it.
Organized, articulate and engaging. Politics is my least favorite subject but she makes it so intriguing.

Extremely passionate, engaging, and communicative. Knows what she is talking about and how to get you to understand it. Lectures are dense and assignments are tough, but definitely learned a ton in her class. Best professor I have had at UC, highly recommend.

Professor Bertram is awesome! Definitely knows her material and gives specific examples to enhance the readings. A lot of reading for an upper-divison course, but well worth it. One reading response due each week (200-300 words), an in-class essay mid-term, and a final essay to turn in. Highly recommend taking a course with her!

The best politics professor in Santa Cruz hands down. She is the most articulate and concise professor I've had. She is very knowledgeable about her subject and easy to talk to. There is a lot of reading required, but she goes over it really well. One midterm, and one final paper, and weekly reading responses. I recommend her highly.

Prof. Bertram is an incredible no BS lady. Her class is demanding, but entirely worth it. She makes you think and really gets you involved in the subject. Make sure you do the readings and take good notes (the midterm is open note). HIGHLY recommend Eva - she's super duper rad.

Eva is incredible. The 2 essays she assigns are hardcore and that's what you'll need the readings [of which there are an insane amount] for. The final, which is open note and you get a study guide for- can be completed perfectly with information only from her lectures. Bring a computer to class because no one can write  that fast. GO TO CLASS.
Great teacher, has a knack for sparking interest in her subject. Work is fair, and although there is a lot of reading, it is generally very interesting while providing a bipartisan view.

I took 25, 120C and 122 with her; they were all fantastic. She is crystal clear, and she made me passionate about American labor policy. I'm taking my senior seminar with her and I can't wait. Her tests aren't terribly easy, but if you read and attend section (mandatory) you'll be fine. Amazing professor, take every class you can with her.

Very interesting topic but be prepared for hurt wrists because she talks really fast and gives you incredible amounts of info each lecture. Kinda overwhelming but overall class is fun. 2 take home midterms and in class final essay.

Erik is an amazing professor for Porter core! Attendance is mandatory, and will determine if you automatically fail. I feel like this class was especially easy compared to the other 2 courses I took this quarter. Participation is not mandatory. I'd recommend him again and again, he's really great! People who hate on him are extremely wrong.

Take Porter core with him if you want to be challenged to think more deeply and work a little harder. He gives good feedback. I've definitely grown from taking this class as a thinker, reader, and writer
If u r hating, you're wrong. This was my fav class and I barely did any of the readings and did fine.

Core class was pretty difficult, definitely get ready to read and write a lot Makes you participate in class a lot since it is a small core class. Isn't the most engaging and interesting either even when you are struggling in class Just gives out information and doesn't answer questions clearly go to class or will fail (attendance), grades harshly

I really enjoyed the lectures and sections (shoutout my TA Rebecca Gross) for this class. There is A LOT of reading for this class and A LOT of tedious assignments, especially for a lower division course. I am a Lit major so it was not too bad at all, the topics are fascinating and fun. His lectures are interesting + enjoyable and he is hilarious.

He's really cool as a person and is really funny. He follows the concept of “1 credit equals 3 hours of work”. So for this class he expected 15 hours per week but it would end up being more like 18+ for me. Despite it being a lecture there's mini group work each lecture. If you're looking for a class to breeze right through don't take this.

Erik is a very genuine teacher who gives great feedback on papers. The class could get quite boring at times but honestly, it was fine because you could have interesting conversations with him if you put in the effort. There was a lot of busywork but he graded them easily, as long as you followed the directions you would get 100% almost every time.

Erik is really cool. A lot of teachers feel like they're talking at you, but Erik talks to you. Very down to Earth guy. I had him for Porter 1 and the course has lots of reading but in future years they're cutting it down because students are complaining.

This course currently has a lot of bloat, but it's getting better and Erik was listening to feedback and making adjustments within reason. I expect by 2024 or 2025 this course will be different, as it will be under a different provost. He was a great prof and was fun to work with in class, though it is a considerable amount of reading.

On one hand, Erik is very good at providing a new and unique way of looking at films. He has a funny and personable side to him that comes through very strongly in his lectures. That being said, the second half of the class kind of lost me and became too advanced for someone who doesn't know or care about the Western way of looking at films.

Erik was fun and very knowledgeable, but compared to other porter core classes, he did assign a ton of more work and readings (as my roommate mentioned), so if you have the patience and time to do all that then you'll be fine in his class.
A lotttt of reading but all interesting material, sometimes it definitely felt like overkill. Comes off a bit pretentious but is really knowledgeable. Interesting lectures.
I enjoyed Dr. Bachman's class and teaching. The class was definitely very challenging, but I do recommend him if you're up to doing a good amount of work.

The "get ready to read" tag is an understatement. It is a LOT of reading. However, IF you're up to reading it all, the rest of the class is pretty straightforward. I think his word choice comes off as excessive sometimes, but if you get through that, he seems extremely knowledgeable about his subject. He's good but definitely has a few quirks.

It's been a while since I took this class but I really didn't enjoy it. There was a lot of reading, which I didn't mind. I felt like my work was graded really harshly even when following instructions to a tee. It made me doubt my writing abilities and just overall felt shitty

I took this class thinking it would be a fun GE, I was very wrong. It was supposed to be an into class but felt very advanced. Way too much reading, weekly papers. The professor seems arrogant and pretentious, though it got a bit better towards the end. He does listen to feedback, I'll give him that, and he eased up a bit halfway through.
Just so so much work, had to withdrawal from the class, I just couldn't keep up. He was sort of funny in class sometimes.
Prof. Bachman is a fair grader and generally I look forward to his class. he is nice but he also assigns a lot of readings. I took his Porter 2 Film class and really enjoyed it.

While there was a lot of reading for the class, Erik was always polite and offered clear feedback on assignments. He was a fair grader. He also was courteous to students' individual needs and put students' ideas first, especially in discussions during lectures. Erik is a great choice for Porter 1!

Bachman is a very fair grader who gives thoughtful feedback with each assignment. Hes very lenient with assignments and understanding of particular circumstances. The only thing about this class is that there is a lot of weekly reading but you learn how to get through it. Overall I really appreciate him as a professor.

Laurel is not a good person. She lacks skills in all aspects of life(interacting with other humans)and does not want you to succeed. She will find any excuse to fail you. Its a power trip. She is weak and as a result her only claim to ruling over you like a dictator is by making your gpa suffer. She is not your friend she will be your demise.RACIST
Nice but too nice. Won't tell any kids in your class to stop being obnoxious when they are in the middle of class.

The classes are extremely boring, unfriendly to international students, maliciously counting people as absent (even though they clearly attended), and not teaching those who are not good at the language.

Synchronous online course. Class started a little rocky because there were differing expectations from the prof and students. But Laurel did her best to accommodate students needs, even if it was in interesting activities. Discussion and reflection posts due every week even is class didn't meet. Lots of guest speakers from varying backgrounds.
Very awkward and made class feel uncomfortable with nervous laughter unfortunately.

Professor could not encourage students to speak in class it was so awkward :((. I thought the papers were kinda blah and I feel the professor had a lot of silly rules. Felt kinda like a high school class. She really tried tho, got to respect that.

does not care about her students, horrible prompts on assignments and grades them heavy. found out she was marking me late for walking in 2 minutes late. I asked her about it and she said it because it is disruptive. she is trying to fail me on technicalities and it's literally a first year core class. she also has extremely boring discussions.

As long as you do the assignments and try a little you'll be fine. I didn't love the class, but for a required class it wasn't completely horrible. Fairly easy grader as long as you put some effort in.
Nice teacher, mandatory freshman class which sucks, busy work, grading scale wasn't clear on the syllabus so ruined my GPA in the end but overall okay class.

She's a sweet person, but her teaching style wasn't for me. There's a lot of busy work, but she's usually an easy grader as long as you put some effort in. During class she's really nice, but she does ramble a lot which makes it boring. I didn't find the readings particularly engaging either.
Laurel was by far one of the worst professors I have had here at UCSC. She has no regard for students and genuinely does not care if you succeed or not. Good luck with the homework load friends.
Didnt love this class but very caring teacher

Vague in her teaching and expects you to understand how everything should be formatted to her grading. Doesn't explain anything and grades extremely difficult. Do yourself a favor and choose another proff.

Professor Peacock is wonderful. This class was not overwhelming with homework, had readings but hw was not too much. There was a creative option with the weekly assignment and she was open to feedback. She is a very kind prof and I had a wonderful time in this class.

She is the nicest professor ever, one of the sweetest people in general. The class made me hate reading but thats not her fault I had her for Porter 1 core class which is a class that would make anyone hate reading. Despite the actual class she made it enjoyable.

She's amazing, and so precious. Typical class: you read some stuff, then write about it. What else do you expect in a college core class? Please be prepared to discuss and actually read what's assigned. There's not much, and you'll just want to make her smile, trust me. Overall, amazing class. Don't be shy and just talk! Love her.

Laurel was such a sweet person. I had her for Porter Core, so it was a small class. She often got off topic but overall I had a good understanding of the texts and what she wanted from us with each essay.

Laurel was simply outstanding!!! She has a very professional demeanor and a great sense of humor. I learned more about myself and how good of a writer i was than in any other class ive taken in the past! Take her class immediately, shes the nicest person ive met!
I absolutely loved Ms. Peacock. She is the nicest person Ive ever met and her class is absolutely wonderful! BELIEVE ME, she is great. I HIGHLY recommend her!
Great teacher, helped me improve my writing. would definitely recommend

Claire is the sweetest person on planet Earth. The class itself was boring, but Claire tried her best to make the material engaging. There is a lot of readings, but nothing too time consuming. There are two homework assignments a week. She gives clear instructions and meaningful feedback. Claire is very forgiving and not a harsh grader.
I literally adored her as a teacher. Wants you to succeed, and is super understanding!

Claire was an empathetic and understanding professor who made me look forward to a class I otherwise found uninteresting. Despite this, she engaged my classmates and me with plenty of great seminar questions. Everyone I've spoken to has praised her highly.

Claire is a great professor! Porter 1 is not the most riveting class, but Claire does a great job of making it as engaging as possible. We did a lot of large and small group discussions. Homework is consistent and frequent, takes 1-2 hours in-between each class. All my friends who didn't have Claire disliked Porter Core a lot more than I did.
So so sweet. Course was annoying, but she made it nice.
Porter Core class isn't great, but there's not much Claire can do to fix the actual course guideline.
awesomesauce
I didn't really enjoy the class but that was at no fault of Claire! She really tried her best to be engaging and accessible for everyone and you could tell that she truly enjoys what she does.

Claire is so nice and caring! While there is a lot of reading the assignments are easy and short. There are only a few essays and she's not a harsh grader. She always gives good feedback and I would 100% take her again.
Such an amazing teacher!! Lots of reading but it's all manageable. Claire makes all the lectures interesting and is very forgiving of late work or missed class. 10/10 would take again

Claire is an awesome professor!! Lot of reading but the seminars are so engaging and the journal entries are very easy. A few papers and projects but they're all graded pretty leniently. I loved this class :]

While Professor can be kind, he tends to be very elitist and unwilling to support students if he does not know you well. The course was easy if you studied but the many assignments were graded harshly, felt like busy work, and were excessively long. He mostly talked about his research, which felt like it limited the course.

Cam doesn't have the best rep on here, but as someone who read these reviews and was skeptical taking the class, I have no regrets. There's a fair amount of readings, but they're just used to answer the homework. Don't even have to read the whole thing. He is kind, respectful, and has good lectures. I would totally take another class of his!

Loved his lectures! Such a sweet old guy. Very understanding. I wish I had gone to his office hours, but I never had time. Super accommodating and talkative. He answered all of my "what if" questions with glee, awesome guy!

Prof. Leaper is a good teacher. He doesn't post his lecture slides on Canvas, and attendance isn't mandatory unless it's the first week or the final, but if you go to class, he'll have printed notes handed out. The final is worth 50% of the grade, and you can have 1 front and back cheat sheet, but still make sure to study the harder concepts.

I personally enjoyed this class. Final is in person and 50% of your grade which was very stressful and not consistent with the weekly online quizzes or online midterm. Prof leaper seems to care a lot about his students and is very passionate about his work.

i enjoyed lectures and the overall course was not too difficult but the final is worth 50% of grade, so make sure to attend and pay attention in class. midterm and weekly quizzes aren't difficult at all.

I think Prof Leaper, is okay he tends to go too much into detail sometimes which can distract from the topic.I didn't love the structure of the class/notes. There were printed notes which honestly was a waste of paper, and I feel like online notes would've been better. The final is 50% of your grade, its a lot, I would say just try your very best.

Quite knowledgeable about what their teaching for this course. Homework is a bit of a pain (lots of short answer questions) but no exams (except there's MCQ homework which are kinda literally the exams). One major group project throughout the quarter, but its not a lot of work.

Winter quarter: His lectures were always really good and it helped that he would give note sheets with the main points of each topic at the beginning of each class. I recommend taking your own additional notes. The quizzes and midterm were open note, he allowed a double-sided paper for the final and gave back a few missed points each quiz/test.

His final was 50% of your grade, the rest of your grade is midterms and quizzes. His lectures were good but quite boring, and the only material he gave students access to was printed out notes at every single lecture, which felt like a massive waste of paper. Do not take for an easy GE, try to take a different prof if you can, I wasn't a fan of him

Wish I would've gotten another teacher but it was fine. Lectures are pointless but he has a weird policy where he won't give you notes or publish slides so going to class is "mandatory." TBH you will be fine if you miss lectures and just do the readings- I wish I would've felt confident skipping more. Final is 50% of grade but easier than quizzes.

Had good detailed slides and provided a paper of all or most of the information that was talked about in class, but refused to post his slides or record his lectures. Final was 50% of your grade but it's pretty easy as long as you study. Quizzes every week and not allowed to go back once you pass a question. Was a nice professor and taught well.

You must attend class for the notes as he does not offer the slideshow outside of the lecture. Sign up for tutoring since that's extra credit, and make sure to do the readings assigned per week. The final is 50% and there are weekly quizzes, but he drops the lowest grade from the quizzes overall, and this class is not too bad. Not good for GE thou.

Do not take this class as a GE, the final is worth 50% of your grade. Professor Leaper's quizzes, midterm, and final are lecture and reading HEAVY. Professor Leaper does let you use a cheat sheet for your final and drops your lowest quiz grade. There is also a 1 page "essay" that is required which is not too bad.

His class isn't that crazy, I mean it's an introductory psychology course. Surprised I got an A+ since there is no real curve. More than 50% of your grade is in exams. 50% is your final. I liked psychology but the classes were boring until the latter half.

The teacher is very well versed in his subject, his slides are clear and straight to the point. The lectures are very well explained, he leaves plenty of time for questions and tells you exactly how the course will be from day 1. The only option for extra credit is LSS, which is almost impossible to get into, and the 50% final is stressful.

Professor Leaper is an excellent teacher. His lectures are honestly really engaging however to receive the notes you must attend lectures. I would say for a GE it's a little rough (making the final 50% of our grade) but if you're genuinely considering majoring in psychology take this class with him.
50% final.
Boring lecture, test heavy. NEVER TAKE HIS CLASS AGAIN

Final is 50% of your grade, and the only assignments he gives are quizzes and a short essay. Not a lot of homework but doing well on all the tests are super important. Suggest reading all the material and study his lecture notes (not on Canvas, can only receive by attending lectures).

can be a little disorganized in class, but she is a good lecturer and knows her stuff/ super nice and engaging. 3 tests with MCQ and 2 short answers (final was only MCQ); if you read the textbook (not necessary tho)/ listen in class/ actually use the study strategies she teaches us, you are more than prepared for tests and quizzes. Easy A tbh!

Hausman does talk in tangents when it comes to the class lectures. However, she ensures that everyone can understand the material through relevant case studies that is prominent to the real world and helps you write potential short answer responses for your exams. She gives extra credit throughout the quarter through SONA and learning journals.

Hannah is amazing! She is a great grader, provides tons of extra credit opportunities and is clearly there for your success. She doesn't try to trick you in midterms BUT there are a lot of assignments and her lectures are a bit slow/boring. Overall, I'd take her again, she is knowledgable and here for you!
Explains material very well, easy to follow, very passionate about stats. Talks a lot during lectures but I didn't mind at all, she was very funny. 10/10 would recommend.

AMAZING! I took PSYCH 2 with her and she was an excellent professor. I seriously recommend forming a study group and attending all office hours. She is extremely caring and has a lot of understanding for students. Very much recommend!!

hannah is super nice and clearly cares about her students, most of your grade is based on tests and quizzes, attendance quiz is easy as long as you read the textbook, stats is hard but she is good at explaining during lectures, you just have to read the textbook and ask questions, section is annoying and feels like busy work tho

Professor Hausman is a nice person but her teaching style sets you up to fail. Attendance is mandatory with in class quizzes, 60% of your grade is based on your midterms/final, her “study guides” are nothing like the exams (even her TA's agreed), and no matter how much you study it will not be enough unless you've already taken stats before.

Yes, she does go on short tangents but it was part of what made the lectures more personable and enjoyable. I kept on top of the assigned PDF textbook readings, reviewed weekly quizzes, and the optional test reviews, went to each lecture/section, and did well. There were always extra credit opportunities w/ group projects + test corrections.

Hannah was very nice and made statistics feel less intimidating as I am not the most mathematically talented person. She explained concepts in a clear way and provided a lot of resources. Definitely go to section as that is instrumental to doing the lab reports. I really liked her energy too she was funny.

I had Hannah for psych stats and she was an amazing and caring teacher, although the class isn't easy because of how jam-packed the quarter system is Hannah, is one of the best professors I have had thus far at Uni. Very funny and caring teacher if you ever need help feel free to reach out but if you struggle with math go to Office Hours

Shes a sweet person but her teaching sucks and she always goes on tangents. She literally cannot focus and gets distracted easily. She makes students buy iclicker plans because she doesn't want to grade and her quizzes are difficult.
