Andrea structured the class really well with having reading and a straightforward quiz due an hour before class. The midterm and final were multiple-choice online. She tells great stories about her own clinical experience and held a section answering questions about grad school and PhD programs which were so helpful!

Professor Cook is a fantastic teacher. Very clear, concise, and exceptionally informative lectures with meditation breaks during lecture. Very well paced and specific about assignment instructions with reasonable homework load. She truly developed my passion for health psychology. I look forward to taking more classes with her!

Andrea is an amazing teacher! She is super clear in her lectures even though she is going over a lot of information. There is A LOT of reading in this class, and even though it is super interesting , it is still a lot so get ready to read. There are 2 small quizzes a week which are pretty easy and a midterm and final. Lots of tests, but are easy.

I highly recommend taking her if possible. clear grading criteria and the exams were very fair in the sense that it mostly covered lecture material. The work load isn't bad at all and she really wants her students too succeed. Nothing but good things can be said about her teaching skills. Overall great experience

such an amazing professor with lots of clinical experience. a textbook is required but you can find the pdf online, even then i never used it. she keeps class engaging with a short group discussion every lecture which allows you to pair up and get to know others. she also meditated with us every lecture! amazing professor TAKE HER

She is not a hard grader and she is very very knowledgeable of music theory, but I felt that her style of communication and in-class lecture structuring needs work. However she made all of the very detailed packets for all of our TA lab sections. Also is a very helpful and responsive person. I can tell that she really wants her students to succeed.

Hi Kyung is a great musician, but she's not the greatest instructor. Majority of the class was doing your own, private study and then things would be "clarified" in the classroom. Even then, it's hard to fully understand things until you go to the labs (both of them) for practice. She's passionate which is a plus as a music teacher.

Dispite the *not so bad* accent she is a very nice teacher. She is a very happy person and it rubs off. The class is hard unless you really know your music. Sections are hard too and the TA I had wasn't too helpful. The class has 1 midterm and 2 quizes before and after, there's lab midterms too so watch out.  I'd highly reccomend her

Overall, a good prof.  She's humorous, encourages participation, her english and accent is fine, although it may be hard to understand her explanations once in a while.  Always encourages students to go to her office hours or the TA's office hours if they need help.

HORRIBLE teacher. Don't take her. Her accent is so thick much will be unintelligible. She doesn't speak English well enough to answer questions accurately, she often gets the question completely wrong. She is rude to students. She doesn't teach as much as just gets through the curriculum assigning homework and grading- no method for acquiring skill

A GEM of a course! Dr. Manago's dev-psych + journalism background gives her dense lectures an erudite "snap" that's surprisingly hard to come by at UCSC. Lecture slides sparse; just take notes on her lectures. Weekly reading reflections, midterm, & final based on assigned papers and lectures. GO TO OFFICE HOURS (especially for final essay help)!

Any bad review you see for Manago was likely given by some lazy student who couldn't bother to go to the lectures. If you are looking for an easy A for an upper division psych class this is not for you---if you're doing that, then why are you even in college? This course is extremely engaging and will require you to put in effort (as it should be).

This class would be fine if it was the only class I was taking. She contradicts herself so much in lectures, her study guides are so broad and you will end up studying for sm stuff that's not even on the test, only to have a bunch of questions on some random shit she said once in lecture. This class had me burnt out.

She's an okay lecturer, and that's it. We had a paper that was 25% of our grade that she barely talked about, her tests are meant to trip you up like you are meant to get them wrong, and she defers to her TAs so much. She contradicts herself so much in lecture, so you never know the right answer. She is what makes the class hard, not the material.

If you can take another Prof for Psyc10 then do it. Exam questions are so specific and go over such broad material its difficult to even study for. Not to mention the exams are based on the Lectures which she wont even record for you, plus her lecture slides are so vague theyre unhelpful. If you do all other assignments tho its passable.

Professor Manago was a great professor for Psyc 10. Her lectures are straightforward and the readings assigned were through online textbooks. Her tests asked questions that made you apply concepts and actually showed you understood the topics. She doesn't deserve the bad ratings people have given her, I definitely recommend taking her she's great.

her lectures were personally very confusing to me; she provided lecture slides that barely had any information on them and somehow wanted us to copy down everything she said at the same time as processing everything and keeping up with her pace. her instructions are unclear and i think the only reason why i passed the class is because of my ta

I went to all her lectures and sections and did 100% of the weekly essays, and got above average on the midterm only to be screwed over by her extremely hard final. Her exams are way too hard with no time to check your answers. She's a sweet person but my god she can't make normal exam questions to save her life. Class averages are always so low.

If you take this class be prepared for the most difficult multiple choice exams you have ever taken. Every single question is vague yet oddly specific and some are just flat out trick questions that the entire class got wrong upon reviewing the answers in section. 3 studies and a 20 page article with only 10 slides to organize it is bad.

Sweet person, HORRIBLE professor! Gaslights her students into believing theyre the problem when its really her horrible teaching methods & awful class structure. Assignment instructions were super unclear  even if youre sure you did it right, expect a 60%. Refuses to curve and wont admit her faults. Lectures unnecessarily repeat book material.

If another prof is teaching, take them instead. She repeated exactly what was in the textbook in her prerecorded lectures and zooms which was not helpful for truly understanding the concepts. The research paper was unnecessary considering that it's an intro class so we should've focused more on the concepts than the paper. Unclear prof expectations

Honestly, I really like Prof Manago. Yes, the midterm was difficult, but there was still more than 50 percent of the grade left. I got a 67 on the midterm and still got an A in the class. You must do the reading before attending the Q&A if you are to do well. The async. lectures are also helpful. Put in a bit of extra effort and it's not too bad.

Avoid her as much as you possibly can! I took an intro. class with her and the class average for our midterm was a C-... the entire class complained and she refused to curve. This class is already hard enough as is, but for an intro. class, it's insane! She claimed that we should not care about our G.P.A., just about how much we learn instead...

Do not take her class!! The class got an average of C- on exam 1, and she refused to curve it because it means she "cares about our learning". My grade went down about 17%, and I went from a B+ to a C-. I am about to fail this class, which I definitely need because I'm a psych major. There are only two weeks left of class. HORRIBLE professor.

The class got a C- average for an exam and she refuses to curve despite receiving numerous emails from distraught students. There were people whose grades went down by almost 30%, causing them to fail the class, two weeks before the end of the quarter. According to past reviews, this is characteristic of her. Her slides include no useful info. Bad.

Avoid Manago at all costs cuz you'll end up regretting taking psyc 10 with her. Terrible lectures (like seriously very poor) and her exams are very difficult. She is a tough grader on exams and on assignments meant for the research paper. The structure of this class sets you up to fail, so i suggest to avoid this horrible professor.

Ahhhh oh my gosh, do NOT take a class with Manago unless you are prepared to teach yourself EVERYTHING. Like half of your grade will be from exams and reports that are either horribly written or super hard to understand. Be prepared to BEG for extra credit opportunities haha

The directions and feedback are difficult to understand. The major assignment for the class is a research project but because of COVID the directions were unclear and not well adapted for virtual learning. The textbook is interesting but the research papers are totally separate and unexplained in the online format.

She is a great professor. The quarter I took this class was entirely online so it was different than it normally was, but she adapted and changed the class as she needed to, to make it easy for the students. The class was easy to get an A as long as you did the readings and had a basic understanding of the materials. She is also a sweet person.

You need to pay attention in class, take good notes, and do the readings but you also learn amazing things. She is such a brilliant lady and every lecture I learned info relevant to everyday life and the articles we read were recent research publications. such a great class, would definitely recommend if you are willing to put in the work!

Everyone giving a bad rating is probably a film bro...I LOVE Professor Lusztig. She is amazing. Sure, experimental film is a little hard to grasp but y'all need to open your mind a little more. She was really helpful and created weekly online labs for us to do that were clear, concise and informative. I want everyone to take a class with her.

irene is very sweet. 171c had a LOT of material every week. one of the most work-heavy classes i've had in 4 years of college. you definitely have to be interested in the topic if you're going to take the class. otherwise you'll be miserable. a lot of the class was critiquing each others' work which i found very valuable.

irene is an incredible professor/mentor/filmmaker. If you are unsatisfied with film bro culture at UCSC take this class. She not only brought excellent and wonderfully weird feminist content to screen but she also really wants to hear your ideas and help you develop your stories. You will screen work every week and get honest and clear feedback.

Irene has honestly been the best professor I have taken a course with. I took the class my sophomore year and with her guidance have become fairly successful in the major. She is tough but if you make it through the class you will be a much better filmmaker.

She is very intelligent, there's no doubt about that. She's also really kind and brought us snacks in the early morning class. She does not give helpful feedback on work. She asks unanswerable questions and then sits silently. Also her film choices in class were borderline un-watchable. She lets you debate your grade which is okay.

Irene really knows film, but she likes more experimental/artsy themes. If you are light-hearted or comedic this class will be a tough challenge. She gave mandatory reading quizzes, which is pretty stupid for a film production class, many people didnt pass. She is very critical and not always that positive, brace yourself, but you will learn a lot.

I'm not a film major and she used a lot of experimental examples that I didn't really enjoy and don't think it really got her point across, but she's still a good professor. The assignments are fun and interesting and I really enjoyed doing them.

Irene uses a lot of experimental clips which were a bit hard to follow, but overall I really enjoyed this class.  She obviously knows a lot about what she's teaching and was very helpful in explaining things I didn't understand.  I'd take another class with her.

Irene is unqualified to teach Film 20P. The material out of the reader is straightforward enough that going to class is waste. She makes things unclear with her use of experimental films and then doesnt explain how they are related. Her voice is too quiet making u sleepy and annoyed in class. This class was a waste of time because i learned nothing

Irene is a terrible teacher. The quality of your work doesn't seem to matter in this class, but whether she finds the work creatively interesting to her personal tastes, so everything is completely subjective. Also, her voice and lack of passion during lectures makes it very tempting to drift away to  slumberland during class.

Each class consisted of 1) watching clips from experimental films that made no sense 2) Lusztig asking the class what they thought of the clip 3) silence and unexciting comments from the class. Repeat steps 1-3 for an hour and 45 minutes and that is what the class is like.

Probably the best class in the Film 20 series. Most students come in knowing a lot about film, but she does a decent job of putting everyone on an equal playing field. She's done a few feature films before and knows what she's talking about. A lot of work though, with assignments due almost every week of class. Not an easy A, unless you like film.

Typically I really struggle in math classes, and was really nervous for taking Stats. Professor Juan offers so many opportunities for student success though. He explains the concepts really throughly. I felt that he really cared about student success. There were so many opportunites for extra support in this class, would recommend to math haters.

I hate stats but Juan made it make more sense. There's easy weekly homework, 1 open-note midterm and quizzes. He always wants you to ask questions and look stuff up if unclear. The lectures feel long and boring, but he explains stuff well. 2 automatically excused absences and worst grade on assignment dropped. it will be hard to fail this class.

Honestly yes he was a good professor but he would never explain how he got the answer. He would just start writing down numbers on the board or any number a student would say and continued with his lecture which is quite confusing. But overall its okay just make sure to read for the quizzes since they will bring your grade down.

I felt that Professor Pedroza's class was difficult but fair. His grading criteria are clear in the syllabus. He is a caring professor and looks out for his students. Lectures are very helpful and he always takes time to explain concepts. Quizzes are tough and so was the final but as long as you put in effort, you can pass the class!

It is apparent that Juan cares about his students and is always willing to help. He likes when you ask questions about the material and will provide study guides/handouts to practice examples which are extremely helpful. Quizzes can be confusing and will drop your grade by lot especially since HW is graded so little. The final was honestly hard.

Juan is a very good professor; he has an amazing sense of humor and has an interesting way of teaching. You don't need to have a lot of background knowledge about Stats to do well. Lab work and homework are time consuming and are done in STATA. The quizzes can be hard if you don't understand the material. He likes when you participate in class.

Professor Pedroza is funny and understanding. For Statistics, there are a lot of topics that can be hard to grasp and simplify. I would recommend having a study group, and getting outside tutoring if you have less of a statistics background. Stata was 50$ (but can be used on campus computers and textbooks free online. Quizzes and final online.

If you don't have a background in stats, this class is honestly not that hard. I definitely recommend tutoring bc everything piles up fast. Class time is often boring but sometimes helpful. There isn't that much homework and the quizzes are moderately hard, especially if you don't know the material. Very mid class
He is super nice, you should definitely watch online lectures, however in person ones are not necessary unless you want further clarification and examples.

I love Prof. Pedroza's classes. Does a good job engaging with everyone, and leaves it open if someone has a question. Very accessible outside of class. Hell, I sent him an email and he responded 10 minutes later. The material is pretty tricky on its own, but I did get a lot out of going to sections, and his review sessions in lecture are helpful.

As someone who hates math, this class wasn't horrible. Figuring out STATA was definitely difficult & I struggled, but the internet was helpful. Lecture & section 1/w. Assignments were time consuming, but quizzes were the worst. They completely tanked my grade, so be sure to prepare for those. He drops your lowest hw grade. Final was pretty hard.

Prof. Pedroza is such a good lecturer, but the lectures were pretty dense. He didn't make us buy the textbook & provided lots of resources. Super responsive when I emailed him. He also modified the class format so we only had to attend 1 lecture a week synchronously. Very flexible and easy to talk to. Questions in class were highly encouraged.

Professor Pedroza is amazing! He respected our circumstances during this pandemic. I would totally recommend taking him! Your grade is based on 4 reading responses (drops lowest one), one midterm and final, but due to The Black Lives Matters Movement, he made the final optional for us!! Also avoid using Passive Voice! lol (he'll teach you this)

He is an amazing and passionate professor. He will make you work for a good grade. No midterm, only a final 10-page research paper. He has 4 reading responses due every other week. Readings are all online. He is super helpful and available outside of class. He wants you to succeed and provides amazing feedback on work. AVOID PASSIVE VOICE.

Professor Angelo's lectures were really amazing and very insightful to listen to! They require that you submit lecture notes for every class but they drop the two lowest. I found these notes to be extremely helpful in understanding the material so take good ones that you can refer to later for your discussion posts and final essay.
She's the absolute best, she really cares about students and the subject. Material can be tricky but the assignments themselves are pretty chill.

Even though this is a large class, she managed to still connect with the students by opening the floor to discussions most lectures. Dense readings, but once she goes over them in class you'll really be able to grasp the concepts, so try not to skip class. 4 homework assignment & 3 papers, however, 1 is a revision. Tough but within reason.

Such a good class! I looked forward to lecture every week and found her teaching style really nice. She likes class participation so if you have thoughts share them but she might ask you to elaborate. My TA was Kyle and to be honest he sucked. Instead of helping with any questions I asked he would answer with a question and make you figure it out.

She likes the idea of seminar style lectures, even when there's +100 ppl, so she likes participation. No exams, just 3 papers (the 3rd one is a revision) and a couple assignments. She wants to engage with the students, so talk to her after class or during office hours.
Professor Angelo is a great. Presents lectures in a clear and easy to follow manner. One of my favorite professors.

Professor Angelo expects students to engage in the lectures, so read the material prior to lecture. Don't miss class or section, she does about four pop quizzes through the quarter. Easiest points to get and easy to way see your grade decline. A lot of reading is required but it's spread out throughout the quarter, so dont slack off on it.

H. Angelo encourages students to speak freely about course material. She listens intently and delivers thoughtful feedback.  The readings and assignments are organized. After taking this course I was eager to learn more about the theories H. Angelo taught. Take her class if you want to really learn something.
Two missing class is a fail. And you have to relate to class readings while writing papers and be ready to work on a research paper on an environmental social topic.

Geniunely learned so much while having fun! He's a funny guy, pls laugh at his joke. Class was super engaging and aligned with readings. TA's were awesome too. The final project was a blast, too. Definitely recommend him! Awesome dude!!!

Overall an okay class. Wouldn't recommend as your first college writing course as it's very heavy on writing and reading non-stop. I took it the summer before freshman year and it was a very large jump in the amount of stuff you are asked to do. Also, the mini-lecture are not mini-lectures (compared to other classes I've taken over the summer)

20% Weekly Lecture Notes. He tells you how to take your notes. They aren't notes, it's another paper. 20% Canvas Reading Responses. Weekly paper, not the worst but the readings are rough. 10% Discussion Leader. Just a reading response with more stuff. 20% = Critical Learning Autobiography "Semi-Final" AND 30% = Final Project. Practically 2 finals

Roberto is very caring and understanding. He really loves to teach and you can tell the subject is one of his passions. There's a lot of reading, but there are no tests and you have a lot of freedom within projects. Would recommend for a GE.

I loved Roberto he was so nice and was very understanding of what everyone's situation is especially at the end. I found everything that he talked about to be very helpful and interesting. He's pretty funny in a nerdish way but can also be just generally funny. I would definitely recommend his class; it was my favorite for my last quarter at UCSC.

Wanted to see how people felt about this teacher, she is very well educated, able to provide great feedback for responses. As a senior, she gives you the platform to speak and educate the class. Participation does matter because the students make the class 196s04,

Bettie didn't really teach this course, it was mostly taught by the guest lecturers. She is sort of rude to the class. The class had barely any criteria; just weekly quizzes, participation, and a final essay. Expected easy A. She didn't post a single grade throughout the quarter. I got a B+ & have no idea why. I emailed her but got no response.

Loved socy of sex, the class really opened up my ways of thinking and I took it last quarter of my senior year. socy 1 also great with prof Bettie. Wonderful teacher; honest, open and really takes you to the heart of sociology. AMAZING! In the top 3 teachers at UCSC for me!!
I learned absolutely nothing, but I got an A-, so if you're looking for an easy GE or extra 5 units, this is the way to go.
This teacher does not teach at all! if you love an easy A class take her just a presentation and you're set

Pop Culture studies was ridiculously easy. Everyday reading quizzes in place of midterms - which u switch with a classmate to peer correct for u. A couple 5pg papers on topics broad enough for u to choose something you're really interested in. So it's easy to to write. If she sees you really invested some thought and effort, you'll do well. I got an A in this class and barely made an effort. Highly recommended!
Awesome teacher! Very interested in helping students and keeping us engaged.  Fun and hip.  DO HER READING! which really isn't much anyways

I expected so much more out of this class-by the 2nd part of the quarter, a lot of people just stopped going! I expected her to be much more engaging. The class was not very well-structured. In fact, the best part of it was a 2-credit optional video lab, which she didn't teach!

They censored the word I wrote below... but it was nothing bad. I thought some of her comments regarding race and her own recollection of experiences were unethical and unnecessary. She tried to seem hip and cool by expressing how much she knows about hip-hop. Im a socy major, but I got a bad grade b/c the class was very unclear and not engaging.
Great Class!  I had never taken a Socy or Feminist class before this one and the class turned out to be very thought provoking.  Interesting readings, only one project and two presentations.

I enjoyed her Pop Culture class...  her views on hegemony and resistance are original and refreshing.   she has a feminist bias, but hey its UCSC what do you expect.  plays good videos too...  oh yeah, she is gorgeous.
I loved her class! The topic was very interesting. She was very helpful and is very approachable. The class is fairly easy if you do your work.

This is the worst class I have taken at ucsc.  There is absolutely NO clarity in any of bettie's themes and the objective of the class is exactly the same for EVERY SINGLE CLASS.  Although this class is relatively easy, this class will be a waste of your time, money and units.  Avoid at all costs.

Julie has done some great work in high schools and produced great research from it. That said, she pretty much blew at facilitating lecture. The class probably needed to be smaller for what she was going for, since it wasn't a seminar it didn't work. All the assignments felt like busy work. If you don't mind the mindless busy work you'll get an A
Bettie is like THE carrie bradshaw of the academy. this woman is intelligent, thought-provoking and does it all in good style!

i think she was one of the best teachers i had, it was way interesting and she really brought in perspectives from hip hop culture which i thought was awesome , especially since the minority views/ideas arent always addressed in classes, its why i changed
No Comments

most of what everyone said about her in her intro class is about true.  take her for socy 129 popular culture and ya'll change your minds.  129 one of the best classes i've taken.  btw it's a summer course but she'll be teaching it fall '05
No Comments

It seemed like any time someone asked a question in class, Bettie answered, "I'm not sure." She'll have to check up on it. This was incredibly annoying, especially since 80% of the time she's asking people for their opinions on things rather than teaching us what we need to know. The other 20% of the time, her lectures sucked. PhD? No way.

I really wanted to like this professor, but unfortunately it just didn't meet expectations. The subjects themselves are interesting, but his delivery isn't very engaging. Technology isnt his strong suit, which made the course harder than it needed to be. While it's definitely possible to get an A, the grading felt inconsistent.
Clearly passionate and incredibly thought provoking lectures, although he definitely does talk slow and ended up putting me to sleep on multiple occasions.

Ive noticed this professor doesn't have the best rating but Im really surprised. He is actually great and his lectures are interesting. But what I will say is that his assignments are not explained very well but if you reach out to him or join his office hours he will kindly explain! You can tell he has a passion for what he teaches.

He sucks, honestly. I have never written for any teacher but he has made my life hell. He doesn't know how to use technology and even with the TA helping him, they never answer gmails on time. He never shares slides either; they never explain the assignments properly, and honestly, it is boring. His class topic is interesting but bad teacher.

The workload is heavy but that's to be expected with an upper-division course. His lectures are so interesting and informative! I will say he does speak a bit slow but I actually find it to be a lot more helpful! Grading is 25% attendance 25% precis 25% precis portfolio and 25% final paper. Try not to fall behind!

The professor is super funny and incredibly laid back. It's a very simple class with a clear grading criteria and the TA's grade the majority of the assigned work. Lectures aren't mandatory but the sections are! I do wish the class gave a bit more than just a simple slide show but the teacher is amazing!

I would take any of this man's courses again and again. While he does require a heap of reading...we are literally in college. His delivery is a little old school but his content is fascinating and he really digs in when students show they're interested. I would dare to say his course changed my life for the better. Highly recommend.

My favorite professor at UCSC.  The course material is really nuanced and fascinating.  He's a gentle grader and overall helpful and engaging.  Yes, he speaks in a monotone but once you get past that the classes are great.

This class was super boring and not engaging. However, the grading and the TA's made it a lot more bearable. The grading was done, solely, by the TA's so if you get a good TA it can make getting A's really easy. The entire grade was comprised of these bi-weekly essays that could just be done by looking at the slides made by the prof and TA's.

The professor is very flexible with due dates because we're online. However, he mislabeled his class as synchronous, which was very frustrating as he made it asynchronous and those don't work for me personally. Because he was so flexible with due dates, we also had no idea what grade we had in the class until the end, as papers are just 'complete'.

Surprised at some of the reviews? It seems as though his main focus is that he wants you to receive ideas and focus on thinking about the subject. Yes the class has key texts that are integral for the paper(s) but the good news is if you can grasp those 3 main readings you are doing well. He's funny, a good lecturer, and is flexible.

If you want a lecturer who speaks unbelievably slow with no mic yet somehow speeds through the slides Battle is the guy for you. Majority of my notes were only half complete and that isn't because I write slowly. His slides are basically the textbook. I could have stayed home and read the textbook and learned the same amount.

His lectures are insightful but he doesn't connect with the class. As far as assignments there is no consistent structure. All assignments are created & grades by the TA's which he does not really communicate with. No way to track your grades. I do not recommend soc10 with him but I might try 1 of his UD Anthro courses which's his specialty.
Battle is a great lecturer and clearly knows the criteria. In each lecture, he would show and talk about current news and connected it back to the course, which i loved! overall, he's pretty chill.

My advice: focus on the first 5 assignments bc the class is based on the first few. Don't lag on the final, he gives you 3 weeks to do it for a reason. Trust I lagged and I regret it. Make a friend in the class for when you skip lecture bc he doesn't upload any notes. Do the EC bc it boosts you 1/2 a letter grade & sit close bc he doesn't speak up.

He is extremely knowledgeable on the sociology of drugs and really wants his students to succeed. His assignments are interesting and he gives make up work and xtra credit at the end. He discusses both sides and asks really interesting questions. His lecture style can be boring, but imo it's worth it. He's v understanding of the student struggle

This professors loves to talk, is a pretty hard grader, and doesn't really care about you or your success. He gives lousy feedback, and I feel like the pace of the class goes so fast that I'm not really learning anything.

One of my favorite prof's at UCSC. Incredibly knowledgeable about the subject matter (have taken 3 classes by him). There is a lot of reading, as is common in Soc. classes. That being said, readings are carefully selected and important to understanding and relating to greater sociological topics. Coming to lecture counts. Overall worth the work.

Unsympathetic boring old man who LOVES the sound of his own voice. Does not care about your personal success or opinion at all. Easy grader and classes get out early which is usually a plus, yet for some reason when James does it I get annoyed and feel like I am wasting my money on the salary of this man who could care less about his students.

Prof. London has a very understandable class and never tries to trick you. Even if you don't do the reading, she'll explain stuff. Download the book of libgen, it's too expensive otherwise. The midterms are graded on a curve and although there's a project each week, they're easy to complete. Fine class

Professor London is a solid professor and lecturer. Her lectures were all clear and concise but heavy. The assignments were already laid out at the beginning of the quarter. They're pretty straightforward and easy to complete if you take notes and pay attention. Honestly not that hard, pretty easy class for a major requirement.

Make sure you don't skip your pop quizzes, they can make an impact in your grade. Everything is open notes! Research papers; make sure is something you know or passionate about. If you are trying to learn a new topic you came up with for your research, good luck. That means more work for you

She wants you to go to her office hours so she can flex her research on you. Really mediocre and boring class. The major writing assignment is broken into two parts and is basically your whole grade. I didn't really watch lectures or read the assigned materials. Discussion sections were annoying. TA would waste class time for meditation sessions.

She speeds through slides during lecture so it was hard to copy down notes. Other than that, she is really passionate about her research and explains the concepts well. The final grade consists of two research papers (7 pages each), 3 smaller papers, 5 quizzes, and participation.

London loves the sound of her own voice. If you want to sit in lecture after lecture about her own research and stories that don't relate to the course, she is the professor for you. She is clearly passionate about the subject and wants you to be just as interested. The course load consists of 5 quizzes, 3 short essays, & 2 part research proposal

Professor London was an excellent instructor. Powerpoints were clear and easy to follow as she spoke. She gave information clearly and I felt that I learned a lot from her lectures. Although the textbook was required, I never ended up purchasing it and didn't seem to need it.

Professor London is a very passionate and understanding teacher! Her lecture/teaching style is very interesting and engaging, making the overall class experience great. I really enjoyed learning about her research and learning about all the different forms of education inequality. Overall an amazing course!

Want an A? You really have to work for it! There's one research paper but it's separated into 2 parts. This paper is extremely time consuming and is worth 45% of your grade. The rest consists of 5 online quizzes, section, etc. Take this class especially with London! Her lectures are engaging and interesting to listen to. You won't regret it!
She basically taught the book out loud in class. But she was real straightforward and there is no final only a 10 page paper with a presentation. Straightforward and knowledgeable.

The professor is kind and grades fairly. If you put a reasonable amount of effort into assignments, you will get full points. The assignments were interesting and thought-provoking. My one complaint is that I did not receive any feedback on my work the entire quarter. She did mention a death in her family so maybe she normally gives more feedback.
I have taken classes with Megan and she is awesome, definitely try to speak up in class and meet her to chat, she's super nice and chill!

Professor Megan cares when it comes to her students understanding the material as well as also making sure to stop and clarify confusing academic jargon. Weekly theory interpretation discussion post and responses due that weekend. Strict AI policy and lectures are mandatory but you are given 5 late passes. Encourages people to come to office hours.

Megan's awesome! The class relies HEAVILY on group discussions so showing up and talking is crucial. It helped me come out of my shell a little bit, which was scary and enjoyable at the same time. Be ready to trauma bond with group you will usually do the activities with!

Megan is one of the best professors I've ever had. She is super charismatic, hilarious, intelligent, accommodating, and relatable. I just disliked having mandatory attendance, but the requirement did keep me invested in the course. She made a very boring topic (Classical Social Theory) engaging and interesting. Also her Canvas is so well organized!

Megan is a wonderful professor and it's clear that she is passionate about the topics she is teaching and wants us to be as well. Attendance is taken by an exit ticket at the end of the lecture, which isn't too bad as you can show up late and get the attendance points. Attendance is a lot points so make sure you are doing the exit tickets.

The class itself was okay, but it's really the professor I couldn't stand. Megan's structure for lectures and expectations for assignments could use more work and be more fleshed out. Instead, she assigns a bunch of readings, and lectures feel like walls of information that she'll never tie back to again, and you're expected to memorize instantly.

As an incoming freshman, I was a little hesitant to take this upper-division class at first, but it was worth it! The work was clear and manageable, there was a lot of reading but it was all very interesting. There are also five late passes, which helped in the beginning, but overall the class was interesting. No finals or midterms, only essays.

Professor McNamara is the best professor I have ever had. This class was so fulfilling, and I would always walk out wanting to learn more and more from her. Her teaching style is amazing. No other class has left me wanting as much more as this class did.
She covered a lot of information per lecture, notes are important! Assignments were okay and she is not a tough grader.

She made this class subject easy to understand. She provides slides for the class before beginning the lecture which allows students to keep up with her while she is speaking. If you don't show up for the class you will not pass since she takes attendance through "exit tickets". You will have about 2 assignments per week.

Although I found social theory a bit boring she makes the class fun and engaging. I really enjoyed her lectures and how compassionate she is with her students. You typically have around 2-3 assignments per week and each assignment is broken down into smaller assignments or one out of three will be a paper.

Professor McNamara is honestly a really good professor. Mandatory classes with exit tickets at the end but it isn't that bad. Assignments are all straightforward and pretty easy if you put the time into completing them. She honestly cares about her students and highly encourages office hours! Very chill and funny professor, would take again.

I've taken two courses with Professor McNamara and have thoroughly enjoyed both of them. She is engaging and enlightening in her lectures, and really values our learning over grades. She only really truly asks one thing of you and that is to show up! I absolutely recommend taking any course you can with her- you won't regret it.

If you miss this class it is gonna be relatively hard. That said, Megan is an amazing teacher. She's funny and makes lectures fun, but is also passionate and helps us learn in the process. The structure of the class is great, and some of the activities are really fun. Great course to get started if you're into sociology for a major.

Such an amazing kind teacher! Her lectures are interesting and she is very funny. The midterm and final was just a fun research paper and as long as you show up to the lectures you'll have a good grade. Such a great starter class and good for General Ed classes.

Best professor ever! Her lectures are relevant and digestible, and best of all, available if you do not attend lectures! If you're interested in sociology, SOCY1 will definitely sway you. Best class in my spring quarter. Excellent lectures and content with an amazing individual to teach it.

Professor McNamara is honestly one of the best professors I've had since being at UCSC. She makes lectures engaging through her presentations and her commentary. She is also very progressive in her thinking and genuinely cares for all of her students. The homework is easy. It's  around 3 assignments a week unless it's midterm and finals week.
Very nice, can seem like a lot of work at first but it's all very easy and manageable work

Genuinely cares about you as a student and will work with you if you have any problems in the class. She is extremely lenient with late work and always gives the best feedback! Super caring, would take again!
She's pretty chill and her lectures are interesting ngl sometimes she says things that are kinda weird but it's whatever. She puts the texts online which is chill.

Christie clearly cares for her students and wants us to succeed and grow as people through her class. She is self-aware in a way that makes her very approachable and kind. Homework assignments are very easy and don't require you to do the full readings. Only 2 papers the entire quarter. Take notes in class, show up, and you'll pass.
Christie is really great. Her lectures are really interesting and she cares a lot about the students. I would recommend her in a heartbeat!

Really solid and interesting lectures. The classwork itself is pretty simple as long as you stay on top of it. I recommend going to office hours and getting feedback before essays are due, she gives gives great advice. Pretty easy A and a fun class.

she's genuinely such a sweetheart. made the class very interesting with the material she taught and never gave overwhelming amounts of work. she's also very understanding and was a joy to be taught by,

Dr. McCullen is a very fun and cool professor. She had us working in groups throughout the class, which made it easy to make friends and feel passionate about the subject. Consistent homework before each class and midterm essays are easy.

This class is amazing!! You get to dive into so many aspects of postpartum that not many people knew about. The way the professor takes their time to address this topic but also sharing their own story is amazing and very appreciated. Very understanding that we have life outside school. Always checks in with students to see how they are doing!!

She actually cares about her students, and makes every class so worthwhile. If you can, take this course because she makes it interesting. Papers are not too hard to do and neither is the class work! Overall great teacher and one of my favorite professors!

Loved her. Great energy and cares about what she teaches. She makes class fun by engaging with her students. ALOTOF READING,you canskim through and still do the assignments well. For my class we had no tests, just to major papers but the rubric was clear for both. Seemed scary but she walks you through it and wants to see you do well in her class!

This is for pregnancy/birth. Christie is an amazing professor who's incredibly caring. She really makes classes interesting even though they aren't super lecture heavy. An assignment due before each class, a birth story essay final+ 3 late passes. A few weeks there's a couple extra assignments but it's very doable. I'd highly recommend taking her!

This is my second class with Christie and she's great. She's very loose in terms of class structure so a lot of group discussions and not super heavy on lecturing. A few assignments due every week that are manageable and the discussant role worksheet looks intimidating but it's not (just go the first or second week!). Lots of meaningful convos
She an amazing professor and spends lots of time listening to student's feedback. Sometimes gets behind in lectures and seems to understand that students are human and is a pretty easy grader.

Christie is cool. She's very keen on getting feedback from her students; whether it's by participating in class or providing actual feedback on the class. Lots of reading, and assignments due every week...our prompt for the final was ridiculously hard, but hopefully she will change it for future classes.

Christie is one of the friendliest professors I've ever had. Classes are structured to really engage students with the content and with each other, and consistently hosts space for honest conversation. They're easy-A classes, but curated with a lot of love & knowledge, so don't take advantage of it if you get the privilege to experience it!
Genuinely really enjoyed this class would take it again if I could. Christie is a really great teacher and genuinely cares about her students.

Christie is great, she is really funny and makes class exciting. She actually takes the time to connect with her students and is always open to talk about anything! There were two papers, and two very easy but tedious assignments a week plus exit tickets. I didn't even open the textbook and got an A, so yeah.

This professor is amazing, very energetic, and doesn't always speak the whole entire time. Props to her and the TA's for making changes to the class because they noticed that students were having a hard time with the book and the essay prompt, so they adjusted for us. Just one thing you'll have to read a lot but assignments aren't hard.
Christie McCullen is such a great teacher. She is very passionate about what she teachers and is very understanding.

Prof. McCullen is an amazing professor with a clear passion for what she teaches. I look foward to her classes. The class workload is not heavy whatsoever, just exit tickets and prep notes that don't take more than 20 minutes. (+plus the readings). However, my TA for the course would not respond to any of my emails and is super hard to reach.

Competent, engaging, & responds to emails. Only 1 assessment + a tiny song project. Super easy class; my friends who didn't have this prof for OAKS 1 always seemed to have more work than me. Even as a CS major, this class was still captivating & I learned why I should know at least a little about social justice when I always avoided & disliked it.
Prof. Jones was fantastic. Grade is predominantly based on weekly essays, but he grades fairly if you do the readings. Readings were all interesting, and class discussions felt productive.

Jones is a great Professor, not sure why so many people don't like him. I learned so much. He really focused on making sure student's voices were heard and didn't just want us to analyze readings but put our own experiences and thoughts into it. It's not hard to do well in his class and it's clear that he really cares about us and our education.

Jones is one of my favorite professors! I felt like he fostered a safe classroom community for discussion, was extremely knowledgeable, kind, accommodating, and supportive. I just wish the class had less essays and readings, but I did learn a lot. You can really tell that Jones cares about his students and the topics he teaches.

class is a combination of him lecturing with slides and group discussions. he definitely values the insight of students, and is accommodating about deadlines. dont receive much feedback on essays tho, and the ones due weekly are large portion of grade.

Loved the set up, read and reflect before coming to class to discuss
One group project that was pretty easy 
He is very caring, communicate if someone comes up and he will work with you and or check in
He does call on people to add to the discussion if no one does, but he is pretty fair about call on different people every time
This class is hard to fail and he really cares about his students! Would 100 percent recommend . If you do the readings and participate you will pass the class.
The class was based on 3 essays, once you fail those you can't really work your way up (difficult to get a good grade on the essays even if you try hard)

Class is structured so you read a couple articles at home and then we come to class and discuss them. Appreciated the times when we were able to have engaging conversation. As long as you put in effort into your writing and discuss in class should be an easy A. Loved this professor!

If anyone is reading this page and considering taking Professor Jones's class I swear to god DO NOT. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Not even trying to be dramatic, this is by far one of the worst classes I have ever taken at UCSC and that is saying a lot. It is all due to the teacher and his ridiculous grading scale, lack of communication, and zero feedback.

HORRIBLE AVOID!!!! This class has so many wrong things to say about. A SOC elective should not be this hard? The papers are graded by a TA who grades harshly. No communication with students at all! Had to be involved in discord in order to talk to students. If you want to take this class all I can say is good luck.

Soc178 (Social Problems) : 45% papers, 30% quizzes, project 25%. Professor Jones absolutely needs to DIVERSIFY his grading curriculum. There is no engagement whatsoever. No Zoom classes, no interaction with classmates, the only interaction is with his pre-recorded, drawn out lectures. Plus textbook. Incredibly traditional (outdated) teaching style.

DO NOT TAKE his class. He is unwilling to work with students and refuses to answer questions after class if you don't make an appointment with him. He speeds through his lectures and refuses to share his presentation slides. I was very excited to take this class with him but was disappointed.

He used to be easier, I compared previous classes assignments to the current semester's and he was much more lenient and expected less from previous classes assignments. With the strikes having happened this quarter we had cancelled classes, and he claimed to be totally respectful of people not showing up - many people couldn't. Didn't accommodate.

DONT TAKE. NOT CLEAR with material yet expects a lot. Speeds through lectures yet refuse to upload slides b/c it'sS his research so you miss half your notes & he does not provide a study guide for midterm & final, "you're supposed to know everything". Even through the strike when more than half of his students didn't pass the picket line.

DONT TAKE THIS. He is not clear w/ his material yet he expects a lot from his students, horrible teaching technique. Speeds through slides giving no time to take notes & refuses to upload them b/c it's his research. Did not let us know what to focus on for the midterm & final, just expected to know everything even though we missed half our notes.

Professor Morse, although well meaning, makes the course harder that it needs to be. The final paper (the only assignment) presents a convoluted structure. Her class poses a challenging experience. Lengthy, strict guidelines make this class harder than it has to be.

I would not take Morse again, and I would recommend you take any other professor.

Morse wants all her students to succeed and to make this class as painless as possible. She gives every assignment a 48-hour grace period and she is super receptive to feedback and makes sure to adapt when possible. When students complained about the length of the final paper she made sure to adjust and be as flexible as possible.

Morse is a very caring and amazing Professor. She truly wants to see her student succeed, she gives 48-hour grace period on every assignment and ensures that we understand the material. Lecture is very term heavy as we go over 45+ slides but she makes it engaging and easier to understand by going over questions. The TA's were very helpful as well.

SOCY 3A: Learned about research with Professor Morse, a very term-heavy class that did get boring at times. However, Professor Morse tries to find ways to engage with her students. This class has a 48-hour grace period and accessibility to every lecture online. She helps you a lot if you go to office hours. Would take another class again.
Very sweet and understanding professor. Loved the pre-recorded lectures made the information easier to learn.

Jaimie is such a great professor, even through COVID times and online school. Very flexible (gives out a grace period of 48 hours after each due date), is very accessible outside of class, and makes sure students really grasp the material. If you put in the work, this class will definitely pay off. You are a gem, Professor Morse!

Hawthorne is a bit strict on things like attendance at first glance, notably she didn't post recordings to lectures for makeups. However, she's super kind and considerate, and did a good job facilitating discussions in lecture that were both relevant to the material and our current day. Highly recommend her classes for sure.

I love Stephanie. Her class is structured in a way that encourages informal conversation. She has to use VHL, but the activities aren't fine. Her grading scale is nice. You still have to do the work, but the distribution takes away the pressure and allows you to actually practice spanish. Highly recommend if u want to learn.

I actually took Spanish 2-4 with and Stephanie she's my favorite professor I've had here because she always makes the class engaging and is very understanding of personal circumstances for extensions, she even gives excused mental health days. I'd recommend bilingual speakers take a more challenging professor, but she is great for beginners.

A majority of this class consists of talking with assigned groups in your class, which I found very useful. She facilitated discussions and taught both vocab and grammar concepts. She's very willing to answer all your questions. There wasn't too much homework, and it was easy to complete. Exams were okay, and she's very forgiving. Highly recommend.

Classes are interactive and the topics are interesting. There are weekly online grammar assignments, as well as some speaking ones. Be prepared to do group projects outside of class. Quizzes and exams aren't too hard, and she leads class reviews. As long as you participate and keep up with work you'll be a better speaker by the end of the class!

Stephanie is a great professor! I was super nervous going into Spanish and I felt super intimidated. Stephanie has done nothing but support my learning. She answers all my questions happily and is so accommodating to her student's needs. She completely shifted my perspective on Spanish and made me excited to learn every class.

Prof. Lain is very knowledgeable and nice. She wants her students to succeed and is very approachable outside of class, plus she's quite accommodating. However, over $100 for an online textbook??? Absurd for a broke college student. She wasn't good or bad, but I wouldn't take her class again.

Definitely not that difficult. If youve taken literally any language class in high school that wasnt Spanish, youre already primed for some success in this class.

Only a 12 hour workload every week, and its not even that hard if you just complete those exercises and show up to class.

Having no background in Spanish for this class was honestly pretty difficult. If you are a new person to Spanish, I would recommend studying a lot, maybe up to 3 times per week. I found it harder than organic chemistry to be honest.

Professor Lain is a great professor and keeps the class interesting. There is a lot of group collaborating (for me, in a breakout room) where you act in scenes (ex. doctor,patient, etc.), discuss,and record videos. There is a final group presentation where we recorded each other's videos and watched them + reviewed each one on the day of the final.

Professor Lain is one of the gems of the linguistics department at UCSC! She seems a little stern on the outside but she is super genuine, sweet, and really just wants her students to succeed and she is willing to help you do so. She has been so flexible during the pandemic and is also EXTREMELY good with feedback! Take her!
Teaches a beginner Spanish class in all Spanish, including everything on canvas and instructions for assignments. Not a well organized course.
Lots of little homework but overall a good class with a teacher who actually cares to teach and not just speak Spanish the whole time

If you have any desire to improve your spanish or actually learn anything useful, do not take her for 5m. Spends at least 25-50% of each class speaking in English, does not teach practically anything about medical vocabulary or how to speak to spanish speaking patients, but gives 3 of the 5 quizzes in the class on accent marks

Stephanie is a nice teacher, however her teaching style and testing style makes it hard for people to pass her class. She gave us an essay on the first week of school and told us she just wanted to see where we were at and ended up grading it brutally and it actually counted towards our grade! You have to basically be bilingual to pass her class.

Stephanie was pretty quiet and timid. I personally didn't learn very well from her teaching style (the way she prints out her lectures is weird to me). She's super kind and caring and wants all of her students to succeed. WileyPlus is useless and the mandatory textbook is expensive ($150 or so) and is used to access online assignments.

Stephanie is the best Spanish teacher in UCSC. She really cared about her students and is very sweet. Even after the course with her was finished, she still answered my questions from a different Spanish class I took. Take her!

I was placed into SPHS 4, but I wish there was a SPHS 3. I am familiar with Spanish, but definitely not fluent, so reading two novelas in Spanish was very difficult for me. However, there are a ton of easy homework assignments, so I was able to get an A- even though I was struggling with the main coursework. Prof. Perez is also very understanding.

I took Spanish 5 with Proferros Perez. I loved this class. For most of the class, we work with partners, speaking and solving problems. Perez is always open to answering questions and makes it ok to make mistakes. The group projects were a lot of fun, and this class is an easy A, and you'll learn a lot. I would 100% take this class again.

Profesor Perez was such an amazing professor, and I loved having him for Spanish 1. After a mediocre experience in high school Spanish, he made me truly engaged with learning the language. Attendance is mandatory but that's really how you learn. The final was a little difficult but nothing too crazy. I recommend this professor.

I really liked Mr.Perez he is a really nice guy and he is funny and makes class fun.He is understanding about where each of his students are with Spanish and tries to accommodate the best he can but obviously he can't always do so. I am really not good at Spanish but I was able to do decent and have fun. My class was small but fine. Muchos Gracias.

He's a great professor and I walked out of the class learning a lot of Spanish. Attendance is mandatory and his class relies heavily on partner collaboration and discussion. I would definitely take his classes again.
Very funny and his class was very fun. He talked slow enough for me to understand and had engaging fun activities. Lots of online homework and online tests and quizzes.

Profe Perez has been one of my favorite instructors while at UCSC. He gives good lectures with lots of examples to really explain the concepts he is teaching. As long as you do the readings and pay attention in class it will probably be an easy class. The professor is really nice and understanding. Would want to take more classes with him.
Fantastic professor who gives great feedback and values not only his students learning but also passing and enjoying the class

I've had some Spanish experience before, so this class was relatively easy for me. I think for someone who is very new or not as experienced this class could be hard, but A. Perez is sympathetic and helps you understand the material. There's homework almost every night, but shouldn't take you too long, just pay attention, and show up for class.

Ariel is such a nice teacher. I've had some Spanish experience before UCSC, so this class was no problem for me. Ariel does such a good job at checking in to make sure you are understanding the material. I can imagine, and I saw it happen, that it would be tough for someone who is new to Spanish. That said, he will get you through it.

This was my first Spanish class at UCSC. Profesor Prez was an awesome teacher who cares about the progress and success of his students. Despite some struggles during the quarter that caused me to miss a few weeks of class, he was happy to meet and help me get back on track. As someone with previous experience in Spanish, I had a pretty easy time.

My favorite professor at UCSC so far. Really funny, caring, and obviously interested in what he's teaching. It is a language class, and the material is designed to make sure you're learning, so it's not a super easy A. But show up to class, do the homework and (admittedly heavy) reading, study a bit outside of class, and you'll be fine.

Profe Pérez is an amazing professor and I think it would have been better to have been in person. He is always open to scheduling an office hour at your convenience and allows late work if necessary. He cares about each student succeeding with a bit of challenges here and there. Funny and chill.

Have taken multiple classes from him during remote learning and he is so organized and clear with his expectations. Many teachers are struggling to teach remotely right now but he has everything dialed and it makes for a stress free remote learning experience. He chooses amazing and moving material that you will actually want to read and engage wit

This has been my worst experience in a Spanish class here at UCSC. Had 12+ assignments due MWF @ 12pm. Had to wait 2 weeks to gain access to VHL + made me make up all those 160+ assignments. Assigned a book that's WAY too hard for our level + at least 25+ questions for each chapter. Gave us a TIMED ORAL + WRITTEN FINAL. DONT take online if u can!!

12+ assignments on VHL due every MWF AT 12PM, which was awful and took very long, too reliant on online material. in class activities were useless. Had to read 13 chapters of a book entirely in intermediate Spanish that was way too difficult, assigns 30+ questions for each ch, and then expects you to memorize the content for the TIMED oral final.

Ariel is a great guy and a good professor, but the class is soooo hard, and it's only hard for the sake of being hard, not for educational maturity. He's there for help when you need it, but there's too much reliance on online material. The assignments he creates are very helpful, the the midterms and final are super difficult.

I had this professor for SPHS 5 and 6. Although there is a lot of readings and homework i really enjoyed the class. The professor made sure everyone participated and he gave good feedback on how to fix our homework. He's also funny and has a good attitude. Definitely i would take one of his classes again.
Was unreasonable and forces students to take courses that they aren't prepared for.

This was my first spanish class and Ariel made it super easy. I started to fall behind and I just kept going to office hours and kept getting more advice from him until I was confident in the material. Great guy!!

Don't do it. Why are you taking SPAN 5 in college. Anyone but her. Maybe she's less bad in the First-year classes, but she expects you to be essentially fluent by now. She does a lot of in class activities with small groups. Her class is very tedious and she claims to be very sympathetic, but she's not, she's literally just rude.

Loved this class! Prof Malone is definitely strict but fair. There is a lot of homework and classwork, but she assigns that much because she wants you to succeed and by the end of the course I was definitely a lot more confident in my abilities. Though, she does rely heavily on the textbook, so make sure you get it on time!!!

Professor Malone was a great teacher. She always gave amazing feedback, and would allow you to correct the assignment or project as many times as necessary. While she did assign quite a bit of homework, it was all very manageable and relevant to whatever topic we were covering. Highly recommend taking her course!
Her classes were always well planned and interesting. The best at correcting your work and returning it in a timely fashion. Fully devoted to her passion for teaching.
Take her class!!!!

Prof. Malone is the definition of accommodating. There was a lot of HW throughout the week, but she was always nice about extending the due date. The only thing were the quizzes for readings. I get quizzes must be done to check that we are reading but it got repetitive. Plus the readings were often long and boring, but she's truly the best!

This professor really loves giving h/w. Idk if it's because of the person who is head of the department chooses the h/w or not but way too much h/w. It's like they think you are only taking that class. Its super unnecessary. Take this class if you are sure of it or need it. Also, take with friends to divide the workload, it really helps.

This class was pretty difficult, but it's the best Spanish class I've ever taken. Barahona is a patient, wonderful teacher, and my Spanish has improved so much. Be ready for a lot of online homework though. Attendance is mandatory, and participation is really important considering the small class size. As long as you stay engaged, you'll do well.
I had a total of 4 Spanish courses with Professor Barahona. He was an amazing Professor who ta

He's cool. The class isn't very hard and he wants you to succeed. You have to go to class and do the homework to do well, but its not that big of an ask. He really emphasizes participation. He was very caring and funny! Would recommend!

Prof. Barahona is a very good professor to learn Spanish from, a lot of in class activities are discussions in pairs so you get a lot of experience talking to others in Spanish. Lots of homework but very doable and easy to get a high grade on. Flipped classroom method so make sure to pay attention to homework, he doesn't go over much in class.

I absolutely loved this course! He explains concepts very clearly and is willing to take time to properly review material. He has small quizzes every Friday, but they're online and pretty easy. Be sure to talk in class and do hw on time, and he assigns a lot of small assignments so always give yourself 1-2 hrs to complete. He's a great teacher!
Best instructor in the Spanish department.  Great guy, great teacher, really cares about what he's doing.  Take a class with Byron.

Really cool professor! I thought about dropping the class to Spanish 3 but he encouraged me to stay in the class and I am so glad I did. Prof Barahona made the class really fun and interactive. As long as you keep up with the homework and go to class you'll do great.

Prof is a kind person with a professional/academic demeanor. Heavy grammar emphasis, however, and lectures weren't engaging. I lost confidence having daily conversations. Class all finished with high grades due to homework (unlimited attempts) being most of the grade. Would recommend, but it's not a conversation class, it's a grammar class.

Professor Barahona is an amazing teacher. If you are serious about learning spanish, take his class! Be ready for lots of homework due every other day (even the day after your first class), and having to actively participate. Not a class for those who do not want to speak up- he will call on you! The homework load was rigorous, but doable. 10/10
Super responsive, but a pretty specific grader on tests. This class is pretty easy if you just do all of the homework and portfolio assignments.

Absolutely love this professor! He is a very kind, challenging, knowledgable man. Relatively relaxed until big assignments are due, then you def have to put in the work to get the grade you want. I am such a more fluent and confident spanish speaker after having him for 3 quarters in a row - Span 4,5, amd 6. Also, the topics in his class are great!
Amazing professor, and easy to get a good grade if you really put in the effort. Hes very passionate about his subject, and the movies he chooses were incredibly captivating imo.

So Professor Barahona was good and I feel like my Spanish improved, but he could be a bit intimidating/abrasive in in class discussions, which made it harder to correct mistakes because I was under pressure. There is also a lot of work, but its pretty manageable. The book is expensive, but necessary. His class was time consuming mostly.

Barahona is probably the best professor to take Spanish with at UCSC. He's an easy grader and he takes the time to explain stuff in class. The textbook and homework code is expensive but very necessary to do the homework.
Awesome professor. I've taken two of his classes and hw isn't tough if you keep up. Not a harsh grader.

The textbook is so expensive, but honestly you get you get your money's worth bc we use the online website for the book and the book literally every single class. Lots of homework, but the answers can be found online. Honestly I kind of had to learn some of the grammar on my own time to really understand it. My spanish def improved though.

He assigns A LOT of homework. If you don't do the hw you can't participate in class, so just do it. His class is structured entirely around the book, but the book actually offers meaningful lessons to be a bicultural person. His class is really structured and can get repetitive and boring. Not my favorite Spa prof here, but my Spanish improved.

Barahona is a very good profesor. His lessons are clear cut and easily understood. Expectations are clearly communicated through the syllabus. While he will let you make up tests and quizzes you missed (with good reason), he won't do so without making you feel slightly bad about missing. Overall great teacher, quizzes every friday.

Pretty much what you need in a language teacher. Very clear and helpful, gets along with students well. There WILL be homework every night, but it's never anything too tough, just a lot of it. He really wants to help all the students though and will change how the class works if it means everyone will be able to handle it. Would take again.

Really enjoyed Prof. Barahona's class. Class was enjoyable, though his Spanish immersion wasn't so strict (partially because of the many students who got bad grades in Spanish 2 -- not his fault!). Online homework was easy; not too much of it. I feel like my Spanish improved greatly in this class.

Professor Zyzik is amazing, she definitely cares about all of her students and is very passionate about what she teaches. This course is material heavy, with a podcast episode every week (25 min - 1hr) about social justice issues in Spanish-speaking countries. The course material itself isn't easy, but it isn't hard to get an A if you do the work.

Great professor, very clear and concise in her examples/explanations of the material. Very knowledgeable & enthusiastic about what she teaches. Strongly encourages student participation & questions. Relatively easy class if you attend/pay attention to all of her lectures, she gives you all the information & tools that you need. Highly recommended.
Zyzik is very dedicated! Her first language is Polish, which is cool. The work is  mainly reading but the books are interesting. Put in effort for an A, but an easy B class.

Great Professor. She was extremely caring and helpful and really took an interest in the ability and progression of our language development. I was truly sad on the last day of class because I'm going to miss having such a fantastic professor. Gracias por todo profesora.

Eve Zyzik is great, very witty and engaging! She's accomplished in her field and takes the class seriously, and expects you to take it seriously, too. She teaches well and she makes classes engaging and interesting, though. Speaking and oral comprehension in (interesting) discussions are most common, though you do read some articles and a novel.

A fun Spanish class. She talks very slowly and is super easy to understand. A lot of the class is based off of discussion of reading material. She's not a native Spanish speaker, but she speaks perfectly!
She's really sweet and even though she's not native, she practically speaks like she is. This class is pretty easy, so don't worry to much about the tests. 2 midterms and one final.

Zyzik was an okay teacher, although she could've been more patient with us when we were learning new vocab words and grammar. Then again, I took it for Pass/No Pass so it made little difference to me. Better than most of the Spanish teachers here, though.

very helpful professor. she's very knowledgeable in her department (linguistics and spanish language) and besides being a nice, understanding person, her classes are great for discussion and are very intriguing.

Ms. Zyzik is a great teacher. She does not assign a lot of homework, but her main focus is on vocabulary so studying is a must. I also feel like I should note, however, that she does not sound like a native speaker. If you want to practice your comprehension she makes it just a little too easy lol! :)
What are you people talking about! She is so helpful and her spanish is beyond perfect!

A very kind professor who made sure to answer any and all questions. The material isn't "hard" but it can get confusing. He makes sure to try and help as much as possible. One midterm, one final and a short final presentation. Not a bad class.

Great Professor! Very kind and is willing to help out students. Even though the class material isn't "hard" it can be confusing, but he breaks down explanations to make the information easier to digest. Weekly HW assignments due based on class notes, but they're not too hard or long. I would recommend taking this professor for this course

He was caring and easy to reach with questions. We'd read an article before class, he'd lecture about it, and the class would discuss. I learned a lot and felt engaged. The case study project at the end of the quarter was hard, but midterm and final were mostly multiple choice and easy. As long as you're ok with reading and writing you'll do well.

FOR STAT 7- 
Andrew is super great and does his best to review in discussion before the worksheet. I can confirm his W stats rizz. He's also in The Eras Tour movie so he's lit famous! but seriously he is great and you can tell he cares.

**He was my TA for STAT7
The best TA I've had so far, without a doubt. It makes sense that he's taught before because he really knows his stuff, and is excellent at explaining the concepts. I am completely new to statistics and he made the class work so much easier to comprehend. He's also super approachable!

I had Andrew for STATS 5 and I would take him 100x over if I could! He an amazing professor that truly cared for his students. His love for stats is infectious and it made the class so much more enjoyable. It was a summer class, so attendance was mandatory with no homework and only in-class quizzes; very manageable and comes straight from lectures

Andrew was an amazing statistics professor who made attending class and learning the content entertaining. He stayed humorous and caring while ensuring everyone was equally successful in learning a topic. He answered all of my questions with clear guidance and was easily accessible during office hours, which was also very helpful.

Andrew uses a lot of easily digestible, creative examples and metaphors to teach complex concepts, and it works impressively well. He is a great lecturer and his passion for statistics is infectious. It's obvious he puts a lot of thought and care into his teaching and his class was a lot of fun.

Genuinely the best stats/math prof I've ever had. He really wants students to understand the material and is willing to support them with their learning all the way. Took him over summer and we were only graded on in-class quizzes every day, which I really liked. No trick questions, just making sure we are learning. HE'S GOT W STATS RIZZ TOO!

I am taking her for a course on Bayesian Statistics, and she is extremely hard to follow. There is not much exploration into the topics at all, it is given purely from a mathematical notation perspective, which she explains in a unnecessarily verbose and sometimes repetitive manner that makes it difficult to discern the most important points.

Raquel Prado's class is fair, but very challenging. I would recommend reading concepts behind certain formulas briefly as she tends to run out of time toward the end. knowledge in multivariable calculus and discrete math helps a TON. attend MSI sections for hints at midterms/finals evaluations.
Prado's lectures can be dry but she is willing to answer your questions if you don't understand. Go to MSI and discussion sections if you're struggling with the material and practice the problems.

I didn't pass Prado's STAT 131 class. To be more specific, I failed an entire college class because I was missing 2 formulas from my exam cheat sheet. Our class is graded on 10 quizzes and 2 exams. For each quiz, our TA's go over the quiz material AFTER we take it, giving no room for questions before. My advice: wait for a different prof to teach

Graded on tests and quizzes, the optional HW is not reflective of the questions on either. Seems like half the class is failing and the other half is just doing well based on prior knowledge. Would not recommend.
Lectures don't explain the content and don't show examples, and the textbook she uses is abysmal. Even if you miss one quiz, you will not be able to pass the class.

I rated Raquel's difficulty as a 1 because RMP thinks that harder is better, and I disagree. Raquel is probably the most difficult professor I've had to date. Im a CS student, so I've had much harder classes, but no professor as hard or as bent on failing a class. Lectures make no sense, to the point that our class discord has provided more help.

Don't take this class in the 90 minute lecture format. The lectures are extremely dense and you'll be writing notes nonstop the entire time. It's a ton of formulas and very little examples, and even the examples are very dry. I love statistics but this just isn't how it should be taught in my opinion.

Lectures aren't super important but read the textbook and do ALL the homework problems she gives. That is the best practice for quizzes and exams which are the entirety of your grade. She gives some extra credit on exams which can be helpful. Her tests are fair. I had a much better experience than my friends who took the class with Sanso.

Skipped a lot of classes, barely passed. Optional homework questions are very similar to the tests, and tests are fair. Lectures are dry, usefulness of the uploaded class notes varies wildly.
