Textbook is dense, not good resource for learning. Do the homework, don't skip class, and you'll be fine. Try to avoid if it's an 8am class, or bring coffee.

This class is not an easy class. Prado is a pretty good lecturer, but her lecture could be pretty hard to follow. Grades are only tests, hws are not in your grade. This class can be pretty hard at the end and sometimes she doesn't explain the material very well. Her tests are fair, not hard if you put time into it. Probably best prof for this class

AMS 131 is by no means an easy class but if u have to take it Raquel is the best proffesor you could choose to take it with. She talks a bit quickly during lecture so that she can fit in examples but she is VERY helpful during office hours. Very lenient grader.

This stats class should not be as complicated as she teaches it Examples are not clear, her lecture notes can be confusing. does not give yu a clear explanation of problems. and gives excuses for grade ranges, regrade tests. takes you lots of points for having one single mistake. I would not reccomend.

Not the worst math professor, but certainly not the best. Class structure was strange. Homework not mandatory, helps for quizzes and tests, but there were too many questions on quizzes and tests that were unrelated to the HW, which is super frustrating. Eventually got demoralized about doing the HW since it might not pay off. Got a B, but was hard
Her teaching style is fine, but her exams are pretty difficult. There are 3 quizzes, 1 midterm and 1 final and the homework is not graded. The midterm and the final exam was pretty tricky.

The material wasn't hard, but this class covered so much material in such a short period. 3 quizzes with 1 optional, 1 mid term and a super easy final. Questions are similar to assigned homework. I got 100% in the final. I believe there were many students got 100% in the final as well.  My friend got 56% in the final still passed the class.

She's a decent teacher  who goes over  the concepts from each section and some examples. The quizzes and tests are based on the hw, so try to understand how to do most of those problems. The class can be pretty hard, but the grades are curved by around 10%.

I've never taken Stats before and thought it was fairly easy except when we did probability, which most people did poorly on for the quizzes. She goes through the powerpoint and answers your questions in class really well. HW isn't required but you should definitely do it bc it makes everything a lot easier to understand. Humorous sometimes.

Homework is not required but if you do the homework and study, you should do well on tests and quizzes. Although, probability is a difficult topic that most people do not do well on. Study and you will be fine.

She is relatively confusing in class because of a language barrier. Not necessary to attend lecture if you are good at learning out of the book. Definitely get the book. Tests and quiz's (1 page cheat sheet) aren't too hard if you study. That being said, you should definitely still study.

I took Prof Kei in what I believe was his first quarter teaching and unfortunately you could tell. I don't want to say you shouldn't take him because he has potential. That's why I left my review so neutral. Just wait till he has some more experience before you take his classes unless you're really into stats.
Least understanding professor I have ever had, does not accept late homework even if your house is on fire.

Took this class winter 2023. Lectures were boring and confusing and his explanations did not help me grasp concepts. I understood more material by taking notes on the textbook. This class is supposed to be accessible to people who have not taken stats before but that was not my experience. Homework should have been worth more points.
worst prof ever

Your grade depends on the two midterms and the final. I only got through this class by relying on my TA. Make sure to go to section and office hours and try to understand the homework. For tests, he allows you to bring a paper of notes or formulas, so don't worry about memorizing everything. The class is hard but manageable.

Lectures are very long and the professor takes too long talking about concepts that he doesn't even explain very well. Homework can be very long and it is not worth that much of your total grade. You must utilize every resource that he gives to even get a decent score on the tests. Refrain from this professor if you are new to statistics.

His lectures can feel boring and longwinded, but he does explain concepts decently. However, this is a class where you need to put in that extra effort to really study the textbook, go to discussion, and work on practice problems outside of class. He also doesn't curve the tests, so studying hard for the midterms/finals is important.

He isn't exactly the best at explaining concepts, but if you've taken a stats course before, he'll do just fine. He comes off genuinely involved in his students' success, but sometimes his explanations just don't make sense. If you're able to pay attention in boring lectures, you'll probably be okay.
Dont take this class unless you fall asleep or get bored easily. Prof didn't really explain concepts thoroughly and made material harder than it seems on paper. Wouldn't take again.
Not a lot of homework, but not good at teaching and lectures don't cover or explain much material

This was definitely one of the harder classes I have taken, but luckily Thanos is a great professor. Lectures are sometimes long winded but he cares about his students and is very knowledgeable. This is not an easy A class, I attended office hours and section every week, which paid off. Tests are somewhat difficult but hes transparent about topics
Terrible teacher.

The lectures are pretty boring but they helped clarify some of the concepts in the textbook. If you dont show up, though, you can still pass. I had to teach myself a lot but it wasnt too bad. The class itself was pretty easy and straightforward. Hes very fair; make sure to do the homework and understand it bc thats what the exams are based on.
He is so nice and as long as you listen and do the homework you will pass. He is fair just do your stuff

Definitely a nice guy. Lectures are okay but a little boring. He posts pretty great lecture notes online and you can pass the class by just going over those. Hw is mandatory but graded on participation only, and no solutions are given so I would recommend going over the solutions online which definitely helps learning the content.

His lectures can be boring and his accent can be hard to understand, but he's a nice guy and gets the main info across well, though some of the more in-depth examples he gives tend to be confusing. He posts all class notes online too. The only hw grade is for whether you turn it in or not. The rest is exams, which are the hw problems but modified.

Very generous with grading, slightly confusing. He does not get very excited or shows much interest in the subject, but it is stats so who can blame him. He did an excellent job of making a non-intuitive subject easy to understand for many people. When it comes to exams, dont try to wing it. Very little textbook use, so attend sections and lecture

Teacher was pretty bad.  Got to the point where if I went to class I left knowing less than I came into with.  That being said the material is not too difficult.  Can pretty easily teach yourself with the help of a decent TA.  I also suggest checking out MIT's Probability on Itunes U.

His lectures are horribly long-winded, but the class itself is relatively easy. The exam/quiz problems are almost entirely based on the homework assignments. As long as you occasionally attend class, check the website for the chapter summaries or do the homework (or find the solutions online) you'll easily pass this class.
It is not a hard stats class and his exams & homework are fair. Just go to office hours and you will be fine. He recycles questions on his previous exams so study those too.

Absolutely awful. Not only is a jerk when you approach him for help, but he unnecessarily complicates the lesson on a daily basis. I got help in the class from a math whiz who explained to me that the concepts were actually much SIMPLER than the way in which the professor presented them. You know that's a bad sign. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

My experience having Bruno for STAT 7/L and STAT 5 made learning statistics accessible and a fun challenge. He is very passionate about active learning and participation, so you have to apply yourself. Teaches slowly and intentionally- perfect for introductory classes. Compassionate guy, an old school teacher that cares about you as an individual.
A nice professor who teaches with enthusiasm but tests on what he thinks should be taught in prerequisites.

Wanted to rate this guy and honestly sad to see all the hate. Genuinely nothing wrong with the guy just teaches content slow but he has enthusiasm for what he does. All I did was review the concepts and it was straightforward. I can see why people struggled in the course but I feel that's more of a struggle with the math than the teacher.
He gives really easy tests just do the HW.
I got a good grade and it was easy lol
He is not good, teaching and personality wise. Would never do this class again. Pick any other professor you can.

Although this professor is a bit roundabout in his teaching, his class was really easy to me. The homework overprepares you for basically any exam he could give you, and his exams are really straightforward. The questions were always pretty easy and he's not a bad guy at all either.

I can see why people had issues with this class. But honestly I thought his tests were pretty intuitive even without studying much, and were very fair without many trick questions. The material also did not take too much time to learn so it wasn't a bad experience overall.
He can't teach. That is literally it.

The ratings are harsh given how easy the professor makes the class. He goes really slow and over-explains a lot; the only problem I had was with the notations he used because he explained concepts with advanced notation. Other than that, this course was super easy and the prof is super into what he teaches.

Lectures are not worth going to. I stopped going after the first few lectures and learned from the textbook and I expect to pass with an A. Exams are easy if you make sure to do the homework. Seriously felt that I wasted time during the few classes I went to bc he doesn't explain the little information on his slides. My TA didn't help either.

From the beginning of this course I was lost. He genuinely makes things more confusing than they need to be, dancing around the question and not giving a straight forward answer. Lectures and sections are next to useless if you want to understand the material. I asked for some help and was basically told to go to the DRC. Can not recommend this.

Terrible lectures, just reads off of slides but he will go off on tangents. Textbook is very useful as I don't think the lectures are worth going to. Tests are very easy and very similar to the homework. Just read the textbook and watch supplemental videos and you will be fine.
He doesnt teach, he reads off the lecture slides. He is a bad teacher

If you end up taking Bruno Sanso for STAT131, I would recommend reviewing all calculus and statistical notation and symbols before the first week and keep a cheat sheet of it. It is near impossible to understand what he is saying without knowing all the symbols. Also review calculus problem-solving techniques beforehand as well.

As long as you show up for every lecture and stay caught up to understand the material, you can do well. I read all the listed textbook sections by week in the syllabus, and it was an average textbook. Quizzes were a little annoying but not too hard or impactful. Midterm and final questions were very easy if you knew the material and did all hw.

This class was incredibly frustrating. His attempt to prevent cheating in quizzes was counter intuitive (you can't go back and edit your answer to questions). The textbook is terrible at delivering content (I would recommend Bertsekas and Tsitsikilis' Intro to Probability).

Pretty much everything that has been said in others' reviews is accurate. There are so many things that feel like he is trying to get you to fail this course. The lecture consists of reading from slides. The tests/quizzes are much harder/different than the HW or lecture. The textbook is arcane and examples scarce. So little effort here. Run.

He is definitely not a bad person, but the way he teaches is awful. All he does is read off of slides that are impossible to read if you don't understand the material. All you are graded on are weekly quizzes, midterm and final. 
Long story short, try to avoid him if you can.

Absolutely worst lectures where prof. will read from the slides and do not explain in a way students can understand. Do not waste your time and money taking this prof for any class at UCSC.  

"Everybody Happy" is an insult to students who try hard to understand and fail to do so.

Run away if you can! You will hardly learn anything.

He had okay hands-on lectures, but no-email policy and spoke fast. Two hard HW's due every Friday, only class where I went to TA sections and tutoring consistently. Mandatory lecture and section activities. Midterm had test corrections for half points which saved many, final had a mean of 52%. Only need 65% to pass, hard class for non-math majors.
The homework did not correlate with exams. He mentioned that we should study the homework and throughly work through them. None of that did nothing. I'm so sad really.

Grades are due today. Everyone failed. Class average on exam after curve was 50%. How does that make sense? Hmm. Idk. Easily the worst non-tenured professor on campus. Advocates to talk in person when he is a rush to his research meetings. Please, my internship at Google, my boss would let me email him with his 500k salary. U r not important dude.

announced that he designed the class so you do all of the learning yourself. Thinks that college courses are entirely self study, but don't worry you have to come to class as there's attendance quizzes and section worksheets that are 15% of your grade. Problem difficulty is inflated; lectures recorded but not available to students - everyone failed

Doesn't do emails. Lectures are rambly and often incomplete (warning: telling students to 'self study' topics we don't cover isn't actually teaching.) Tests are curveball atop curveball. Scaffolding for non-math majors? Zero. Grading is 'generous' because if it wasn't, we'd all fail. Sections are also poorly structured. TAs carried. Disappointing.

WARNING: Do not take him. He is the worst professor I have had in my college career. I am not being biased either. Homework is ridiculously hard, exams are even harder! and he does not prepare you at all! He says "understand the homework fully" and youll do fine on the exams. Both lies.

nice with some things but he makes an assignment due every lecture and discussion to make attendance more than mandatory. example of his attitude: to make up for “not giving us homework over thanksgiving”, we have 2 due the monday after and still 2 more due that friday each worth 100 points when every other class is just prepping for finals.

In my view, this faculty member feels wildly out of place on campus. Lectures trail off, access to help vanishes outside class, and the homework is a slog. Student questions seem to trigger passive-aggressive replies. Overall, a frustrating experience that'll be met with a department review.

So terrible. Just stay away if you can, take a different professor or postpone this class until he stops teaching it. He doesn't actually care about his students or their learning. He's basically just roleplaying a professor and doing a terrible job. Good luck to everyone taking this class currently, somethings seriously wrong lol.

this is without a doubt the worst class i've ever taken. and it's not like the class should be this painfully difficult. the content isn't the issue it's just made way more difficult than it needs to be. it takes a serious amount of effort just to figure out what you need to study. save yourself the misery and take the e campus version.

Proudly stated at the start of the quarter that he designed the class so you will spend MOST of your time learning material and concepts on your own. Seems to think theres an absolute link between how much you're struggling and how much you learn, so he makes problems artificially difficult even if it's just repetition and not conceptual.

Less than 3 weeks in, giving us homework with concepts we haven't learned said "hint: you can't solve this with what I've taught in lecture". He rambles in class looking at the floor, missing students with raised hands. His homework problems consistently have typos and don't make sense, and he makes it clear he wants no emails. Young guy, big ego.

Ends class early but assigns homework on topics he skipped, sometimes due right away. It feels unfair and disorganized. You will likely have to teach yourself much of the material and put in extra work outside of class. Hard to understand what he is saying.

This class was so vastly different from Yunan Wang's secondary Stat-131 offering this quarter that the department needs to take action. There is absolutely no reason that the Statistics department cannot standardize this course. Homework was intense and 30% of our grade, and the exams were nothing like the practice problems provided to us.

Fast and abrasive. Has a strict no email policy. Assumed you knew stuff from non-prereq classes. If you fell behind, you may as well drop the class. Midterms were nothing like homework or practice problems. Showed "examples" but was really just proofs. If you are not a math major, you will most likely struggle and he will not be understanding.

Assumes everyone MUST understand what he's got going on. Absolutely no teaching skills and no enjoyment. Nobody learns, records lecture (doesn't share unless DRC). Completely ignores emails (its a rule in the syllabus). It's just super old school and lazy, seriously the most peeving class I've ever taken. Don't do it to yourself, take another class

A particularly difficult class compared to other stat131 classes, grading weighs in from class quizzes, has 2 midterms , 1 final and homework. All graded based on getting the questions corrected. Teaching content is harder to understand from lectures really textbook heavy to learn

The worst professor I've ever had the displeasure of taking a class with at UCSC. Vague grading criteria, changes grades halfway through, and creates a very toxic class culture; he expects you to understand everything at his PhD level just because he vaguely showed an image of something. The only reason he's a prof is bc of his research.

Nice guy, and passionate about stats. I am not a stem major, so I just took this class for my GE. It wasn't horrible, but I was annoyed that towards the end of the quarter, grades would fluctuate. Assignments would get changed to lower scores randomly. Maybe he was fixing grades? But just know halfway through he's gonna become a tougher grader.

A nice person, classes are pretty chill, a good balance of in class materials, homework reading, reflection journals and 3 big projects. Overall grading is very generous, allows freedom on topic of writing too. Just don't expect that you'll learn much. Is willing to help proofread and make finishing touches individually if you go to office hours.

This may possibly be the laziest teacher i've ever had, she does not care to actually review the work you have. instead she just comments the same feedback on everyone assignments. Its clear she uses ai to grade as well terrible teacher would not recommend if you are wanting to actually learn, if you are looking for a class thats easy to pass enjoy

The homework is so easy that you don't even need to actually read the material to finish it. Lecture content and instructions are organized and clear, and she is always willing to help and answer questions constructively. Overall her class is relaxing :)

Lots of silly homework assignments that are unnecessarily long. You could skim the readings and be just fine, her papers are easy and you have lots of time to ask questions and work on them. Lots of assignments are peer reviewed before you actually turn them in so its super easy to do well in the class just actually do the work.

Super nice and respected professor. She gives constructive feedback and grades holistically so if you put in the effort, you'll get a good grade. You also learn from her class, which is nice if you're planning on taking WRIT2 at UCSC. just put in your best effort and you'll earn a good grade

Super caring and sweet, gives amazing feedback. Grades holistically, so if you participate, turn in assignments on time, and take her feedback into account, you will do just fine. Can't miss more than two classes, but class is very helpful for assignments so you won't want to skip anyways. Super helpful outside of class as well. Amazing person.
Chill class, simple lectures. Grades holistically, keep participation up and put effort into your writing and you'll be fine.

Great professor! Puts a lot of trust in her students rather than holding their hands. The work itself is incredibly light, especially for a writing class. Very easy, fun class. Only downside is attendance is mandatory and will drop you by an entire letter grade, so be careful!

Clear and concise class material, a few major papers and several smaller assignments, used contract grading. She was super understanding and kind -- she clearly cares about her students, be sure to talk to her and she will do her best to help you succeed.

Flexible with deadlines, just communicate. Lots of actual practice writing. Writing groups with 3+ people every week. Easy assignments. Grades using a grading contract made by the class. Easy-going lectures/content.

very accommodating and truly cares about all of her students. she made a genuine effort to learn everyone's name and took the time to understand each of their projects. her class was mostly all new topics for me and she explained them very well to us. her office hours were very useful, as well

She really cares about her students and is always there to help, even outside of class. Her class has a fair workload- just four projects throughout the semester, a reading, and a reflection before each class. If you pay attention and go to class, you're pretty much guaranteed an A. The projects are explained really well, so it's not confusing.
Professor Michals is one of the most compassionate teachers I have ever had. She is super easy to talk to and will make sure you are able to complete the assignments.

Overall great class. Lots of reading at first, some of which didn't feel relevant. Grading was contract based and we got to contribute to the contract. It included more work for an A but it wasn't too bad.
It is easy to pass. Just a writing class. You do need to finish 5 writing projects, that's a lot but okay.

Her feedback was thoughtful and clear. The hardest thing about the class is the constant homework assignments but if you spend like a solid hour on each journal entry it should be fine. Her lectures were well structured and you can tell she enjoys what she does.
I would say she's the best. Nice patience and skillful teaching experiences.
Her class is so difficult.

Her class is not super difficult, but lectures are mandatory and extremely boring. The class only had 5 assignments and 2 of them were barely longer then 15 minutes. Overall a pretty easy class, with a pretty solid professor.

Sarah gives fantastic feedback on your assignments and is very caring towards her students. Some people have said she's a hard grader but if you put in the work, apply her feedback, and follow the assignment carefully, you will do fine.
she is so nice. and the Project she gave it to us is the only interesting Project I ever had in my first year
Don't listen to the bad comments on her. She's actually an amazing teacher if you attend class and reach out. Like fr. Just reach out for help and she'll reply so quick. Don't be scared.
would not take this class again
actually i took writ 1. pretty easy A
Easy class, easy A, but canvas is super unorganized, due dates are hard to find, the lady is not good at technology at all. Tried to open one of her assignment once, a recursion showed up instead.

Super nice , if you wanna learn more.

She is the best choice
I loved this professor as this class was an easy A.
The class is pretty easy and straight forward. It's a very good introductory class
Kim is really nice to every student. The classwarks are useful and systematic. I really learned how to write papers after I take two od her class.
Kim is a really cool writing teacher. She gave you good feedbacks which are really helpful. Really enjoy her classes.

she's literally the worst professor. she's no help on the portfolio. she's super unorganized. it's an easy A but be prepared to be frustrated the whole quarter. she assigns things she never gives feed back on. all of her work is busy work. seriously, take this with someone else.
I had Kim for Fall of 2014. It was a fun and interesting class.
lousy personality

Great professor and super cool guy. Really cares and puts your personal growth in writing first. While this class is graded by completion (with a default grade of B), you are still expected to put in significant effort. If you're not looking to learn, there are definitely easier and less workload-heavy professors out there. Otherwise, pick Chris.

Great professor! Lectures are chill, and he's very approachable, gives valuable feedback on your papers, and is available to help outside of class—you just need to ask. Completing all assignments guarantees a B, and two extra assignments get you an A. Effort matters more than writing skill, so this class is great even if you're not a strong writer.

PLEASE TAKE WRITING WITH CHRIS! He is one of my favorite teachers! I took Writing 1 with him in Fall 2024. He challenges you to grow by grading you on completion rather than on how good your writing was so you really got to grow a with the many revisions. He is also just such a kind human being who really cares for his students! Love Chris!

Chris is so passionate about writing and it shows (Columbia grad). I felt so supported in the class, as well as in my personal creative writing endeavors. Take advantage of office hours if you are an aspiring writer, he has a lot to say if asked and you should listen! I also loved his grading policy as others mentioned. Cool guy all around.

GUYS HE WAS SUCH AN AMAZING TEACHER SO NICE SO COOL! If you got a problem with this guy that's probably your fault. But other than that attendance is mandatory very easy class hope to take it again for WRITE 2 !!!!
Genuinely had a crush on this guy. Seemed passionate about writing/literature, and wanted to see students succeed and be more comfortable with writing.

I took Chris's writing 2 class in Spring 2024. He was a very understand and caring professor. Nothing was a letter grade, but he would give really good feedback especially on your papers. Had to do 2 extra assignments to get an A, which was not an issue. Lots of homework spread throughout the quarter, but very manageable if you start early enough.
He is very personable, and is willing to give extensions if notified in advance.

He's passionate about writing but if you have personal problems that conflict your attendance with class, most of the time we won't accommodate. If you do the work and show up everyday you'll get a B automatically, you have to do extra credit to be considered an A. LOTS of reading/writing, journals in class with pen and paper also printing papers.

He is such a great professor. He is kind and caring, and wants to improve your literacy skills in any way you can. He allows you to take risks without worrying about your grade. He allows you to learn and try again in your writing skills. I always looked forward to attending his classes and honestly time flies in his classes.

You will receive an automatic B for completing all assignments, and an A if you do 2 extra assignments. It was easy to succeed as you're graded on completion. He provides thorough feedback and is highly invested in your success. It's easy to pass, but if you want to excel as a writer, show extra effort.

Chris Garrecht-Williams is a wonderful professor. The way he engages with his students is honestly heart warming and in a big school like this, being able to have a teacher who understands the importance of connection makes the whole experience richer. Chris makes hard work worth doing and allows for each student to take a risk with their writing.

This teacher is the best he grades on the work you do not how right or wrong it is. He wants you to try new things for your writing. Even if you fail or make the eassy bad it is ok and you will still get B his grading system very good

Came into writing 2 expecting a boring class that I just needed to pass. I was wrong. Chris is an amazing teacher and really revived my lost love of writing. The class is based on contract grading, so as long as you do all the work you get an automatic B. Phenomenal teacher, highly recommend taking!

I hate writing, but Chris's class is laidback and gives plenty of opportunity to learn and improve your writing. He grades off completion and if you do all the work, you get an automatic B. If you want to get an A, there's a few extra credit assignments you have to do but they're easy. He lets you turn things in late and gives good feedback.

I took Christopher WRIT1E class and I loved it. His lectures were always enjoyable, they were never boring, and the work was always interesting to read. When I would turn in my assignments, I would ways get great feedback that I felt that my writing was improving. So overall, I would recommend taking his class if u want to have fun while learning.
Great professor, makes writing easier and gives good feedback on papers.

He is probably the best professor I've had at UCSC so far. He gives great feedback and really cares about his students. He doesn't grade too harshly either. He is really nice and gives a manageable amount of homework. You'll love him!! I had him for writing 1 in Spring of 2022 but it won't let me select it here for some reason.
Chris really cares about his students, he gives extra credit opportunities. just do the assignments and you will have an A.

Pretty chill professor however gave several people low grades for participation, to the point that it tanked some grades. I thought I was extremely talkative compared to most of the class and got a 9/15 on participation. YAP in this class.

Note this is a 2 credit class & focus was on speakers, not prof. Regardless, super fun and chill. I put it on P/NP to be safe but got an A. Geoff himself is charismatic and kind. Speakers vary in quality but are usually great & give great insight, even ones unrelated to my major (CS). Got more out of the class than expected. Class isnt for non-STEM

Geoff is the chillest teacher ever. Class was mainly just discussions of said assigned readings. The only downside about this class was the essays. Fortunately, there aren't that many and the prompts are not too restrictive, but they are essays nonetheless. Everything else was great.

Awesome professor! Class discussions were pretty engaging and really added value to the readings. 1 quiz every week, but super easy. Had only 3 papers, all with appealing prompts that made me want to write. Attendance is mandatory, but I found myself wanting to go to further understand the material anyways. Overall, would definitely recommend.

Prof Childers is truly just an incredibly nice guy. You can tell from the start that he cares. His in class discussions are engaging, from what I can tell he's the only Stev1 teacher that doesn't check homework a lot which is super sweet. I commend him for putting up with all these kids forced into core first semester!

Geoff is a great teacher! In my opinion, his class is a lot easier than other Stev. classes. He expects you to do your work and doesn't check for annotations. Assigns about an essay each week and an online quiz.

BEST. PROFESSOR. EVER. Participation MATTERS in his course. If you show genuine care for learning, you will receive a good grade in his class. Geoff is open to everyone's opinions and brings great discussion to the classroom. Dedicated, respected, funny, and an overall awesome human. My favorite hippie and philosophy graduate.
Just participate and you'll be fine. Geoff loves people that participate.

easy class hate that we're forced to take it so by default I hated the books he's a tad passive aggressive and questions a lot of what is discussed and makes you feel like you're wrong or dumb. The papers were fun to write and he's gives you feedback without asking so
Geoff's biggest fan!! he is like google had a kid with a really funny hippy!
I love Geoff. Just participate and he'll love you. He's very engaging and he makes the class go by quickly.

Geoff is genuinely one of the best out of the professors I've had at UCSC. He's very approachable, and super friendly if you have questions or need help. Stevenson 2 is definitely a reading-heavy course, but its still a manageable workload. Geoff always has a good vibe coming into class and makes an effort to get to know his students.
He can be a very tough graders sometimes. He's funny without trying to be funny. Pretty chill guy.
He is a tough grader sometimes. But overall a pretty chill person. He's pretty understanding in general.

Just took a service learning course with Geoff. He was supportive and accessible outside of class via email. We had to perform community service and post blogs, do discussions, and write a final paper.

Geoff's vibe is so cool. His questions of the day were the only thing keeping me going this quarter. His lectures were super interesting, class discussions were super inclusive and just fun overall. We did an essay in the form of a dialogue, which was actually really fun. Geoff is just great, definitely take a class with him!
One of my most fun classes ever.
Really good lectures, very easy to take notes on. Be prepared to spend hours some weekends reading. Cool dude and inducts fun conversations with your classmates.
GREAT!!! Inspired me to hopefully teach this class junio/sernior year.

Geoff is the best! If you want a good core class professor, Geoff is the best option. Lectures were very interesting and writing assignments were very reasonable. Also he gives great advice with writing papers.

Interesting and very informative lectures, so you'll be typing a lot. Attendance and participation in section is 30% of the grade, so show up and say something. There were a lot of readings assigned each week but I read barely any and was fine. Overall, he's a great lecturer and the material is interesting, an engaging and not too difficult course.

He is very light hearted and understanding about work as long as you put the work in. There is a fair amount of reading but it is super important to read it because the quizzes and final are easy if you read the texts. The quizzes and final are open note.

Super chill guy, very funny. Quizzes are open note but can focus on some very small details from readings and lectures. Essays are a bit annoying but they are relatively short and there are only two of them. Very nice and caring professor. Don't use your phone in class. 9.2/10

I was one of only a couple taking HIS78 as a freshman, so I found it quite challenging, but it was super fun and engaging. Prof. Kehler is an amazing lecturer if you're into history and staying after to talk with him is lot's of fun. Attend his lectures, read the required readings, and you'll be fine.

He did way too much for a mandatory class (stev2). If you're really passionate and a hardworker maybe you'd like him. But otherwise I really don't recommend, there's way better STEV professors. The bi-weekly quizzes were very hard and unnecessary. His only redeeming quality is that he's funny.
he gives very good feedback on essays, he is very technical when grading and WILL read your essay so I suggest to use the writing center or the stevenson tutors if needed

This is a new class but it really didn't feel like it. Kehler is a great lecturer who makes lectures both informative and entertaining. He does go through slides very fast though. Assignments are light outside of one paper he did where we drew numbers out of a hat and picked a country to write about. My favorite professor at UCSC.

Mr. Kehler is a great teacher and his lectures are very informative, however they are content-heavy heavy so you'll be typing away for the entire class. He also assigns a lot of reading but I didn't do any and was fine. The content is easy to understand but be prepared for rigid grading from the TA, and show up to discussion it counts for 20%!!!
I loved his class and his teaching style. Every time I was stressed about work he would help me figure it out and the work that we did was interesting and made me reflect on my life a lot.

Edward is definitely a character, he is a lovable funny guy. He cares about his students. As far as the Stevenson 1 teachers he gives less homework, but he gave weekly open note quizzes, which could be somewhat difficult. Expect to have to work hard in this class but an A is definitely achievable with good notes and participation.

If you are looking to get an A with Kehler, do not take his class. Dr. Kehler is a tough grader and almost never gives out As. His lectures are intense and he refuses to post lecture slides. The class has an insane amount of reading (7+ textbooks) and in person essay exams. Cross your fingers for an easy TA if you want an A with Dr. Kehler
Edward is very funny and kind, i feel like he is a great professor that wants his students to learn!

A very very kind and sweet professor. He seemed to understand that other things are going on with students. There was not a bad class the whole quarter. He puts effort into trying to make you enjoy the class and be in a good mood. Also the readings he assigns, though a lot, are good readings and worth it in the end. I appreciate him.
Amazing Teacher! Pretty comedic too
great teacher

I really loved having Professor Kehler as my first college professor. He is very engaging and interesting, making class fun! The workload was relatively light compared to some of the other professors teaching this course. You absolutely have to participate if you want to succeed though! Overall, would recommend.

My favorite professor ever (not close). He very clearly teaches content, his lecture style is engaging and helps with some of the drier material, and the readings were always interesting and informative. I took many classes at UCSC simply because he was the one teaching them.

Took him for Stevenson 2 in Winter 2020, right before the pandemic. He has a very dry sense of humor which I loved. He can be a hard grader on essays but gives great, thorough feedback. He was very thought-provoking and I learned a lot from his class. Not necessarily an easy professor but the work was worth it!

Such an amazing professor. It's obvious why people claim he's one of the best in the History department. He funny, easily accessible, and extremely informative. Pretty heavy reading, but the class is so worth it. He's such a great professor.

An unreasonable amount of reading expected each week, asynchronous lectures that are dense and unstructured, and the class is ran by a TA rather than Kehler himself. A lot of papers and the TAs grade pretty harshly despite them giving little time/instructions on the papers. Wouldn't recommend the class, its new and unstructured.

TAKE CAREN IF YOU HAVE THE CHANCE!!! By far the best STEV1 teacher you can take. Each week is a different reading and the class is fully discussion based. No essays except a final paper, no tests. She's so sweet and class was so much fun if everyone actually participates. Genuinely an angel.

Overall a very kind and endearing presence. Pretty discussion heavy, but she was very open to hearing different ideas and didn't shame anyone who disagreed with her. Fun and creative activities related to reading. No tests, quizzes, or papers. Very understanding. She's the best!

Like the other reviews, she is an extremely caring and understanding person. Yes, attendance is pretty mandatory, but if you have good reasoning she won't fault you and understand. Homework is sometimes heavy, but even then that's just the course and she is easy on grading. Def recommend
Awesome professor, cares about students and makes class really interesting. Very few papers but participation in class is very important. Checks annotations.

Amazing amazing professor! She is so passionate about the material and cares for her students! I enjoyed being in her class and our books were interesting enough that I wanted to participate even though I'm shy. I would recommend her for both stev 1 and stev 2 even though I just had her for stev 2! I wish I could take this class again.

She's truly the best of the best. Very respectable and inspirational personality. Your only homework is getting your reading done which can be heavy, and we only wrote one paper for our final and didn't have a midterm. You have to participate in class, she really likes any type of comments, she's too kind.
Amazing professor! Best core teacher, a lot of reading but each class for Core does the same amount, however, she makes it enjoyable! Would love to have her as my teacher again!

Professor Camblin is by far one of the best professors I've ever had. She genuinely cares about her students and makes class very fun and engaging. She's changed my perspective on life for the better and I wish I could take her again. Quite a bit of reading, but that's just part of the curriculum. You won't regret taking her class!

Caren is the best Stev core class professor! There were such fun projects and activities. We even did yoga on the knoll for one of the class activities. It is a lot of reading, but that's just the curriculum and she does a great job making the texts less boring and meaningful. If you have a chance, take stev2 with her junior fellows!
The best stevenson professor by far. Caren makes the class so much fun, and she is so kind and understanding. My favorite class ever, I looked forward to attending.
One of the most interesting classes I have ever taken. Fun discussions and activities.
I love Caren! She's so understanding especially when I got sick with Covid she just told me to rest and tell her when I'm feeling better.
All around best Stevenson Prof for Stev1!
My favorite professor by far. Makes class fun by playing games to go over the reading. Literally the best

absolutely love Caren!! she makes classes very fun with lots of different activities, workload is very manageable.
If you have the chance absolutely take Caren's class!!

I took her class during fall 21 and it was great. She is really caring and understanding, and you'll enjoy her lectures. We wrote 0 essays and I was surprised because all my friends in stev 1 did. If you can take her do it, easiest class.

Caren is a wonderful professor who cares about the success of her students. As long as you did the reading each week and showed up for discussion, very easy to get an A. Aside from reading, homework was very light. My favorite class this quarter.

I don't think there's a single person who could not like Caren. She's the sweetest prof you'll ever meet. This class is so engaging and she manages it very well. There is a lot of reading and writing but it's not harshly graded and the reading completely changed my perspective of the world. I highly recommend her.

Caren is an AMAZING professor! She really takes the time to get each one of her students and is always willing to help. There was homework/reading almost every night and three papers in total. Her lectures are amazing and she's extremely engaging. Take Caren's core class!!!!!
The best professor I've had so far at Santa Cruz

She is def the easiest core class teacher. She's the only one who doesn't check annotations and tbh I do not do the readings and I have 100. But she's sooooooooooo annoying and passive aggressive she drives everyone crazy… she's always calling out students too like every class. Would take again tho bc it was so easy.

Engaging reading, but unexciting classes. Samuels wanted the class to be engaged and tried a variety of seating setups and activities to encourage participation. These efforts failed due to her passive-aggressiveness. She cut off interesting conversations about the readings and created an uninspiring environment. Not the best but not the worst.
Good class, slightly boring at times, but as long as you participate, do the readings, and show up to class you should have no problem getting an A
I think your experience in this class will highly depend on how much everyone participates.

I really enjoyed her class! A lot of reading though. Also a super easy class which was nice, but if you wanted more rigor I wouldn't recommend. You could also get away with not doing the readings as long as you do some research on the books. She's also really nice/caring and has a sense of humor. Just don't miss class!

Loved her, cares about her students and has great energy. No quizzes, lots of reading and annotations but doesn't check annotations like other professors do, some in-class writing at times but it's very laid back and mainly just asks for your thoughts on the reading and its themes. The class discussions were interesting and overall would recommend.

such a sweet professor! the readings were a bit tedious at times but honestly really easy and interesting. the discussions were always super fun. she's really understanding and there was a total of only two papers: midterm and final. definitely recommend!!!

Love Love Love her!! She is super funny and sassy! If you want to get a lot out of this class, you def can but also if you want it to be a back burner class you could probably get away with it too! she invites good conversation and really cares about her students!

The class is primarily discussion-based, and rarely any lecturing. Professor Samuels is very sweet, however like all the other Stevenson core teachers, they never explicitly state the grading scale in the rubric, and it is difficult to get an A instead of an A-. Overall she is a great teacher and I loved her guidance in discussing the texts we read
she is so caring and silly, we learned a lot without having a lot of homework. the only homework we really had was reading and annotating. no midterm.

Jessica really cares about her students! But you NEED to attend and participate. She makes it clear what she wants for papers/essays. She also is super helpful in her office hours or after class if you have any questions. She gives tons of feedback in form of a lengthy canvas audio message. I really recommend her for Stevenson 2!!

Took awhile to warm up to the Professor. Wasted a lot of time with stuff that we probably didn't need. And don't even try to email her, I sent at least 3 emails over the course of the quarter and she never responded to any of them. If you have a question, ask her in person or go to her office hours. All in all, not terrible

Easy class - 2 reading responses (way shorter compared to an essay) and no reading quizzes. 1 final paper. She accepts late work for a little bit less credit. Splits everyone into pods and makes sure that we keep in contact with each other so that everyone knows what's going on. Makes sure to check in on everyone.

I don't think Samuels developed her own lesson plans/assignments. Pace of the class was somehow too slow and too fast, because in class we drag through discussions and have to talk in small groups very often but outside of class things are due super often. Most disorganized class I've ever taken and you never know when/what is due ahead of time.

Professor Samuels is one of the kindest, most understanding professors (and teachers in general) I have ever had. She's extremely helpful and I really don't think I would've been able to do as well in this quarter without her.

She's honestly very kind and understanding of her students. This class was pretty easy she only requires weekly notes and a few essays for your grade. If you stay on top of your work you should be able to pass with no problem. The class was pretty interesting as well.

Very nice woman who is truly interested in what she teaches. I had her for STEV 1 and 2. Her lectures are very engaging if you take this class on zoom you'll go to breakout rooms a lot. Lots of reading but topics and assignments are interesting for the most part. Definitely an easy A

Jessica is incredibly sweet and understanding of her students' struggles. She makes the reading and homework meaningful and knows how to successfully facilitate group discussion. Get this class if you want a pleasant quarter!

Hands down the best teacher I've had. She is so caring and kind to all her students. She makes everyone feel like they are in a safe space and doesn't force people to talk but encourages people to share their opinions in order to generate a good discussion. Lots of reading for class but you only turn in notes and a few essays for your grade.

Professor Samuels is so sweet and such a great professor. Class time was spent discussing the readings rather than lectures so the readings are unavoidable. We read a new book every week and there was lots of busy work but other than that it was a pretty relaxed and fun class.
Take any other Stevenson 1 core professor

Love Zeb, she was truly wise and sweet. As someone who doesn't mind reading, the readings itself we interesting and eye opening. However, we did have bulky readings each week, as well as hour long weekly quizzes:4-5 open answer all based on readings/lectures. Find yourself struggling on the readings or the quizzes? Her lectures help, so take notes.

Great professor! Interesting lectures/discussions that made me really think. Lots of readings and does check annotations. Weekly 1 hour quizzes, but not too hard. 1 group project. She clearly cares and just wants the students to engage with the material.

Zeb is really kind and understanding. Definitely more work than other Stevenson classes but if you participate and make a connection with her, you will do amazing. Discussions can be a little boring at times but even if the class is quiet she will carry.

Lots of people try to avoid her class because she takes it very seriously and has weekly quizzes on our readings, but her passion and kindness make up for it. She always makes sure to have a productive and fun discussion without making anyone feel dumb. I learned a lot in her course and would take her again in a heartbeat.
I really liked this class and Zeb was great - not the easiest Stevenson class but engaging which is more important in my opinion.
She's super sweet just a really harsh grader

Had the best experience. Very engaging, a great lecturer, and the classes are very interesting. She does require a much closer analysis/interaction with the readings compared to other Stevenson Core profs, but that's to be expected for a college class. You can tell she has a genuine passion & care for our learning. Would definitely take again!

- Great prof, she had so much knowledge about what we were studying and was great at making class discussions engaging and interesting
- She is a little harder than most of the other Stevenson profs but she also does not have mid-term exams or final exams so if you are not a good test taker, this is a good class. 
- I would 100% take it again
This professor was so buns, smh I showed up sauced to class everyday cause no way I could go there sober.
Lots of reading. She had very nice and thought provoking class discussions on the philosophies of the texts. One long paper at the end of ~10 pages.

Zeb is passionate. Well at times the  corebook assignments can be tedious, Zeb forces you to really learn from the text. She has an anthropology background, so you get to learn not just about the texts, but the situations surrounding the texts. Good class that you will get a lot out from.

Professor is a really nice person but gives a LOT of work that feels necessary. The reading is a lot and the Quizzes being due on Monday sucks because of the discussions all take place after the quizzes. The core books feel like a lot of work, as sometimes she adds extra work even after the initial prompts have been already published.
Effort is not rewarded at all, annotations & core book assignments take up a lot of time per week and you need to take notes in plenaries.

Zeb might be one of the worst teachers I've had in a long time. She makes you read 100 pages per homework assignment and doesn't discuss any of the reading in class. The quizzes are before class online so you can't even discuss the new week's reading before you take it. Don't take this teacher.

Professor Zeb talks a lot and sometimes runs the tiniest bit over class time but you learn a lot from her and from the discussion we have in class. Both midterm and final are papers. There is a discussion post and quiz every week. Pay attention in class in order to score well on the quizzes as well as watching and reading the things she recommends.

I loved having Zeb for fall core. I found our workload at first to be a lot but it was really easy to get into the rhythm of doing it every week since it doesn't change. She is a fair grader and leaves great notes so you can get better in your writings. Absolutely loved the class community we had.

At first, I didn't like writing all the response papers we had to do every week, but I grew to like them because she gives really good feedback and I feel like my writing really did improve in her class. We usually read a book each week and go through it pretty quickly which makes it pretty hard to digest, but it's something you have to get used to

Zeb is an average teacher. She tends to go on tangents and lectures most of the class, when it's supposed to be a seminar. I almost fell asleep in her class many times. Gives out an insane amount of homework, I would spend about 3 hours every week on the 2 page reading response and get a B almost every time. + quiz and discussion board every week
Zeb was awesome, took time to give me in depth comments on my essay. Classes were open and mainly just discussions that helped clarify the texts. Lots of reading but worth it.

probably the most laid-back professor you could choose for stevenson core. most of the class is graded on annotations, participation in class discussion, and in-class journal entries, but these are not graded harshly at all, just put in a decent amount of effort and you'll be fine. only one essay that is also very easy

Be prepared to take lots and lots of notes but Lau is super chill and could probably be a comedian in another life. He genuinely enjoys his job but participation does depend on how social your peers are.

Super chill and funny guy. Stevenson 1 is a reading heavy class so its unavoidable but David Lau is by far the best prof for this class. Really funny and cares about his students. No quizzes, no tests, checks annotations and in-class writings and you have one paper at the end of the year. 10/10 would take again.

He's honestly a really good teacher but there's just lots of reading to do. You can tell he cares about what he's teaching and lectures would have been a lot better if students would participate. We only had 1 quiz I believe and there were discussion posts due every Friday and Tuesday. Overall, he's great and his class is easy to pass!
Super nice, and very understanding.

Easy-going. I took his class in Fall and overall class was a bit quiet. He really likes participation and is super nice even if it's wrong. The work wasn't bad. I remember each week we would have to write a 250-word discussion post about an article and the final was a reflection. There's also a lot of reading. Definitely take him!

I loved loved having David as a professor. The class has a LOT of reading but I think thats how all the core classes are. It's really not all that bad, because he talks a lot about it which helps u understand. I will say u rly should participate I regret not, our class discussions were dry which wasn't helpful. Seriously, PLZ PARTICIPATE!
Great professor and easy grader but long lecture. Mostly talk about the readings for homework. Usually one to two assignments per week and very manageable.

We read about important events that are happening in the world today and are allowed to express our opinion in our writing. We meet once a week and there was at least one small writing assignment due every week. He mostly grades you on the big essays and just wants effort in the small ones. Although he may go on tangents, I encourage people to join

Really solid professor for core class. Homework and projects were reasonable and manageable, and Professor Lau was super accommodating and understanding. Lectures can drag on sometimes and break out rooms were not as effective but it's expected with the transition to remote instruction. Overall, a really great professor.

This class was so incredibly easy! I cannot express that enough. There wasn't a lot of reading in my opinion and was very manageable. You do two discussion posts a week and then write an essay later in the quarter. Professor Lau was kind and it's easy to see that he cares about his students.

Has a global perspective with deep historical knowledge about writers and poets that are representations of a significant periods of time for a culture. I would recommend attending lectures because he gives so much context and life to otherwise challenging texts. His online presence has been very encouraging/welcoming despite the challenge of COVID

If you're looking for an intelligent, extremely knowledgeable, fair, nice and funny instructor who can make a boring English class very fun and exciting, David Lau is your guy. He's really an amazing teacher.

Lau is an amazing intellectual man. His class is very history oriented, he is a big reader. So his knowledge of the past really put where we are today in the world into perspective. If you have a fascination with history, PLEASE TAKE THIS CLASS. Nonetheless he is also a very lenient on grading (when he actually grades). Do the work and you'll pass.

David is a really clear and helpful writing teacher, the papers are outlined in class and he gives good feedback when grading. Lots of reading, but one of the books was really interesting. Class is easy to pass if you turn in all papers (5) on time. Very knowledgeable in many areas and lectures are a diverse learning experience.

David Lau is very knowledgeable about international affairs and global interactions, to a point where the lectures revolved around those topics instead of feeling like an English/writing class. Half the time, I'm pretty sure peers zoned out because it was difficult to relate unless one is interested in such topics. But he is pretty chill on grading

Professor Lau was a little boring. We talked about globalization all the damn time. Lectures were pretty small and chill. He did get mad one time because some one forgot their book and was texting but other than that he is pretty chill. Easy A, if you read.

David Lau was one of the my favorite English teachers as he was so chill and cared about his students. He is a very smart man and knows his stuff. Would definitely take this class again and recommend it to all students.

David is a living legend. He knows a lot about literature and global issues so he talks for the most part in class. Not too much reading and one person presents the reading for each class. He is not that hard of a grader and gives good feedback. Overall, the class was pretty easy and I would take him again.
the best prof. ever, knows a lot, cares about student, very encouraging

172A: Be prepared to spend more time then you would like on this class. Lecture isn't mandatory and is slow paced, but prof gives out most of the hw answers so its worthwhile to attend. 
172P: Poorly designed class, doesn't give out As unless you get extremely lucky with your group and spend a ridiculous amount of time and effort on assignments.
Lower effort class thats not hard to succeed in, only two assignments over the quarter and much better than him 172AP. If you take both at the same time it's 2 different sides.

As mentioned previously, 8 homework assignments easily over 10-15 pages, midterm & final over 25 at the least. Desa comes off as a nice guy when you talk to him, but concepts are over-analyzed and adherence to his methods is what alone gets you good grades. Rubrics are very ambiguous so makes getting a good score hard, but the min to pass is 65.

I'm so sorry if ur in the major. I want to disclaimer I didn't have to do the project. Desa is genuinely one of the most awful professors i've ever had the displeasure of having. someone else said they're also minoring and found it hard to care... yeah. it's not technically hard, but so ridiculously tedious. everything u submit will be 10+ pgs.

As an academic, he's very knowledgable about his area. He also explains things very well. However, these two don't mean he teaches well. Homeworks are 15 pages per week, midterm/final is 30-50 pages. The midterm average was a 54%. He does allow regrades, but the grading is brutal and cryptic. Personality wise, he's ignorant and rude but can be nice

Honestly, this is a very low maintenance class (2 unit). Subhas brings in amazing guest speakers who have thoughtful advice and insight. You just need to attend the weekly zoom, engage, take notes. There are only 2 papers for the quarter on the guest speakers presentations and lessons learned in the class. Truly an educational class, I recommend.

Does not post lecture recording you are forced to go to every class, class is poorly organized. The concepts are very surface level and is just unnecessarily complicated for no reason. The TAs were the only good part about the class they were helpful

The class is HW and papers based, midterm + final are similar to HWs, and are time-consuming busy work, not a logically hard class. You need to follow the structures shown in his lectures or you'll fail. Often HWs will be 5+ pages long and midterm 25+ pages long, and graded hard, but you can resubmit. I'm a TIM minor and found it hard to care tbh.

Ok actually so annoying. And rude. Always telling students to stfu and literally takes more time out of the quarter saying "dont talk amongst yourself" than if we were to just talk about the crazy things he says during lecture. Literally doesn't gaf about a single student and is so annoying, I REPEAT, so. annoying.

Desa is an ineffective professor who poorly communicates and fails to engage students. His lectures consist of unclear notes, and he dismisses questions by saying students should be "professionals." His hands-off approach leaves students confused and unsupported, struggling to understand the material on their own.

Great professor. He will set you up for success in the class. Don't be intimidated. I have taken multiple classes with him and have truly learned so much quality information. He is very transparent about what he wants to see on HWs and the time it will take. HWs are time consuming, but have quality info that you will need to know for the exam.

I found prof Desa to be ignorant and rude. He seems like he'd be a good grandpa maybe but we weren't allowed to unmute ever in the zooms, he interrupted guest speakers, he was loud and just rude a lot. attendance is mandatory, the papers are long and tedious- I did not like this class. for a 2-credit course this felt like a 5. 
3/10

Subhas is a tough professor, but his class is memorable for TIM majors. He explains the material really well and everything he writes down on his notes is applied to all his assignments. Follow all of his specs and you'll do fine in his class. The project class is the most difficult part but it'll be good on the resume for product management roles

He is a nice guy, but can be intimidating. He knows his stuff and you truly get to learn real-world lessons from him. The homework tends to be very time consuming, but if you attend lecture and take notes, he will give you a lot of guidance/hints. You need to put in the work for sure, but this class provides valuable lessons in my opinion.

took tim 172a as a tim minor. go to lecture and take thorough notes! don't love how he calls out students but as long as you pay attention to lecture you will do well on the hw. can resubmit hw for more points. hw is long and time-consuming (3-4 hours per assignment) so do not wait till the last minute. final and midterm are take-home

Subhas is great. He can be rude and yell at students but don't take it personally when he does this. He can be hilarious at times with his quirks during lecture. The project, you get paired up randomly, and will be the same group for TIM 172A and 172B. He gives many chances for a good grade by allowing resubmissions. Not hard if you try.

Subhas is a decent professor. He can be rude during meetings and office hours, but pretty much he gives a lot of chance to get a decent grade in his classes by allowing resubmissions. Class is a lot of work so get started early with his assignments. Project is the hardest part of the class so hope you got a good team for your product.

If he could stop interrupting his own guest speakers every 5 seconds with quirky remarks or questions we'd be golden. You have to write 2 painful papers for the entirety of the course. Papers have a bunch of unnecessary requirements and the deadlines are extremely awkward. Grading is super unclear as well so brace yourself.

Subhas is a literal definition of a rude professor, specifically on the project class. He will yell or talk over you when you start to explain your process of the work. Time consuming work and nothing is correct for him. Will find any mistake to berate you on the meetings. Not a good experience. TIM majors good luck with this class.
The professor is very rude and condescending. He's dismissive and provides very little useful feedback on the term papers. He's difficult to reach outside of class and isn't very flexible.

Although I'm not a theater major, I thoroughly enjoyed this class and the professor's teaching. Amy is very kind and very insightful. I struggled a bit in the beginning of the quarter and she reached out to me to make sure I was okay and met up with me in order to help me catchup and improve my grade. I would recommend her to anyone really.

Amy is passionate about theater, but lacks structure with her classes. Her lectures are irrelevant and incredibly difficult to derive meaning from, and she does not do a good job at keeping the class engaged or excited. She could do well at teaching a very specific upper division, but for a lower division acting class, she was very misled.

She is honestly the sweetest human being I have ever met, and definitely my favorite professor of all time. She made acting feel like an incredibly safe space, and focused a lot on mindfulness, being present, and voice work. She's incredibly approachable and compassionate. If you get the opportunity to take one of her classes, DO IT!
incredible director and artist. very caring
She's awesome!

this is the easiest ucsc class!! patty is so sweet and u basically just hang around in class talking to peers and doing fun improv. patty  gets u out of ur comfort zone but everyone gets an automatic A. no homework except a very short/easy final reflection and u perform a short poem to ur section but its soooo easy.. satisfied IM get.
I absolutely loved Patty. I took this class for IM GE and it was so fun.

Patty is simply an amazing professor, if you show up and try you get an automatic A. Main attendance is done in section, so if you must miss a class, miss the lecture. As long as you try a little, you're good to go. Patty will also help you outside of class all you need to do is go up to her. Wonderful teacher, WILL take again
Patty is one of the most caring professors; she is flexible with deadlines and encourages creativity. There is very little emphasis on grading.
Such a great person to take an acting class with! She respects everybody and wants everyone to succeed.

This is a really fun class, and Patty is such a sweet person. Respectful of pronouns, and tries to refer to the students by name. Attendance in sections is pretty much mandatory, but you can get by even if you skip a few of the big lectures. You WILL have to perform in front of the entire class, but overall a really good environment.

Patty is a very good professor that keeps you engaged during class. I thoroughly enjoyed THEA20 a lot because it felt like the only class where I could interact and meet other people. The grading is also pretty easy; if you put in the effort and participate you will get an A. Overall one of my favorite classes I've taken here at UCSC.

This class was so fun! As long as you show up and participate you will do great! they will see that you are trying your hardest and putting yourself out there and will give you a good grade as long as you are trying. And you will learn a lot of valuable acting skills that you can use in-person and online. Amazing class and amazing teacher! :)))
You won't regret taking this class. As long as you attend your section and complete the assignments you should get an A. The professor is really welcoming, so expect to engage a lot and have fun!
she is the highest rated professor at UCSC for a reason if you need you IM credit she is the professor to take. she is a goddess

I love Patty! Literally one of the BEST and sweetest professors I've ever had! She enjoys what she teaches & is always radiating with positive energy. This class is an easy A as long as you go to class every day and PARTICIPATE! You don't have to be great at acting, all you have to do is TRY! This class & prof was the only highlight of my time here
Patty is an amazing professor. She teaches you how to be comfortable in your own skin. You won't regret taking this class. Sections are just as fun too.

Best class ever. She is so kind and teaches you how to be more comfortable with your self. She makes you feel important and you will be interested in what she says. Easy A as long as you show up and try.

She requires in class performances that you need to participate in otherwise you won't pass, but if you do show up and participate it's definitely an easy A. Overall Patty was a wonderful professor who took the time to learn everybody's name in a large class. She made everyone feel like they were good enough and she created a safe environment.
Patty is an inspirational teacher. Even non-majors love the life lessons they learn from her acting classes. She still performs, so she's not all theory and can provide incredible feedback!

Show up and you get an A, but be prepared to step outside of your comfort zone. On another note, don't expect that just because you have a lot of acting experience means that she doesn't have anything to teach you. She has a lot of great knowledge that will really help all levels of experience.
Patty is soo sweet & kind. She makes sure every one of her students is involved in her work and is such a kind soul. I love her!
Patty is super caring and makes class a fun and interesting environment. I highly recommend taking a class by her at ucsc.
Wonderful human and professor.
Excellent and kind.
Such a caring professor. I took his intro to ballet and he is very encouraging and gives great feedback. It is an easy A as long as you do all of the work and show up. 10/10 class and professor.
Ted is a wonderful professor and a kind person. His classes are super fun, and he genuinely cares about his students. I couldn't recommend him enough!

Excellent Professor! Ted is very  nice, if you take the time to talk to him outside the class he can be a very interesting person. He knows this stuff very well and give his teaching a major priority. He does his best to make sure students are understanding the subject and give extra credit to give a chance just in case if you miss some points.
Great professor and super nice person. Take his class for sure :)
AWESOME!

Ted is by far the most influential instructor I have had thus far in my education, dance and otherwise. He helped to transform my movement that I have been developing from a young age. If there is one dance class to take at UCSC it's any class with Ted! He is so helpful and always knows when and how much to push you to succeed beyond expectations.

Tim's class was SUPER FUN! He's funny and he always has a good attitude. I looked forward to this class all the time. And he's very patient. He's very clear in what he expects from you but he's also  lenient at times. If you want to take a dance class, take one with him! You won't regret it.

Were it not for Ted's clear articulation and strong ability to engage students... I probably would have dropped out of school a while back.  I am grateful for his wisdom, his passion for learning, his guidance.
No Comments

Best dance instruction on campus! Has a very impressive background. Extremely patient, innovative, and helpful. Very observant and engaging in class. Expects a lot from his students. Explores different facets of dance i.e. feminist theory, anthro, medicine. Never marginalises students. If you like to dance, you shouldn't miss this class!
She's alright, pretty intimidating at times but she has fun with you if you let her

This professor is engaging but you'll never really know if she likes you. More work than you'd expect but also kind of a fun class? I have mixed feelings. Her grading scale is really arbitrary and she gives very vague rubrics and prompts for her writing assignments. She's cool though.
The way she grades makes her class frustrating & exhausting. Gave several students 0s on an assignment for not doing something she forgot to put in the directions. Class has

Intro to directing was not an easy class. The homework could be very time consuming and the final binder nearly killed me. However, Dr. Wear is a very passionate teacher. The class was interactive and fun, but the homework load was just a bit too much for me. I did learn a lot about directing though, so I'm ultimately glad I took the course.

Professor Wear is kind and a wonderful teacher, she is passionate and helpful. Her lectures were fun and I love the exercises we did and the way her class was structured. The only thing that was not best the high workload for the final. There are few assignments during the quarter but the final seemed to be the most time consuming one.

Class was easy enough. The lectures are very boring and Solt speaks slowly. You MUST read all of the readings to do well in the course. The quizzes and exams are easy if you do so. There are about 20 quizzes, 2 exams, 3 writing assignments and 1 video assignment. Don't take this class if you do not want to be on video in front of your section.

Class was relatively easy, and most topics are covered in the lectures so readings weren't super necessary. Solt is a pretty dry lecturer, often went over time, and didn't leave time for any questions (This was even stated in the syllabus). Well-researched on the topic. Syllabus is main reference for all assignments. Avid fan of AI images.
I like her lectures but they were long. She adds a lot of info and the projects are easy if you find topics tou find interesting

Long lectures and would often go over time but it was online so you can just leave. she is passionate and I did enjoy the topics. She goes over pretty much everything in lecture so if you don;t do the reading you are usually good. Easy class and few projects but super managable.

I loved her! I am not a theater major and took the class for GE. her lectures are on powerpoint but she has a lot of commentary that goes along with each section and is truly passionate. fun projects if you apply yourself and pick things your interested in. She is a fun speaker and understanding.

Susan Solt is knowledgeable, but her teaching style is not good. Her lectures feel like they are three hours long instead of an hour and a half. I find the content to be interesting but the way she lectures makes me feel super uninterested. She also goes over the allotted time for class and seems to have little respect for her students.

She seems very knowledgeable, lectures are well researched but she uses AI images for everything (they are ugly and often give false or inaccurate impressions of what she's actually talking about). Little to no interaction with students and the syllabus is needlessly confusing and poorly written. Bad with technology.

While her lectures are well researched, she does not plan them well enough and goes over the allotted class time more often than not. There are two production history assignments, but good luck getting feedback on your first one to improve your second. And lastly, the group project is horribly coordinated and the syllabus is barely helpful.

None of the instructors know how to use technology or zoom. Susan also doesn't have respect for her students time constantly  going over the end of class. She makes it very known she doesn't care about your tech issues even though this is an online course. If i was not required to, I wouldn't be taking this class.

Considering this is an online course, Solt has little to no knowledge of technology. She does not know how to teach nor how to respect her students. Despite recording all her lectures, she refuses to post them since "attendance is mandatory." In addition, she never replies to any emails at all. This class is the worst I've ever taken.

Solt has little respect for her student's time. She expects perfect attendance and has openly admitted to not caring if student's are having technical issues while also going past the end time of the class. She is a dry lecturer and her assignment instructions are vague with the only description being to refer back to the 35 page syllabus.

She's experienced and has a great portfolio. Class doesn't have much material and is based on few assignments and attendance. Overall, it is an easy class. She isn't tech-savvy, which resulted in class ending early almost every day. She's super knowledgeable, but I feel that the class could have been condensed. The class was fun but felt redundant.

Took muppet magic in Fall 2023. Professor was not as tech savvy, but it was not a big issue. Her lectures and background was pretty interesting. We had two projects throughout the quarter and a couple section quizzes and small discussions, but overall everything was easy to understand and fun to get creative in. I would definitely recommend her!
Her lectures dont really offer any help for the class material. Its kinda just her talking about how great she is. She is an incredibly tought grader, but overall the class is kinda fun.
Can't express enough how great of a professor she is. SUPER caring and kind, and her class was super fun to take. 100000% would recommend!
