Probably my favorite professor at UCSC. Pamela is SO fun to be around, and she cares about you a lot. Her classes can be pretty boring, though. 117 was super easy and there were a LOT of group projects. Also a lot of the assignments were completed in class as well. Overall 10/10
very fun class. very kind, knowledgeable, and helpful professor.

I took her costuming design class and it was amazing! I had no drawing experience and was starting brand new. She adjusted to everyones needs wether we were brand new or had been drawing for years. As long as you show effort and try your best you will get a good grade. She is also very sweet and a great person in general. Projects were very fun :)

Greg absolutely cares about his students and teaches lessons about life, not just acting. I am pretty serious about acting and honestly, this class did not help my acting that much, but it did force me to get out of my head. I definitely recommend his class for people who want to get out of their shells, but aren't super serious about theater.

This was such a fun class to take and he actually made the activities during class time really fun and engaging. As long as you put in a little effort you'll have a good time and don't be afraid to talk to him about literally anything because he's such a fun person to be around.

He was a really funny guy with some unconventional teaching methods. This probably isn't the class to take if you are dead serious about acting. As a GE credit, this class was pretty fun. I do think the essays that go with the two projects in the class are a bit long and you kind of have to draw them out. Pretty cool class tho.

Took this class for IM GE. I attended the first two lectures and stopped going because it wasn't required. Participation is mandatory for sections. We submitted 4 assignments total: midterm and final - scene and process paper. TAs take off points without leaving any feedback. You can absolutely do the projects without going to lecture
Greg was one of the best professors Ive had. You can tell how much he cares about his students and teaching overall. Just be sure to attend class and you should be good.

Greg wants everyone to become better human beings. He teaches you to be kind and forgive yourself. This has been the most transformative class I've ever taken. TAKE THIS CLASS! However, it depends on who else takes this course. I was lucky enough to enroll with others who took the course seriously. Everyone was in tears by the end of class<3

There is a lot of group activities that go with acting. Really fun! There were two papers due and two acting scenes that were graded as well as attendance. If you want a fun relaxing class, this might be it.
Really enjoy class with Greg.  He's really there for his students and listens.  I've learned so much from him.
This was one of the most fun classes I have taken, it was an easy A and Greg is a really cool teacher. You do games in class, section and attendance are mandatory, but once again, it's fun and easy.
Greg was nice but frustrating at times. He likes to hear himself talk. The class is very fun usually, but when he goes on rants be prepared to stand for a very long time and entertain yourself.

Greg is an oddball. This class was fun and definitely a weird class to take if you aren't a theater major. Lots of games and exercises throughout the entire class period. As a non-theater major the course made me more outgoing in sections and ultimately more confident about speaking in large groups. A fun class, I'd recommend it!

HE taught Intro to ACTING. We played a lot of games in his class, which were very fun! But although they seem applicable to acting when he explains them, I'm not sure how well they are. He talks A LOT too. But he's a kool guy, very friendly.

Intro to acting was not an introduction. If you want to play games, go here. His style was way too unconventional for me. But if you want to gain more confidence in yourself, take this class. You'll be screaming and running in every class.

I wanted to expand my skill in acting, not theater acting. So no,I didn't enjoy 90% of the games because we didn't learn how to reACT w/people. We learned more how to be comfortable w/each other by making faces&noises.We did weird 'suzuki' games on the filthy ground. Wish we could've practiced monologues in class more. Easy but waste of time.

Easiest class you will take but prepare to have your time wasted. Greg is the most annoying person to listen to and all the exercises he does are ridiculous. The TA's basically taught the class and whenever he decided to speak the whole class would groan. I thought my high school director was the worst but she was topped. enjoy.

Fun excercises in class but he repeats himself ALL THE TIME. He rambles on about the same stuff waisting class time. I would recommend the class but with a different professor. Section made the class much more managable.

I disagree w/ the person below me.  The class wasn't useless at all!  It helped me a lot w/ my acting!  At first, it did seem that what he said was boring & useless, but you REALLY had to listen to him to understand how it all applied to acting.  I became more aware of what I was doing & feeling as an actor because of him.  A great acting prof!
A good actor and nice person--just a bad teacher! What a waste of my time! It was a useless, boring class with mandatory attendance. It honestly felt like being back in grade school. Boo.

Greg, is definitely an interesting person. It seems like he rambles on about stuff, yet he's just trying to get the point across of what he's trying to say, and the stuff he is saying usually does help in your performance. He doesnt really get to know the students, his TA's handle getting to know you.

He's cool, though he uses profanity until it just doesn't mean anything any more. After awhile you begin to think that everything he says is bull, but he believes in it so much that you can't help but humor him. Very repetitive. Extremely easy class.

If she does not like you she will be passive aggressive. She's basically the mean PE teacher who expects you to do all the work that she can't even do. Outdated feminist who targets men and will recommend sending you home vs. contributing to the university.

Prof Ochoa has tried very hard to be flexible during COVID, but sometimes that leaves guidelines fuzzy and a lot of class time was spent answering questions about the class rather than content. The amount of reading assigned is impossible to do and absorb within the time frame, but because there wasn't a late penalty this quarter I could catch up.

Prof. Ochoa is incredibly inspiring I loved the way she starts each class with song (theres even a playlist for the course). The material is interesting and its easy to stay engaged, however there is copious amounts of reading. I found that the reading load is a bit too much considering we all have other commitments, which is my only complaint.

Most readings can be found online. Just talk to your TAs about where to find them. But the dense readings are way too much while juggling other classes. Gives a few chances for extra credit. Skipping class docks points off your final. Just understand the main concepts that are associated with which readings and you'll be fine. Free tutoring helped.

Do not buy any of the reading material unless absolutely necessary, because most if not all of the material can be found online and then printed out for cheaper. Ochoa is simple professor that has major concepts that are repeated throughout the quarter. Know them, find a good example of it, and reference them often.
Lots of reading but all very interesting
Great lecturer, but sooo much reading. The books are somewhat interesting but there's so much it's almost impossible to get it all done.

Lots of reading, indeed way to much. For an introductory class, Ochoa is expecting a little too much. I took this class as a GE thinking it would be interesting and maybe really eye-opening, but I did not really enjoy it as much as I would. The only thing that was good was when they showed us films. Those were actually interesting.

They do not know how to teach well, allowing them to blabber on during lecture. Doesn't know how to interpret what the concept of feminism is. They confuse their students, and assigns readings that are meant to be for graduate students. The lectures are everlasting without any clarification of what is supposed to be taught. Shouldn't be a professor
Not a very clear lecturer, kind of sporadic. However, if you do the readings and write exactly what she is looking for, the course is an easy A.

I heard great things about Ochoa but was really disappointed. Discussion and lecture consisted of a group of upset and obnoxiously PC individuals reading WAY too deeply into ads and other media. It culminated in a final project where people wrote bad poetry and were told they were profound and brave. Extremely frustrating and boring.

Nice person, poor professor. Ochoa was often late to class and put a lot of work on the poor TA. Coursework is easy and lecture isn't mandatory. Uninspiring class overall, and she's still late to posting our grades. -_-

Prof Ochoa will go out of your way to help you, but can seem a bit rushed. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOKS. You can rent the readings/find them online in pdfs. But she will open your eyes to new ways of thinking, and is respectful to all students, with no bias. Her speaking skills are excellent and she makes a 1.5 hour class as un-dull as it can be.

Interesting subject but coursework is demanding and often confusing. Lectures not mandatory but ATTEND SECTIONS. Extensive sometimes repetitive reading. Upper div class masking as a lower div. Confusing lecturer. T.A.s THE GRADE PAPERS. Feedback on papers very detailed but a bit too critical. VERY DIFFICULT to get an A in this class.

I thought the reading was interesting. I liked being able to do my own research paper at the end of the quarter. Many students didn't do reading, which was obvious when no one would speak/give an opinion/ask a question. Marcia was very clear and has such knowledge. Try to visit office hours, as she is very busy, just like all professors at a UC.

Not helpful at all. Never replies to emails and is always too busy doing other stuff. I do not recommend taking this class with this professor. we only read about three chapters in each book we purchased.

We had to buy a ton of textbooks and we hardly use them. Her assignments were very confusing and unorganized. Thankfully the TA's here helpful. She was not the worst professor ever but not the greatest either.

It is the worst class in the world! She is not helpful at all and she gives very hard writing assignments when its a lower division class. Horrible class, she honestly made an interesting subject completely boring and made me hate it! Dont take her class!

So many writing assignments with very confusing prompts, and all but one were never returned. The feedback was snide. No need to read because lectures were her bumbling through the readings or forcing us to do awkward and unhelpful group work. Attendance sheet was passed around during break time so it was easy to miss. Worst class I've ever taken.
great prof...i would take her again
She's terrible.
Super kind and put a lot of work into each student.
Prof Weems spent a lot of time with me encouraging me to complete my paper and project. Very kind.
Amazing and knowledgeable professor. I learned a ton about contemporary performance.
Encouraging.
Waste of time. Wish I had taken a class with a professor who wants to teach and Who doesn't even read the papers she assigns.
Didn't learn anything from this professor.
Unworldly and does not teach. She phones it in most days.
Avoid
Prof. Weems is caring and makes sure that all of us are engaged in the material. I have learned a ton about contemporary theater!

This was one of the worst academic experiences Ive ever had. Shes passive aggressive and condescending to students. The class was listed as a lecture class but then we ended up just doing group presentations every single week or having guest speakers. Prof Weems didnt even teach. This class isnt worth it.

Please do not take this teacher, he may do class online but he is a really harsh grader and I'm scared I'm going to fail this class. He'll make you do assignments over and over again till you get it right. For the assignments he make you try to meet all of his criteria, and if you do not meet one, he'll give you a zero. PROMISE

His class was structured in a way where you cannot move forward until you reach a grade threshold on an assignment, so get ready to redo almost all your assignments! Overall, if you do extra credit, attend his office hours, and manage your time you will succeed. It's scary but he is right there with you to support your learning.

Can you pass this class? Yes. Is it easy to? No. The first half of the quarter is filled with heavy reading and homework, and 9/10 times the canvas assignment is worded in a highly confusing way that hardly conveys what he is looking for. You will likely have to do revisions on almost all of your assignments. Again, this is possible, but HEAVY.

My point is similar to other recent comments, the feedback is obscure, the requirements are not clear or not listed all at once. This course has a 10-minute video essay project at the end of the semester, If you are like me and have no experience in video editing, I would not recommend taking this writing 1.

This class might be the worst class I have ever taken. With 2-3 weekly assignments and a 350-word minimum per assignment, I was doing more work than all of my other friends in writing 1 and even writing 2. He makes you redo every assignment for full credit and his instructions could not be less clear. DO NOT TAKE HIM

Be prepared to resubmit assignments two to three times each. The overall workload isn't the heaviest, but with all the resubmissions it will feel like a lot of work. This class sucks, but you can and will get a good grade if you do all the work, and resubmissions, and go to office hours. Goodluck decoding feedback, you will need it.

class was uninteresting and tedious. His online instructions are super confusing and very vague, he'll take points off for things that he didn't mention/specify in the instructions. Although he allows you to resubmit stuff (take full advantage btw if you end up taking his class), his advice is repetitive and unhelpful. He tends to copy and paste.

Writing 2 with Dr. Navarro was a challenging but inspiring class. The course work was difficult but he framed it in the way that we were able to choose our own research topics. He made it clear in the beginning of the quarter that this class comes with challenge and to be prepared to take initiative early on or you fall behind and is very true.

To be honest, the only way you fail this class is if you never do the work or revisions. We were allowed to do revisions on assignments until we earned the full points. This class is very assignment heavy the first couple of weeks but it has no midterm or final. If your other classes assign a lot of work I would not recommend adding this one.

Dr. Navarro is a tough grader, however he lets you resubmit to earn full credit, as well as gives feedback which if you implement, gives full credit. That being said, I don't think I would have gotten my grade without office hours and asking clarification on certain prompts and feedback. Use what he gives you, and you'll learn some good skills!

Very harsh grading, but you are able to do revisions as many times as you want for full credit, take advantage of that! There is also alot of extra credit, so your grade is directly proportional to how many hours you put in and whether or not you can follow the instructions in the feedback. Office Hours+Revise assignments+Extra Credit = Guranteed A

All of the grading was incredibly fair. There were many assignments where you submit once, receive feedback, and submit again for full credit once you have revised. No busy work. Everything you do in this class is meant to improve skills. Office hours were very useful for clarifying directions for assignments. Just submit work on time.

Navarro is a very passionate professor which is very notable through the way he teaches and talks as he's always giving feedback and incredibly fast with replies compared to other professors. that being said the class isn't easy and requires lots of work compared to other classes. I took the class last quarter but looking back I'd take it again

Has a passion for teaching, and his assignments follow exactly how he wants them listed in the rubric, you can look at feedback he gives and redo most of them for credit till the end of the quarter. Lots of work but can be split evenly throughout week without problem. Offers extra credit as well that is easy.

Professor Navarro is very caring checking in with his students. If one were to take his class just to keep up with the material he would deduct late points. He is not a tough grader ironic coming from me who has a C but I just caught him. It's easy to bounce back because he works with his students. He's still grading my extra credit so who knows?

It definitely takes a lot of time and hard work outside of class but it is possible to succeed, you just have to work really hard. Lots of busy work in the first 5 weeks but it is doable. As long as you follow the rubric to a tee and resubmit all of your assignments until you get full credit, you will get an A in the class. Lots of EC opportunities

Run! Joseph Navarro is a super tough teacher. All of his recent reviews are very accurate, he gives a ton of homework with vague instructions and a super strict grading scale. It is almost impossible to tell what he wants out of assignments. If you have a heavy course load this quarter he adds so much unnecessary stress just don't take him.

The professor has good intentions but cannot execute them. The instructions for every assignment are extremely vague to the point where if you don't do it to his cup of tea, you will get points off. Writing is already subjective, so prepare to be extra confused trying to figure out this class.

Run! Joseph is just not a good professor for Writing 2, his workload and grading is insane. We can resubmit an assignment multiple times, which seems like a great opportunity for redemption at first. But the grading is so incredibly harsh, to the point where repeated re-submissions are the fundamental requirements of this class. It's crushing.

His feedback is extremely robotic, almost sounds like he is AI generating every response and with the same exact sentence every time.

If I am being honest, I am not sure how he became a professor with such a unprofessional attitude and an unwillingness to understand students/

Professor Perera was the best professor I had for my first quarter at UCSC!! He's very kind and helpful, and explains assignment and course goals clearly. His feedback really helped me improve my writing, and he makes all the classes super fun (even the group projects). Overall, loved all his classes and I'd def take him as my writing prof again!!

loved this class! took it as a 10 week async summer class along w math 23b. not hard at all! such a nice prof and grades very easy as long as you do the assignments and put at least some effort. 5 big projects, only one being a traditional essay. final 2 projects were group projects. make sure you meet w your group and it'll be breeze.

good teacher,However, I really struggled to find the value in a lot of the little assignments he gave! a lot of what he gave out felt like busy work, and that style of teaching feels really lazy to me! its really hard to get 100 on essays, I never got anything below an 80 but never anything higher than a 90. lots of group collaboration for a grade.

Enjoyed Nirshan a lot! There is a lot of assignments and papers however he is really forgiving with grading and understanding. Felt that his lectures sometimes didn't apply to the assignments and the group work was sometimes not the best organization wise however I recommend Nirshan for any Writing course because he is really great overall

Professor Perrera gives really great feedback on all of the assignments. With this being a hybrid course, everything was very organized, clear, and easy to find. Class has a lot of online discussions and for in person class he also likes people discussing. There is a lot of work sometimes, but it is manageable.
He's a pretty chill guy. Since his class was asynchronous, I only contacted him a few times. Just do the assignments on time, and you should be chilling.

Nirshan has got to be one of the most friendly professors I've ever had. He always put so much effort into teaching his class and you can tell he really cares. He was always easily accessible through email and gave very detailed feedback on all of my assignments. Would take again!

This professor was amazing. He is so caring for his students and it is so obvious how passionate he is about his work. I was super nervous to take Writing 2 because of the workload but it was not heavy at all. I probably spent about 2-5 hours a week on homework and sometimes less. He is a super good teacher and I really enjoyed his class.

Professor Perera is the nicest professor I know. He's super understanding and wants his students to succeed. There is a lot of reading and writing every week though, but this was more of a hidden class for the writing assistant job. I would recommend him. He's very accessible through email.

Professor Perera is one of the few professors in the Writing Program at UCSC. His first quarter teaching the Theory of Tutoring Writing was essential for new writing assistants where we can help clients enhance their writing skills. The reading responses and the discussions we had in class were relevant to the course objectives.

He was one of the best English teachers/professor I ever had. The assignments are fun. Although theres a lot of work its work that helps you do good on assignments. The professor is very calm and doesn't grade too hard. Attendance is graded but its worth going to because its a fun class. Turn in assignments on time because late policy is strict.

Very kind and easy-going. Never forces students to participate and extremely understanding. One of the best professors ever, and really emphasized on collaboration and interactions. Accessible after class and willing to help even outside the course if you need advice. Empathetic, soft-spoken and never forceful. Just do assignments on time.

I took Writing 2 over the summer with him. A lot of work but if you are willing to put it in there is no way you won't do well in the class. The 5 projects are interesting and the professor is always available outside of office hours if you just email him your problems. Probably the best writing 2 class to take.

Was a pretty simple writing class however it was relatively time consuming although it was not super intensive work. Projects are interesting and creative although sometimes a little gimmicky, such as the emoji proposal project. Heavily emphasizes peer feedback and has a lot of assignments. Some assignments can feel like busy work at times.

I took Nirshan a while back in the summer for writing 2. All his assignments were incredibly useful and fun for all my classes up until now. We did so many fun yet useful projects. He was really kind and his instructions were always clear. He is one of the best writing 2 professors ever!!!

Perera is great! Participation matters, but he's very supportive and understanding and listens to everyone's voice equally and thoroughly. My only complaint is I didn't get much feedback on my writing (out of like 15 ish writing assignments I only got feedback on 2) which was odd for a class focused on improving your writing/analysis but oh well.

While I hate core classes in general, if I were to pick, I would pick his class because he's just a chill guy and it is very clear what he expects. He is also very accommodating and reasonable. Also tries to facilitate discussions as well. For core class, you can't go wrong with him. I've heard worse from other professors.

nirshan is a local legend. this was the first class I took at ucsc and it was by far my favorite. nirshan is the best professor ever and deserves the whole world. if you ever get the chance, TAKE HIS CLASSES

Easy-going and accommodating. He gives a lot of comments about your work, and he values improvement because you can revise your grade at the end. 3 projects (recipe, group pres + essay, storytelling). Nice to learn speech skills. In terms of writing, I didn't learn much. I recommend taking if you like to present, coming from an introvert.

3 very speedy projects, each within two or three weeks. Super friendly as a person although he gives vague comments and want you to improve with that. Mostly grade easily but can grade hard at some points. Overall, nice professor and recommend if you want a fast-paced and presentation-based class.

The projects can take a long time. The good part of this course is that you don't have to worry too much about the grades you get, because you get a chance to get a better grade on all the projects and some assignments by revising them in the final project. It can be challenging, but it's good for learning.
The course had very boring lectures and a difficult process to receive a good grade. The entire course was essentially working on a single essay in many parts.

SOOOOOOOOO BORING!! don't take this class unless you want a yawn fest! 
Her grading is ridiculous and tedious. I could have sworn I did almost everything right for most assignments, and there was always something! Her assignment rubrics and outlines are very, very confusing as well. Don't take this writing class!

The grade bundles are lies!!! To get an A you had to go to her office hours at least once, not get marked down on low stakes assignments, or marked on high stakes assignments (like essays, projects, etc). I did all of this, and to my knowledge, so did other students, but we were in for a shock when she ended up dishing out B-‘s to people.

Extremely boring lectures, often used the whole class to outline the next assignment. Grading in bundles, unsatisfactory/satisfactory and low-stakes/ 4 high-stakes assignments. Disappointed by uninteresting assignments, not diffucult but they were time-consuming. Understanding of excused absences and gives some slack for late work.

Prof. Kareem is fine, I didn't find her class super difficult, just boring. The grading is in bundles, meaning getting a good grade isn't as difficult. If she likes you and you turn stuff in early, you'll be fine, just be warned you will feel confused and bored.

Lara was a great professor for writing 2! If you are scared on who to take, I 100% recommend her. She understands if you miss class, if you turned work in late, and tries to bring the vibes up as well in her class. She had like 2 quizzes and 4 projects that required typing or essay work, and she gives you plenty of time to do them.
Professor Galas does not mark off points for late work. She was very reasonable with her grading process, and there was a short workload.
Sooooo chill and nice and a super easy grader. I was dreading taking writing 2 but she made the course super enjoyable and easy
Actually, the sweetest and genuinely cares for the students. Is kind and funny, and is a great professor. Her class is easy and she is very understanding and flexible. Fire professor.
She's very kind and she cares about her students. She always does her best and the class wasn't hard as long as you keep up with assignments and pay attention in class.

I took her during spring quarter 2024 and she made the class way better by giving us a theme that was interesting compared to all the other writing two classes. She did get sick and there was the Palestine protests so we only wrote maybe one essay but she is a good teacher and cares about her students.

she was absolutely wonderful!! her assignments were creative and fun, extremely easy to complete and she was there every step of the way to help. every single class was engaging, fun, and worth while. she very often brought us treats like cupcakes and candy for everyone to share. if i could take a class with her again, i would!

Galas's WRIT 2 was at best confusing, and at worst sloppy. I'll give her credit that she did her best since this was during pandemic, but the organization of the slides/assignments were not intuitive at all. I personally do not care that she showed us gory lynching photos without warning, but for those who get queasy easily, avoid this class.

This is the most "High school" like class I have taken since coming to UCSC. Dr Galas was a great professor, explained things well and in depth, and was very accommodating. My class ended up getting cut short due to protests and she essentially canceled the rest of the assignments. 

One thing to note is she did cancel 3 or 4 of her lectures.

Super nice and easy to talk to, seems like she really cares about her students. Class was fun and lighter on writing assignments than I would expect for a writing class. Lectures got cancelled often (+ entirely cancelled during the online protest weeks). If you're looking for a not super intense but still very good writing 2 class, would recommend

Dr. Galas is very kind, and makes her classroom feel like an open environment for discussion and learning. I can't remember a class where I've had genuine conversations with so many of my peers, and she facilitates this with a very student-oriented structure to her assignments. I appreciate how much concern she has towards cultivating our voices.
easy class, did not improve my writing at all, pretty boring most of the time but required attendance. very touchy feely.

I was initially worried to take this class because of the reviews but I assure you she is wonderful. She cares a lot about her students and is very forgiving if you just ask for help. She gave me an extension whenever I asked. She truly wanted me to be able to pass.

After reading other ratings, I went into this class not sure what to expect. I entered as a freshman and found the course load manageable and enjoyable! If you wanna enter in the world behind what motivates movie portrayal of students in school films, take this class. Specially as a person of color, you will discover alot about yourself!

Professor Galas is such an inspiring and knowledgeable professor! Her class was super interesting and she worked hard to cultivate an encouraging, safe, and fun learning environment. Everything that was asked of students was realistic. She provided extremely useful feedback. I felt very supported and accommodated by Professor Galas!

Galas was a good professor and showed genuine interest in her students. She often did not follow the syllabus and it made it difficult to know what was happening in the class. Not many tests, but attending class was mandatory after three absences. She was not a bad professor, but I would not take a class from her again.

She was very nice and easy going however she barely stuck to the syllabus making it confusing on what is and isn't assigned and when to complete them, and didn't grade anything until the very end of the quarter.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Terrible teacher, gave up, late late grader (week 10) only, does not do anything. Did not respond to emails or host lectures. expected us to read the worst short readings I have ever seen and then discuss with a random group of students that we were also forced to write group essays with.
Professor Lara was great. She did a fantastic job explaining the material and gave good feedback on writings during office hours.

She is very organized and is a really good listener. She provides great readings and is very knowledgeable in her field. She will always make you feel good and you gain a lot of practice during each lecture.

PLEASE try to avoid her!! She's not a bad person, but she doesn't manage an online asynchronous class well. Canvas and syllabus is SO difficult to navigate. Instructions for assignments are so confusing literally takes me like 30 mins just to understand the assignment. Mandatory 3hour zoom meeting twice. Brutally honest and SUPER tough grader.

The course is difficult to navigate as an online course. She lowkey expects you to read her mind, and to do more than the assignments ask. I would understand a bit more if it was an in-person class where we meet consistently, but as a completely asynchronous class I would not recommend.
Brutally honest grader but pure heart and soul I love her
She's kinda tough good luck lil bro
The professor has tough grading and set expectations on writing. Stopped replying to my emails and continued to deduct marks.

Her Canvas is not easy to navigate, especially for an online course. The assignment instructions are unclear, and when you ask about it, she tells you to read the instructions again. She also has two mandatory 3-hour-long "group" Zoom calls that require you to present to strangers (if public speaking is not your thing, DO NOT take this class).

This was not a good writing class. She is a tough grader and her assignments are very vauge. If you have questions or concerns about anything it is very hard to reach her she usually never responds. This makes it harder to understand the assignments and how to do better. Yeah overall not a good class.

Don't take this class. Dr. King is an extremely unfair grader. If she doesn't like you personally she will give you bad grades. She disagrees with your project if it doesn't align with her personal views. Very rude to students. Her instructions are extremely unclear and if you ask her about something she will act like you're stupid.

Absolutely horrible. The worst part is how she refuses to take any accountability for bad instructions, saying students should have contacted her ahead of time if they didn't understand correctly. The class is all online and her canvas is impossible to navigate. She really does know a lot about writing, sad that she's too self obsessed to teach it.

Dr. King assigned us to reflect on a traumatic experience that had happened to us. She basically told us the more traumatic the event, the better grade we would get. I wrote about food struggles I have had, and she graded my paper, saying that I "should add weight numbers" for detail. So inappropriate and very triggering for many students.

Dr. King is the worst teacher I have ever had. I had to miss my writing group as I was very sick, and I even offered to send her a letter from the school health center verifying this. I asked for a way to make up for this. She ignored me and gave me zero for that assignment. Not at all kind or understanding.
nahh man, late on posting assignments, disagreed on personal views about writing assignments.

This class takes up SOOOO much of my time. Writing groups meet every other week for 2 hours each. On top of that, her office hours are mandatory and 2 hours each too. She's rude and assigns homework SUPER last minute, sometimes giving us only a day to turn assignments in. I'm a pretty open-minded person, but WORST teacher I've had. Do not recommend

dude this lady is so mean??? i had to present over zoom and she was just dogging on me for looking uncomfortable and sad and like i didnt wanna be there, just being mean for no reason like you have no idea what i'm going through, why are you commenting on it? also assignments are confusing and she's not very understanding of circumstances.

She is a very tough grader and doesn't seem to care about her students. She was very rude when giving feedback and made me feel like I was being made fun of. She gives lots of work which is hard for me as a STEM student. Her assignment prompts are very long and don't give good instructions. WA was a great help in understanding her mess of a canvas.
She is not sympathetic at all. Her canvas page is not the most organized I've seen. She makes fun of her student's insecurities and brushes it off as a "joke". Extremely tough grader.

Her canvas felt like I was navigating through the Sahara. I could not find anything. Would constantly pick favorites and her assignment prompts were long but did not give instructions. Queen of yappington city.
I'll keep it short and sweet, good professor, super understanding, and she gives good advice!
Most frustrating class ever. I despise her. Do yourself a favor and don't take any of her classes.

Horrible. Mandatory 3-hour long Zoom meetings. Many essays about uninspiring topics. Buying the book is also mandatory. Her critiques are contradicting depending on what you revise. Instructions on Canvas are very unclear. Canvas is poorly organized and due dates are not all in the same spot. TAs give wrongful advice since prompts are so unclear.
Shout out to Anthony for helping me finish my c requirement despite dropping out of the summer halfway. Most prof don't go out of their way to help students.
This prof is super understanding and passionate about his teaching, I feel like I lucked out. The course is fun and you learn a lot, but I wish there wasn't any group work.
I loved Professor Breakspeare's class. We didn't have to write boring papers or do busy work. I felt like the assignments actually helped me think. Super kind person.

Very unclear about the guidelines for his projects. Grade is dependent on group work effort and participation. Has an attitude for things he doesn't like. I recommend you choose a different professor, I would never take again in a million years.

Super nice professor. Class is heavy on group work. Please make sure you're not contributing too little or too much, try to make it easier for your group members and yourself. Sometimes vague directions for assignments. Reach out to him with clarifying questions. Super accommodating. Liked the professor, just not the class.

I really appreciate Professor Breakspeare's teaching style and compassion, I had a lot going on when I took his class and he helped me stay on track. I also liked the blog project, which was a different and fun way to learn about information literacy.
Is nice, but he also gives a bunch of busy work and grades harshly. You are doing group work for the entire class. He does give really good feedback on the group project.

This class really gives you that stereotypical college group project feel. However I liked Anthony as a person. Felt he was confusing with instructions and could have been more lenient. Class is busy work, but he will help if you let him know your needs. I got cooked by my group but I'm sure if I let him know earlier he would have cut me some slack
Love this man. He always kept our class motivated to finish even when things got really hard. Thank you UCSC for all the compassionate teachers.
Super accessible and accommodating professor. Definitely recommend.

Very manageable summer class. He's nice and very reliable to communicate with online. Half the grade is individual and the other half is based on group work. The workload very reasonable and not super time consuming. I spent maybe 2-3 hours per week on homework for the 10 week course. I would highly recommend this professor, he's really cool.
I really appreciated Anthony's teaching style. I felt connected to the course and even when I fell behind he helped me catch up. Definitely recommend taking him!

great personality & fun lectures but grading criteria and instruction is VERY open ended. u need to go to office hours if u wanna get some idea of a rubric. there's a group "research" project (writing a prospectus& making an ad) + 2 individ writing posts due weekly + reflection hws -- use em dashes for an A!!!!!
was very flaky at end of qtr :(
He was amazing, cares about your well being in the class. Wants you to succeed!

This class was inspirational, as it focuses on unlearning unhelpful lessons about writing we've been taught in the past. I appreciated his hands-on approach to an online course (we met with him very often) but also the freedom to learn at my pace. Overall 10/10

Professor Breakspear is amazing. I could listen to him talk for forever. He has such a young perspective and high energy attitude. He assigns few writing assignments, totally manageable and is really easy to speak to if you need help or an extension. I loved this writing class.

I feel like I learned nothing this course. He was all over the place and missed class more often than he showed up. We only had a few assignments and they were weren't graded too harshly but the process for grading was unclear. You better hope he assigns you with a good group for projects because that's a huge part of the grade.
The professor is really invested in the class and students. We had the chance to work on a group project and it was great learning experience. I would highly recommend this class !
A great teacher! You work on a group writing project which makes the class much more engaging.

Interesting course where you make your own rubrics and grade yourself which I hadnt done. Group work is lame, but Anthony really helps move things along so it doesnt feel tedious. Videos in this class are the GOAT. Honestly the summer went by fast bc of this course

Reviews are all accurate. Grade is participation-based (contract grading), super light workload, as easy if not easier than high school English. Super friendly person; he's the chill unserious professor you always see on Internet posts. Some days are just watching Black Mirror episodes, another day was coloring a poster. A great option for WRIT 2!

Professor Joesten was amazing. Every other lecture you'd sit in class and just watch a netiflix episode for an hour and then discuss your thoughts on the episode related to the theme of the week. I am a comp sci major and watching Black Mirror was a blast! You have the opportunity to get really creative in this class so take advantage of it!

i took him over summer and he was AMAZING. deeply cared about his students and was looking for growth, not perfection. he allowed for an abundance of creativity (very rare for writing teachers) and was sooo lenient with late work. absolute blessing after teachers i had the previous quarter l

I'm a science/math person so writing isn't my thing. This class was great though, professor provided help and feedback, He also encouraged students to explore different genres. I loved that the course is based off of Black Mirror, a great TV show that explores the dangers and benefits of technology and human use of it. Highly recommend!

I took History 18 for Spring 2025
His class was just taking notes but it was easy, His midterm is easy and the final is a test from all the notes.
His classes would end 30 minutes early so that's a plus

Daniel is fantastic professor who's kind and creates a welcoming environment in his class, which makes participating very easy. The course is both engaging and interesting. The workload is very reasonable and the rubrics for the essays are very open ended, as he encourages student creativity. It's clear that he loves both his job and students.

I love Dan! His class is so fun and we focus on Black Mirror throughout the quarter and discuss it in class most of the times. The essays are mostly based on completion so it encourages you to actually write for fun instead of worrying for a grade. Great class, great man, take this class!!!!!

I took Prof Joesten for WRIT1 and WRIT2 and he was easily one of the best professors I've had. He uses contract grading and is very clear with what he requires on assignments. He is extremely caring and understanding of his students and their circumstances. Classes revolve around Black Mirror and are very interesting overall. Highly recommend!

Honestly a really interesting class, you watch black mirror episodes which tie into the assignments and just discuss things related to the course theme, black mirror, or readings in many of the classes. Joesten is one of if not the most caring, flexible, and fun teacher I've had at SC so far highly recommend at least for writing 2.

This is one of the most interesting classes at UCSC. It revolves around technology. I really liked the content we learned. The assignments were pretty straightforward. Professor Joesten cares about his students and is very understanding. Highly recommend!
If you need to take a history class, do it with Dan! He's an amazing professor who cares about your success. He's easy to communicate with and makes class time fun while extremely educational.

He is very caring and accommodating to all needs. Relax in his class, have fun, and do NOT hesitate to reach out to him for further assistance or advice. He is an easy-going professor, but do not let that undermine his writing abilities :D

I love Daniel! He is very understanding and grades accordingly. Although attendance is mandatory, I actually enjoyed attending this class. There were a few essays throughout the course which were relatively easy for me.He sets up zoom calls to give really helpful feedback. He really cares about his students and it shows through this class.
Easy pass, but many reading

Very easy-going teacher, the class was based on Black Mirror eps so for hw we mostly only had to watch that. Papers aren't really grades until the end where you'll have a portfolio of your writings but he's very understanding. If you talk to him about any concerns he'll understand and really looks out for his students. Overall an amazing teacher.
One of the best professors at UCSC. He truly understands each students needs and wants you to succeed in this course. God bless him

Daniel is a great professor. He made sure the textbooks and all the readings were accessible online so you didn't have to buy anything. He was super accommodating and friendly. There was a decent amount of writing but nothing too crazy.
He's a great professor, super accommodating with deadlines and gave me good feedback on my papers. You should get an A as long as you do all your assignments.
Awesome teacher. Engaging subject material, easy to pass if you go to class and do the everyday assignments.

Prof Lunine is a sweet, energetic presence. He's always ready to help with a smile on his face.  It's obvious that he wants to see students succeed, and he's happy to discussing your writing with you. He gives a considerable amount of assignments leading up to every paper, but they're never "busy work" but all meant to help with the final product.
Extremely nice guy. Entertaining lectures and very understanding when you need help with the class.

W prof, very chill and supportive prof, cracks up lots of jokes, makes you feel included and motivated a lot going to class (I had his class in the morning), always willing to help students in and out of class, he brought in the author for Great Hanoi Rat Hunt as a guest speaker and it was such a great experience, don't sleep on the assignments tho
Brij is an absolute W. Best professor I've had so far at UCSC.

This is what a model professor is, at the beginning of the quarter, i suffered some loss and Brij was there to support me along every step of the way. He actually gives proper feed back to every paper and there are never any guesses as to why you got a grade. His modules also make you learn and take you among every step of the writing process.
he was such a chill guy, i loved his class a lot and it was super easy, just dont procrastinate on work

Brij my GOAT. He is very chill and understanding, you can definitely believe all the other reviews about him. He is passionate about the class and the material, and he's always ready to help you out. If you're struggling or even just want to discuss assignments, I'd definitely recommend talking to him.
Brij is awesome! Some assignments seemed a little pointless but he is a good teacher passionate about learning. I would 100% recommend you take him as your writing 2 instructor.

Brij is awesome, he legitimately cares about his students and wants you to succeed in his class. It was at times a lot of writing, but he provided so much support that it didn't really feel overwhelming. Would highly recommend.
Favorite professor at college. And favorite teacher ever a lot of fun and just a great teacher.
Brij is one of the best professors I have had so far. He is so understanding, caring, and intelligent.
Brij is a very understanding professor, and very funny.

Brij was an amazing professor! He shows so much passion for teaching and getting to know his students. There were a ton of assignments required for his class, but he was really encouraging and motivated me to do my work. There were 3 major essays due in this class, and he gave amazing feedback on all of them. An overall amazing dude!

Brij is absolutely wonderful. Assignments are difficult sometimes, but he's really good about answering emails (even on weekends) so just shoot him one and you should be good. He's very willing to learn about his students' interests even if they're new to him and is generally a great guy. Take him if you can! You won't regret it.

I loved Brij so much this quarter! I showed up to class early to just talk with him about unrelated things to the class. You have to be on top of your assignments as some of them are very quick to pass. The way he handled the major paper of the class was amazing, breaking it up into smaller assignments. It's the reason I produced such a good essay.

Brij has by far been the greatest professor I've had at UCSC. He is super engaging with his students, and the class was actually fun. He takes the time to get to know all of his students. The workload is very manageable and he always gives good feedback and is always willing to help. I would recommend this class for anyone!

Brij is the best professor I've had hands down.  Writ 2 is a hard class, but Brij explains how to do well in the class and gives multiple chances to improve grades.  He's always available through email and office hours are a great resource.  When I got covid he helped me catch up after I had gotten over it.  Highly recommend his classes.

I took Brij's Writ 2 class because of his rate my professor, and he absolutely lived up to his reputation. I wouldn't miss the opportunity to take his class if you're trying to narrow down which prof to enroll with. There's seemingly more homework than other courses, but it's to your benefit as he grades the work leading up to larger assignments.
Lunine is an amazing teacher. Lectures and homework are straightforward. Office hours are really helpful. Attendance is mandatory. If you're looking for an easy A, I would look into other professors.

Professor Lunine is a fun and a caring professor when I took his class for Stev 26. He does offer plentiful of extra credit assignments, which will be great if you want to boost up your grades. Homework load isn't too difficult, as most of the time you would read articles and express your thoughts on the articles. Overall, a fun, pretty chill class

Assigns an unreasonable amount of work. Modules aren't available until Monday of that week, so there is little warning of extra assignments. Gives thorough feedback, but it is vague, unclear, and overwhelming for a non writing class. Lectures are often Mark's stories, which contradicts the course theme of amplifying marginalized voices.

so difficult to work with, hard grader, gatekeeps how to get an A , he has this weird thing against technology so you cant take notes on an ipad or computer or he gets mad. you cant miss class and the class is basically him talking nonsense for 2 and a half hours. final project is also confusing and overall just didnt feel supported at all by him

Mark is very nice guy but omg doesn't he just assign so much work like ik some ppl taking writ 2 with different professor that are having an easy A n barely do anything in their class but if u enjoy writing so much u should take his class but if u tryna just fulfill n get over it or a stem major pls do urself a favor n run

Best professor for writing. If you put in the effort and work, he will also respond with the same if not more effort. Ex: My 5 page (doublespaced) essay came back with 2 pages (singlespaced) feedback plus lots of feedback in the margins. I improved as a writer with his revisions. However, it was a very hard class with a lot of work.
I found the class structure to be a but confusing

Great teacher. If you're not used to contact grading, it takes a bit to get used to. Assignments require some thinking and take time but are relatively easy. The longest paper we had to write was 1300-1600 words. He is big on revision, so you have an opportunity to review and improve your writing.

Prof. Baker is one of the few teachers in my life that have had a huge impact on the way I write and communicate. He has a great approach to teaching the craft of writing, but it's very intense. If you put the work in, you will be rewarded with an A. I'd highly recommend this class, but not if you have other demanding classes on your plate.

Overall, the class is good, you just have to perpare yourself for the pace of the class as well as with the amount of work you'll have to be doing. If you miss one class you will be far behind. I just personally prefer if the grading wise in the class was different because then I think I would have done a better job. Rather than out of 3 points
Mark is a great teacher and grader, He does give you kinda a lot of hw but he does give you a lot of time to complete your work. I would 100% recommend and plan on taking his writing 2 class.

Though he is a bit of a tough grader, professor Baker is actually a really nice guy and is super lenient about late work. If you are feeling overwhelmed with the workload just let him know and he won't mark you down for turning things in late.

Mark always gives back good feedback and cares about your progress as a writer. Most complaints pertain to the amount of work but this class would be hard regardless of your professor. You get time to work on readings/papers so it's really about time management. I would definitely take this class again.

Professor Mark has been the only teacher I've had who has gotten to know me. The feedback was helpful for revision, and I feel more prepared with writing. The storymaps project was good and an interesting assignment.

Mediocre guy, but this class was awful. He crammed so much work in one quarter. This is a very heavy workload class, so if you have to take him, make sure your other classes are easy. He forgets that Writing 2 is a requirement and that no one actually wants to be there.

This was a good class for me. I was able to write on topics that I cared about. His assignments gave us a lot of freedom, including the major research project. The class was challenging, but Mark was friendly and helpful, especially in office hours. I'd take again.

This class was so much work. I have no idea how he has so many 5-star ratings because I felt like most of the class hated him. Most demanding and stressful class I've taken and I've taken some pretty hard classes. He doesn't care about your mental well-being. he makes you redo almost every assignment while assigning more work.

I learned a lot in this class and saw my writing improve. Mark gives a lot of feedback which is helpful. The workload was heavy, but all for two main assignments. He cares about his students. Probably my favorite professor so far.
not worth the stress and all the work. Do not take writing 2 with him.

Most horrible experience I've had so far at UCSC. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!! Most overbearing professor I have ever had. Students would tell him that they were overwhelmed and he would just brush it off.

Mark is a great professor and seemed to really care about students and their mental health. He gives a lot of feedback on your writing, and I was surprised by how much feedback he gave for each paper. My only problem with the class was that there were a lot of informal writings, but we didn't have much of these in the second half of the quarter.

I had Mark for Writing 2 and I won't lie, this class wasn't worth taking. He sets it up as if it's a class that is significantly more important than it is, so it is a ton of work considering the fact that you have to take it for a general education requirement. Also, if you want the A, you are gonna have to work your ass off to get it.

Super nice teacher, always wants to engage with students and tries to have students led discussions Core does overall have a lot of reading but we were required to annotate all of the readings. 2 Essays, Pleasure Reading, and the Accordion book were the major assignments over the quarter. Heavier workload compared to other core class instructors.

Lots of assignments, but it's the same for any writing class. Most are graded complete/incomplete, but there are 3 bigger writing projects that are actually graded. She gives you tons of time for each one and gives you feedback before you submit your final draft which is super helpful. You have to meet with your group once a week but it's easy.

Porter 1 has a lot of reading regardless but Professor Ingrid really tries to have all of her students engage with the material. Homework almost everyday that involve readings that are talked about in class later, long readings and homeworks usually involved a small summary. Textbook and small book required. Overall good professor.
Ingrid is just a great professor all around. She has clear critique and advice. She makes the classes very engaging compared to other core professors I know of.

So much writing. Every week there would be like 3 or 4 assignments. Do not take if you do not like writing or talking. I thought that the material was very easy, but the pure amount of work is more than what I've heard from other people in writ1. She gives great feedback and allows you to revise at the end of the quarter for extra credit. Very kind

Core class was super chill, only 2 short essays per week that should take only an hour each. Required textbook is $50, I had it covered by financial aid, but you could probs get away with not buying it, just search for the articles online. Easy grader and no final, just an art project at the end. Just put in some effort and you'll be fine.

Very kind professor. There are weekly writing assignments and weekly online-discussions. When I took the class it revolved around Feminism. You will need to submit all assignments and are always at the same time. There was also weekly group cooperation activities, fairly manageable.

Ingrid is a super kind professor who genuinely cares about her students. There are a lot of written assignments but they are manageable and are often graded for completion. The films and readings for this class were focused on feminism and were very interesting in my opinion. I would definitely take one of Ingrid's classes again!
Ingrid is an understanding teacher that is truly looking out for you. Her course allowed me to love writing again. I highly recommend her as a teacher.

Ingrid is a very caring professor and you can tell she was really passionate about teaching. Our class revolved around feminism and that came with a lot of readings and discussion post. Were talking 3 readings and 200 word discussion post and all due at 3pm monday and wednesday. The worst part was how much group work came with the class.

She assigned a lot of reading homework and response assignments, but she encouraged writing 'informally' a lot, so they weren't difficult to write. A reasonable amount of projects and essays, and she gave plenty of time and instruction on how to do them, and also grades pretty easy if you put in effort. Overall solid professor.

Whilst her class was very reading intensive, Ingrid is very kind and truly wants her students to pass. I struggled a lot to complete work due to personal issues, but she worked with me outside of class and helped me pass. I suggest heavily, the discussions you'll have in her class are powerful!

She's really nice and seems like she really cares about helping everybody improve their writing. She gives a lot of work, but it's never too difficult and she doesn't grade too harshly. My only issues with her class were deadlines for assignments being at 9 am and having to turn in drafts for essays.

Pretty good writing teacher. Readings she assigns corresponds well with the writing assignments that she had you do. All of what she wants is clearly explained in the rubrics. Helped me become a better writer in terms of better organizing my thoughts and elaborating further on my ideas. However, participation is key ! Tough grader.
She is a nice teacher, but hard Grader

She's very sweet, very helpful and really understanding. She gives great feedback and not a terribly hard grader. However, her class involves a lot of busy work that is very very unnecessary and teaches you absolutely nothing.

I felt I became a better writer through this course. Although Ingrid assigns a lot of readings, she tries to balance them with questions and discussions that relate to the essay prompts. As long as you show up to class, turn in your homework on time and show that you're making an effort to improve/revise your essays when needed you will pass.

Her writing 2 class about photography is horrible. I didn't learn a single thing and her writing prompts are more confusing than interesting. She contradicts herself with her own grading and holy moly, the amount of homework she decides to give out is actually outrageous. I would at all costs try to avoid this class!
I honestly had such a bad experience with her. She was not helpful in helping me pass the ELWR .
She assigned WAY TOO MUCH HOMEWORK. but also very helpful if you ask for it.

Pretty entertaining classes, really makes you think. Very chill core class. A ton of discussion posts which lowkey got on my nerves and sort of feels like busywork but wtv class content makes up for it and she's real asl
An amazing professor who really takes the time to make sure you understand the content and expectations of the course!

Class based on how to write a research paper, 2-page op-ed halfway through, 10-page research paper for final of anything you want to write about. She cares about her students and helps you through some late work, but some assignments have a hard deadline and won't be graded late. She's super involved in class and has really cool outfits every day.

I took Andrea this Winter quarter class, which was NOT difficult! The class major assignments included discussions due every Thursday, a two-page op-ed, and a 10-page paper on a topic, which combined with the op-ed. The topics are all of your choice as well! Very simple class did not need to read much! Andrea is understanding and works with you.
amazing, kind, understanding professor. Take her for oakes if you can!

I love this professor so much, and I will remember her for the rest of my time in college. She is an absolute sweetheart that is extremely caring and compassionate. She helped ease my stress for my first quarter here and is a great listener, I am extremely lucky to have someone that cares this much about her students!

My favorite writing professor! I took her WRIT2 online class this summer. Throughout the course, she showed genuine care for her students and their writing. Each assignment provided helpful feedback. She responds to emails promptly and is open to valid reasons.I enjoyed learning how to write in this class.

Writing 2 took a slow pace in a research paper. Professor Seeger is very understanding and flexible and even adapted to the protests and strikes happening by moving everything online. They are one of my most engaging professors and always kept it real from the beginning!

Andrea is my queen. She genuinely cares about the well being of her students, and I loved having my core class with her. Grading is clear and most assignments are loose ended and discussion based. As a yapper and creative person I really enjoyed class. I definitely plan on taking her Writing 2 class too!

She is the best professor I have had so far! She truly cares for the students and their writing journey. I was terrified of research before, but after taking her class, research kind of excites me. She lets you choose your research topic about anything you're interest about. I had so much fun in this class, and I hope to take her other classes.

The best professor I had so far, very sweet and you can tell she truly cares for her students. Instructions are almost always clear, and shes always forgiving and willing to clarify anything you may be confused about. Very sweet woman, and very respectable!
absolute queen, shes so sweet and her class is so fun.

Seeger is probably one of the best instructors I've ever had. She was engaged and enthusiastic about the class and always made everyone feel included. She was always open to everyone's ideas and did a fantastic job at explaining the course material. You're basically guaranteed an A+ if you put in even a little effort and the assignments are simple.
Chill
Contract grading, so as long as you stay on top of your work and don't procrastinate you will do good (she's very lenient with due dates.) Friendly and approachable.
I hate writing, so I may be a bit biased. Lots of assignments that seemed totally random and not related to the projects. I took this asynchronously and I kept forgetting I was in this class.

Taylor Kirsch is an amazing professor who really cares about her students. She is very understanding and adaptable. I took this class asynchronously and overall enjoyed it. There are five big projects which are based on completion as well as weekly writing activites. There are a couple of required Zoom meetings with the teacher and peers.

Prof Kirsch is one of the best writing professors. Asynch class with homework every week, doesn't take too long to do. There are 6 major writing projects throughout the course which are tedious but not too difficult. This class allows for a lot of creative freedom and the prof is excellent at giving the exact feedback you need for your essays.
Taylor Kirsch was probably one of the best professors I have had. She is very kind and understanding.

Super compassionate professor and the class was really well-structured! I took it async online, so we didn't have attendance but we did have to sign up for mandatory conferences to discuss projects. She also grades via contract grading (on completion); would take this class with her again, and that's coming from someone who doesn't like writing. :)

Dr. Taylor Kirsch is one of the best writing professor's I've had! She is a genuine woman who cares deeply about the success of her students. The environment she created for this course felt safe and sincere. If by any chance you have the opportunity to take a class of hers- I highly recommend it!!

This professor super nice and understanding. The class itself was asynchronous and pretty easy but if you procrastinate its going to be stressful doing the all the work last minute. You do a few papers but you get to choose the topic and audience etc. If you need extensions she'll gladly give you more time. Love her ;P
Dr.Kirsch is super understanding and easy going, it's a lot of writing assignments during the week, but they're short, just a little time consuming. As long as you do the 4 projects you'll be fine.
She is very helpful and amazing at giving feed back. Very supportive with any ideas that you may have, and she helps build upon that idea.
Easy pass, but many readings

I was lucky enough to take Taylor's Writing 2 class "Agility in Writing" in Winter 2021. The course is not an easy A, but if you consistently do the assignments and put in effort for the projects, you will succeed. She is very understanding and can be flexible with deadlines. I highly recommend taking her if you have the opportunity.

Professor Kirsch is a very welcoming and amazing professor. This class was asynchronous so no zoom meeting and I could work whenever I wanted. There was 7 major projects(essays) but 3 of them are not graded. The load can be heavy especially when you get to the research paper. I strongly recommend going to office hours each week and talking with her

The experience with W2 depends on the professor you take it with. With Taylor's class, it isn't exactly laid back but also not very time consuming. Writing with Agility was flexible with topics that we were able to choose to write on and fair deadlines. You also get to work a lot with classmates to peer edit, revise, etc. Great class overall.

This class is very fast paced with lots of work. I wouldn't take this class along with two other heavy workload classes. A majority of my homework hours were dedicated to this class. That being said, I improved an incredible amount as a writer during the quarter. And Taylor sincerely cares about your improvement. If you seek her help you will pass

I LOVED this course and specifically this professor. She was so incredibly sweet, patient, and provides great feedback overall. For the coursework, It is very easy and manageable ESPECIALLY if you are a STEM major.  A big paper is due towards the end of the course but you get weeks to work on it and prepare so its not the worst at all.

Other writing professor give a LOT of work for no real reason but this professor is literally the best. genuinely cares about her students and wants us to succeed in Writ 2. It might seem a lot at first, but trust, it dies off because the whole quarter you're only working on one project with small assignments that helps u. SO TAKE IT!!!

Simply a very good professor, her classes/assignments unlike others at UCSC are paced out in a way that try's to help students learn at their own pace, Dr. S is also very attentive with emails and comments on her assignments which honestly just makes you feel important. Just put in some general thought into these assignments and you will get an A.

One of the best professors I have had so far at UCSC. Her assignments are worth your time and not hard. You just have to stay on top of the work, because if you don't, it gets really overwhelming (her late policy is very forgiving though).The final project was easy to complete because the assignments for the class all build towards it. 11/10!

An amazing teacher, she was so kind and her feedback is filled with compliments/motivation, it makes you feel smart and cared for. Idk if every class is the same, but mine consisted of small assignments each week that helped form the final. So not only did I learn, but completed my final with ease, I was never stressed, yet I learned so much.
Extremely easy writing 2 professor

This professor truly cares for her students and wants them to succeed and improve their writing. The course starts out heavy but is still very manageable but dies down. Dr. S gives great feedback and it encourages you along the way. If you put in decent time and effort into this class, you will definitely get an A. Cant recommend enough

Loved loved loved this professor! Took her async class over the summer, and fell in love with writing all over again. Her assignments are easy, and her grading scale is so organized and very easily manageable. As long as you follow it, getting an A is easy. You can always join her online office hours to ask for help before assignments are due.

Dr. Shearer was the best professor I have had at UCSC so far, I took her for Writing 1. It's a lot of reading, annotations, and writing but it is not in vain, all of this work makes you a better writer. She has clear feedback on EVERYTHING, and her grading system is amazing, it is not hard to get an A in this class! Hoping I can take her again.

Dr. Shearer has been my favorite professor so far during my two years at UCSC. The material is thoughtful and useful, nothing felt like busy work or unnecessary. She built a space that was comfortable and left room for exploration and experimentation with writing, with a clear grading system that she stuck to. Can't recommend her enough.

Heather Shearer is such an inspirational professor. I am angry that I cannot have her again, especially for an in-person class. If you are reading this review, please take her class. Her feedback was amazing and in-depth, you can tell that she loves her job and is passionate about the assignments she gives.

Extremely kind and uplifting professor, has a very simple grading system: basically get points per assignment , once you max out in an assignment category you don't have to do the rest of the assignments. So if you do everything in the beginning the last couple weeks basically only have a final project to focus on. Only 5 minute lectures per week.

Can't remember the last time I had this much fun in a writing class! Dr. S is the sweetest and genuinely wants you to succeed. She grades pass/no pass, so you can focus on experimenting with your writing style and having fun with the assignments. I learned a ton and genuinely improved as a writer after this class. Couldn't recommend enough!

I love Dr. S! Her class was asynchronous and she didn't post lectures, which made the class bearable. You just do the assignments she gives, which I much prefer over listening to lectures. Lots of homework (that are all due T/Th) so don't fall behind, but she seems to be understanding about extensions. Super kind, would love to have her again :)

This teacher grades holistically, and since this is writing the grading is all up to the teacher. I put in far more hours in this class than my STEM classes which I aced. This class was a nuisance and I strongly recommend against this teacher. Some might say otherwise but this grading scheme was too subjective.
She's awesome. Just the best. Take her class!
She's extremely helpful and wants you to succeed. Very approachable and always respectful.
the best writing teacher I've ever had do the work and follow her criteria and you will get an A extremely helpful and clear

Had to switch to Pass / No pass (I passed) after seeing how egregious her grading is. Most difficult class I've ever taken (as a stem major) and assignment instructions make little to no sense. You WILL get a zero if you miss even the smallest part of it. It being online is tempting but just take it in person for ur own sake.

I'm not a good student by any means, but damn. Can't email because you're just gonna get a response saying "idk, good luck bro" yet critiques your work like gordon ramsay. She'll tell you you're wrong (if you're even that lucky) and provide no feedback whatsoever. Can't believe I'm saying this but I wish there was a lecture. Great late policy.

Extremely strict grader, gives the most minimal feedback, or gives a whole essay back to you about how poor your writing is. There are like 5 assignments per week, usually writing essays, peer reviews, and readings.

Actually, the toughest grader I have ever had. She has no sympathy for you at all and will likely make you dislike the class. It was so discouraging, and she gives so many assignments that barely make sense, and then she really gives you a hard time grading them.

This professor does not necessarily care about your learning. She will give vague advice and tell you to read a 600 page textbook on citations and writing. Teaching style is suboptimal because she does not teach lectures at all. If you want to pass your WRIT2 class, do not take it with her.

They're the type of teacher where 99% of the class could fail the assignment and she wouldn't recognize that they're failing to teach something. Terrible advice on every post, and strict grading that can feel completely random at times. Makes me wish it was in person because maybe if there were lectures she would end up actually teaching something.

Hardest class I've taken, so many long and tedious assignments with very unclear instructions despite how detailed and lengthy they are. Grades really toughly, and no matter how hard or how long you put into a assignment it is never enough. Feedback is stale and never provides any helpful substance to improve work, overall a uninspiring class.

Do not take if you are a stem major. So much work already assigned in the first week and its all complete/incomplete, I had to drop the class first week because I could only focus on the writing class and couldn't do work for my other classes.
You really have to pay attention to EVERY detail in the instructions; some things you think are acceptable turn out to get incomplete grades, no matter how many hours of work you put in.

Terry is a great professor! Lots of homework, but that's to be expected with an asynch class. Assignments graded complete/incomplete. Grade consisted of two major assignments, but she always let us submit a first draft graded complete/incomplete, she gave feedback, and then we submitted a second draft for a final grade.

I do like Professor Terry as a person, however the instructions were always extremely unclear, she was a tough grader, and wasn't always accessible outside of class. She wasn't available to fully help each student and should have some TA's if she's going to be a harsh grader and not be the most available.

I took this class two years ago and I STILL think about how terrible it was. It's the only class I've ever had to withdraw from. The amount of work is diabolical (4-8 assignments per week) and instructions for assignments are so unclear. I have never felt such immense hatred for a professor, let alone anyone. Do not take this class!

Professor Terry is a good professor, but she does assign a lot of homework and reading. She's a tough grader and sometimes the instructions are not super clear, but if I'm confused, I can always reach out to Professor Terry and schedule a meeting to discuss my issues/confusion and resolve it. Overall not a bad class, and I'd probably take it again.

terry is actually the worst professor i have at thusfar at ucsc. the workload is absurd & everything is graded on pass/no pass except for 2 papers. her feedback is unclear and unhelpful. she literally copy and pastes feedback from one essay to the next, word for word. could talk forever about how terrible and frustrating this class is. DO NOT TAKE.

She relies heavily on her weekly assignments, which are long and repetative. She doesn't give very clear feedback and shows a lot of bias when reading assignments, as in something will be acceptable for one students paper and not the others. She gives really long and overwhelming instructions but they don't really make her expectations clear.

Deciding to withdraw (for the first time) from this class because she truly is so terrible. Terry does not give any sort of constructive criticism. She once commented "I don't know what this is, but delete it" under an assignment. She gives out lots of homework, I want to say 2-3 big writing assignments a week (out of 4-5 writing assignments).
VERY WORK HEAVY for an online class. Work is also toughly graded not leaving out any details and she doesn't help on how to fix errors. DONT TAKE IT.

VERY WORK HEAVY. They are also a very though grader though with every last detail. Taking this for writing 2 requirement and it's proven more difficult than any of my in-person class. This class gives out so much more work than any other I have taken and its online. -_-

I know that the online course may be enticing, but DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Take the in person one. Almost all assignments are based off of a pass / no pass system, and she will grade things no pass with little to no reason.
