You will have no understanding of what grade you will achieve because of this. Enrolling in this class was the a mistake.

The workload for this course was very manageable and pretty average for a writing class. P/NP on assignments, letter grade on 2 big assignments determines your grade. She gave us 4 weeks to write these assignments and we submitted for feedback every week. I don't see why you can't earn an A in this class if you listen to feedback and talk to her.

Professor Wong is an amazing professor. She absolutely cares for her students and wants them to excel in her course. She divides the class into groups of 7 for group assignments. There are 10 weekly assignments, including 3 major projects. I wanted an amazing Writing 2 experience, and Professor Wong made that happen.

Honestly, it was a great and easy class. You are split into groups and you work with your croup on weekly assignments for the entire quarter. Only 10 assignments, 3 of which are essays and some of them are peer review / discussion posts.

Excellent feedback, lots of work (two small assignments due every other day) but she graded kindly. Class was all online which was freeing. Assignments could be vague but as long as you showed improvement or effort you could get an A. Learned a lot and my writing improved significantly. Has helpful instructive videos to augment classes.

If you are comfortable enough with writing, this class is an easy A. Professor Wong is incredibly kind, understanding, and a relatively easy grader, as long as you're mindful of run-on sentences and other grammatical syntax.

She is a wonderful teacher, provides amazing feedback and time to help you with any papers you have. She does give a lot of assignments a week, but I have been told that it is the case in all Writ1 classes! Would definitely recommend her!

Professor Wong set up a wonderful asynch Writing 2 course in Spring '22. She gave wonderful and detailed feedback, and was available for meeting when I needed help. She had lots of little assignments, but they helped me practice my writing and take a few moments to breathe each day. Good class if you're into writing.
Instructor Wong was an amazing teacher! She commented on all my assignments personally, which was nice because it was normally TAs. Lots of work, but it is manageable. Loved her class!

Professor Wong was an amazing professor for writing 1. She was very caring and actually interested in the student's academic and general life. There were lots of homework assignments (2-3 assignments every MWF), however, they were pretty easy and mostly just discussion posts, and 4 essays. She really helped improve my writing throughout the quarter
She is a harsh teacher, but it is ok to take her class. Take her class if you choose PNP. Otherwise, you need to work really hard to get a good grade.

There is quite a lot of writing as is expected of a writing class. If you aren't confident in writing. Go to office hours. Prof Wong always gives good feedback and is willing to help. I ended up doing bad on a paper but she helped me understand what I needed to fix. [canvas discussions, group projects, small writings,6 major assignments]

Tiffany Wong is one of the best professors I have ever had the pleasure of taking at UCSC. There definitely was a lot of writing due but she broke it down into manageable parts and offered extremely helpful feedback. She was also just extremely interesting and charismatic, which made lectures bearable. You will not regret taking one of her classes.

Prof. Wong is an excellent instructor. Although, I know I have serious grammar issues. She always gives me hints to help me improve. And, she is very caring about her student. Many of the works may be hard for us, but they did help us a lot. She is also available for the Zoom meeting if you have concerns. Nice to study with her.

Honestly, the best professor I've had at this school. I came into her class with poor writing skills and really didn't expect much from her. But when I got a 50% on my writing assignment I was pretty upset by that. I asked if we can have one on one sessions to help with my writing. In just a few weeks she has helped me advance my writing skills!

Did summer sesh with her. Superfast with grading, and she gives really good feedback on the papers. Workload can be somewhat demanding at times, but can't blame her for it as it's probably department criteria. The class comprises of many response-type assignments with a few essays and an 8+ pg. research paper at the end. Overall, a great professor.

Take this class with Professor Wong! She is truly amazing and incredibly kind. Yes, there is a bunch of writing, but it is a writing class, so that should not be a surprise. It is easy to do well in the course, just turn your work in, and she responds to emails quickly.

She's a very passionate professor. CRSN1 was very easy. She graded based on effort rather than content. 0 tests, 0 quizzes, and 0 papers. Multiple writing assignments but only 1 that required more than 2 pages of writing.

I'll be honest and say this class was a lot of work. Plenty of reading and writing assigned every class. However, I genuinely think I've improved as a writer. She is accessible outside of class and gives plenty of advice on what works and what doesn't in an essay. If you're willing to put in the work to improve your writing, take this class.

The workload is quite heavy throughout the quarter but it is very much doable. However, a lot of the work that was assigned seemed a bit unnecessary. The theme was Creativity and Mindfulness which alleviates the stress in comparison to other classes. I would not stress too much on the quality of work as a long it is relatively decent.

Definitely a rigorous class. The first few weeks are really intense, but the workload does ease up a bit. The theme of the class (Mindfulness & Creativity) definitely helped in making it feel less intense. Tiffany is extremely caring and it's clear she wants everyone to succeed. She is also very flexible with extensions for assignments. Great prof!

Show up to class. Do the work and show you put in some effort, and you will get an A. Her class is very intimidating in the beginning as the workload is a bit much, but how she grades isn't too difficult. As long as you're able to manage the work, you should get an A.

I genuinely did not learn a single thing in this course other than never take this professor. Long readings expected, only graded on three papers, a presentation, and "informal writing" in split: 15-20-30-10-25. Optional revisions but no original grade to help decide to revise or not. Guessing my overall grade even after course end (grades due tom)

Honestly, I had a hard time taking her criticism. On the bright side she knows the exact insight to give you on your essays and what needs to be revised. Readings are pretty interesting if you're into how writing can be manipulated into a more creative aspect. The end half towards essay 3, be aware of the work that can pile up. Lmao still possible.
Pretty chill class, 3 essays with a couple of small assignments in between that don't take a ton of time/effort. Nice feedback on essays.

I took her Writing 1 online class and liked it. There was a lot of reading but I got by just fine with barely skimming them. Some of the assignments didn't have super clear instructions but all you need to do is reach out and she'll explain. The assignments consist of a couple of discussion boards, a final presentation, and like 3 papers.

Roxi is so disorganized. Assignments are all over canvas, hard to find, and have confusing directions. I took her online, so that was incredibly detrimental. She also assigns a TON of long readings, most of which feel pointless. I will say that she gives great feedback, and encourages students to rewrite essays at the end, which was nice.

I would have never thought that when meeting this teacher would be a horrible experience I am not joking when I say that I cried when I meet her as when I was explaining my reasons for one of my essays she said " I will give you an F since you are taking a long time to give me an answer." She is passive aggressive and shows her favoritism

@ first I didn't like Roxi. the recorded lectures were so hard to watch: she read from a script and they were cringy honestly, but only had to watch a couple. assigned a LOT of work, but I ended up LOVING the readings and my essay writing improved so much. very understanding if you communicate, gives thorough feedback & i learned some great stuff

Roxanne can be very lenient/understanding, and she gives lots of useful feedback to improve your writing. Though, at times, she was just bluntly mean. Work isn't terribly overwhelming, but you'll have to stay on top of her novel-length announcements. Readings are well-chosen but she never lectures or explains them. She's an OK choice for WRIT2.

This class will make you a better writer without a doubt, but the journey is not very fun. The amount of readings were overwhelming and some times convoluted. Many of the readings and topics are interesting to learn about, but I constantly felt behind on work. Roxi is understanding and will grant extensions, she cares about her students.

Easily one of the worst professors I had. Always have a passive aggressive attitude making it clear she rather be doing something else than teaching. Unrealistic amount of busywork, completing all assignments on time and actively participate in every meeting for only a max B grade. If you value your GPA, avoid her course. Hardly learned anything.

Many are complaining, but I believe that's due to the amount of work. If you do what is assigned you'll succeed in this class. She is helpful in giving feedback,&is genuine in helping you improve&succeed. I had her for two classes and I feel like I only got better with each class. She is caring and passionate about what she does. Highly recommend

Assignment instructions are unclear, however she clarifies if you ask. Her classes are overloaded since she only teaches once a week, but she does upload lectures on yuja. She gives feedback on everything, even final drafts, so you have the opportunity to improve your writing skills. She will go through your essay, and give impactful comments.

Roxi is a very passionate professor who care about her students. Make sure you come to class having done the reading and ready to share some ideas. She gets frustrated when the class doesn't participate which is valid. She definitely helped me improve my writing and was available to meet with me personally and always answered emails quickly!

She can be extremely rude to her students. She assigns presentations and while someone is presenting, she cuts you off repeatedly. She doesn't make the classroom feel like a safe place to talk about interpretations of the text. She'll blatantly tell you you're wrong. I wouldn't recommend her for writing 2.

She is really mean to her students and make them feel bad for coming to class. She acts like a high school teacher, and has really difficult readings and rushed deadlines. She gets mad if you don't do one reading. A lot of oral presentations and cold calling. Please just take another class with a different professor.
Absolutely terrible, she was always so rude when giving feedback.

Roxi is one of the best teachers I have ever had. I feel that I learned so much from her as both a writer AND as a person. She is truly inspirational. There is a lot of reading and writing, but that is to be expected since it is a writing course. Material was incredibly interesting. Definitely take class from her if you have the opportunity!!!!

One of the best writing teachers I've ever had. Assigned a LOT of material but most of it was interesting so it wasn't that bad. Make sure to have basic knowledge of material before class. Essays were pretty flexible with the assignment and due date, had a great time writing them. Only problem was the timeline of essay due dates; they felt rushed.
Tries to cram too much stuff in too little time and space
She yelled at me for asking questions (questions that everyone had, keep in mind). Heavy on the reading!

Lots of reading outside of class, straightforward pop quizzes on the reading. Very little class was devoted to teaching about writing. Most of the learning happened in the required workshops. 4 major essays, pretty straightforward and manageable. Overall, he is a nice guy, but he can get passive-aggressive if he doesn't agree with you.

Highly encourage you to take Steve's class. He is so chill and lenient. Classes are discussion-heavy, even as a highly introverted person, but not bad. You have readings due before each class, and there are short quizzes on them, but they're not hard at all. There are so many opportunities for extra credit, and he gives great feedback on essays.

Don't take this class if you want a class that teaches you how to write. It's mainly in-class discussions with a few essays in the background. I found that when I expressed an opinion that was different than his, he became borderline aggressive and always got the last word (when my male friends disagreed with him they were met with praise)

Great guy and makes class engaging. Feedback on papers is great and understands that not every revision he proposes is objectively correct. Clearly respects each student and their opinion, even if they differ from his.
Overall he's a great professor. Super passionate and made class really enjoyable.

I took Writing 2 in Ireland. Professor Coulter is a fair grader and gives excellent feedback. He's also just an interesting, genuinely nice guy... his class was challenging in a good way, and the first class I felt engaged with at UCSC. If you have the chance, you should definitely take a class with him!

I took Writing 2 in Ireland. Professor Coulter is a fair grader and gives excellent feedback. He's also just an interesting, genuinely nice guy... his class was challenging in a good way, and he changed assignments if students felt swamped. Writing 2 was the first class I felt engaged with at UCSC. If you have the chance, please take it with him!

He's a really cool guy who genuinely cares about his students. He makes class fun with activities and gets us to engage with one another. He would hold class discussions that would sometimes turn into light-hearted debates. His office hours are helpful, and he's good to talk to if you have things going on. Overall, he's awesome.

There were readings due before each class and pop quizzes on the readings which were really straightforward. Steve made class fun, enjoyable, and interactive. The essays were fun and he holds mandatory office hours to help you go over your essays. He was really helpful and really cares about his student's success!

He was very invested in the class, making his prompts general to allow you a lot of room to make it personal. His office hours were beneficial and I developed many visual and creative writing skills because of it. Most of the lectures are open discussions, sourced from short quickwrites in class. Overall, the best English class I've ever taken.

Professor Coulter is a great professor! I looked forward to his class each week. We would have interesting discussions about real world events and he gives reliable feedback that improves your writing. Really awesome professor that wants you to succeed. Very considerate and understanding and provides lots of extra credit oppurtunities.

I took Steve Coulter's Writing 2 course in Ireland, and it was one of the best experiences I've ever had. Professor Coulter cared about our experience and wanted us to enjoy our time in Ireland while also making us better writers. I was never overwhelmed by assignments. If you are hesitant to take the study abroad in the summer, perish the thought.

Very easy class and a good professor. There are 4 doable essays throughout the quarter. You have to do a fair amount of reading outside of class. Attendance is a part of your grade. There are quizzes on the reading at the end of most classes.

I took Professor Coulter's class in Ireland as study abroad. I had an amazing time in Ireland and in the class. He really cares about his students, is very accessible, and gives good feedback. It is easy to get an A in the class as long as you read and take his  writing feedback. He wants you to have a good time and do well. Highly recommend.
Amazing, inspiring, and overall passionate energy. Open-minded and discussion-based class that made me truly enjoy writing! One of the best professors I have had!

I took Professor Coulter's Writing 2 class, specifically the study abroad program in Ireland. Not only was the trip amazing but Steve was such an amazing professor, he really wanted his students to better our writing and made sure of that. He understood we were also abroad and tailored the class to meet our needs in Ireland. Great Professor

Discussions are really interesting. The class uses a lot of peer review and peer grading. I took the class P/NP. Each essay has a required meeting with the class tutor and a meeting with the professor. You won't be able to see how well you are doing in the class except for weeks 4, 7, and 9 where he sends emails with your projected letter grade.

Steve talks a lot about how he doesn't care about grades which is nice and takes the pressure off. And it'll be no problem to get a good grade in the class if you just do the assignments. He also provided really good feedback on writing assignments which was super helpful. The class isn't hard but still got a lot from it. Also genuine, nice guy.

NO idea why people love him so much. He was unapproachable, and a stickler for writing rules. If you want more freedom in your work, I'd avoid him at all costs. BIG micromanager, has a pretty big ego too. I had a panic attack due to a discussion, and when I brought it up, he brushed it aside instead of listening and learning like he says he does.

FAV PROF AT UCSC! Easy A but also a very rewarding class. TRULY cares abt students & the subject he teaches. Doable workload compared to every other writ professor. Attendance mandatory (2 absences allowed) if u miss more there are makeup opportunities! Very fair grader, grades on effort rather than pure writing talent. Can't recommend him enough:)

This professor gave several time slots when she was available for us to do mandatory one-on-ones and then complained when people wanted to meet at the ones that were most convenient for them. During the call she blamed us for the fact she set up the time slots when she didn't want to talk to us.

Asynchronous, but MANDATORY teacher meetings, group meetings, AND TUTOR meetings (even if you don't need help you need to sign up for a grade). Prof is passive-aggressive but somewhat understanding if you have reasons for missing assignments. Essays and projects are simple but you learn nothing about college level writing.

Genuinely think she has agoraphobia and probably locks herself inside the whole day to grade assignments because wdym we have like 15+ assignments due every week. Like genuinely she expects you to put in like over 6 hours every MWF for this course as if college students don't have anything better to do? Girl get a life and get a grip on reality.

I'm disappointed we have a 350 word limit for this because I can write a whole novel on why she is the absolute worst professor. You don't learn in this class but there is so much homework, so tedious. Her Canvas is also formatted so complicated. I truly wish she would retire. Tired that professors like her are still approved and hired today.

For a writing class, we've only written one 500 word essay. And that will be the only paper we write apparently. Don't be fooled though, you'll have a billion homework assignments to do instead. Even as an asynchronous class, you are still required to attend office hours and tutoring. No your writing won't be improved. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

SHE IS SO ANNOYING. Her syllabus says there's a grace period for homework she locks certain assignments after 48 hours so don't underestimate the workload. The assignments aren't that hard but you will fall behind if you don't pace yourself, it's a lot of note-taking and discussions. You are also required to attend tutoring EVEN IF YOU DONT NEED IT
so much work for an online class. you have like 15 assignments every week, however she is kind of lit
I think this was a pretty easy course and the work load was fair given that we had no real lectures. She was a very understanding instructor who gave out grace periods.

Would 100% take this class again. She very sweet and understanding and will help you with anything in the course. Her feedback is always amazing and she is very easy going in terms of late work (but you should still try to do it on time before your grace period ends). Just efficiently do you work and attend office hours and you'll be fine.

Brenda is great but, as mentioned by others, the workload can get overwhelming. She accepts late work for a week after the due date on most assignments, which is necessary. You need to prioritize this class over your major requirements which is not normal for a writing course. She is very understanding and accommodating but be prepared to WORK

Professor Brenda is really a kind professor however the amount of work she assigns due MWF is unreasonable. 3-5 hours due each day. Crazy amount of work that could be avoided by taking a class in person - not worth the online class tradeoff.

She's a nice person and gives good feedback, but she gives way too much homework. The work is pretty easy, but very time consuming. Assignments are due 3 nights a week, most of which is just busy work. If you have a busy life/schedule, I wouldn't take her class.

This isn't an online class where you can lay low and unknown. There's conversations with her, tutors, and your group-mates. She makes it fun and easy to navigate. She was a very supportive, understanding, and kind professor. Gave lots of feedback and wasn't a harsh grader at all. Some projects can get lengthy, but her criteria is very clear.

Brenda's class was one of my favorites I have taken! I learned a lot of tools that will be useful in my future writing. She assigns a lot of work that can get overwhelming, but she is accepting of late work to a certain point which meant a lot. There is a lot of reading and writing to do, but the assignments are genuinely interesting and helpful!
The most kind and compassionate person to walk. Although she does give a substantial amount of work, she excepts late work throughout the entire quarter. Amazing person. I reccomend.

Professor Sanfilippo is a very kind teacher. Though, she gives excessive amounts of homework 3 days a week. She is very strict on making sure you turn everything in that is required. She makes you read a lot, be sure to have a lot of time on your schedule taking this course.

I had an amazing time in this class. The professor is extremely nice, and her feedback is very helpful. I would say this class has a lot of work and time that you have to put in, but it isn't overbearing. I think I learned a lot from this class, and I definitely have noticed my improvement over this course. Overall, an amazing professor.
Her assignments are all easy and relevant, she's a great teacher! she also gives good feedback! she's very understanding of students and cares about us passing her class and learning.

Wonderful professor. She is always an email away for any questions you may have. Yes, there is a lot of work but each assignment helps with the major project grades. Nothing is too hard as long as you use time wisely and sometimes those grace periods too.
Brenda is a great professor and very nice

If you need to take Writ2 don't take this class, especially online. The way she sets assignments up is that they're due at the end of the week, but there are so many parts to each assignment with multiple due dates, or you'll be doing MUTIPLE mini tedious assignment wrapped up into one (2-3 a week). She's very nice but the workload is a joke

super super course heavy. be prepared to respond to the same discussion post a total of nine times in one week, and have an assignment due essentially every day. aside from that, it's pretty easy to keep up with the class, just make sure to stay on top of the assignments.

Absolutely evil amount of work given. This alone makes her one of the worst and least considerate teachers I have ever come across. NEVER TAKE HER CLASS. She has no consideration for the fact that people have things to do outside of her class. She assigns so much bs busywork that the quality of your writing will suffer because of her class.

There is a LOT of work, but very easy to manage. Assignments are due almost every day. However, the assignments are very helpful to prompt thinking for upcoming projects. Additionally, they add up to a hefty grade cushion. She is also very forgiving when it comes to external circumstances impacting classwork.

She gives no hw detail but nitpicks everything you turn in. I repeatedly asked for confirmation on group projects work/ideas, we still got points marked off in EVERY category. I almost got a B in a class unrelated with my major. Don't take her class unless you want to beg your way to a full score on assignments daily. She's also very disorganized.
The class is mandatory but boring, not at the fault of the professor. She is really kind and gives incredible feedback on every single assignment, no matter how small.

Taking the async course currently, the level of work assigned in this online course is insane. The reading is not very intresting and the 1-3 weekly discussion posts (with peer comments) on top of the SEVERAL writing assigments is extremely stressful. I feel only frustration for her harsh grading and overall worthless feedback I have received.

But her materials are very confusing and make little to no sense. She adds projects last minute. Her instructions are confusing and wordy. Additionally, her grading style consists of + and -, which is not accurate. She is quite slow in class and her classes don't always have a clear goal. Additionally, her assignments are a lot of busy work.

Took async online. Had to complete a lot of work on your own. Read a writing handbook and a book which was a collection of essays, 1 chapter a week for both books. There are about 1-3 short writing assignments and 1-2 discussions every week. There were 2 major essays with first+final drafts. We got decent feedback on almost every assignment.
She is a very nice and understanding professor. However, there are points throughout the course where she assigns a large amount of work. It can be overwhelming at times.
Very understanding but I didnt like the class.

Sarah tried her best at teaching and I really appreciate that. But, most of the time in my core class it felt rushed and I never really learned anything through her. I learned most of the stuff through the books she assigned us to read. Was very unorganized and unclear with most of her instructions.
Great professor, mentor and human being! She has been one of the most impactful educators in my life.
She skipped classes more than the students did.
The communication is great between the teacher and student. You won't have trouble as long as you are on top of things.

Genuinely a very nice person. Sara-Hope is also willing to help you in and outside of class and will also make accommodations if you cannot turn in an assignment on time. Essays are not too long except the final but she gives you plenty of time. A lot of the work in class is busy work, though.

Sarah hope is a wonderful writing teacher. She is very eager to help students outside of class. There is some work, but there is in most writ2 classes, and she will definitely help you improve your writing.
GREAT PROFESSOR. WILLING TO HELP OUTSIDE OF CLASS.
Super nice teacher. Very sweet and is always willing to help you out. Only drawback is that she gives a ton of HW. Nonetheless, you learn a lot.
Nice person, interesting discussions, but it's as if she thinks we have nothing better to do than churn out 4-5 papers a week just for her class.

This was the Oakes Mentoring, its pretty easy show up to class meet with mentees and get to know the mentees and reflect on each meeting. Also self reflections as "mid term" and "final". She's accommodating, just communicate with her. Readings aren't necessary, if it's important you will have time in class to read and discuss.

I took this course winter quarter and she was very understanding about if you needed extra time to turn things in, points wouldn't be taken. Class attendance is graded, mostly talk about how to deal with feelings and either assignment that was just due or will be due. Lots of small groups, pretty chill.

knisley is super nice and engaging. get ready to share a lot of personal stories and be engaged in her class, but she makes the subject very engaging and personalized. lots of great feedback. loved her class, would take it again.

She is a very good, very reliable, and very supportive teacher. She made an ordinarily boring class very fun. She is incredibly experienced and knowledgeable. The homework assignments were pretty easy; only about an hour of work per assignment was necessary. Overall, she is very good.

Knisely is great, she gives great feedback on your papers, and allows you to submit rough drafts of papers that allow you to get a good grade on the final papers. She makes a class about feminism interesting, inviting and motivating. She is one of those teachers I'd genuinely wanna hangout with cause she so cool.

I absolutely loved Professor Knisely as my core instructor. She demonstrates genuine care for her students, with check-ins at the start of each class and a flexible late work policy. It's clear she cares deeply about the material. Her class was reflection, article-reading, and discussion heavy, but she made it manageable and walked us through it.
I LOVED this class. It reawakened my love for feminism. Knisely is amazing and builds good classroom community.

my girl knisely rocks! lots of reading (3 assignments/week) but all super interesting and sunday's are movies. essays are written over ~4 weeks with multiple drafts, peer edits are really big with her. her lectures are sometimes long but shes super funny. be ready to talk! she fosters a great environment for convos, class vibes were immaculate

Knisely is such a good professor, she always checked in on us and seemed to really care about how we were doing. She led some really interesting discussions during class and encouraged us to be social with each other. I met a lot of cool people in that class and we all loved her. Would take again in an instant, hopefully will for Writing 1.

Oakes 1 is an easy class on its own but taking it with Knisely felt less like a college class and more like a respectful discussion with peers. Her vocabulary can be colorful at times which to me is pretty funny. She's very caring about people's situations and she focuses a lot on mental health. We read one book in her class so not much reading.

Knisley is an amazing teacher. The discussions in this class and her others were so good, offering up a lot of opportunities for sharing experiences in a comfortable setting. Definitely recommend taking her courses.

The class discussions alone are empowering and expand your mind. I am so happy that I learned about technology and how it affects us in our everyday lives. She is such an inspiring and respectful professor, I highly recommend taking her class if you have the chance!

Professor Knisely is outstanding! She cares so much about her students and really guides you through her class. The class is super organized and every week of the quarter is already posted on canvas the day the course begins. Essays (2) are split into small parts and lots of feedback is given, so getting a good grade is not too challenging. Great!

I have taken Prof. Knisely's WRIT 1 and OAKS 70 during the year of 2020, and 2021, and received grade A for the both courses. Prof. Knisely is a great professor, knows how to provide her students wonderful lecture, and she shows lot of caring toward to her students.

This was one of my favorite classes this past quarter. It's a two-unit class known as Oakes Poetry, where we read different poems in which we create our own and share weekly. Although our classes were through zoom I felt welcomed and she always made sure to check up on her students.

Professor Knisely actually cares about her students and the material she teaches. The readings and writings aren't that bad (200-300 words, 2x a week) and the discussions aren't bad either. We only had to write 2 papers this quarter and she actually gave good feedback. The only downside is mandatory participation!
kind and helps to make your work better, she actually reads what you write and gives good comments

Really nice. Understanding. For online, she isn't too much of a stickler on Zoom. Three assignments each week, of which have readings that are a bit much but you don't need to actually read it all--just pick key info.

She is such a great and friendly professor who wants her students to succeed. She is there to help you do well! She makes the class enjoyable and is a wonderful professor! I was in her writing 2 course so of course there is a lot of writing, but so long as you do the work you'll get a good grade.

Lindsay is hands down the best prof i've had at UCSC. She is a great professor and a great human. She engages with students on a personal level and integrates important themes in course materials. As long as you read, attend class regularly, participate and make a personal connection with her you will succeed in her classes!!

Kate is a very good professor, but the class is a LOT of work. There are many assigned readings, some with assignments, and 3 big writing assignments over the whole quarter. She uses contract grading with a B baseline, so to get above that you need to do extra work. I struggled a lot, but she wants you to succeed and meets students where they are.

Very good choice for WRIT2! I found her class to be fairly easy and engaging. The theme was environmentalism and we spent most of the quarter on a literature review on an environmental topic of our choosing, with a presentation and nature essay at the end of the quarter. The last ~3 weeks were stressful as there were 2 major assignments squeezed in

Not as much writing as you'd expect for a writing course--that said, not so much teaching of writing. Most of it comes from her feedback on your work. Class discussions, when people participated, made the class feel more engaging from its constant dullness. She does provides insightful feedback but is sometimes a bit rude/passive aggressive.

I love this teacher. She was incredibly funny, she would pop jokes every now and then and she was extremely helpful and cleared up any confusion with any assignments. She provided wonderful feedback and always introduced new ideas. She genuinely seemed interested in what the students brought to class so that was a bonus for me in my opinion.

Kate was really nice and understanding. Complete both class work and Above B work on time and you will get an A. Basically, it was graded on completion, tutoring sessions, and a final project (it took me 2 hours to finish the final project). Super chill and easy.

If you have issues outside of class and need an extension she'll give it but it can be confusing weather or not she cares. She's a good teacher, lectures can be boring and she takes attendance but it's not really part of your grade. There was this contract grading that was interesting but I don't know if I liked it, heavily focused on timeliness.

Kate is a great professor to take for writing 2. Her lectures were really thought out and well connected with weekly readings. Instead of writing many papers, we instead worked on one large paper all quarter and shared our findings in different ways such as an argumentative essay, a presentations, and posters. I also liked the group work!

Katherine Ross is alright. She definitely is a little passive aggressive but it's fine. The most annoying part of this class for me was honestly going to the lectures. The lectures were the most boring thing I have ever been to. Along with that, the grading was very annoying as it was "B grading" or whatever it's called.

Honestly this class was meh. The grading scale used was really weird and complicated.. We had "above B" tasks (on top of regular work) that if you didn't complete, wouldn't allow you to get an A. This included 7 half hour meetings with a tutor outside of class. Class itself was always beyond boring and lecture heavy, but nothing was learned.

Class was usually boring bc she tried to fill it all with discussion. I feel like she never taught us much. I liked some of our readings, but the homework was really time consuming. This class had the most hw out of all of my classes. Didn't feel like I learned a lot, but it was pretty easy to get a good grade.

Pretty mid. The class could be pretty boring, but some of the subject matter could be interesting at times. It will suck though if no one talks in class (discussion is a lot if it). Not bad not good. I think she tries at least.

Overall, I kind of thought her writing 2 class was meh. Let me put it this way, her writing 2 class is an EXACT copy of your CORE CLASS. The only good thing I would say is that out of all the writ2 classes, her's probably gives the least amount of hw. But she was kinda bias when grading my paper (i'm not the only one who thought this)

Very good teacher. Well organized, thoughtful, readily available outside of class. Gives good feedback on papers. Overall, there were 2 main papers in this class--an essay and a research paper. She gives a very clear syllabus and makes materials available, her class is very organized on canvas. Overall amazing teacher.

McCourt's writing class felt almost as if it were a high school class, pretty easy and straightforward, but she is a tough grader on papers which was annoying, she returned everyone's work with revisions, and asked for resubmission from the entire class.
Workload wasn't too heavy, and she grades by complete/incomplete! Really chill, and understanding and assignments/grades were easy to understand. Overall super sweet and would recommend!

This is quite an easy and laid back class. Everything is graded on whether it is complete or incomplete. All rubrics, grading criteria, and instructions are clear. Very minimal workload. Plenty of feedback is given for each assignment. Alex is generally very understanding and will allow for revisions. All I could ask for as a STEM major.

Extremely laidback and understanding. Feels more like a mentor than a professor, but in a good way. Tough grader, but the critic helps a ton! All of the homework was laidback, fun, but still challenging. Always learned something new in this class.

The class is graded complete/incomplete, and each missing/incomplete assignment drops your grade by HALF A LETTER. She's flexible on wording, effort matters most. My only issue was towards the end, I wasn't sure if something needed revision. It felt like I was submitting into a void and just hoping for the best. Keep a track and it shd be chill.
Super easy writing 2 professor, ended up making the big final assignment optional/extra credit. Did basically little to no writing for this class and still got an A!
I had last year, the guidelines for grading were very strict and she isnt clear about how you are graded

Professor McCourt uses a complete/incomplete grading system. Also, she lets you revise your work three times before the grade is final. She assigns a lot of work, but its manageable. She's pretty chill and understanding, but she has firm boundaries with final grades. Going to her office hours helped me a lot, too. If you do the work, you get an A.

I loved taking writing 2 with Alex. She changed my relationship with writing and how I think about revision and accessibility. She grades with a complete/incomplete system and gives you plenty of chances to revise. She really cares about her students and I felt so empowered in her class. She has high expectations but it will only help you later on

As you expect, there are a ton of writing involved, but all of the papers you write are on a computer, so it isn't that bad. Professor McCourt is a very chill teacher who is also nice, considerate, and very lenient. She understands your needs and how stressful school is, so she is lenient when it comes to homework. Her lectures are semi-fun as well

Alex was friendly and easy to communicate with in and outside the classroom, she is all there to support you in any way she can. We incrementally work on our final project the entire quarter, the lessons/lectures line up to the part of the project we are working on that week(s). The project is on whatever topic you choose, with easy certification!

Not sure why there isn't more reviews on this prof, but she is amazing! Took her class in fall as a first year and I absolutely loved it, she is very caring for her students. And her assignments are very straightforward plus fun. I love that she incorporates TikTok and gen z lingo in her lectures but not in a cringe way. TAKE HER CLASS!!!

Very few reviews on Professor McCourt, overall amazing professor. Lectures are easy to follow and are created to be funny and interactive. Most times you will be working in small groups in class, very few assignments apart from the one's due in class, fun projects, graded based on complete/incomplete, no midterm but final is a project.

Alexandra is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is genuinely so kind and caring and it was a blessing to take a class with her. She uses a complete/incomplete system so it's relatively easy to get a good grade. I would recommend her class over other writing 2 profs based on my friends talking abt workload.

Grades using complete/incomplete system, it's easy to get an A in this course. She has a 48-hour grace period to submit late work. Uses class time for lectures/small groups and is very laid back and caring. If you have a valid excuse to miss class, it works. You get 3+ weeks for your final essay. I loved her a lot, take her for writing-1!
Very nice teacher and assignments were graded by complete/incomplete. Will give you an extension if you ask. Also assignments were very clear on what to do.

Each assignment is graded as complete or incomplete and if it is incomplete, you have the opportunity to make it up and change the grade to complete. She is very understanding and a good lecturer. If you have the option I would 100% take the class!
Passionate and amazing professor who really cares for her students. She gives so much good feedback and really wants to help you succeed.

Super understanding, flexible, and helpful. Discussion posts are really tedious but they are easy and end up helping me more than I'd like to admit. Essays are graded in complete and incomplete, and you can get a chance to rewrite with feedback from her. As long as you put in effort you'll be fine. The best writ2 teacher imo!!!
one of the sweetest most understanding professors. you get a nice, thorough build-up to projects. take her or else !!

Professor Tina is amazing, she gives tons of feedback even for the smallest assignments. You go through 5 projects, but you have a lot of time to write drafts, receive feedback, and turn it in. There are LOTS of opportunities for extra credit and she's always willing to help. You are required to meet with the tutor 3 times, but she's also helpful.

Projects were very manageable, you could definitely get them done in a couple days if you focused enough. Hands down my favorite writing class out of all of the ones I've taken. Tina gives great feedback and the projects were very straight forward, and we had a lot of time to do them.

I do not think there is a better professor for writing one than this one. I have no negative comments to say and she really tries to get to know the students, even giving them nicknames. She is super caring and compassionate and the workload is totally manageable.

I enjoyed Tina's class a lot! Assignments were direct yet open-ended so you could pick a topic that interests you. Deadlines were intuitive and fair. She also prefers a hybrid approach so I ended up only having class once a week! Ultimately, Tina is very willing to work with you and I don't have any criticisms! Note that she prefers

Tina is one of my favorite teachers I've had. She did our WRIT 1 class in a hybrid style and she was certified in online teaching before COVID even started, so the online portion of our class was highly enjoyable. We only met once a week in person and she was so engaged and entertaining when we did. She puts in so much care and effort!

Professor Osborne really cares about her students and often gives really good feedback. The projects were pretty easy and there are a lot of peer reviews throughout to help you focus on them. Class becomes helpful if you participate.

I enjoyed this class greatly. I was nervous for writing 2 as I am not a writing major at all but it was not bad at all. My only complaint was lots of small assignments that add up greatly in 1 week. These assignments are easy just time consuming. Also weekly quizzes on readings but thye are easy

Prof is a critical grader but gives good feedback and notices improvement. Work is manageable, my only complaint is a lot of it felt like busy work.  Prof puts lots of effort into class and getting to know each student. Overall would recommend to fulfill the GE.

Professor Osborne is very passionate about her profession and it shows! She is very understanding and wants all her students to succeed. She does a really great job of organizing the class in such a way that gets students engaged and interested in the course.

I loved this professor so much. My class was asynchronous and anytime we turned something in or chatted in the discussions, she was so attentive and would respond very quickly. She graded your assignments very fast and is always there it help you. I just felt very supported and also this was an easy going class. Overall, amazing.

This is an amazing writing class and by far my favorite. She's a wonderful professor and has clear grading criteria and lots of assignments but they're manageable. It's a lot of reading so brace yourself but other than that it's an easy class if you do everything correctly and on time. She gives extra credit for turning in assignments early too.

15 hours of work to do weekly and it's just a ton of little tedious assignments. You have at least 4 things or more to turn in on Tuesday of which could be group projects stacked on top of regular projects, discussions, and peer reviews. I would show my work load to my friends and every response would be "no writing class should be like this.

Easily my favorite professor/teacher so far. I haven't had a class structured and taught so well. Everything was easily accessible and it was so well organized . She also made it super engaging/approachable and I found myself participating much more than normal classes where I would be scared to death to participate.

The sweetest person alive. Flexible and understanding. Too many good things to say about her :). In terms of the course, as long as you keep yourself aware of the deadlines you should find it quite simple.
Very helpful professor. Gives great feedback and plenty of extra credit opportunities. A lot of freedom to pick your own partners and topics for projects.

Prof Osborne really did her best to make sure the grading was clear and fair. Weekly discussions, quizzes, and 4 major group projects are what you're graded by. She provides a lot of extra credit opportunities throughout the quarter that you should have no problem getting an A if you put in the effort. Highly recommend taking writing with her.

This was Professor Tina's first time teaching writing 2 and she did a good job organizing the class. There are 4 major projects and weekly discussion boards that regard the readings. She is very organized and clear about expectations. Zooms were optional so it was asynchronous. She is a tough grader, but respects effort more than anything.
Awful with technology and doesn't respect the students' time. Took forever to get the assignments graded.

While not a challenging class literally at all, Prof Abrams just makes your life hard. I took this class literally 3 months ago and still have not received my final grades on more than half of the assignments I completed in this class including my midterm and my final paper. So much emphasis on attendance for no respect in return.
Professor made most of the assignments worth zero and also didn't have us do the presentation at the end unlike the other jrlc professors. 10/10 you should take her for JRLC

For the core course, she is extremely light. She is so focused on her writing classes that she sometimes forgets to assign homework or even reading. Almost the entire quarter was a pass/no pass class. She never grades assignments and everything is super free. It will feel overwhelming in the beginning because she assigns work right before it's due.

If you can get another professor, you should. She has no idea how technology works and has graded none of our assignments (its finals week). She rambles in class on information that its either barely related to the material or not at all relevant. Shes late to class almost every day and holds us after to explain assignments she forgot.
horrible teacher

I've been in her class for 2 weeks and she makes everything extremely difficult. She does not know anything about technology and in 2020 there was a review posted saying she doesn't post assignments. I can assure you she doesn't. Her lectures are extremely confusing, and she isn't clear with her instructions or deadlines.

She is a very bad teacher, avoid her class at all costs. heavy on participation and even forces the students to popcorn each other. assigns lengthy homework late and expects it to be turned in on time. homework assignments will require a good chunk of time.
She was incredibly disorganized and would assign homework halfway through the weekend.

Doesn't care about her students whatsoever. Would rather have someone retake a class for a graduation requirement rather than help her students become better. Avoid her classes at all costs and good luck getting a C when she posts the project the day before it is due and is insanely unclear about her expectations. Horrible woman!!

Not good with technology. Won't respond to help with classwork. Marks every minute you are late. Unclear in what she expects in projects. Horrible teacher that agreed to let me make up work, in which I submitted it back to her and she never responded again much less change my grade. Doesn't care about her students at all. Avoid her classes.
Worst woman I have ever met. AVOID HER CLASS SHE WONT PASS YOU OR WORK WITH YOU

I had a horrible year with Ms. Abrams because of her "technical difficulties" where she forgot to publish the homework until the day it was due. I did not pass the Writing requirement and she AGREED to help me. I made up a project for her, did the work and she didn't respond ever again or change my grade and I put effort into the class and attended

required book was found online. 4 papers with learning exercises in between. Not too difficult honestly. Abrams is really nice and respectable. She gives really good feedback and I recommend talking to her if you need help. Class could get awkward if you dont speak but if you do (and you read the brief readings) then it'll go by fast.

If you are interested in journalism, then this is the class for you. Honestly, take it pass or fail because it makes you focus on actually writing instead of getting the paper done just to do it. Also, this class has been great. I have definitely grown as a writer and I owe it all to Professor Abrams. She's a great person; she's super sweet.
She is absolutely a good teacherShe  is patient and helps me a lot

There are essays due every week along with readings of the course. She does have a tendency to post homework assignments late causing one to stress out especially if there is other coursework. I honestly did not learn anything in this course. Writing an essay is not a critical-thinking tool, it's regurgitating what we read. Class is hypocritical.
I love Eliz!!She is super cool!!!
A wonderful woman and a fantastic teacher-super approachable and really willing to help each individual student.

Teacher requires a great deal of writing, but not always essays. Had her Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and had an assignment due almost every day. Each assignment was about half-hour of writing after the reading (if reading was required for writing) Tutor session requirement. Sometimes homework not get posted until a day before due. Take at own risk.

By far the best writing teacher I've had. She absolutely loves helping students with their essays. Lots of peer review and she leaves good feedback. She also loves talking about common interests. There is a good amount of homework but its better than other profs. Her assignments and papers can be a bit ambiguous but she'll clarify if you ask.

If you are a math/science minded person, please do NOT take her class, I beg you, you will NOT get along. Participation is key for her so you MUST go to her classes or she will fail you. She gives horrible feedback/instructions and no rubrics as the year goes on so be ready to totally guess at what she is expecting from your work.

If you are a math/science minded person, please do NOT take her class, I beg you, you will NOT get along. As long as you participate things are okay. However, as the year went on the instructions got less and less clear and when I asked her for help she would explain things in the most unhelpful round about way possible.

Class was quiet, but when I spoke with her, she really lit up! Tips: engage with her and ask questions—she cares about her students. Homework feels pointless, but skipping it adds up. Grading was fair, and the class itself was easy, though a bit boring. Overall, an okay experience if you put in the effort to become a better writer.
DONT TAKE WRITING 1 WITH HER!!!! Shes such a hard grader and assigns SO much homework its unbelievable. Shes incredibly nice but super tough.

Her grading policy is ridiculous. Didn't receive an actual letter grade until AFTER finals. Insanely tough grader. All my essays received Cs, even after it was looked over by tutors from the writing center.

Amis is a nice professor, but her grading is completely ridiculous. You are unable to see what grade you have until after finals. The only way to find out is through looking at your rubric and making assumptions. She also never specified her attendance policy so none of us ever knew if we were penalized for that. Class is hard to engage with too.

Amis is a cool professor. I had her in the Fall of 2023. She is friendly and supportive and will allow you to make up work if needed. I received pretty good scores on my papers (I am waiting to receive my grade for my final paper). Only downsides are her unclear instructions and that you will not receive a grade until the end of the quarter.
Just poor

Be ready to do a lot of useless in class work with other people and add it to a folder that she probably doesn't even look at. 4 projects total I think that are all connected and somewhat easy, but you're not given a specific grade on them. You dont find out your grade until after finals but you can kinda deduce it based on your project grades.

Honestly not the best lecturer, but she teaches. Definitely is pretty nice, and the course work she does make you do is necessary. Pretty mid, not bad not great. I learned from it. YOU WILL NEVER KNOW YOUR GRADE UNTIL AFTER FINALS

She is a good teacher and gives great feedback on all of the work, which is only about 4 main projects that are not too hard. The class is a bit boring, but she is a super nice woman and very caring about any issues you may have. She wants to get to know her students, Definitely recommend!

Professor Amis gave 0 progress report throughout the quarter. I was never made aware of my grade and overall learned nothin gin this class to take with me. I couldn't even recall a single assignment if I wanted to. Best way to describe her is as a see you next Thursday IFYKYK anywayyy don't take any classes with her, much hate, Charlie Delgado UCSC

I loved maggie, she was very personable and never even asked students to turn on cameras, very understanding if you are just in contact. I actually ended up improving my writing a lot during this course, decent workload but nothing too crazy. I would take her for writ2 if I could 100%.

The class wasn't too difficult, but I thought it had a lot of busywork. It was on zoom and I would rarely be able to pay attention. She is nice but it just wasn't a very interesting class. She is a relatively easy grader and was understanding when I had to miss class or turned stuff in late.

She's a good teacher! The only frustrating thing about the class is that we don't know our exact letter grade for the whole quarter. I think we're probably going to get it once the quarter is actually over. She likes to make conversation with her students and engages with us.

The professor is an incredibly tough grader that doesn't explain what she is expecting or wants. She also doesn't provide grades until you see your final grade. Also she gives a lot of useless busy work that doesn't help at all. Overall just not a great class or teacher.

A horrible writing professor. She forces us to do live presentations at the end on zoom which makes no sense for a writing class. Would not recommend to anyone unless you want a bad grade for some reason.

You don't know your grade until the end of the quarter. If you don't write like one of the greatest writers in the world, good luck trying to get an A let alone a B. Extremely tough grade although she has such a fun personality, she has a hidden hatred for honoring her students' work.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. Constantly call on you in class. I understand wanting everyone to participate but forcing people to engage in a topic they're not too sure about is just annoying and everyone dreads it. Talks way too much yet never manages to explain anything thoroughly. ALSO A TOUGH GRADER. 0/10 recommend

Angel. Restored my faith in humanity. The type of teacher who wants to lift you up and help you become the best version of yourself. You are in good hands with Dr.Lisa and she will be there for you in any way you need. A memorable experience and one to be cherished forever. Do yourself a favor and welcome this angel into your life.

I love prof Schilz. Her class was chill but also useful. She teaches us about how to find effective and trustworthy sources. We were not forced to write tons of essays; we got to explore different writing genres and conventions. Her grading system is great and gives you a chance to revise. 10/10 prof, cares abt her students a ton.
Love this professor, take her for writing 2. So sweet and easy A. Totally improved my writing skills.

She uses contract grading which takes out a lot of the stress personally. The late policies were super fair especially for someone who needs it. I learned a lot and the projects were actually really fun!

Lisa is very caring and kind, the lectures are pretty short and there are a decent amount of assignments but they don't take very long. All assignments are graded complete/incomplete and can be regraded with no penalty for up to a week after the due date. The rubric is clear on what you need to meet to get an A, very doable take her for sure.

Nicest teacher ever, getting an A is super achievable. Your progress is only compared to your own and not to others, and her grade scale is complete/not complete, rather than A-F. Assignments due before every class, and attendance is graded. Super chill teacher and good class
Great professor

Assignments were due MWF, assignments were graded on a complete/incomplete basis. Professor Lisa is amazing, very caring, and gives great feedback on assignments. She really wants you to succeed in this class, I took this class async online and she was reachable via office hours. Would definitely take again

Very generous and caring professor. We had a lot of work to do every week but everything is graded complete/incomplete so you'll get credit as long as you put in effort. You also have the opportunity to redo assignments that aren't up to par (for full credit). 1 week grace for all late assignments. Easy if you put in the work and utilize resources.

LOTS of homework. when i say lots i mean lots, its easily 10-15 hours of work each week and while there aren't toooo many assignments (maybe like 6-7 a week) they def take a long time to do so be prepared. she is a nice prof tho and allows a 1 week grace period for assignments

Lisa is a sweet and knowledgeable writing professor! She gives 3-4 writing assignments weekly but her criteria is incredibly clear. She gives valuable feedback after each assignment. Do not get behind on the journal entries! You do assignments as complete/incomplete and do an additional project for an A at the end (optional). Would highly recommend

Lisa's great! There was quite a few assignments due every week and mandatory group workshop meetings, but they were beneficial. Assignments are graded leniently. She even changed our last unit to revision since she thought we needed more help with analysis. Don't be afraid to reach out to her as she loves to help her students.

There are assignments due M,W,F and can get a little heavy sometimes. She grades very leniently and is so understanding. You'd be surprised how much she genuinely cares for the student's well-being. Assignments are based on complete/incomplete, do the extra assignments for the A! I absolutely loved this class, it revolves around jane the virgin btw

Need an easy WRIT 1 teacher? Take Lisa. We had 2 major writing assignments and 1 final (a project where we pick a genre and produce something like others in that category) but all 3 of them were graded leniently. I am glad to have taken this course with her. Very accessible outside of class and gives feedback on almost everything.

I love this teacher so much. She makes me wants to cry. By far the easiest and most caring teacher out there. Literally gave us a whole week of break just to catch up and you can literally talk to her about anything. I'm still unsure of my grade but it doesn't matter because I genuinely enjoy her as my teacher. By far the best, hands down.

Prof. Schilz is amazing! Her lectures were very informative. The work modules we had to do every week really took you step by step into the writing process (and actually made it fun) and I felt that it was easy to understand. Take Schilz if you ever get the chance!

Super caring professor, made writing 2 fun and you actually learn. She always makes comments on your assignments and is really helpful. Things were due Mon, Wed, Fri, and she'd give us a reminder every morning. She accepted late work and you can always ask for a 24hr extension, she's very understanding! Definitely recommend her classes!

I LOVE LISA. She's the first professor that I feel like I have a true connection with and she really does care about her students. Her feedback is so helpful and she pushes me to be a better writer. Definitely take writing 2 or any class with her if you can. Reading wasn't too bad, just get it done ahead of time so you aren't scrambling to finish.

Took her for Kresge 1, Writing 1, Writing 2. Amazing professor really cares for the success of her students. Lisa is straight forward abou what she expects from assignments. Took her for Kresge 1, and took her for the rest of my writing courses. I am a bad writer yet her class was extremely enjoyable. Would take her class again if she taught more.

Love her! Her class will definitely make you a better writer just through some amazing, very helpful feedback she gives. I learned more in her class in a quarter than I ever have in my 4 years in high school. Participation matters but it's required to get the most out of the class. Pretty underrated honestly.

sweet and kind english teacher. Very boring. Very vague instructions, very vague rubric for the papers as well.She isnt grading you on improvement of your papers, your paper is graded based on her expectation of you as a student.3 big project papers and lots of little homework every day on the side. Miss one day of hw and you will fall wayy under.

She's a really sweet and supportive professor, and was very accommodating about extensions for me. Her grading criteria is EXTREMELY clear and it's also pretty fair. Some of the work she assigned really felt unnecessary for the MANY hours it took to complete. Solid WRIT 2 prof tho. Just keep up and follow her helpful feedback, and you'll be fine :)

The class I took was half online asynchronous and half in-person. The in-person lecture was frankly useless. We barely spent any time talking about instructions or course materials.  She says multiple times that she prides herself on transparency, yet her assignments have the longest descriptions that don't help us. Do not take Writing 2 with her.

An amazing teacher and breath of fresh air. I would maybe spend an hour a week on hw, so if you kept up with things little by little the work is very manageable. Very generous grader, good feedback. She is a great human you can tell she cares and puts effort into what she doesn't because she loves it. I'll miss her.

Took WRIT 1 as a hybrid. While the course is workload-heavy, Susannah is a very kind and accommodating professor. Many reading and writing assignments, but the prep feel like busy work. Big papers will sneak up on you if you don't manage your time well. Overall, grading is pretty fair, and she's very understanding and helpful if you reach out.

WRIT-1: Overall was a good teacher. The workload was not crazy, but at times became stressful due to papers being every other week. Very lenient on late work and make-up assignments for major projects.

Be ready for heavy work load. Says that the work load is normal for a college student but none of the courses I have taken gave that many assignments in a week to complete. Claims to be mindful about your other courses but isn't. She will increase the already heavy workload. You might end up spending more time on her class than one for your major..
Loved this class, the projects are unique and gave me a good intro to UCSC.

Held mandatory weekly meetings even though the class was supposed to be asynchronous. Loads of reading and writing, 2-3 large assignments weekly. Was never actually taught anything about writing better in this class; pretty much just lots of busy work and essays. Never got any feedback on anything. Does not accept late work.  AVOID THIS PROFESSOR
a lot of pointless assignments and there is a mandatory group zoom meeting even though the class is supposed to be asynchronous

Worst professor I've ever had. Extremely out of touch workload that is 4x the work of an upper division Sociology class I took this quarter. All busywork. No late work acceptance. Doesn't update important grades until end of quarter so I couldn't do any assignments that I didn't know I needed to pass because all assignments are closed. AVOID.

I am going to be quite honest, this professor gives far too much homework for an intro to writing class.
The fact that you need to write 800 words of a diary every day just to earn an A is absolutely ridiculous. 

Many of my peers agree with me, the workload is unnecessarily long and does not help out the student in any way.

Ray was a great professor, he really cared that you did well in the class and was always there to help. However the class was really assignment heavy, about 3 things due per week. But the assignments were fairly easy just a lot of busy work.
Really disappointing class, very assignment heavy but mostly just busywork. Felt like a high school study skills class

The professor was lenient in how you wished to pursue your work but the work was extremely tedious and boring. Workload is severe. The professor is out of touch with the actual goals of the class and why people take it. Its a forced class. With a forced professor. Professor just power hungry. Stay clear of this professor.

Asynchronous Writing 2 class. He's really nice & helpful. He's very accessible if you need help. 1 major project broken into 4 parts & lots of mandatory supplemental work (easy though). Easy to pass as long as you put in some effort. It's an easy class, but you have to put in the work and do all the small assignments. Lots of writing invloved.

I love professor Daniels! Very friendly, somewhat heavy on assignments, and a bit of a tough grader, but evidently cares about their students and gives thorough feedback. Also, available after class hours very often.

I really liked Rays class, he cares about his students & does want you to pass. Ray gives lots of homework so you do have to work. It wasn't hard though & Ray was always accessible out of class to help you. You can tell he cares about his students & their writing. Don't expect this class to be an easy A, but its not that hard if you work for it.

I knew WRIT2 would be a lot (A LOT) of work, and I'm glad I was able to do it remotely during COVID quarter. Ray gives great feedback and is very responsive to unforeseen circumstances with students (AKA will be lenient if necessary). I definitely feel like Ray's syllabus worked out to make me and my peers better writers at the end of the course.

My writing has improved so much from taking this class. I started the class bitter about not passing the ELWR but left a better writer. Ray gives incredible feedback during one on one meetings and assigns meaningful readings and prompts. The only downside is that you won't know your grade for the class until the quarter ends.

Tough Grading, make sure you are PNP. Lots of homeworks. Very useful feedbacks, if you just work a bit hard you will DEFINITELY pass ELWR. She is friendly and willing to help, just go to her office hour for as many times as you can.
Nice person, a little bit too much homework with tough grade. But he always give some useful tips
Strict in homework and attendance.
I can learn a lot from her class with much homework!

Despite the topic of the class being interesting, I was bored to literal tears. She uses pop quizzes to force attendance, the projects are dragged out, and she is incredibly nitpicky on assignment completion criteria. You physically can't check your grade with how her scheme works. I asked her what it takes to get an A and she dodged the question.

Writ2 with her was great, she gave me very constructive and detailed feedback. This coupled with her readings about how to be a better author really helped me see how my writing could improve. She was really kind and understanding about extensions, and even had a 24 hr penalty free late deadline. A good bit of readings and hw, but very manageable.

I took Erica for Writing 1. It was online this winter quarter but I seriously loved her. As a freshman, I haven't had too many good professors yet and she was the first one whom I genuinely enjoyed. She is seriously so nice and really cares for her students. It is a bit of work but she was just a really good teacher. I loved her!!!

The way she grades is hard to understand making you unsure the whole class what your grade is, its really stressful and hard to know when to ask for help. She gives incomplete on assignments even if they meet the basic requirements. Then you have to rewrite them while doing tons of other homework. Her lectures consist of her reading long quotes.
Erica expects you to really learn a lot in her class. If you work hard, you are gonna become a strong writer. But if you don't work hard enough or skip classes, Erica would be a pretty tough grader.

Helpful class. Gives great feedbacks on all your assignments. However, the feedbacks can be long and tough since you could be expected to add two more paragraphs and what not. The class itself is heavily student discussions and participations. EXPECT TO HAVE A LOT  OF READING AND WRITING. She really makes you work it. HARD to get an A. Easy B tho

There was no textbook but you are required to print out the readings. Five essays for the whole quarter. Grading was fair. Very easy teacher, but then again, writing comes easy for me. Subject: Killing TV was really interesting, saw a few episode clips in class. Enjoyed it very much.

I loved this professor so much! There is a fair bit of writing assignments, including on the weekends, but they're typically not to hard. She is very kind and accomodating. The essay's are super egaging and fun to write!

Kae is genuinely the most caring and accommodating professor I've ever had at UCSC. She cares so deeply about all her students and she gives you a lot of freedom with projects. She offers SO MUCH extra credit, if you try at all you'll get a great grade. Homework has basically no deadline if you talk to her before. TAKE HER CLASSES!

Lots of reading and busy work assignments. The topic was interesting but a little out of my normal media consumption so it was a little difficult to do some of the themed assignments. The projects have a good amount of creative freedom but the prof tried to reroute some of my projects because I wanted to do my own thing. A little annoying but fair.

Super fun class with insane amounts of creative freedom. This class pushes you out of your comfort zone (in a good way) and will truly make you into a better writer. I think a bit more critique on assignments would be beneficial, but at the end of the day, she's an amazing professor and I'd highly recommend her.

Great instructor, they put in so much work to their class structure and responding to all students. You can tell that they just care a lot. Not a huge work load at all, just some chill readings and responses M/W/F. Suuuper understanding late work policy, and 3 fun large projects. You can't go wrong with this instructor!

She was ok. Had her for both WRIT 1 and WRIT 2. Lots of little homework assignments/time wasters. About 3-4 bigger projects. She was kind of difficult to listen to sometimes, not very interesting and engaging. She is a pretty easy grader as long as she sees that you're putting effort into your work. SO many little readings assigned with homework.
Absolute loved this professor for my writing 1 class. The lectures were helpful and the projects were manageable. Definitely recommend her as a teacher!

Roybal is one of my favorite professors at UCSC. She cares about her students. Extremely accommodating with extensions if you ask. You are always guaranteed at least an 80 if you turn in the assignment on time. 
Theme: retrowave - pretty interesting and easy compared to other themes
Participation: mandatory, Friday class was online watching a movie

Such a great professor! So kind and understanding, makes Writing 2 really interesting and fun. Smaller assignments basically just graded on completion, and super fare on the 3 big projects. Take this class for a fun and easy Writing 2 experience!!!

She was a really great professor, in fact, one of the best if not the best I have had here at UCSC so far.  I think her way of teaching and her very kind demeanor really changes the game.  Attendance is mandatory but the class is cool so it's okay.  Projects and assignments are really fun and creative. You're lucky to have her.

I loved this class, being a STEM major, it was a nice break from my other classes. She is really chill and understanding. A couple of assignments throughout the week, but very manageable. Papers are graded really easily, her whole thing is your writing is who you are, so if you answer the prompt you're good. Really recommend.

Kristin was a very kind and caring professor. She is a relatively young professor, and she knows the needs of students well. She was especially accommodating to people with anxiety. Also, the lectures are a little boring and there are a lot of little assignments, but it was pretty easy to stay on top of my work.

Kristin is kind and a relative easy grader, but she often turns what should be a simple explanation into a very boring and rambling lecture. Her feedback is also not very detailed, I got about 2 sentences for a multi page essay. Not to mention with how much she micromanages attendance and participation, she should frankly be a high school teacher.

This was by far one of my favorite professors in my three years of schooling here at UCSC. Professor Roybal was super involved and caring in each of her classes. She does an amazing job at keeping everyone engaged as this is a core course but she tries to make sure the lectures aren't boring. She gave great feedback and helped me pursue writing!

She is a great professor.  She carefully reads each student's assignment and gives constructive and supportive feedback.  I feel my writing really improved during this course.  Be sure to keep up on the assignments as they add up over time.  There is clear direction provided with each assignment so if you keep up on your work, you should be okay.

Professor Roybal is a great professor. She grades well and makes the class easy and fun. I had two assignments per week and plenty of time to finish it but make sure you don't miss any deadline.
I would definitely take her class again if I could!

I loved her and this class! I usually hate English because I am not very good at it and usually English teachers are very confusing with grading, but Kristin is super clear and understanding. She gives you feedback on every assignment and supports you throughout the class. Overall the best writing class and writing teacher I have ever had!
She is a great teacher, very accommodating, super nice, and she lets you express yourself when you write!

Philip is a good teacher, if you need help outside of class he is available and is allways filled with good advice. My one problem was that sometimes assginmnet instructions where unclear and abit confusing. I often had to email him to get some clarification on what he was looking for in a assignment.

Phil is a lovely guy. His writing 2 class online is pretty easy going and most assignments are pretty much graded on completion, but the essays are a little tough. If you don't ever expect to ever get over an 80 on your papers then you'll probably like this class.

Extremely rude and never listens, and very hard to communicate with, which is pretty ironic considering the class he's teaching. Some people need to look in a mirror, do a little bit of self introspection, and realize that they are NOT important. You have a degree in some pyramid scheme major, you are NOT that guy, you will NEVER be.

Phil is a great prof. hes very caring and passionate abt writing and his students success. He has very strong (understandably) feelings on AI and is figuring out how to teach writing in a world ridden with AI. Super friendly - engaging classes each week had lot's of discussion. I'm not a great writer and I don't like writing. I enjoyed his class.

His Writing 2 class will make you a better writer across all practices, as he focuses on writing across all practices not just literature.
