Missing classes will definitely bite you even if not mandatory. He without a doubt cares about his students, but certainly comes off as a bit pompous. Give him a change, and it will be worth it.

Very organized but also the most passive-aggressive and unmotivational professor I've ever had. Although attendance is not mandatory he is horrible at explaining assignments via Canvas, so go to class so there are no miscommunications, he will not care if you are confused and blame you for everything. He is a know-it-all.
mad clutch that you don't gotta go to class. u prob should tho because I never knew what the assignments were asking bout unless I went to class, the classes were always pretty interesting anyways.
Somewhat tough grader and can be knit-picky with assignments, would definitely recommend going to office hours if confused on any of the assignments or receive an unwanted grade...

I want to warn anybody taking his class because he is an incredibly picky-grader and is rude. His class lectures are boring and feel like a waste of time. When I expressed my concern about his grading he insulted and blamed me for his faults. He will make your a quarter miserable and be prepared to be spending 10 hours on homework a week.
Dont take this class pick another teacher. He assigns so much busy work. He does not grade normally. I did not benefit from his class.

NOT TRYING TO THROW SHADE, but I think those who give him a bad grade are probably sensitive to feedback and probably dont like writing. I think his feedback is very helpful and he his class is actually easy. His grading was surprisingly light and willingly gives extensions when asked. My grade was a B+ cus I submitted everything late but its easy

I was nervous about taking WRT2 since I hadnt taken a writing class since high School but taking it with Phil Longo was so awesome. It was online, lectures were easy, fairly short (once a week, 10-20 minutes) and enjoyable. Assignments were lots of discussion posts and Minor/Major projects(basically midterms). Easy grading and gives extensions. 5/5

Gives feedback on EVERY assignment if you like that but if you are not a great writer, his feedback is harsh and super knit picky. He has made me feel terrible about work I've been super proud of. Gives 3 modules of work every week with each of them having 3-4 lectures, 2-3 readings, 2-3 discussion posts. Do not take his class if you can

I would not take this class if you just want to get WRIT2 out of the way. It's not a hard class if you enjoy literature. I do not and I did not enjoy the class. I only took it to be done with WRIT2 and it took more of my time than my major classes. He also is disrespectful in his comments on your grades. Don't take the comments personal.

great professor! he gave amazing feedback that improved my writing skills. attendance was mandatory and if its a hybrid class prefers you going in person. its not an easy class but if you put in the work you should get a good grade like me! beware of discussions as they arent in the to do list in canvas, which is why i was late to a few

Took him for writing 1. Honestly the best teacher I've had so far, made class really enjoyable. As long as you do the homework, make the revisions he tells you, you will get an A. I loved his class, and I actually became a better writer and feel super confident for writing 2. you could tell he is super excited about writing and cares a lot.

Amazing. Truly changed the way I approach writing. He grades very fair and is approachable and helpful. If you feel like you are a bad writer, take this class. You really realize how writing is a practice rather than a skill you are born with.
My first rating on Rate My Professor. I could only give him 5 points because the max is only 5 points.

Great professor all around. Assigns interesting readings and assignments for students all about current events. All of the work is pretty manageable and he gives great feedback and wants students to succeed. He truly seems interested in his job. The lectures are very engaging.
It was such a fantastic class, he is easily in the top 3 teachers I've ever taken a class with! Writing was difficult but fun to do our own research and he gave excellent feedback.
I loved writ2 with him

You can tell Loeffler genuinely cares about his class but holy shit he's a tough grader. You can put several hours of work into this class a week and still barely expect a B. If you are expecting to get an A with less than 10 hrs of work each week I would not recommend taking his class. You will not enjoy his class if you just care about your grade

This man is literally one of the most intelligent and passionate professors I have had the pleasure to learn from. I will literally grieve this class forever, it was so amazing. He motivated everyone to try their best and that is rare to find, especially for a GE. He is a tough grader, but SO worth it. You WILL become a better writer. Ily Toby!

Toby is so passionate about what he does, which is reflected through his class. He is a tough grader, but I have learned so much from his class. Even though you have to put in a good amount of work to do well, I think that anyone who takes this class will come out a much better writer. Overall, tough class, but super insightful.
Amazing teacher. Sweet guy. Loves what he does and it shows through his lectures and grading style. Good feedback. You will be a better writer at the end of it.

He is a good professor and very passionate about the subject. He is very specific about his writing guidelines and is a tough grader. I do think I became a better writer but definitely would never take it again the work load is quite heavy.

Toby is one of my favorite professors at UCSC. The class was very discussion based, which was extremely engaging. The readings were interesting, the process of writing papers and receiving feedback was really helpful, and I overall feel like a better person and writer after taking this class. Toby was very passionate & encouraging. Loved the class!

One of my favorite teachers/classes at UCSC. Fully a discussion-based class, which I loved. Everyone was engaged and eager to discuss the readings (philosophy heavy). Lots of reading and essay writing, but if you start early and don't get behind you will really enjoy this class. Helped me develop my writing and way of thinking. Good old school way.

Toby was a really bad professor in my experience, he doesn't understand different learning styles and doesn't provide any helpful feedback. There is an insane amount of work I would say it took me 7+ hours and participation in this class is required/attendance is mandatory. It was really hard to focus on my other courses due to the workload.

Toby was amazing in lectures and making sure that the material was understood clearly and what the students were expected to do. Attendance is very mandatory and he is very critical of writing, but that is in order to push each student to do better! There was a lot of reading, but it is all very interesting and discussions were great!

SUCH a good teacher! this class genuinely changed my perspective on a lot of things and made me a better writer. Toby cares a lot about his students success and gives really good feedback. There's a lot of work but it's all really interesting. Just make sure to read instructions very well, do all the work and readings and participate in discussions

Toby is a fantastic professor who changed me as a writer! This class is very reading and writing heavily, as expected for Writing 2. But every single class provided valuable, introspective content and discussion. If you want to improve as a writer and think deeply about life, take this class!

Dr. Loeffler is a great teacher. Very kind, engaging and genuinely caring about his students and their writing. The workload varies throughout the quarter, but it's never too much. Class discussions were always great, he has a great way of steering the conversation while also letting students speak their mind about the pieces that we read.

Toby is an awesome professor. The theme he chose for his writing class is amazing and he really cares that you're developing yourself as a writer over anything else. He is super personable and is super accommodating and understanding if you end up falling behind in his class. A lot of hw is assigned so be sure to stay on top of it! Overall 10/10!

Toby's pretty valid. I enjoy his class. There is a fair amount of work but if you start early it is not bad. We discuss very interesting topics and there is always time in class to discuss what we think with our peers. Everyday you break out into small groups of 3 or 4 and it's a good way to get to know some of the people in the class.

Toby is one of the best professors at UCSC. His class is well organized. He is a caring and respectful professor who encourages discussion in his classes very much. His grading is fair and gives appropriate amount of feedback. There is a good amount of reading and writing but the readings are interesting most of the times. Loved the class entirely.

Toby is a great lecturer and utilizes class time to the best of his ability. He has a progressive outlook on topics and encourages students to share their opinions. That being said, there are plenty of papers and writing assignments due in this class, so be aware of your time management. He gives you the opportunity to redo papers as well!

Toby is genuinely an amazing professor. I have learned so much and my writing has improved a huge amount. He gives a lot of feedback but the class is a lot of work. There is a lot of reading and writing and you can not get away with not doing the readings, he will know. There is a lot of discussion is class and it is required.

Toby is a great professor and definitely helped me improve my writing! Although you do write a lot of papers in Writing 1, he gives you enough time to complete each one and you can see the improvement throughout the course. As long as your participate and show up to class, you'll be just fine.

Although you'll learn a lot from Toby, he's an extremely strict professor and your participation in the class is graded super harshly. There's papers/assignments due every class and its a fast paced class, but he does give very helpful feedback and he's very good at helping- you're writing will improve.

The single most accommodating and understanding teacher I've ever had. Allowed me to switch out of a group that was not working (project) into a group in a separate class, and continually accommodated me for countless obstacles I had during the process. Attend office hours too! Do one for every project, her advice is super helpful for passing.
Slow lecturer and non-tech savvy. Poorly facilitated group work, as well as prolonged focus on simplistic concepts, were used to kill time. VERY easy work and pass, just lacked quality.

Not accessible outside of class and attendance was mandatory. 
Slow lecturer, was non-tech savvy, and we learned nothing special about rhetoric or inquiry that wasn't presented to us in outside material. Poorly facilitated group work, as well as prolonged focus on simplistic concepts were used to kill time. Easy work and pass, just lacked quality.
Professor Newberry gave a lot of essays that were back to back and didn't have a break in between writing projects. She would alw

Do not take this professor. She is so unorganized, and it seems like she doesn't prepare for classes in advance. She talks so slow it's hard to stay engaged and awake. She also gives everyone B's, and you have to do an extra project to get an A. I did the extra project and she still gave me a B?? Class always felt like a waste of time.

Pros: She's very chill, and you can tell she genuinely wants to help you pass.

Cons: Very disorganized Canvas page, especially the syllabus. Very far from tech savvy. Mandatory office hours with her and with the writing assistant, but due to some personal circumstances, we had to do less than usual.

Note: i can feel my brain melting in this class
If you want a chill class for credit if you're taking writing, this is not the teacher. Mandatory attendance, mandatory office hours (what??) the most mind numbing class you'll ever take.

She was really nice and understanding in class, but due to a lot of crazy circumstances this quarter it was a bit difficult to have clear communication with her. She did care a lot, and her grading style is kind of unique and flexible. Her writing projects were really interesting and none of them felt pointless.

Pros: Very kind, patient, and chill. Uses a heuristic grading system.
Cons: Not tech savvy, disorganized canvas page, and makes changes to schedule frequently (ex. cancel class, change office hours)

Although Ellen is lovely and caring, her Canvas is incredibly confusing as she is not tech-savvy. Due dates and even assignment instructions are unclear. If you take this class be prepared to commit a lot of your time to required office hours even if you don't need help with anything. Reminiscent of a high school class.

I would absolutely recommend Ellen to anyone looking for a good writing teacher. She really cares that students are passionate about what they're writing about and actually takes the time to read your papers and give quality feedback. She's also incredibly accessible and helpful outside of class. 10/10 teacher

Pros:
Gentle grader
Creative lectures
Fun to listen to

Cons:
Was not always clear with instructions
Not tech savy 
Messy canvas page

Very confusing class due to a confusing lesson plan. Professor is very micromanaging in class, and slow at grading. The work (three essays and simple journals) is fine, but frankly should be taught online.
Very disorganized person with a quick temper. Assignments don't make much sense, but she is a very kind person and teaches with passion.

Ellen is very nice and sweet. I enjoyed her class except she is so unorganized. A lot of times she didn't know what she uploaded on canvas. Due dates were always up in the air. She does give good feedback to you especially in office hours. If you want to pass, go to office hours and have her review your writing. DO NOT miss class!

AVOID. Ellen is really nice, however online schooling for this class is a nightmare. The canvas is extremely unorganized, it is very unclear what is due when, and everyone was totally lost the entire time. Sometimes assignments are posted hours before due, and there is several hours worth of homework each week. Also do NOT skip live class

Stay far away. Totally unorganized and makes ridiculous excuses to cancel class at the last second. Trying to understand what she was asking for in her assignments was like defusing a bomb. She didn't give any feedback on assignments until the final grade, didn't respond to any emails asking about grades so I went P/NP. Workload is unreasonable.
Good professor that's very caring towards her students.

The professor herself is really nice, but the class itself is a mess. The Canvas portal is copy-pasted with generic information, and it is really unclear what assignments are due when. Sometimes things are posted hours before due, and a lot of the information/instructions are never posted, posted late, or are inaccessible in some way. Confusing

Ellen is really nice but this class was very disorganized. Lots of what she told us will be graded at the beginning was never graded and we had to buy a textbook we never used. The papers she did grade though were straightforward and easy. This class is a pretty easy A if you turn all your assignments in on time.

I really enjoyed Tanner's teaching style. They are passionate about the class and were available to meet outside of class. The work load was good, and was a nice balance of papers, group meetings, conferences, and discussion. I'd take agin for Writing2. .
Would take again. The writing was manageable, and I liked the grading contract. The professor cares about students and made things approachable.
grades based off participation but also can give grades based on opinion?

Tanner's teaching style is quite engaging and truly helped me understand writing a LOT more. They are also very considerate of their students and give students a reasonable amount of time to complete each project. Their grading contract is also very clear and shows how to achieve the grade you want! Just stay on top of the work and you'll be fine!

Tanners class was very helpful for improving my writing. They care a lot about students and it shows. The papers were difficult, but peers and the instructor helped. Theres a grading contact in this course that means you can get a B if you do the work. Recommend.

The sheer amount of work is insane. Two assignments a week, would take several hours to finish. Very, very weird grading system. I missed one assignment (it was 30 points, essays were usually 100 and other asgns were 10-30) I FAILED the class and had to withdraw. One assignment shouldn't cause you to fail the class IMO -- esp for a GE.

The amount of reading assignments each week is overwhelming, and some of the homework rubrics can be vague, so leave ample time for HW. Even so, she's a pretty easy grader; I always received extra credit and got good feedback on my assignments. The grading system was a little weird, but overall, getting an A is doable; you just need to have time.
If there's one thing missing from your entire assignment she gives zero credit, the work you did counts toward no credit. I WOULD NEVER TAKE THIS CLASS EVER AGAIN.

Writing 2 is supposed to be a class that everyone has to take. But online, this professor adds so much needless complicated work and grading system. Way too much work for a class in comparison to other writing 2 professors online.

Dr. Silva is an amazing professor! She really helped me improve as a writer this year. Her class gave me the opportunities to write and explore topics that I've had a great interest in, but no time to explore. However, she does assign a lot of reading and gives heavy assignments, so if you want an easy writing class she's not who I'd recommend.

This class was credit or no credit no in between at all (no partial). If you get more than 25 points deduction that it you are done.  If you miss one thing in the assignment they would put it as an incomplete! The professor acts like this is the only class you are taking! Wouldn't recommend this class it was based on leisure but very boring.

Overall, really great professor. With the online course, it is a little more work if you want an A in the class. If you want a B or a C, there are also routes you can go that make it a little easier but getting an A is achievable if you put the work in. She gives great feedback and reaches out to students if you need help.

In the class there's two prompts, GenZ becoming a bad generation and talking about advice giving. You have to meet with a group of 4 once a week.She had vague rubrics, which led to misgrading.I would email about the rubric being vague but she never responded to criticism, which led me to get a 88 in the class.I emailed follow ups, never responded.

I am not one to complain about the workload, but this professor's expectations were very excessive. Expects 6-9 hours set aside for work in her class weekly. The class theme and the readings were very interesting, but the work associated absolutely ruined it. Very kind person and Canvas was very organized, but I really would not take this class.

This was my favorite class this quarter. Everything is independent work, and things are due on Tuesdays and Thursday. There are grade paths which are all fairly reasonable, and assignments are graded P/NP.  She gives out extensions and redos on the form of tickets you get from certain assignments. She is accessible and very caring. Amazing class.

online course but had work due every tuesday and thursday (so some assignments you had 2 days to complete). Grading was path based and each assignment was pass/no pass or full credit/no credit. Work not terribly hard but was too broad most times with guidelines for papers but then would critique about too broad/too specific.
It's not that she is a tough grader it's that the amount of writing and reading she assigns is insane and the main penalties are for late submissions so beware!

VERY tough grader. Passive aggressive when grading assignments. Twice the amount of work than a normal Writing 2 class. Puts in a lot of effort into grading, but extremely nitpicky on everything. Got marked for slightly wrong citations which aren't part of actual writing. Don't take if you're STEM because you have more important things.

I would not recommend that anyone take this class. The stuff she teaches is very elementary yet she grades very harshly on comically easy assignments. If you miss class due to sickness or any other emergencies she will mark you down even if you complete the work. We wrote one essay in this class with we received no feedback to.

Its a straightforward class. Pretty chill as long as u do the work and "participate" which is just showing up and sometimes collabing. NO final!! but 3 papers throughout the course but she helps u build up to it. Overall a really good prof. I wouldnt say shes an tough grader but make sure to follow writing requirements.

Prof. Silva, although she tries to be kind, is INCREDIBLY passive aggressive. the reviews which describe her as such are correct. Prepare yourself to feel personally attacked through grading and expect to work twice as hard in this class than any other writing 2 class. She is competent and willing to help but she came across very rude.

I really liked Professor Silva! She was super accessible outside of the class, and her office hours helped me do well on the big papers. She communicates what she expects, and she really helped improve my writing. The class was hybrid, but show up because it's 25% of the grade. A lot of work is assigned, so the class could be overwhelming at times.

Took this course in person once a week and asynch the rest and it was great. Silva is very kind and assignments are very structured with clear grading. I actually enjoyed most of the readings we did and the writing assignments had fun themes. As long as you stay on schedule and put effort into the assignments you will do well.

prof was really nice but my review is more ab the class. it was WAYY too easy. this class taught me that college writing and the expectations are not as difficult/high as ppl make it out to be. seriously the workload was less than my freshman yr of hs DONT WASTE TIME/MONEY SKIP AHEAD TO WRIT2. there is nothing in writ1 that will help u grow

Denise Silva is hands down the most incompetent professor I have ever had at UCSC. Most of her peers (the writing 2 professors my friends have/had), realize no one is a lit major, but, she feels everyone enjoys reading 4 articles between Mon and Wed, and between Wed and Fri. We don't. & 3-5 weekly 3+ page essays, plus 3 10 page papers. NOT leisure.

I know a LOT of people don't like her because her canvas is SO confusing. But the actual class itself is so easy. I missed 3 big assignments and still got an A-. The work is easy, it's just peer reviewing old assignments. However, her canvas is still so confusing. You just have to communicate with her and show progress and you will get an A.
Class was hell

She is a nice person, but her teaching style is questionable. The canvas page is very unorganized and assigns weekly writing projects. Each week, we have written assignments due every Friday and need to be submitted on Peerceptiv. It's an online tool used to write and give feedback. It cost $20. I believed the class was easy to pass. Lock in!

Is a nice person but terrible professor. Unorganized, and grading criteria is very ambiguous despite her claims otherwise. Canvas is like hell trying to navigate from the random emojis to the out of order assignments. Very technologically challenged and blames canvas for her lack of clarity. Material isn't too hard, just do the work on time.

This class was a nothing burger!!! Rambling class discussions and incredibly high expectations for our level of understanding made every class incredibly overwhelming. She seems to take pride in her organization but the canvas is so overwhelming. So much work is crammed into the first 8 weeks when it could have been spread out. Don't take this.

Joy is a very nice person. However, lacks the ability to explain anything, if you ask any clarifying questions don't expect to actually get clear answers. Not one time I have got a good and helpful answer from her about the work that SHE assigns. All her assignments are cryptic. However, it really helps you build a bond with your fellow classmates.

She's okay. If I could rate a 1.5 I would've. She assigns quite a bit of work. Assigns quite a bit of work. Canvas page is confusing to navigate. Tends to ramble a lot. She does get good feedback on essays. You can get a good grade, make sure to put in a lot of effort. Do extra credit by doing more peer reviews than required. You can do this!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!!!!!!! She's super nice and all but you will never understand what she is talking about and every assignment is the most confusing thing you will ever read. I had her for writing 1 and I hated it with a passion. You can't even ask her a question without her confusing you MORE. She is super nice but its not worth it dude.

No, just no. Run for the hills and don't look back. While Joy may seem kind, her course is ridiculous. I learned nothing all quarter other than how to do busy work and wade through the confusing messes that are her prompts. Don't even talk to me about the Canvas alternative she made us pay for.

At first I didnt like this teacher because her canvas page seems unorganized but then I got used to it. Also if you ask her a question she may keep talking to you for half an hour -- she has a habit of elaborating too much. She gives good feedback on papers and the class is easy. She is kind and she gave us donuts on the last day of class.

I do not recommend taking this class if you already have enough work load a week. A bunch of unnecessary assignments were given with not a clear explanation and the grading is kind of confusing. The professor is sweet but the workload is heavy and exhausting.

Frustrating amounts of work make you wonder why you decided to take the class. Used a platform that required payment for making an account. She herself is not entirely clear when giving advice on writing. Oh god the workload was unbearable. Only take her if you have a light course load for the semester, as the amount of papers due can overwhelm you

Save yourself the headache. She expects full-time students to do 15-20 hrs of work PER WEEK in a REQUIRED class. Organization is a nightmare: She makes you use 3 different platforms at once, 1 you have to pay for. Material is pointless and overcomplicated especially if you are already a strong writer. She's also quite cynical and a big complainer.

Prof Hagen is such a sweet person and I think everyone can agree, but the coursework constantly had very vague and verbose directions that often give no real guidance on what is actually expected, with the added addition of so much content on Canvas to confuse everyone even more.

Her class is one day in class and one day on zoom. She's overall a very kind person, she just rambles a lot about the instructions of an assignment. Most of the time confusing students about the main purpose of the assignment that is being given.

It's a shame there is a 350 character limit because I cannot stress enough of how much of an incompetent  teacher Joy Hagen is. If you want to take a class where the directions them selves are more confusing then any of the assignments... here it is. Whoever gave this woman a PHD needs to be sentenced for life. I pray for anyone else who has her.

Do not take this class. I think she's a great person but honestly she makes this class way harder than it needs to be. She uses all of this fancy terminology as if she's trying to prove to her students that she went to Stanford. But in reality she just confuses everyone and never explains herself, even the TA's were extremely lost and confused.

Professor is a nice person; definitely passionate about learning. She talks A LOT is very unclear/confusing. Uses contract grading meaning students don't know their grade until the end. Based off experience, If you are someone who has DRC accommodations, I suggest being very straightforward about your accommodation needs.

The professor is very nice and passionate about her work. From my experience, her feedback is pretty good but she talks non-stop and you won't understand a thing she says. Her instructions are so vague and unclear that I was lost on what to do for most of my assignments.

I did not have the good time with the course grade. The professor would give me the feedback. I would change the words but the professor would give me more of the criticisms. I do not understand the things to change.

Professor Levitow is an amazing guy. I learned sm Yiddish, & although there's a small packet of homework due before each class, he's reasonable with grading and the hw helps u stay consistent with the language. He has a phenomenal sense of humor, shows you pics of his cats, and gives positive feedback when u get something right! LOVE THIS DUDE

Very kind, very funny, super caring. Constantly getting emails calling us precious students, offering homework help and advice. One class he was worried the homework was too hard and when students got the answers correct he was fist pumping in excitement. Grades pretty leniently, and explains things very well. 100/10 professor, class makes my day.

Very nice professor, cares a lot about teaching Yiddish, small class size helps with learning but beware if you don't like participating. 2 quizzes plus a midterm and final are similar to the homework and he tells you exactly what to expect. There is homework every class but only a few pages to help you practice the language.

He's very nice and lectures are engaging. There is hw every class but that's expected for language learning. I had no trouble learning a lot from him over the quarter. There are two quizzes, a midterm, and a final but he clearly lays out what you will need to know to do well on them. Highly recommend taking his class.
